description: Fruity, ripe aromas of banana, nectarine, peach and date emerge from the aggressive alcohol. Entry is sweet and smoky; the flavor at midpalate is sugary and laden with wood aspects that wipe out fruit elements. Aftertaste is one-dimensional.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers delightfully piquant aromas of lemons, limes, even tangerines. Entry is balanced, and simultaneously tart and sweet; at midpalate the taste profile becomes a bit too sweetly unctuous. Regains its acidic/tart, citrusy footing in the finish. Need a cultivated sweet tooth for this one.
label: spirits_taster

description: Nosings find delicate aromas of oak, spice and raisins and a pleasant leathery quality. Entry is borderline fat with bacon rind and buttercream, with enough acidity to balance the sweetness; the midpalate features tastes of tobacco leaf, leather, light toffee, cinnamon and oaky resin. Aftertaste is heavy but with enough depth.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find layers of aromas of honey, heather, pine needle, thyme and salty single malt Scotch whisky. Entry is thick, gently sweet but balanced by a fierce herbal quality; midpalate focuses on the whisky while the various herbs, spices and honey make merry around their whisky core. One of the best liqueurs available.
label: spirits_taster

description: Attractive foggy pink/rose color. The bouquet is highly perfumed with intense fragrances of orange peel, passionfruit and mango pulp, with a backnote of spice. Entry is lusciously tart and fruity, displaying an ideal balance between the alcohol base, acidity, and fruit. Finishes impeccably balanced, clean and juicy. Bravo! Serve chilled.
label: spirits_taster

description: The lovely, austere and enticing bouquet offers scents of black pepper, charcoal and limestone. Entry is sweet and lightly spiced; at midpalate luscious tastes of caramel corn, charcoal, quartz and cocoa bean make for wonderful North American unflavored vodka drinking. Concludes smooth, complex and layered. A coming superstar.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is mesmerizing with multiple layers of fragrances that include pine/cedar, quinine, fennel, white pepper, licorice, mace, allspice, sage and rosemary. An orange zest flavor appears at palate entry; midpalate finds exotic tastes of orange zest, tangerine zest, multiple herbs and spices, honey and pine. A fabulous liqueur.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find classic London Dry aromas of juniper with assertive, prickly spirit and citrus. The palate entry is creamy, juniper-heavy and curiously chalky; the taste profile at midpalate is herbal, piney and citrusy. I like this gin a lot but wonder: Would it be even better at 47% abv?
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find pleasantly dry, grainy and stone-like aromas with subtle notes of grass, grain kernel, beans and granite. Entry is clean, off-dry and intensely grainy; the midpalate tastes are more stony/mineral andgrainy. Ends on a grainy, sweet, tangy and spirity note.
label: spirits_taster

description: A blend of original Benedictine and Cognac. Smells assertively of herbs, honey, quinine and baking spices with added aromas of black tea and tobacco. Entry tastes of tea, sage, fennel and a touch of quinine; the Cognac emerges at midpalate, lending a layer of elegance and genuine distillate presence. Finishes like a champion, long, semisweet, intensely herbal, mildly spicy and satiny.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers delightfully tart fragrances of ripe blueberry, blackberry and black cherry, with intriguing side notes of cocoa bean, textile and green vegetation. Entry is mildly sweet at first, then turns refreshingly tart and acidic; midpalate features the flavor of ripe and bittersweet berries. Ends ripe, appealingly tart and fresh-tasting.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet includes aromas of green apple, Bosc pear, poppy seed, parchment, apricot and new leather. The palate entry is honeyed, dry and luscious; midpalate displays many delicious flavors, including honey, vanilla bean, pork sausage, cinnamon and nutmeg. Finishes with elegance and component integration. A fabulous VS and a superior value.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes discover scents of buttered toast, baked apple and pear pastry, cinnamon and nutmeg with subtle notes of old, worn leather, pipe tobacco, cigar wrapper and burnt sugar. Palate entry is moderately sweet; at midpalate flavors of vanilla, toffee, dried cherry and lanolin vie for dominance. Finishes tight and elegant.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find delightful, tart fragrances of freshly sliced lemons. The entry is totally focused on the crisp, clean taste of lemon juice; at midpalate there's just enough sweetness to balance the lemony/citrusy character.
label: spirits_taster

description: The fresh, vibrant bouquet smells delightfully of juniper berries, cedar sap, brambles and blueberries. Entry is keenly tart, blueberry-acidic and mouth-puckering; at midpalate flavors of juniper and cooking spice move to the fore of the dry bittersweet taste profile. Finishes ultra-clean, amazingly tart and acidic, yet eye-poppingly fresh. A creative and sophisticated gin.
label: spirits_taster

description: The somewhat nondescript bouquet is neutral and mildly grainy with some mild aromas of spice and ripe yellow fruit. Palate entry is meek and softly sweet; things improve at midpalate as flavors of charcoal, maple and sugar syrup emerge. Finishes well in a sweet grain manner.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find odors of fig, pumpkin seed, macadamia nut and floor wax. Entry is moderately sweet, intensely figgy, minerally and bitter; at midpalate the fruitiness of the fig comes to the fore. Concludes bittersweet, tangy and piquant.
label: spirits_taster

description: Smells deeply of aniseed and licorice with hints of mint, smoke, and rubber tire. Entry is very anise-like, herbal and mildly sweet; at midpalate there's a slight taste of gunmetal and minerals, but then in the finish the anise turns more licorice-like and pleasantly candied. I liked this well-made, not overly sweet arak.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find only mild vanilla bean/vanilla extract aromas. The palate entry offers a genuine vanilla-like, bittersweet and spicy taste; the vanilla taste accelerates at midpalate and is appropriately bitter and tasty. Improved after a rocky beginning.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers aromas of apple and pear with nuances of wood resin, white pepper and toasted honeywheat bread. Entry taste is assertively oaky, off-dry and baking-spicy; at midpalate the oaky flavor intensifies and drowns some of the fruit and spice elements. Aftertaste is off-dry, calmer than the midpalate, leathery and pruny.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet smells of minerals, semisweet grain and citrus zest. Entry is sweet and sugary; the taste profile at midpalate takes on heavy notes of glycerin, cane sugar and charcoal. Finishes with a sugar rush that's out of balance and inappropriate.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aromas include old oak, hemp beeswax, asparagus, pepper and pine. The palate entry is smooth, sap-like and sweet; at midpalate the flavors integrate in an ideal display of maturity, grace and vigor. Ends up lip-smacking sweet, fiber-like, oaky, honeyed and a touch salty. An exciting addition to the growing Extra Añejo category.
label: spirits_taster

description: The luscious Speyside bouquet offers layers of aromas that include smoke, wood, touches of palm oil, browned butter, vanilla bean and pork rind. The palate entry is rich, bittersweet, caramel-like and creamy; at the wonderful midpalate the taste turns sweeter, nuttier and more fudge-like. Finishes elegantly, yet very focused, and integrated. Delicious.
label: spirits_taster

description: The complex, understated bouquet finds aromas of barley malt, seaweed, heather, oaky vanilla, honey, sherry cask, scrambled egg and minerals. The palate entry is oily, buttery and oaky sweet; by midpalate the flavors include assertive tastes of marzipan, marshmallow, baked pear/peach pastry and bacon fat. Finishes with a luscious fruit/grape thrust. A masterpiece.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find lovely fragrances of baked pears, peach, caramel corn, hazelnut, newly tanned leather, baked pineapple and nougat. The palate entry is long, luxuriously textured, nutty and semisweet; at midpalate deep flavors of vanilla extract, oak, honey and sugar maple are added. Ends with finesse. Sensational and one of the benchmark single barrel bourbons available.
label: spirits_taster

description: The seductive bouquet offers wonderfully floral, fruity, guava- and melon-like fragrances of elderflower, becoming richly pear- and quince-like following aeration time. The palate entry is soft and firm; the midpalate is integrated, harmonious and exquisitely balanced between alcohol level, sweetness, acidity and floral impact. A perfect liqueur.
label: spirits_taster

description: Crisp and classic, this gin is ideal for martinis. A light cucumber aroma leads the nose, opening up with more cucumber and juniper on the palate, finishing smooth and brisk on nutmeg and coriander accents.
label: spirits_taster

description: Produced in the last remaining independent distillery in London, this G&T-worthy; gin is bracing, clean and crisp, with lots of juniper, a light floral note midpalate, and spicy-sweet finish of coriander.
label: spirits_taster

description: This versatile gin has a mild, almost neutral scent and marshmallow sweetness on the palate. Most of the flavor is on the spiced, warming finish that shows coriander, citrus, cinnamon and black pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is pleasingly sweet and citrusy, hinting at fennel and pine. On the palate, this gin is notably smooth, even slick, melding fruity and floral notes. White flowers blend into a racy lemon-pepper finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Setting the benchmark for London dry-style gins, look for a fresh, clean scent and flavors of lemon peel and juniper, accented by white pepper, ginger, cayenne and coriander before fading to zingy lemon and a mildly sweet exit. At 47% abv it reads a little hot, but it's ideal for drinks with a bit of dilution, like a classic Gin & Tonic.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from sugar cane, this limited-edition small batch gin is distinctly citrusy. The aroma mixes pine and candied lemon peel, while the palate gets a hit of orange peel on the crisp finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This bouncy, astringent gin is infused with sencha tea, but doesn't really taste like it. Instead, the flavor profile is on the spicy side, showing plenty of cayenne, cumin and black pepper, finishing with zingy alcohol heat and a juniper punch. Versatile for adding robust flavor to mixed drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bottle is vibrant turquoise but the contents are perfectly clear. The sweet aroma suggests candied lemon peel, warm orange peel, and a faint licorice note. Bold licorice leads on the palate, fading into bracing juniper, black pepper and clove.
label: spirits_taster

description: Ideal for martinis and G&Ts;, look for a brisk, bracing aroma that mixes juniper and anise. The palate is smooth, dry and citrusy, with most of the flavor on the cinnamon-accented finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The base spirit of this gin is distilled from sugar beets, not grain, which may explain its pronounced sweetness (note: the recipe dates back to 1945). The aroma is almost neutral, with just a faint breeze of pine. On the palate, the juniper-pine note comes forward, along with a marshmallow sweetness, though it finishes with citrus chased by earthy anise and black pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Scented with juniper and lemon peel, this light, silky gin is distinctly citrusy and crisp, suggesting lemon and grapefruit peels. It finishes lightly sweet, enlivened by white pepper and candied ginger sparks.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose is mild, almost neutral, while the palate shows juniper, white flowers and anise, breezing into a gentle finish brushed with white pepper and the merest hint of grapefruit peel. Save that pretty pale-green bottle to showcase some spring flowers.
label: spirits_taster

description: As the name suggests, this is a relatively floral gin. Delicate and perfumy, with not a trace of juniper, the overall impact is like a bowl of pink carnations, with floral notes interwoven with lychee, raspberry and lime, winding into a soft, cinnamon-laced exit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Robust and almost creamy on the palate, this gin opens on bold anise and coriander aromatics. The palate has a fruity cast, suggesting citrus peel, raspberry and even a flicker of banana, spiced with warm coriander and cardamom.
label: spirits_taster

description: The spicy-sweet aroma mingles anise, coriander and sandalwood. The palate skews distinctly sweet and floral. Robust juniper is interwoven with lingering violet, leading into a delicately spiced finish plus a final, faint floral exhale. Distilled from locally sourced red winter wheat.
label: spirits_taster

description: The producer's tag line is “lighter than air,” and while we wouldn't go quite that far, it's indeed quite light. The aroma is sweet and subtly fruity, evoking orange peel and lychee, while the palate is silky and delicate, with rosewater and lychee shored up by cinnamon and ginger sizzle on the finish. Cocktail friendly.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is delicate and lightly fruity with lychee, faint banana and grapefruit peel notes. But the palate surprises with a punch of spicy-peppery heat up front, mellowing to rosewater and lychee midpalate. There's a pleasing cucumber sweetness before finishing on more sizzling cinnamon and coriander, with alcohol heat on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is mild and slightly sweet; the palate is bolder and drying, showing subtle notes of dried orange peel, mulling spices and a mild floral note on the smooth, crisp exit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Versatile and value priced, this gin offers a light sweetness, with gentle cucumber and lemon peel notes that fade into a coriander finish. Temper the alcohol bite by mixing into cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: The markedly sweet aroma suggests candied lemon peel and pink peppercorns. The palate is only lightly sweet and distinctly floral, with plenty of rosewater and soapy violet, finishing delicate and whisper-light, reverberating on a faint citrusy twang at the end. Distilled in England, blended in Iceland.
label: spirits_taster

description: Built on a London dry base but given extra “spice botanicals,” this gin has an almost neutral nose but the palate pops with citrus and spice. Look for juniper and orange peel to play a supporting role, while mouthwatering white pepper, ginger, nutmeg and cinnamon steal the show.
label: spirits_taster

description: Earthy and almost savory, this gin leads with an anise-pine aroma and palate marked by coriander, lemon peel, and a mouthwatering, mushroom umami note. Finishes pleasingly spiced with clove and cinnamon. Recommended for dirty martinis and other savory sips.
label: spirits_taster

description: Portland bartender Ryan Csanky has created a bold, bracing gin. It leads with juniper and cucumber on the nose and palate, followed by complex layers of anise, coriander and cardamom, and a spiced, slightly hot finish that shows off peppery cubeb berry and grains of paradise.
label: spirits_taster

description: This certified organic gin unfurls bold pine and spearmint aromatics, plus a hint of lime peel. The rounded palate echoes that pine and hint of lime, but it's the anise note that really builds and reverberates into the drying finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The mild, sweet fragrance suggests candied lime peel. It's light and silky on the palate, with pronounced sweetness up front and a concentrated lemon-lime flavor profile that finishes on a flicker of cinnamon heat. It almost reads like a light limoncello. Try it in a Last Word or other citrusy cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a distinctly herbaceous profile on the nose and palate. There's a bit of pine but it's not as juniper-forward as most London dry style gins. Finishes lightly sweet, with a fresh pear note, and spicy, like pink peppercorn.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from Maine potatoes, look for a citrusy, slightly funky aroma and powerful juniper and anise flavors up front. Some citrus eventually pokes through the concentrated juniper, but it's the dominant flavor by a wide mile. Black pepper finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Save this Navy-strength (read: overproof) gin for G&Ts; and other mixed drinks. The harmonious aroma shows citrus, anise and fennel. It's hard to get around the alcohol fire if you prefer a straight sip. When diluted, this gin briefly takes on a pearly sheen—similar to the way absinthe behaves—and lemon brightness, juniper and absinthe flavors sing out even when mixed.
label: spirits_taster

description: Brisk, piny, and refreshing, this small batch gin distilled from grapes has an intriguing rosewater note midpalate that finishes with plenty of lemon peel and cinnamon heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled and blended at Collingwood Distillery in Ontario, this Maplewood-mellowed whisky shows its best when given some time to open up. The dark honey-colored spirit offers a mild vanilla aroma, with flavors of vanilla and bananas drizzled with maple syrup, finishing with ginger and allspice notes. Made with whisky aged for at least three years.
label: spirits_taster

description: One of the few whiskeys made from oats, this “silver” whiskey has a sweet, almost candied-cherry scent and a long cherry-almond-flavored finish. Try adding this well-balanced whiskey to a fruity martini-style cocktail or a white-whiskey-based Manhattan—with extra cherries, please.
label: spirits_taster

description: Three years of barrel time yields a light-gold whiskey with fresh, fruity notes that evoke apples, pears and lychees, a faint smoky flavor and a sprinkling of ginger. Particularly food friendly, this light, soft whisky could be sipped alongside bread and aged cheeses, or savory bites like smoked salmon.
label: spirits_taster

description: A newcomer to the spirits biz, this brand is named for notorious bootlegger Dutch Schultz. How fitting to start by issuing a moonshine, and a unique one at that: It's distilled from pure cane sugar, though it's classified as “neutral cane,” not rum. That said, this vanilla-forward hooch, with a delicate floral touch on the lingering finish, would be great for using in any drink usually made with rum. Well balanced and smooth.
label: spirits_taster

description: This sweet corn-based whiskey has a softness to it, with surprising delicacy for the moonshine category. With its marshmallow aroma and sweet vanilla flavor, it's just a few steps removed from white rum. The jug-like glass bottle features a striking black and silver label.
label: spirits_taster

description: This 12-year-old small-batch whisky is full bodied and supple, with bold vanilla and caramel flavors and a spicy finish. The raised design on the bottle is gorgeous and tactile.
label: spirits_taster

description: The second release in Crown's Extra Rare Whisky Series, this XR (Extra Rare) blend is made with the final batch of whiskies from Montreal's LaSalle Distillery. The amber liquid has a distinct fruity note, melding touches of vanilla and apple, and a long caramel-flavored finish that's marked with hints of clove and allspice. Velvety in texture, this feels on the hot side, and is best when diluted with water, which adds softness.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made using Canadian blended rye as its base, this is a sweet spiced whisky. This liqueur-like product has a golden color and a lovely sweet vanilla aroma that's touched with a cinnamon note. It's very sweet on the palate, with a big vanilla flavor and a creamy texture. Easy drinking and enjoyable; consider mixing it with ginger ale or cola.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from the same “select blend from the 1930s” that was smuggled across the border to the U.S. during the Prohibition years, this eight-year-old whisky has a bright honey color and fruity aroma, plus oaky layers of vanilla and caramel on the palate. Mix this into whisky sours or drink it tall with lots of ginger ale.
label: spirits_taster

description: Billed as “Connecticut's first moonshine,” this is almost ridiculously neutral on every level. It has a mild aroma and neutral flavor, with placid alcohol levels and a clean finish showing just a hint of gingery spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: Rye adds a spicy note to this small-batch spirit, which features big pineapple and banana notes that wind into clove and cinnamon on the finish. It's 100 proof and feels it—consider mixing this into a fruity drink.
label: spirits_taster

description: Stinging alcohol almost overwhelms the malty flavor and citrusy finish. Yet, there's promise here. With plenty of dilution and sweetener, this spirit would provide fine backbone for a white-whiskey sour or other lemony drinks. OMG stands for Old Monongahela.
label: spirits_taster

description: This cinnamon-flavored liqueur is made with Canadian whisky, and boasts a red-hot flavor and heat like Fireballs candy. The sweet, rather potent, heat lingers awhile. It's a fun mixer for those who like it hot.
label: spirits_taster

description: This eight-year-old whisky has a vibrant dark-gold color and mixes fresh apple, vanilla, and resin-like notes. The alcohol is apparent, but it should fade when mixed.
label: spirits_taster

description: Created with input from New York mixologist Jim Meehan, a partner in the brand, this blend of 21 rums from five rum-producing countries—Trinidad, Jamaica, Barbados, Java and Guyana—would make a dynamite daiquiri. Bright lime flavors meld with warm brown-sugar notes and a funky, pleasantly spicy note on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Blended by Cognac Ferrand using rums from Barbados, Trinidad and Jamaica, this elegant newcomer is expected to reach the U.S. in fall 2012. Look for sweet, candied citrus-peel aromas and flavors, enlivened with white pepper and fresh ginger.
label: spirits_taster

description: With most rums, there's a sense that longer barrel time will make it better. But this one is perfectly lovely in its au naturel state. Enticingly delicate floral and raspberry notes wind into a clean finish with a pop of cinnamon. Soft and fresh.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clean and classic, from the citrusy aroma to the light, crisp flavor with endnotes of ginger and coriander. Add handfuls of mint and stir up a pitcher of mojitos.
label: spirits_taster

description: Typical of the Martinique rhum agricole style, the aromatics on this lively rum tend toward funky and herbaceous. Meanwhile, the flavors are complex and deep, showcasing vanilla and molasses, and lots of baking spice (clove, nutmeg and cassia bark). It's easy to see how lovely this would be with additional barrel time.
label: spirits_taster

description: This “dry rum” is destined for tiki and tropical drinks. The aroma is mild, with a delicate tropical-fruit note. On the palate, it's soft and sweet, with vanilla and coconut flavors and a pleasingly crisp finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: As the starting point for one of the best spiced rums on the market, this silver rum holds its own. The marshmallow-like scent points towards the bold, rather sweet vanilla flavors to be found on the palate, with a raspberry note on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This 100% California sugar-cane rum is made in the style of Martinique rhum agricole, but with a touch of West Coast swagger. What does that mean in your glass? A funky, pungent, even primal version of silver rum, reminiscent of a mezcal without the smoke. Look for grassy, almost vegetal flavors sweetened with a bit of ripe pineapple funk. Consider pairing this with a meaty snack, such as bresaola or beef jerky.
label: spirits_taster

description: With its transparent pink blush from hibiscus flowers, this unusually flavored white rum resembles rosé wine in the glass. The delicate flavor tends toward sugary coconut, touched with vanilla and a hint of juicy red fruit. Though even more fruit or floral notes would be welcome, an affinity for tropical drinks is readily apparent.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made using a blend of rums from the famed Angostura distillery in Trinidad, plus “trace amounts” of Jamaican pot-still rum, this spirit is frontloaded with lots of marshmallow flavor, plus a faint floral note on the clean finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Proceeds from this balanced, relatively neutral silver rum benefit Soles4Souls, an international shoe charity providing footwear to those in need. Flavors run to vanilla and coconut, with a clean finish reminiscent of vodka. The playful label sports a Hawaiian-shirt floral motif.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made using a blend of rums aged up to three years, this smooth, silver rum shows forward coconut notes and is made for mixing.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clean and neutral, this rum almost reads like a vanilla vodka. Vanilla dominates the nose and palate, with a bit of black pepper on the finish. Soft and well balanced.
label: spirits_taster

description: A light-bodied rum with vanilla overtones and a bit of agricole-like funk. A pronounced, lingering vanilla flavor and drying alcohol unfold on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This sweet, coconuty white rum is surely Piña Colada-bound. There's a smooth feel and nice coconut fade on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Mix this soft, sweet rum into a fruity tropical drink like a mai tai. Look for a lingering mix of coconut and vanilla.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from grain and potatoes, the producer describes this as “Irish vodka” made in New England. Overall, it's neutral on nose and palate, with a light, airy feel and citrusy exhale.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from local corn, this vodka opens with a moderate amount of almond and vanilla and rolls into a toasty finish. Play up that sweetness in a White Russian or other dessert-like drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clear in the glass, this newcomer has a pleasing lime lollipop scent. The flavor is mild, with a faintly bitter midpalate giving way to a lime-peel finish. Recommended for mixing with tonic or soda water.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is distinct in tropical fruit and lemongrass aromas. The palate feels slick, showing an additional lemongrass flavor, with a finish of marshmallow, pepper and refreshing mint. Made from blend of spelt and triticale (wheat/rye hybrid).
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from whey, this vodka is relatively neutral on the nose and palate, tinged with vanilla and almond sweetness, finishing with ginger and a burst of alcohol heat. Backed by Australian casino mogul James Packer and actor Robert De Niro.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a lemon-drop scent and a flavor that leans toward candied lemon peel, finishing brisk and dry on a white pepper sting. Mix into Lemon Drops, Cosmos and other lemon-tinged cocktails. Base vodka is made from grapes.
label: spirits_taster

description: Neutral in aroma, this is shows a light, delicate palate, with hints of honey, vanilla and coconut sweetness. Finishes with charcoal hint, gentle spice and a faint white floral exhale. Base vodka is made from grain.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from wheat and filtered seven times, including a “milk-based filtration,” this vodka has a neutral aroma and smooth, oily palate that hints at citrus, exiting with subtle coconut sweetness and ginger heat. The unusual plastic pop-top closure suggests that this bottle was designed for super-speedy pouring rather than slow savoring. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a golden hue and a juicy, sweet, spiced aroma. The viscous palate is on the sweet side, almost liqueur-like, showing honey and a hint of mandarin orange before winding into a spiced finish. The base vodka is infused with Seville orange marmalade and then distilled again.
label: spirits_taster

description: This corn-based vodka has a neutral scent and clean palate, finishing with coconut-like sweetness plus a peppery spark. A quote from publisher Larry Flint on the side of the bottle leaves no mistake, yes, this was bottled in affiliation with the notorious publication.
label: spirits_taster

description: No, it's not a flavored vodka, yet the aroma is distinctly fruity, reminiscent of cherry pie filling. The palate reflects that robust fruit alongside hints of cocoa and charcoal on the exhale. Made from wheat and malted barley, and filtered through crushed marble. Small batch.
label: spirits_taster

description: Expect a sweet-tart green apple Jolly Rancher scent palate. The concentrated tartness lingers well into the mouthwatering finish. Temper with sweeter ingredients for cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with a potato base, this flavored vodka is clear in the glass, and exudes an overripe berry aroma. The palate shows sweetness up front, leading into hints of concord grape and a sugary finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clear in the glass, this corn-based vodka has a blueberry aroma and flavor, leading into a drying palate that finishes with a numbing, peppery finish. Producer recommends mixing with lemonade.
label: spirits_taster

description: Dark, mysterious and complex, this deep-amber liquid has a sherried scent, with hints of fresh figs and black cherry. The mouthwatering palate is sweet up front, showing vanilla and black cherry, drying to a long finish of earthy espresso, leather, orange peel and a brush of cocoa. Borderies region.
label: spirits_taster

description: Most Cognacs blend various vintages together: This one is a single-vintage Cognac that was distilled in 1976 and bottled in 2016, after 40 years in oak. It's a stunner, with a complex, perfumy nose and kaleidoscopic palate that starts with cocoa and walnut, moves to a rounded, surprisingly fresh red apple note midpalate, and finishes with vanilla, ginger, cinnamon and hints of tropical fruit. It's drying, slightly grippy and not nearly as oaky as one might expect. Petite Champagne region.
label: spirits_taster

description: Richly scented with fig, raisin and toffee, those notes carry over on the palate along with vanilla bean and walnut. It finishes rounded and gorgeous with a lip-smacking trail of cocoa, espresso, orange peel and clove.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is made from the 1975 vintage from David Picoron's hillside vineyard in the Grande Champagne region. Intriguingly deep, dark aromas beckon: figs, toffee and Port-like dark fruit. These flavors show a bit drier on the supple palate, transforming into dark chocolate, oak and stewed cherries, finishing very long with walnut, leather, clove and black pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Nuanced and complex, this shows a floral lilt up front, segueing into more substantial vanilla and honey aromas. The palate is relatively dry, with cocoa and leather lightening to ginger spice and hints of tropical fruit. Fine Champagne region.
label: spirits_taster

description: The mild aroma hints at vanilla and stone fruit. The palate is balanced and lovely, starting with gentle vanilla and caramel enlivened by fresh pear and stone fruit, and finishing on a mellow baking spice note.
label: spirits_taster

description: The hazelnut aroma suggests a rich, sweet brandy, however the palate is surprisingly light and delicate. Initial nutty, fudgy notes quickly give way to lively orange peel and spice, finishing with an elegant hint of violet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Showing bright topaz in the glass, this Cognac entices with rich, concentrated caramel and toffee aromas. Fleetingly sweet on the palate, vanilla, mocha and hazelnut lead into a rounded brown-sugar finish punctuated by clove and orange peel. This easy sipper would be welcome at any dessert table. Made with a blend of Cognacs aged 11–25 years.
label: spirits_taster

description: This easy-drinking Cognac smells like dessert—think caramel, baked pear and marzipan. Fleeting sweetness on the feather-light palate echoes those aromas as delicious vanilla, almond and creamy flan wind into a zingy citrus finish accented by ginger.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made on the Ilse d'Oléron, this unusual “maritime Cognac” was distilled in 1991 and bottled at 24 years of age. Fleeting cinnamon-roll sweetness up front gives way to an herbaceous sarsaparilla note, coupled with hints of honey and apricot. The drying cinnamon-laced finish shows orange peel and walnut. This is elegant and bright, but it's also overproof so keep some ice or water on hand to lengthen sips.
label: spirits_taster

description: The mild, fresh aroma suggests white flowers and fresh-cut pear, while the palate reflects those gentle floral-fruit notes coupled with honey and vanilla, finishing with a delicate whiff of smoke. Gift this almost whiskey-like Cognac to a Scotch-lover. Petite Champagne region, made 100% from Ugni Blanc grapes.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for elegant vanilla, lemon cream and apricot on the well-balanced nose and palate, finishing long and spiced on a distinct lemony note on the exhale.
label: spirits_taster

description: This shows enough intensity to appeal to whiskey drinkers but plenty of brandy finesse. The palate shows luxurious caramel, rounding out to baked apple and spice, finishing with enticing hints of red fruit and violet. Borderies region.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for caramel and a hint of butterscotch in the aroma. On the palate, baked apple and pear lead into smooth vanilla, then burst into a bracingly spicy finish showing ginger, cinnamon and a hint of lemon. Petite Champagne region.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Cognac offers dried date and fig aromas coupled with cedar. Given a few minutes to open up, those dried-fruit notes deepen on nose and palate to baked pear washed with butterscotch, finishing long and notably silky with ginger, dusty vanilla and sweet cinnamon heat. Grand Champagne region.
label: spirits_taster

description: Rich, comforting caramel and vanilla aromas show that there's plenty of oak influence in this Cognac. The palate entices with caramel, cocoa and espresso, leading into a long, fudgy finish with hints of baking spice, orange peel, almond and coconut. Grande Champagne region.
label: spirits_taster

description: A refreshing take on reposado, this spirit mixes rich vanilla with bold, perky eucalyptus, mint and tarragon. Aged 11 months.
label: spirits_taster

description: This pale-straw Tequila has a mild, strikingly pear-like aroma. Soft and fleetingly sweet on the tongue, it features tropical fruit and agave notes, drying to black pepper on the fiery finish. Aged two to four months.
label: spirits_taster

description: This golden Tequila is lusciously silky, even oily, with light, pretty flavors of agave and vanilla. After a couple of sips, peppery notes kick in on the tongue, fading to hot cinnamon and clove. Aged 11 months.
label: spirits_taster

description: Yes, the name is off-putting, but it's also a reminder not to take your drink too seriously. The liquid is light gold in the glass, with a light vanilla aroma. Despite a resiny note, this Tequila is generally light, with alcohol heat tempered by agave-honey sweetness and a saline touch on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The herbaceous scent, laced with mint, chamomile and jalapeño, is echoed on the palate. Overall, the flavor is light, with vanilla and menthol tingle and cinnamon heat on the finish. Recommended for mixing into cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Most resposados rest in barrels for several months; this one is barrel-aged for a mere 15 days. Along with a honey hue, this Tequila has resiny overtones on the nose and palate, plus notes of dark honey, chamomile tea and sandalwood.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with Persian lime rinds, it's not a traditional limoncello, but it's delicious nonetheless. Straw-colored and bright in the glass, it's slightly sweet and bursting with lemongrass and fresh lime peel.
label: spirits_taster

description: This nontraditional 'cello is made with Persian limes and three different kinds of cherries. It has a surprising rosy hue and is relatively light bodied, offering sweet, juicy stone fruit and a spiced, warming finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This black currant liqueur offers a deep plum color and concentrated dark berry aroma, plus an earthy hint. On the palate, it's full bodied, with big notes of port, cherries in syrup and raspberry jam. Though pleasant to sip alone as a digestif, it's ideal lightened up with sparkling wine in a kir royale.
label: spirits_taster

description: Refreshing and ideal for sipping or mixing, this lemonade-like liqueur is cloudy yellow in the glass, with a sweet lemon-lollipop flavor and mouthwateringly tart finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Nodding to Jewish heritage, this liqueur is made from lemon-like etrog fruits sourced from a California farmer. It reads like a lighter version of limoncello, featuring a bold lemon-zest aroma and clean finish sprinkled with ginger and white pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Orange rinds furnish a gentle, cloudy yellow hue and mild aroma for this limoncello riff. It's big and sweet on the palate, showing grapefruit, lemon and a touch of vanilla on the long finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sweet and viscous, this limoncello variation is a cloudy, light yellow hue. Flavors show plenty of grapefruit plus a faint coconut aftertaste, suggesting tropical drink variations.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with Meyer lemon, this American riff on limoncello is light yellow and cloudy in the glass and viscous on the palate. Providing plenty of citrus-peel aromas, the flavor mingles orange and lemon, finishing long with white pepper and ginger sparks.
label: spirits_taster

description: Ruddy and slightly cloudy in the glass, this tasty, fruit-forward sipper offers cherry and cinnamon, with a fleeting floral hint. Made with lemon rinds, wild blueberries and fresh lavender buds.
label: spirits_taster

description: This clear, pale-yellow spirit combines candied lemon peel with delicate, subtle fresh-herb notes on the nose and palate. Though sweet up front, it finishes clean and fresh, teasing faint hints of celery and tarragon. The producer recommends mixing one part limoncello to three parts vodka for a “limontini.”
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from California-grown lemons and a base spirit distilled from wine grapes, this sweet-tart liqueur appears cloudy and dull yellow, with a juicy aroma that evokes just-cut lemon slices. It's slightly viscous, with a mouthwatering, astringent citric zing and a fair amount of alcohol heat on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Shake well before pouring, since sediment can settle to the bottom of the bottle. Once mixed, this liqueur is pale yellow and cloudy, with lots of bright, true lemon aroma and tart, lemon-curd-like flavor. The alcohol feels balanced.
label: spirits_taster

description: The base spirit of this limoncello-style liqueur is a vodka distilled from Seyval Blanc wine. It appears pale orange and cloudy, with a juicy tangerine-like aroma. The refreshing oranges-and-honey flavor echoes the scent, finishing slightly resiny and with a trace of alcohol heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: The remarkable, vibrant lavender hue is just the thing for adding a touch of color to cocktails. But don't confuse it with Crème de Violette: Although the color and candied-floral nose and palate suggest that violet-flavored classic, this is actually a tinted orange liqueur, with a mild edge that suggests orange peel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Featuring a bright sunshine-yellow hue and lemon lollipop scent and flavor, this Verona-made limoncello is pleasantly sweet and mouthwatering. Tame the alcohol heat by serving as cold as possible—even straight from the freezer.
label: spirits_taster

description: Though at first it seems delicate, with its pale yellow hue and light lemon-peel fragrance, this is surprisingly bold and sweet on the palate. The intensely sweet and sherbet-like flavor fades out to a more authentic lemon-peel finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Described as “apricots blended with Cognac,” this tawny liqueur has a powerful almond-extract aroma, with only the faintest whiff of apricot nectar. On the palate, it's very sweet like amaretto, finishing with a sprinkle of cinnamon spice. For sours and those with a sweet tooth.
label: spirits_taster

description: Slightly cloudy yellow in the glass, this liqueur has a bright, sweet lemon-drop scent. It's also sweet on the palate, with a viscous, slightly sticky feel, finishing with a pleasing lemon-peel note perked up with white pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Grab your corkscrew to open a bottle of this absinthe, a tribute to distiller T.A. Breaux's hometown, New Orleans. The light jade liquid louches to cloudy pale green, releasing gentle fennel, rosemary and fresh basil accented with lime zest and white pepper, plus a long, gentle anise finish. Although it's easy-sipping when louched, the undiluted spirit is ideal for prepping a glass to receive a sazerac.
label: spirits_taster

description: This pretty jade absinthe louches to shimmering opalescent, with a hint of sea-foam green. Relatively bold, the pungent anise scent is echoed on the palate, perked up by lively hints of fresh basil and lime peel. Finishes long and rounded, with an earthy Dutch licorice twang.
label: spirits_taster

description: To make this bottling, T.A. Breaux analyzed vintage absinthe, dated circa 1901. It's burnished gold in the glass, louching to opalescent light gold, and scented with bold notes of anise and licorice. The flavor is mild at first, but shows more anise on the long, rounded finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The backstory is a little complicated: first made in Boston circa 1902, it's now been resurrected in Switzerland, thanks to a Boston-based historian. The absinthe itself is more straightforward. It louches to cloudy pale yellow, releasing a mild, citrusy aroma. On the palate, the star anise flavor is assertive and bright, even when diluted with water, and backed by lemongrass and ginger.
label: spirits_taster

description: This cocktail-friendly absinthe is mild and herbaceous, hinting at fennel, lime peel, and a fresh hint of celery. Made with beet neutral spirits, it has a faint sweetness that plays around the edges. Light straw in the glass, louching to bright opalescent.
label: spirits_taster

description: Starting as green-tinged gold, this louches to opal touched with pale green. The mild fragrance shows fennel and a hint of juniper. Although the alcohol level is comparable to other absinthes, it seems to require more dilution to tone down the alcohol heat and tease out a faint sweetness. Even so, it retains a relatively spicy profile, showing fennel, black pepper and hot cinnamon, plus a lingering licorice note at the back of the palate.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from cashew apples (the fruit that grows around cashew nuts), this spirit typically is consumed in India, but is rarely seen in the U.S. This version is clear in the glass and has a strong exotic fruit-like aromas similar to lychee. Most of the flavor is on the long finish, showing floral and tropical fruit notes. Mix into tall cocktails with juices and soda water.
label: spirits_taster

description: Light straw in the glass, look for bold, sweet almond-like aroma and flavor reminiscent of amaretto or marzipan candy. Compared to most liqueurs, this one is surprisingly light on the palate.
label: spirits_taster

description: This cherry eau-de-vie has an aroma that mixes cherry with a resin-like note, coupled with a bitter, almond-like palate that suggests cherry stones. Most of the fruit emerges on the rounded finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bold, cooked cherry aroma suggests pie filling. On the palate, this clear spirit shows a lot of cherry flavor up front, but it's also quite fiery, which is to be expected from a 90 proof bottling.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with Williams pears from the southwest of France, this limited-edition bottling offers a slightly sweet aroma that mixes apples and pear with a resin-like note. There's plenty of pear on the rounded palate, though the resiny note appears again, plus a drying dose of alcohol heat. More pear flavor turns up on the exhale. Only 10,000 bottles produced per year.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged in barrels for three months, this orange-amber liqueur has a relatively neutral scent and flavor, though it shows some pleasant baking spice and vanilla on the palate.
label: spirits_taster

description: Malty and warm on the nose and palate, there's not a lot of fruit to find in this wild raspberry brandy. Look for a cooked-berry note in the finish, accompanied by white pepper heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: This clear eau-de-vie has a warm, malty, rustic aroma, underpinned by a thread of fruit underneath. Most of the pear flavor appears on the long and rather fiery finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Two years of rest in French oak casks yields a pale straw hue and mellow honey-banana aroma. The aged cachaça sips well, with lots of mouthwatering vanilla, brown sugar and crème brulee winding into a lingering baking spice finish. New to the U.S. as of October 2014.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged for a whopping five years in French oak barrels and packaged in a hefty, pear-shaped bottle, this clearly is meant as a premium offering. The amber spirit smells enticingly sweet, evoking vanilla, brown sugar and even traces of cola with orange peel. On the palate, it's smooth and silky, with big, dark flavors: allspice, toffee, dark honey, toasted coconut, espresso and oak. Add an ice cube and a twist of orange peel for pleasant sipping.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clean, versatile and cocktail-friendly, this cachaça offers tropical fruit and fresh-cut grass, accented with ginger-nutmeg spice on the crisp finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Despite the wave-like dark blue bottle design, created by glass designer Bryan Clarke to resemble the art deco pattern on the Copacabana Promenade in Rio, the spirit itself pours nearly clear, with a faint golden tinge. Look for bold, pungent notes of banana, coconut and vanilla dusted with cocoa, finishing long and fruity.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clear in the glass, with a mild, sugary aroma, this cocktail-friendly spirit shows delicate vanilla and sugar, plus fleeting floral notes, raspberry and banana. Finishes smooth.
label: spirits_taster

description: This acholado-style pisco has a distinctly fruity fragrance, evoking blueberries, tart plum and banana. The palate skews more floral, with just a hint of fruit and honey, tapering to a crisp, elegant finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This single vineyard pisco made with grapes from Atalaya Vineyard delivers a mix of light berry, cantaloupe and floral notes, plus a sweet bubblegum-like pop of flavor midpalate. Sips well, finishing moderately long with a melon-y fade.
label: spirits_taster

description: Two years of barrel aging yields a soft pale gold hue and a vanilla-brown sugar profile touched with banana and cinnamon (think bananas foster). Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: Ideal for tropical drinks and pisco punches, this approachable, earthy-fruity pisco pops with lots of perky banana, pineapple and lychee, sliding into a spiced finish that suggests cinnamon- and cocoa-dusted pineapple slices.
label: spirits_taster

description: This single vineyard pisco is made with grapes from famed Pampa de Villacuri Vineyard. It opens with delicate rosewater and white flower aromatics. The floral notes echo boldly on the palate, easing into a brush of tropical fruit and finishing with a floral exhale.
label: spirits_taster

description: From the makers of Porton, this pisco has an earthy scent that hints at coconut and orange peel. On the palate, coconut dominates the flavor profile, which is rounded out with vanilla, fleeting fruit juiciness at the back of the palate, and a prickle of clove and cinnamon heat on the finish. Try it in a pisco sour.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pungent, grassy and visceral, this unique single-vintage cachaça almost reads like rhum agricole, showing lemongrass, banana and a fiery finish. It's a 2014 vintage made from “select sugar cane” and bottled at still strength. The producer likens it to “Brazilian Beaujolais” – not literally, of course, but here's hoping Leblon will follow the wine world's lead and release more single-vintage bottlings like this memorable one.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is particularly herbaceous, with notes of dill and mild pickle brine. The palate reads as floral, suggesting violet candy and a savory hint of dill, finishing with warm cassia bark and a drying feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Named for an Andean spiritual dance enacting a fight between angels and demons, this acholado-style pisco mixes sweet and spicy. The aroma is fruity and grape-like. However, the palate leads with violet, showing dusty, spicy nutmeg and black pepper before exiting with a floral, slightly soapy note. Producer recommends mixing into pisco punch.
label: spirits_taster

description: This ruddy gin-based liqueur, infused with rose hips and petals and sweetened with turbinado sugar, will appeal to fans of aperitif cocktails. The bold, herbal aroma and sweet notes of burnt orange peel and clove read almost like an herbaceous root beer or a light amaro, finishing with bracing pink peppercorn. Sip over ice or experiment with Negroni variations.
label: spirits_taster

description: Consider this a head start on gimlets and other citrusy cocktails. With a bright, slightly sweet, candied lemon peel profile, this citrus-forward gin is pleasant to sip and finishes with a sprightly ginger note.
label: spirits_taster

description: Hana is Japanese for flower, as the orchid etched into the teardrop-shaped bottle suggests, and this gin does show subtle white floral notes. The bright, delicate aroma suggests floral and mild vegetal notes reminiscent of fresh snow peas. The flavor is equally bright and bracing, with a fleeting berry sweetness and crisp, lightly floral finish. Nuanced and versatile enough for a wide range of classic cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Golden in the glass, this gin is scented with rich, buttery vanilla touched with honey and fresh apple. It's slightly oily on the palate, where vanilla sweetness is shored up with mint, pine, cinnamon and cardamom. Though it sips well alone, this wheat-based gin works in cocktails, too.
label: spirits_taster

description: The earthy aroma shows anise at first, with time in the glass opening to a fresh, grassy note. On the palate, this gin is soft and herbaceous, with notes of spruce, spearmint, tarragon and anise, plus a surprising tart lime note that bounces into the brisk finish. Mix with tonic and enjoy.
label: spirits_taster

description: This complex, balanced gin has a citrusy, lightly sweet palate, hinting at grapefruit and delivering a faint, pleasing white floral note. The finish offers citrus and spicy zing.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from a Niagara grape base and infused with 22 botanicals (hence the name), this small-batch gin is light and soft, with notes of lemongrass, juniper and lime zest, finishing zingy and brisk. Though the producer warns that the gin is unfiltered and may appear cloudy, it looked clear in the glass. Martini material.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bridging sweet and savory, this gin has a citrusy fragrance, which also shows up on the palate. Starting out with mild pineapple-like sweetness and traditional juniper, this gin segues into a spicy, mouthwatering finish with white and black pepper, coriander and ginger spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: An appealing nutty aroma with barely discernable traces of hard cheese and marzipan. The palate entry is raisiny sweet with a slight toffee kick; at midpalate the taste profile adds deft flavors of toasted almond, oak, and black pepper, becoming more off-dry than sweet as a result. Finishes smooth, mature and integrated.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial nosings pick up a solid scent of beany espresso that overrides the cream and sambuca elements; air contact sees the cream take command as the espresso recedes. Palate entry deals with the creaminess; by midpalate, the anise/licorice spirit base makes itself known as the espresso all but disappears. Aftertaste is creamy and pleasant.
label: spirits_taster

description: First sniffings pick up aromas of vanilla, maple, and honey; following more air exposure, the bouquet turns bread-like and baked, with notes of resin, paraffin, cowhide, hemp, and egg noodle. Palate entry is sweet, maple- and sap-like; at midpalate, the cask strength alcohol kicks in, warming the tongue and offering sweet flavors of honey, toffee, and marzipan. Concludes with parting tastes of honey and toffee
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged in 100% Bourbon barrels. Pale straw hue. In the first two minutes concentrated grainy aromas, delicately touched by honey backnotes impress; seven more minutes allow the aroma to evolve into a solid bouquet, notable for its biscuity, wafer-like, poached pear and malty scents. Palate entry is firm, sugar cookie-sweet and displays a welcome hint of oiliness; midpalate is cereal/malty sweet and oily but hardly unctuous as the acidity level is clearly high enough to retain a lovely tartness/crispness. Finishes long, if a bit narrowly focused on the resiny acidity.
label: spirits_taster

description: Beauce wheat; distilled five times. Nosing passes pick up concentrated aromas of grain, moss and wet earth. Palate entry is grainy, off-dry and piquant; at midpalate, the grain, cracker, off-dry flavors deepen slightly. Aftertaste is long, clean and agreeably grainy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aroma is pure and moderately grainy. Palate entry is dry, grainy and concentrated; by midpalate, there's a mild oiliness to the texture and a semisweet flavor of grain mash. Finish goes dry and moderately grainy with just a trace of rye spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first whiffs find lovely, sweet scents of cream, cake frosting and candied almond; aeration stimulates additional scents of heather honey and dates. Palate entry is creamy and oily; by midpalate there's a sweet creaminess that supersedes the oiliness, making for lip-smacking drinking. Finishes honeyed, sweet, floral and biscuity.
label: spirits_taster

description: Tropical fruit, citrusy and mango-like aromas. Light, acidic and very tart at palate entry; the midpalate is refreshing, intensely juicy and almost sour. Aftertaste leans heavily on the tartness.
label: spirits_taster

description: Smells of apples, spice, beeswax and oil. Palate entry is off-dry and caramel-like with a silky texture that forms a base for the semisweet, toffee and apple and pear-like flavors.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial aroma shows round, biscuity and mature praline-like notes that are simultaneously nutty and sweet; aeration allows the bouquet to focus on the bittersweet candied almond core aroma. Palate entry is firm, bittersweet and nicely viscous; midpalate the candied almond dominates to the point of exclusion. Concludes bittersweet and nutty.
label: spirits_taster

description: Golden hue. Initial nosing passes unearth dry, unfocused, slightly muted scents of malt, sesame and even, in the distance, mustard seed; additional time releases scents of palm oil, lanolin, egg white, slight brine and fresh almonds. Better in the mouth than on the nose, the palate entry is deeply grainy/malty, sweet and oily; by midpalate sensuous tastes of dark chocolate, sugar cookies, brown sugar, oak and honey delight. Finishes medium-long, moderately sweet and succulent.
label: spirits_taster

description: Beefeater base with a delicate infusion of pear flavor. Initial nosing passes detect the telltale, semisweet botanical London Dry thumbprint of Beefeater but with a subtle fruity enhancement; time serves only to bring out the pear component a smidgen more, except that it reminds me more of banana than pear. Palate entry is nicely textured, semisweet and elegant; it isn't until the midpalate that I can isolate the pear/banana element from the rest of the botanicals. Finish is long, fruity in a slightly bitter pear peel way and full on the tongue. I commend Beefeater for trying something different and a little bit daring.
label: spirits_taster

description: Inexcusably large amount of sediment and floating debris displayed. Subtle bouquet is lightly peppery and mildly herbal; aeration releases aromas of fennel, green onion, Sherry and oak resin. Palate entry is oily/creamy and moderately sweet; midpalate shows green vegetable, Sherry/honey, and herbal agave flavors. Finishes sweetly.
label: spirits_taster

description: Tart green apple perfume jumps from the glass and eventually calms down with aeration. Palate entry is pleasingly tart and crisp, then at midpalate there's a nice oiliness that complements the fruit.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma begins in an intensely grainy, dry breakfast cereal-like way; additional time in the glass adds woodsy/open field notes of pine/cedar, heather and wood resin. Palate entry is dry to off-dry and grainy, then at midpalate flow semisweet waves of woody vanillin, cocoa, malt and light toffee. Finishes in a flurry of woody/caramel-like tastes.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bouquet offers ripe red raspberry perfume. Ultra-sour at palate entry, but  by midpalate, the sour raspberry flavor is borderline astringent. Aftertaste is sour and mouth-puckering.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening whiffs are of freshly ground black pepper and cassia bark; after six minutes, the intriguing bouquet adds subtle fragrances of licorice, juniper berry and bitter orange peel. The prevailing early-on flavors feature the bitter orange peel; at midpalate, juniper dominates, effectively vanquishing its flavor peers. Turns pleasantly floral and fruity in the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening aromas are of cotton fabric and wet hay; time in the glass doesn't deepen the fragrance, adding only very delicate notes of damp grain, nectarine and spearmint. Palate entry is properly sweet and deliciously grainy; at the midpalate the flavor profile does its best work as taut tastes of oak resin, malted grains, pears, light honey and toasted honey wheat bread make a clear, definitive statement. Aftertaste is predictably mild, softly sweet and more grainy than woody.
label: spirits_taster

description: Whiffs are of raspberry. Palate entry features a near-syrupy texture that underpins the juicy, preserves-like red raspberry flavor; at midpalate, the fruit's acidity helps to balance some of the jamminess/ripeness. The aftertaste reverts back to the keen, sweet fruitiness found in the bouquet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The no-nonsense bouquet opens up with marshmallow, light toffee and light honey. Early taste is sweet and molasses-centric, then at midpalate there's a spiced honey flavor that gently guides you to the creamy, cake frosting finish. I liked this affable spiced rum when I first reviewed it 12 years ago and I still like it.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opulent but astringent scents of honey, nut candy and dark toffee impress the olfactory sense. Flavor is tart, lean and brown sugar-like at first, then it explodes with marzipan, brown sugar, honey, cocoa and toasted almond. Aftertaste is long and bittersweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The early aroma is a combination of malt, wood and sea breeze; the later bouquet is a deliciously harmonious, even creamy marriage of maritime atmosphere and malted barley. Palate entry is chock full of biscuity, peaty, tobacco leaf tastes; the midpalate stage is sweet. Concludes strong, firm, slightly hot, pungent and briny. The best-kept secret of Scotland's Western Highlands.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma offers real herbal/peppery/briny agave quality, plus notes of gum, wheat bread toast and spice. Palate entry highlights a piquant green pepper taste; the midpalate features softer, even delicate flavors of steamed asparagus, herbs and bittersweet agave juice. Finishes gently.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening bouquet emits strong, firm aromas of saddle leather and oak; aeration adds minimal scents of vinyl, grass and distant honey. Palate entry offers sap-like tastes of maple and butterscotch; by midpalate, soft, almost plump flavors of sap, steamed green vegetables and palm oil take charge. Concludes warm in the throat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening aroma owns a distinct, bitter aroma of green olive; aeration introduces atypical aromas such as sea air, green peppercorn and steamed broccoli, especially. Palate entry is bitter going on semisweet and vegetal/grassy rather than sugary; by midpalate, the taste offers bittersweet and oily cane-like flavors. Ends grassy and green. Worked for me.
label: spirits_taster

description: First inhalations unearth mildly zesty aromas of licorice and brambles; richer, more muscular scents of black licorice, freshly ground black pepper and fennel rise with aeration. Palate entry is piquant, prickly yet velvety and slightly stinging on the tongue; by midpalate, the taste profile offers a viscous texture and heady flavors of anise and licorice. Ends smooth and thick.
label: spirits_taster

description: The early stage aroma is fresh, malty, yeasty/beery and honey-like; further aeration stimulates intriguing notes of nougat, milk chocolate and oaky vanilla. Palate entry offers pleasantly fruity/grainy tastes that are off-dry. Ends up semisweet, candied and even a tad sherried.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening whiffs find old library-like aromas of parchment, cardboard and malt; more aeration reveals evolved scents that feature palm oil, lanolin, old oak, wood resin and faint vanilla bean. Palate entry offers a lip-smacking taste that's part maple and part oaky vanillin; by midpalate, the flavor displays semi-rich, woody, Sherry/honey tastes. Ends sweet and cocoa-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: Nosings discover fresh though indistinct citrus aromas that one recognizes as lemon. At palate entry, the lemon component becomes more apparent as a pleasingly tart/bittersweet taste refreshes the taste buds; at midpalate, a flavor of lemon hard candy takes charge, lasting well into the clean, acidic finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is distant except for a slight corny/buttered popcorn trace. Palate entry is silky smooth and oily; at midpalate there's a sooty/ashy core flavor. Ends smoothly and with a touch of spirity fire. Not a great vodka, but nicely balanced, completely dry and very silky.
label: spirits_taster

description: Balanced, light and versatile, and likely a good foil for cocktails. Smoky fragrance with hints of caramel and dried apricots. The golden color, medium weight and flavors pleasantly evoke maple syrup and caramel at first, although zingy, oaky flavors soon follow. With ice, the wood becomes more pronounced. A nice, smooth and dry finish lingers but doesn't overstay its welcome.
label: spirits_taster

description: Complex and dry, with a shifting array of aromas and flavors. At first, this rye smelled spicy and orange-y, but later opened up to a strong caramel fragrance. In addition to heavy wood in the flavor, caramel, dark tea, and tobacco also can be detected. Light, smooth finish is velvety on the tongue. Light to medium body, with the right amount of bite. With some dilution from ice, it opens up, and becomes even more light and crisp. Seems like a good rye for Sazeracs and other cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Silky, smooth and syrupy, with a lightness that would lend itself to a Sazerac. Light tawny golden color, scent of vanilla, oranges and, faintly, peaches. Caramel flavors wind up into a pleasantly warm and smooth finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Complex and bold, with a deep amber color. This one is 100 proof, and won't let you forget it—the alcohol hits right on the nose, but so does a concentrated deep toffee and coffee-ground fragrance. The flavor hints at sweetness at first, then opens up to oak, caramel and spice. The finish is smooth, with lots of lingering caramel, but also a powerful bite. This is a beautiful example of what an aged rye can be, and it probably would have rated even higher if it weren't so powerfully alcoholic.
label: spirits_taster

description: Crazy-sweet aroma, full of caramel, vanilla and a slight floral touch. The bite comes first (and lingers awhile), followed by vanilla, caramel, coconut flavors. It mellows considerably with ice, and becomes quite likeable, drinkable and mild.
label: spirits_taster

description: Dark amber color, strongly and sweetly aromatic with hints of cigar tobacco and allspice. Pleasant, deep toffee flavors almost threaten to turn sweet, but the finish is brisk, brief and dry. Medium body.
label: spirits_taster

description: This rye has a classic profile—a bit of spice, light flavor and good structure. Sweet caramel and aromas faded surprisingly quickly. Flavors featured vanilla and tannic black tea, and finished with alcohol bite and a caramel finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The kickin' chicken was a total chameleon: on the first pass, it reflected deep, round, almost sweet aromas, like fruitcake and spice, and equally sweet flavors of toffee and orange peel. But on the second pass, especially with ice, it became more brisk, dry, and light. However, the lingering, tannic bite and orange-amber color remained constant.
label: spirits_taster

description: This high-rye spirit (close to 95% rye) is manly and rugged, like chewing on saddle leather. Elegant, straight-edge bottle design. Golden color and medium body. Aromas evoked burnt orange peel and ripe cheeses, while the flavors were boldly oaky and bitter, with notes of tobacco, leather and black tea. Dry, short, stinging finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Medium-amber color, citrusy aromas opening up to caramel scent. Big flavors of tobacco, oak, and leather lead to a lingering, tannic, alcoholic and slightly bitter finish. Cocktail purists will love the label showing old-time gentlemen in hats tippling at the bar.
label: spirits_taster

description: Features a bright, pleasantly familiar orange-lemon lollipop scent and fresh, clean and brisk flavors, with most of the lemon in the finish. Balanced, with the right amount of alcohol bite. A sure classic for vodka tonics.
label: spirits_taster

description: The deep, sweet orange and honeyed-floral fragrance is the first signal this vodka will be special. The flavors are clean and brisk, followed by a strong bite and honey and tangerine notes. It finishes sweet, with faint floral and vanilla notes coaxed out over ice.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opens with a fruity, slightly overripe aroma, very close to true grapefruit. The flavors of pomelo and lychee are more dry than sweet, finishing with a touch of anise and moderate bite.
label: spirits_taster

description: The sweet, high but slightly orange-soda ersatz scent accurately reflects the equally sweet and intensely orange taste of this vodka. Because it finishes smooth, with rounded orange and tangerine notes and a Cognac-like, warming touch of honey, it's addictively sippable.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pleasantly aromatic, with punchy orange blossom and lime candy notes. An initially neutral flavor gives way to a touch of sweetness. It finishes smooth, with a lingering hint of orange.
label: spirits_taster

description: Eco-advocates will love that the packaging is carbon-negative. But how's the liquid inside? Subtle and lovely. It's one of the few vodkas with a hint of pale yellow tint, as well as a slightly viscous body. The scent is light, natural, and lemon zest-y. The flavors also are on the subtle side, hinting at orange blossom, and tapering to lemon peel on the finish. This vodka would blend particularly well into sour-based cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bright, lemon-lime soda aromas, a touch ersatz. The pleasant flavor is reminiscent of sweet lemonade, finishing with a surprising herbal note. It braced up further over ice.
label: spirits_taster

description: Luscious and perfumy, with Christmas clementine and vanilla aromas. However, there's far more orange on the nose than on the palate:  a big alcohol bite comes first, followed by neutral flavor with just a suggestion of orange, and a floral finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: True fruit fragrance of orange peel oils, tangerine and a touch of lemon. Restrained and light on the palate, with most of the orange on the lingering finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Despite a faint lime-lollipop scent, the flavor of this vodka tilted more toward lemon than lime, with perhaps a touch of lime-leaf essence. The subtle flavor and light feel would make for a polished, high-end cocktail.
label: spirits_taster

description: Crystal clear appearance, despite the striking orange bottle, and slightly viscous body. Nothing subtle here: get ready for big, sweet, Orange Crush aromas mirrored by sweet, absolutely huge orange flavors. While it was too sweet neat, almost like a liqueur, it gained more bite and structure over ice, and finished with a touch of lemon/citron. Very sippable.
label: spirits_taster

description: The flavors are more reminiscent of pear than orange, and lead to a mouthwatering finish, with just the right amount of bite to balance it out. Juicy, almost too overripe tangerine scent.
label: spirits_taster

description: The fragrance is sweet and like lemonade. Initially neutral flavor gives over to alcohol bite, and then a powerful, lingering bitter lemon finish. Probably would be good in a lemon drop, or cocktail that adds some sweetness to balance out the bite.
label: spirits_taster

description: Dark honey color, lushly aromatic, fragrance like a bouquet of wildflowers:  honeysuckle and clover. Viscous and luxurious on the tongue, it offers bold flavors of dark toffee, lots of oak, and finishes with bitter almond and a touch of raisin. Mellow; hardly any bite when chilled, which makes it highly sippable, almost like Cognac.
label: spirits_taster

description: Complex and addictive.  Scents of cinnamon, hazelnuts, and dried fruit precede big flavors: cinnamon spice, raisinated and plummy, like Madeira or Sherry. Long finish, with a bit of a bite.
label: spirits_taster

description: Dark, spicy-sweet, deep vanilla aroma, and unlike many Bourbons, it tastes just like it smells. Medium to heavy body, with a mellow, lingering finish. Great sipper on a blustery night.
label: spirits_taster

description: Lively, complex and deeply aromatic, with hits of Christmas spice, orange blossom and vanilla. It's spicy on the tongue, with lots of woodsy vanilla and orange. Medium body, this would rock a Bourbon-based Sazerac.
label: spirits_taster

description: Deep color, medium-to-heavy feel. Strong, sweet fragrance with wood and spice tones. Butterscotch candy flavors, so strong I almost hear cellophane unwrapping, are echoed by some oak, caramel and vanilla. Smooth, not too much alcohol fire. Mellow, long finish with a touch of herbal and anise notes.
label: spirits_taster

description: Extremely well balanced—it's complex but no single element stands out. Flavors are of caramel, burnt orange peel, toastiness and oak. Medium body, silky and long finish, with the right amount of bite, lingering aniseed note. Highly versatile.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pour it, and let it sit awhile; this one opens up and gets more aromatic, rich and flavorful, like wine. It starts off with a candied sweetness and touches of coconut and tea on the nose, then opens up to deeper caramel tones. Orange and caramel flavors, mellow, smooth, linger on the finish. Light-bodied, despite the bold, luxurious flavors. And oh, that pretty bottle, like an oversized perfume flask. Add this one to your gift list.
label: spirits_taster

description: A clean, solid, totally dry and stone-like vodka bouquet. The palate entry is medium-full, dry and grainy; the midpalate displays a smooth oiliness that turns pleasantly vigorous and nearly prickly in the throat. Finishes long, stony and expectedly piquant.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening aroma is thick with a pear-like ripeness and the musty smell of grape skins; aeration allows a grapiness that's gum-like and citrusy to emerge. There's a pleasant fruity burst of flavor at palate entry; the midpalate features an acidity that keeps the fruit ripeness in check. Concludes viney, winey, acidic and clean.
label: spirits_taster

description: A curious aroma of clear vinyl smells with meager scents of red cherry and orange peel. The palate entry is better than the bouquet, featuring an agreeably toasty, maple-like surface flavor; at midpalate the flavor profile expands to include butter, almond paste, bacon fat and pork rind. Finishes long, spirity, warm and elegant.
label: spirits_taster

description: The unremarkable bouquet only offers an extremely faint scent of cotton. The palate entry is pleasantly smooth, off-dry, and snack-cracker-like; the midpalate displays medium weight, moderate oiliness and a chewy quality that's grainy. Concludes bittersweet, a bit licorice-like and nicely balanced.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers intense bramble, but scant fruit fragrances. The palate entry is rich and concentrated with a deep blackberry taste; by midpalate the tastes becomes stony, ripe, preserves-like and ripe-sweet. Finishes jammy and ripe.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is as much berry- and melon-like as it is pomegranate-like. The palate entry is nicely sour and tart; the midpalate offers acidic crispness that accentuates the freshness of the fruit. The tasty finish is lean and tart. Not the equal of the more pomegranate-like PAMA or Bauchant XO but very good.
label: spirits_taster

description: The attractive bouquet is pleasantly citrusy and tangerine/blood orange-like. The palate entry is lusciously tangerine-like and sweet/sour; the midpalate takes a sweeter turn, sacrificing a portion of the citric acid to heighten the sweetness. Ends zestily and ripe.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aromas include a bittersweet vegetal scent and a fiber-like hint of hemp with a keen fragrance of charcoal or tar. The palate entry is pleasant and sweet; at midpalate the taste profile turns sharp, smoky and bitter.
label: spirits_taster

description: The compellingly complex and multi-layered bouquet includes fragrances of nutmeg, oak, wet grass, rubber pencil eraser, white pepper and carnations. The palate entry has flavors of   herbs, caney sweetness and flower garden; the midpalate features elements of smoke, tobacco leaf, black pepper, cinnamon, vanilla bean, nut paste and honey. Stupendous.
label: spirits_taster

description: The full bodied, spicy aroma offers delicate notes of juniper berry oil, citrus, orris, coriander and caraway seed. Palate entry is mildly peppery, floral and fruity; at midpalate the flavor profile focuses more on oils and juniper. A unique and great gin.
label: spirits_taster

description: Early aroma sincludes ashy, tarred cinders/asphalt and molasses; following aeration the sweetness element comes to the forefront. The palate is bittersweet, a tad chalk-like and warming, then offers a highly pleasing bitterness. Finishes mellow, cocoa sweet, and lusciously medium-weighted in texture. What all molasses-based white rum should be.
label: spirits_taster

description: A grainy, sweet, inviting bouquet turns bakery-like. The palate entry is soft and delicate; the midpalate features high levels of bittersweet grain kernel flavor, laced with clean acidity and ample viscosity. Ends gracefully, tight and bean-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: Lovely bouquet that is delightfully fruity and nutty at the outset and then turns vanilla-like and winter holiday spicy. The palate entry is engagingly and moderately sweet; midpalate offers long, honeyed flavors without a hint of acidic edge or spirit-induced heat. Ends up plump and properly sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aeration allows aromas of oak, winter holiday spice and vanilla cake frosting to emerge. Supple palate entry, moderately honeyed; midpalate highlights include the buttery/creamy texture and tastes of cocoa, fiber, ash and beans. Sophisticated and world-class.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromas of breakfast cereal, slate, charcoal and wet grass. The palate entry is supple and smoky sweet, thick in texture and altogether delightful; midpalate highlights the ashy sweetness. Finishes robustly and with panache.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sophisticated and delightful aromas of tangerine and rhubarb. The palate entry is delightfully citrusy and sweet; the midpalate phase offers just enough herbal bitterness to balance. Ends up refreshing, orangey sweet and delectably herbal. This deserves to become a popular pre-dinner quaff.
label: spirits_taster

description: Attractive scents of peanut butter, citrus peel and unsalted butter. The palate entry showcases the peanut quality, but adds a hint of charred oak; at midpalate the taste profile becomes more bacon fat-like and smoky, with nuances of palm oil, nut paste and cream.
label: spirits_taster

description: The delightful bouquet offers potent tobacco ash, paraffin, sweet oak and grain kernel. The palate entry has spirity warmth and tastes of cigarette tobacco, light honey and cereal grain; midpalate texture is creamy and deliciously sooty. Finishes buttery, spirity and clean.
label: spirits_taster

description: A medium-complex bouquet that demands focus and time; offers scents of grass, textile, peanut, beeswax with an underlying honeyed sweetness. The palate is mellow and marshmallow sweet, then features luscious and delicate flavors of honey, cola nut and cream. Elegant, poised and succulent.
label: spirits_taster
