description: Made with rums one to eight years old, it's carbon-filtered after aging to remove any color. The result is a medium-bodied, silky rum perfect for top-flight mojitos. It has a bold sugar-cane aroma and lightly sweet palate, with faint marshmallow and almond sweetness. Part of Bacardi's special-edition rum line.
label: spirits_taster

description: The story behind this amber rum is that it's “matured underwater at a depth of seven fathoms (42 feet),” beneath the Caribbean seas. Look for bold toffee and brown sugar notes, finishing exceedingly long and spicy. It's just the ticket for rum punches.
label: spirits_taster

description: Golden in color, it has a fresh, fruity fragrance with hints of apples, pineapple, and honey. On the palate, the experience is a bit more rich, cushioned with vanilla, honey and pecan and finishing with brisk notes of tea and cedar. Pair this versatile rum with ginger beer or other mixers.
label: spirits_taster

description: Though this amber rum flavored with Brazilian coffee extract has a mild coffee aroma, it's quite bold and syrupy on the palate. The flavor leans toward light-roasted coffee, not dark espresso, with a touch of hazelnut on the finish. The coffee flavor doesn't linger on forever, so it's just right to add subtle flavor to cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clear and star-bright in the glass, this rum has a mildly sweet aroma, with a faint hint of banana. On the palate, expect light fruitiness, marshmallow sweetness and baking spice, with a lovely bloom of flavor on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged in former Bourbon barrels, this bright topaz rum has notes of resin and vanilla on the nose. On the palate, it's silky, bold with vanilla and a prickle of baking spice on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This clear rum is full-bodied, even slightly viscous, with vanilla, coconut and marshmallow sweetness and a touch of charcoal on the finish. Even smoother with ice, this should be a front-runner for mojitos and other mixed drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: Some spiced rums are merely colored, not aged; but this nut-brown spirit is made from a base of rum aged for four years in oak barrels. In that context, the substantial, oaky flavor makes perfect sense, rounded out by vanilla, dusty nutmeg and allspice. Mix with cola or ginger ale.
label: spirits_taster

description: “Inspired by” country singer Kenny Chesney, this clear rum is meant for mixing. It has a mild, lightly sweet aroma and flavor, with fleeting notes of vanilla and white pepper leading to a crisp finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bright gold in the glass, it delivers a sweet, spiced aroma recalling red-hot candies. Considering the brash aromatics, it's a surprise to find that it's quite mild on the tongue with a bare simmer of cinnamon on the finish—more flavor and body would be welcome.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from Kentucky sorghum molasses and finished in used Bourbon barrels, this small-batch rum has plenty of personality. It has a soft golden tint and a bold, slightly funky aroma that hints at honey and bananas. On the palate, a resiny note leads, but cedes way to waxy honey, banana and a mouthwatering touch of maple. Finishes long, spiced and bold.
label: spirits_taster

description: Golden and syrupy, this flavored rum has a juicy mango aroma. On the palate, it's quite sweet, with a waxy, toasty note on the finish that finishes more honeyed than fruity.
label: spirits_taster

description: This clear flavored rum has a light banana fragrance, and a light flavor that suggests banana-flavored taffy. Use to add a hint of banana to coladas and other cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Despite the fact that at 126 proof it may be best suited for lighting your tiki torches, it has body and a juicy, apple-like sweetness. However, it finishes so fiery it's literally tongue-numbing. Use sparingly as a float on top of tiki drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: From the first sugary whiff, the overproof nature of this clear rum is immediately evident. On the palate, it has a fleeting sweetness and boy, does it clear out the sinuses. Even mixed, it packs quite a punch.
label: spirits_taster

description: More citrus-forward than the standard Tanqeray Dry bottling, this is gin-and-tonic perfection. The classic aroma features juniper and touches of mint, anise and coriander. The same is echoed on the palate, though it's also bursting with grapefruit and lemon peel, finishing soft and herbaceous but perked up with a white peppercorn spark. The No. Ten also has a new art deco-inspired bottle, making it a particularly gift-worthy choice for summer party-goers.
label: spirits_taster

description: For years, Malacca was best known as a cult gin. Slightly sweeter and less junipery than London dry gins, it is supposedly based on Charles Tanqueray's own 1830s recipe. It was made available briefly in the late 1990s, before it was whisked off the shelves. Once again, this is a limited-edition bottling. It's soft, herbal and fresh, with green notes that evoke spearmint and basil, just enough juniper for backbone, and a delicate rosewater finish. It's a natural for classic cocktails, so let's hope it sticks around a while this time.
label: spirits_taster

description: Infused with citrus peel and spices, then aged in a former   Bourbon barrel for 12 months, this mellow, soft gin has lots of body. Look for a good dose of vanilla chased by cinnamon heat, plus touches of honey, oak and citrus on the finish. With a splash of simple syrup, this complex, golden gin is almost a cocktail on its own.
label: spirits_taster

description: This brisk, citrusy gin is made for classic cocktails. Bold lemon and grapefruit notes meld with a light floral note and just enough juniper to hold it all together. Amid the bright citrus bouquet, you might detect another, more elusive fruity scent. Surprise! This gin is distilled from apples.
label: spirits_taster

description: So what is “Texas--style” gin, exactly? It's “big as Texas,” the producer boasts. More specifically, it's bright, fresh and well-structured, bursting with juniper, rosemary and grapefruit. Bottled at 94 proof, it's also quite muscular, finishing with a warmth that should be tempered when mixed into drinks. Pecans are listed among the botanicals used, although they are impossible to detect.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made in the London dry style and packaged in a distinctive peacock-blue bottle, this gin has mild aromatics and fleeting sweetness on the palate chased by citrus, juniper and spice. The finish is crisp and assertive, even slightly hot at 94 proof, but that won't matter once mixed into a tall gin-and-tonic or Tom Collins.
label: spirits_taster

description: As the name suggests, this is a citrus-forward gin. It's lightly sweet, with notes of candied lemon peel and lemon verbena, finishing with white pepper and ginger sparks plus a subtle floral note. Score a bottle to lend extra presence to citrusy drinks like gin-and-tonics or sour-style cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: The gingerbread-like aroma entices with a fleeting whiff of nutmeg and baking spice, while the palate zings with grapefruit-peel bitterness and lemon verbena. The mouthwatering finish harmoniously echoes the spicy notes detected in the aroma: anise, cardamom, baking spice, and a final dose of citrus, all smoothed over by a cucumber-like freshness.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bold and gutsy, this burnished-copper, barrel-aged gin resembles a cross between whiskey and aged rum. The deep, funky aroma suggests molasses and root beer, though the palate veers closer to brown sugar, finishing with dry notes of chamomile tea, cedar and clove. In some ways this unusual gin is similar to the sweeter old tom-style genre; it should be interesting to watch how bartenders use this to re-create Martinez cocktails and other gin-soaked classics.
label: spirits_taster

description: Though golden orange in the glass, this is not a barrel-aged gin; rather, it's infused with botanicals (as most gins are), but hasn't had the color distilled out. It's sweet and soft on the palate, and the different constituents sing out clearly: juniper, anise and clove are backed by a wave of honey and allspice, plus a surprising dark-fruit note in the back of the palate and a light floral accent on the exit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from California grapes, it holds a bold, mildly sweet profile. At first sip, candied citrus peel seems to dominate, but star anise really rings through on the spicy finish. It delivers a soft and smooth feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Smells faintly of aniseed, cinchona, ginger, and tree bark; following aeration the ginger dominates. The palate entry is off-dry, fruity, sap-like, and mildly spiced; at midpalate the bittersweet taste profile centers on the core flavors of ginger, cola nut, and bark becoming almost root beer-like. Finishes overly sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Only the faintest of hints of banana are found in the nosing passes. The palate entry is tight, dry and squeaky clean; at midpalate a softly fruity, but crisply dry core flavor of dried banana chips emerges. Concludes clean, refreshing, but merely suggestive of banana.
label: spirits_taster

description: A muted aroma of citrus, sweet/sour spice and crushed herbs. The palate entry is light, fruity, and sweet/sour; at midpalate, I keep wondering where the tequila is in the slick mass of citrusy sweet, sticky taste.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial aromatic blast comes off as a simple just off-the-column still scent; aeration does nothing to help this aroma round off or deepen. Palate entry is mildly sweet and brown sugar-like; by midpalate the flavor turns a touch more woody and honeyed. Finishes mildly pleasant and sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Burnished orange. First nosing passes pick up raisins and prunes; aeration expands the bouquet profile by adding zesty scents of black pepper, leather and pear. Starts smoothly at palate entry, then turns a bit hot at midpalate as off-dry flavors of dried red fruit, ripe grapes and candied almonds seem baked, minerally and overly spiced. Rounds out in the steely, slate-like finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Limpid. Muscat/orange blossom scent. Palate entry is tart, astringent and pleasantly orangy/citrusy; midpalate is its best stage as the tart orange pulp/orange peel taste starts to sweeten. Ends off-dry to sweet, pulpy and long.
label: spirits_taster

description: A one-note vodka nose featuring a bittersweet to semisweet grainy aroma. The palate entry is intensely kernel-like and beany and, therefore, bittersweet; at midpalate the flavor profile stays the bean/kernel course but adds a trace of tar or creosote. Finishes hot and raw.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening whiffs pick up citrus zest; aeration brings out juniper berry. The palate entry focuses totally on the juniper, and then at midpalate the lemon zest is unmistakable and adds a note of keen acidity. Finishes on the citrusy side of the street and a little bit fiery.
label: spirits_taster

description: Disappointing bouquet offering faint odors of rubber pencil eraser, unsweetened gum, and white raisin, with just the frailest hint of toffee. The palate entry is pleasingly sweet and maple-like; at midpalate the low-key flavor develops a bit more grip in the form of the sweet toffee first noted at the tail end of the nosing phase. Finishes appealingly sweet and mildly maple-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial sniffings offer atypical aromas of cotton, plastic and vinyl; additional aeration time finally stimulates some meager and distant traces of grapes, grape must and stems. Palate entry is off-dry to semisweet and slightly tropical fruit-like more than grapy;  midpalate at least displays more in the way of true grapiness but it still comes off as being reluctant and timid. Aftertaste shows some substance and grapiness but it's a little late and hardly enough to make up for the lack of distinctive virtues.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first whiffs don't uncover much; aeration produces little other than a faint trace of linseed oil. The palate entry is grainy, off-dry and moderately oily; by midpalate the mildly honeyed core flavor displays some elegance, but there's not enough finesse here to justify the hefty price. Finishes with a burnt toast flavor.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aroma is gently fruity, tropical and easy. Palate entry is ripe, mango-like and properly creamy and semisweet; by midpalate, the taste profile shifts far more to the cream than either the mango or the Tequila and in the process the point gets lost. Aftertaste is all cream.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first whiffs pick up delicate scents of Brazil nuts and anise; aeration adds notes of burning rubber, black licorice and paraffin. Palate entry is sharp and intensely aniseed-like; at midpalate a wave of black licorice swamps all other tastes. Concludes rich, but awkward and off balance—there's no subtlety here. Only for black licorice fanatics.
label: spirits_taster

description: No bouquet worth discussing. Palate entry offers a flat and flabby sweet taste along with some pleasing almond and walnut flavors; at midpalate, the taste profile goes candied and rubbery. Ends pleasantly sweet and oaky.
label: spirits_taster

description: Fruity, animated aroma are followed by assertive fragrances of gum, grapefruit, pineapple and white raisins. Palate entry is fresh, grapy and maple-sweet; midpalate the flavor profile suffers from a flash of raw spirity heat and a trace of dullness/flatness. Finishes sweet, a tad lean, banana- and caramel-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aroma is of limp vegetation and hard candy. Palate entry is pleasantly sap-like and sweet; midpalate features traces of oaky, vanilla-like character and eventually a round, even supple ripe grapiness that lasts well into the aftertaste. Decent once past the subdued bouquet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial aroma is clean, slightly bitter and not as minty as I expected. Palate is zesty, citrusy and slightly minty, with some evidence of rum. Aftertaste is brief and sour.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sweet notes of mixed berrieson the nose, while palate entry is tart and bitter.
label: spirits_taster

description: The strange bouquet includes scents of rubber band, plastic, wet sand, damp earth and mushrooms/lichen/mold. The taste thankfully doesn't mirror the aroma, giving off a moderate sense of fruitcake, dried fruit and refined sugar; the midpalate taste is off-dry and raisiny. The finish is fruity, lazily floral and mushroomy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Nosing passes detect delicate odors of lead pencil, fennel and orris root, followed by herbal/vegetal/ spice scents. Palate entry is medicinal, astringent and deeply herbal; by midpalate, there's an underlying nut taste that's reminiscent of cola nut. Finishes intensely herbal and bitter.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial stages of the aroma seem a bit muted; aeration allows a soft, rose petal and almond aroma to develop. Palate entry is meek, gum-like and a touch caramel-like; at midpalate tastes of toasted marshmallow mingle with caramel candy. Ends resiny and cheesy. An uncomplicated whiskey of modest proportions.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose offers subtle aromas of unsweetened coconut, bacon fat, and dark toffee with additional toasty scents of apple crisp, dates and oak. The palate entry is rich and fresh; the midpalate features flavors of bacon fat, dark honey, fudge, and bitterswe
label: spirits_taster

description: A wonderful bouquet that includes toasty scents of baked apple and baked pear and subtle aromas of brown sugar and marshmallow. There are delicious tastes of ripe apple and pear at palate entry; at midpalate the taste profile offers candied apple, cotton
label: spirits_taster

description: The wonderful bouquet combines elegant scents of sawdust, pine and vegetal agave with aromas of old leather, cigarette ash and pimento. The palate entry is delicate and peppery; midpalate has a honey-like core flavor with supplemental tastes of cocoa, mil
label: spirits_taster

description: A wonderful, layered bouquet that includes aromas of milk chocolate, honeysuckle, cream soda, unsweetened coconut, raw vanilla and cocoa bean, walnut and paraffin. The palate entry is deliciously sweet and oily; by midpalate the flavor includes a foundational spirit presence along with the honeyed taste. Finishes sweet, and textured. A state-of-the-art rhum agricole. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose is malty, dry and woody; the addition of mineral water introduces linseed oil and beeswax scents. The palate entry is chewy, spirity, caramel- and toffee-like; the delicious midpalate includes maple-like tastes of chocolate-covered banana, Raisin
label: spirits_taster

description: A distinctive and fine blanco bouquet that features savory scents of rubber inner tube, pickle brine, green olive, vinyl, new saddle leather and kale. The palate entry is smooth, off-dry, and lightly peppery; at midpalate the taste is vegetal, then it swi
label: spirits_taster

description: Bouquet offers melded scents of wood, old fruit, marzipan and blue cheese. Palate entry is lusciously sweet; the midpalate finds succulent fruit, toasty oak, dark caramel and a touch of honey. Aftertaste is vibrant. A masterpiece.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes pick up keenly crisp and spicy notes of black pepper and oak with plumper aromas of green pepper, vanilla and cocoa butter. The palate entry tastes of fresh honey and vanilla; the midpalate adds flavors of buttercream, steamed asparagus
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening bouquet brims with layers of toffee scents, dry oloroso sherry and fresh honey; aeration stimulates smells of dark caramel, grassy cane, winter holiday spices, and marzipan. The palate entry is silky, zesty, and spicey; by midpalate the flavor includes pipe tobacco, toffee, cocoa butter, and honey. Concludes bittersweet, cocoa-like, and sherried. A Martinique classic. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Overall pristine and smooth, this corn-based vodka is clean on the nose and palate, finishing with brisk white-pepper heat smoothed by faint almond sweetness. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from cassava root, this unusual vodka shows distinct sweetness. Look for a light vanilla scent and hints of dulce de leche, almond and vanilla on the creamy palate, plus cinnamon sizzle on the finish. Ideal for dessert-like cocktails or anywhere a bit of sweetness is desired. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clean and invigorating, with a suggestion of almond-like sweetness midpalate, this corn-based vodka is neutral overall, finishing with a refreshing flicker of alcohol heat. Versatile for cocktail mixing. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Think Bloody Marys and Dirty Martinis for this vodka with a savory side. Made in Sonoma from grapes (natch) and grain (wheat and rye), a faint vegetal, olive brine note leads into a mouthwateringly brisk, pleasingly earthy fade. Bonus: The handsome green glass bottle with copper accents will look striking on your bar.
label: spirits_taster

description: Generally neutral on the nose and palate, hints of rubber and charcoal midpalate lead into a clean finish, with just the right amount of alcohol heat for backbone. A food-friendly companion for smoked fish, aged cheeses or other savory bites. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Smooth and versatile, this “micro batch” vodka offers light coconut sweetness on the palate, fading into cinnamon heat on the finish. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from whey, this newcomer to the U.S. market has an appealing lushness. The aroma and flavor hints at coconut, marshmallow and vanilla, finishing with gentle sweetness and a mild peppery prickle. Producer recommends serving Dirty Martini-style with olive brine and a green olive.
label: spirits_taster

description: This corn-based vodka has a nearly neutral aroma and gentle vanilla and coconut sweetness on the palate. It roughs up a little on the drying finish, with hints of fiery ginger root. But chilled well to take the edge off the heat, it's a fine addition to vodka-based martinis, Gimlets and other cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: The name means “mammoth,” and the enormous, heavy elephant tusk-like bottle is hard to miss. Made in Siberia, this vodka has a fruity scent reminiscent of raspberries and a smooth, drying palate that hints at almond and marshmallow, finishing long with a subtle anise note.
label: spirits_taster

description: Created by distiller/partner Jeff Thurmon, previously a distiller at Tito's Vodka. Look for mild, coconut-like sweetness in this otherwise neutral, silky vodka, winding into hints of lemon peel, ginger and cayenne on the warming finish. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from a sugarcane base, the palate on this small-batch vodka leads with a flash of marshmallow sweetness and finishes clean and bracing with ginger and white peppercorn sizzle.
label: spirits_taster

description: Best known for liqueurs in lurid pink and blue, this unadorned vodka is more sweet than sass and sips well. It has a coconut-tinged aroma and palate, a soft, almost plush feel, and finishes with cinnamon and nutmeg sparks. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Banana and raspberry tease the nose and palate. The earthy, silky palate also shows hints of graphite, charcoal and potato skin, finishing with coriander and almond sweetness.
label: spirits_taster

description: Backstory: The distiller's family has farmed soft white wheat in Oregon since 1875, the same wheat used to make this new vodka. The spirit has a mostly neutral aroma, plus a saline hint that suggests a seawater breeze. Markedly smooth, it glides over the palate, with mild sweetness and a hint of white peppercorn heat on the fade. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: Faint marshmallow-like sweetness leads the nose and palate on this corn-based vodka. Smooth and relatively neutral, look for flickers of cardamom and coriander seed on the exit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from corn, this vodka has a neutral scent and soft feel, with a hint of citrusy acidity, finishing crisp and slightly spicy, tinged with anise and black pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Mix this wheat-based vodka in tropical drinks. The mild scent suggests banana, while the silky palate has a coconut hint that segues into a long, peppery, drying finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from French wheat, the name translates as “beautiful hunt.” The featherweight vodka is mostly neutral on the nose and palate, plus hints of vanilla sweetness, charcoal earthiness and a bit of cinnamon heat on the exit. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: According to the producer, this corn-based “intelligent vodka” is “ultra-purified to zero impurities” using a process that combines ozone and traditional filtration. We haven't sent it to the lab to measure those claims, but we did taste it: The nose and palate are distinctly sweet, with a sugary, marshmallow quality, rounding to a hint of cinnamon on the warming finish. Feels light on the tongue, and faintly effervescent.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made in Tuscany from a base of organic wheat and spelt, this silky spirit offers faint hints of dusty cocoa powder, almond and vanilla, finishing with nutmeg and cinnamon sweetness and spice. Pour for a White Russian or other cocktails with a sweeter skew.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bracing and brisk, this vodka has plenty of citrus and spice, like the very lightest of gins. The scent is relatively neutral, but the palate displays fleeting cucumber, coriander and lemon peel, finishing with white-pepper heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Formerly on liquor store shelves as VuQo, this coconut nectar-based vodka now undergoes multiple distillations and filtrations, including coconut shell activated carbon during filtration. The upshot: Light, dusty coconut flavor plus a long, slightly sweet finish make this vodka right for mixing into tropical drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: “We deliberately didn't shoot for neutral,” says the producer of this Concord grape-based vodka. Mission accomplished: The bold, fruity scent and flavor suggest bananas and raspberries, with fleeting sweetness on the palate and a flash of ginger heat on the finish. Mix into fruity drinks for best effect.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is nearly neutral, with a mild sweetness that's echoed on the palate, where it suggests light almond and coconut tones layered with a faint charcoal note. Finishes with a fiery burst of cayenne and cinnamon heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from corn, look for perky pine and lemon peel notes on the drying, slightly hot palate, smoothed by pleasing sweetness in the fade.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with a beet sugar base, this vodka is mostly neutral on the nose and palate, tinged with almond sweetness and finishing long, with cassia-bark sizzle and plenty of alcohol punch.
label: spirits_taster

description: This 100% corn-based vodka has a neutral scent and soft, silky palate. The flavor suggests cucumber and almond, finishing dry, with a bit of alcohol heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from French grapes, this vodka is mostly neutral, plus mild marshmallow sweetness on the nose and palate. A flicker of alcohol heat builds steadily into the charcoal-accented exit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from wheat, this vodka has a faint lemon peel scent. The palate also is accented with mild lemon and pine, like a super-light gin, finishing with anise and cinnamon sizzle.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from Utah-grown wheat and rye, this vodka has a bold, fruity aroma and flavor, suggesting raspberry and tropical fruit, finishing with a bracing sprinkle of baking spice. Mix into fruity cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Created with direction from bartender Patrick Haight, this amaro is ruddy and bright in the glass, with a fruity aroma that also suggests eucalyptus and lime blossom. Look for moderately sweet cocoa and tart fruit on the palate at first, which morphs into light bitterness and a warming flicker of cayenne heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bright lime green in the glass, this sweet, viscous liqueur has a mild scent and flavors that suggest lime zest and lime lollipops, plus ginger heat on the finish. Use anywhere you'd use green Chartreuse.
label: spirits_taster

description: This superlight, nuanced amaro has a fragrance that suggests elderflower and vanilla sugar. The palate also mixes gentle floral and vanilla, with only the faintest bitterness on the finish, mingled with subtle orange peel and white pepper sparks. Created with direction from Philadelphia bartender Peter Kim.
label: spirits_taster

description: Refreshing and unusual, this Italian-inspired fennel liqueur has a pale straw hue and a fresh, grassy, vegetal scent. It tastes like fennel—meaning lots of anise—plus a dill-like vegetal lightness and subtle funkiness in the finish that's similar to a whiff of cooked cabbage. Overall this is invigorating and sip-worthy.
label: spirits_taster

description: This liqueur is rusty orange in the glass, with an aroma that suggests horehound and orange peel. The palate reads as sherried, with honey, dried apricot and baking spice, plus burnt orange peel bitterness on the finish. The producer recommends it as a hot drink in winter.
label: spirits_taster

description: At first glance, this appears to be a sweet fruit liqueur, with a deep garnet hue and aroma that suggests currant preserves tinged with a mild sarsaparilla note. So it shocks to find an intensely bitter palate, like unsweetened chocolate, with the fruitiness showing as bitter dried orange peel around the edges. Fleeting, teasing vanilla sweetness on the midpalate quickly gives over to a bitter finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This liqueur, which appears to be loosely inspired by Chartreuse, has a dull green olive-oil hue and a concentrated aroma that's like inhaling a slightly bruised bouquet of fresh herbs, including mint and lemon verbena. Thick and viscous in the glass, look for an intense anise sweetness up front and a stingingly spicy finish, like jalapeño and menthol.
label: spirits_taster

description: This amaro seems innocuous at first, with its coffee-brown hue and mild, root-like aroma. But it's intensely bitter from the first sip—so much so that it's hard to detect other flavors, though there's a bitter espresso and unsweetened chocolate core, plus a minty finish. Bartenders love to offer this uber-bitter liqueur as a shock-value shot; it's challenging to sip straight, even though the alcohol level is moderate. But it's also a key component of some classic drinks, like the Hanky Panky, and that's where its value lies.
label: spirits_taster

description: Classified as a malört—a particularly bitter spirit often consumed as a dare—this one is amped to deliberately vicious levels thanks to an infusion of housemade ras el hanout, a Moroccan spice blend. It has a light yellow hue and minty aroma, with a boozy core that reminds of grappa. The flavor is quite spicy, with a jalapeño note that overwhelms the subtler herbal, floral and icy mint notes on the palate, and frankly numbs the tongue and lips.
label: spirits_taster

description: This chamomile liqueur, made with grappa, has a burnished gold hue, pleasing honey and peach nectar aroma. It's sweet at first, showing honey, peach nectar, white flowers and beeswax, with an herbal finish that shows mint and a jarring mustard seed note.
label: spirits_taster

description: Dark brown and viscous, this liqueur has a bold, pungent, earthy aroma. The palate is very bitter and medicinal, mingling with an ersatz cherry-raspberry jam note midpalate, finishing with a drying bitter walnut quality. Taken all together, the effect is disconcertingly like cherry-flavored cough medicine.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with California wine, this raspberry red-hued amaro has a fruity scent and drinks like cherry juice—juicy and mouthwatering up front—plus suggestions of rosewater, bubble gum and cherry cough drops, finishing with a bitter grapefruit edge.
label: spirits_taster

description: Another standout limited-edition release to raise funds for ALS research, in honor of Heaven Hill Master Distiller Emeritus Parker Beam. This copper penny-hued American single malt has a bold caramel aroma and kaleidoscopic flavor that starts with sweet, dark toffee and cola notes. This then morphs to orange peel, vanilla, allspice and clove, with a wisp of sweet campfire smoke on the extremely long finish. 65% malted barley, 35% corn.
label: spirits_taster

description: This blended whisky is an ideal sipper, with an enticing crème brûlèe and dried apricot scents. Those notes are echoed on the palate, but are layered with drier oak and cigar wrapper notes, woven together on a light layer of peat smoke. Soft, complex and well-balanced.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sip or mix this Tennessee beauty. It has a maple hue and a boozy but gorgeous aroma, mixing caramel and burnt orange peel. Those flavors are reflected on the supersoft palate, finishing long on drying notes of cocoa, spice, vanilla and orange peel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from 100% malted barley grown in the Pacific Northwest and fermented with ale yeast, this single-barrel single malt is brisk, flavorful and hints at beer. The sweet, gentle aroma offers vanilla and a subtle root beer-like herbal note. The palate is on the drier side, but pleasing, showing lots of vanilla and a hoppy note at the end chased by allspice and clove.
label: spirits_taster

description: Golden and delicately perfumed with peach, white flowers and tropical fruit, this newly-launched 10-year-old French single-malt whisky shows coconut, almond, vanilla and tapers off gently with cinnamon and clove. Add a splash of water or a cube of ice to soften the alcohol sting (it's 96 proof, after all). Aged in a mix of new French oak and old XO Cognac casks. 290 cases produced.
label: spirits_taster

description: This complex single malt whisky has a dark honey hue and a bold aroma that entwines vanilla and juicy red apple. The silky palate mixes gentle smoke with mouthwatering dry notes—oak, leather and tea, finishing with a smoky exhale accented by orange peel and espresso.
label: spirits_taster

description: The luxe aroma mixes rich butterscotch and apple sweetness. On the palate, this whisky is light and gentle, interspersing fruit and smoke and finishing with a spark of cinnamon heat. Add a splash of water; recommended for sipping.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from a mash of corn, rye and malted barley and aged four years, look for very sweet, bold aromas: lots of vanilla and caramel. The first sip is dry, showing cocoa, espresso and leather, but then the flavors seem to grow sweeter, more in line with the aromas, and coat the mouth with crème brûlèe and a hint of butterscotch. It finishes spiced, with a flicker of alcohol heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Highland malt whisky from Scotland is finished in former Port casks at the distillery in Virginia. The end result is a deep amber hue and a rich caramel and campfire-smoke profile, finishing dry and slightly hot, with sarsaparilla and lots of spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: Beer lovers will enjoy this Irish whiskey aged in craft beer barrels. It appears burnished gold and smells oaky and grainy. The flavor evokes a pleasing combination of beer and whiskey, accented with hops, bitter chocolate and a clove-spiced finish. It even feels slightly fizzy, like the carbonation of beer.
label: spirits_taster

description: The newest blended whisky offering from Hibiki is burnished gold in the glass and has a bold aroma that mixes vanilla, fresh pear and a hint of smoke. The smokiness comes forward at the first sip, wrapping around a core of oak and vanilla custard and finishing long, with a mouthwatering bitter chocolate note.
label: spirits_taster

description: This unusual whiskey was built like a Bourbon—made with 100% corn and aged in ex-Bourbon casks for an average of five years—but sips like a mellow Canadian whiskey. It's supersoft, with lots of vanilla and sweet maple, plus a gentle, drying finish of allspice and clove. A surprising, rounded black cherry note suggests Manhattans in this whiskey's future.
label: spirits_taster

description: This chile pepper-flavored whiskey launched in August 2015. Made with jalapeños grown on site at Rogue Farms, allowed to ripen until bright red, the peppers are smoked and brewed into a “chipotle whiskey wash.” More chipotles are added during distillation, and again during barrel aging. The end result is an apple-y sweet, vanilla aroma and palate followed by a gentle chile simmer and light smokiness. The heat builds with repeated sips, but chileheads probably wouldn't have it any other way.
label: spirits_taster

description: New to the U.S. market in March 2015, this rose-gold whiskey is finished in former California Cabernet Sauvignon casks. The aroma shows nuts, vanilla and orchard fruit. It's light-bodied and slightly buttery on the palate, with lots of vanilla and custard, and a slightly fruity finish and a build of alcohol heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: The name of this whisky has nothing to do with coffee—rather, it's named for a type of still invented by Aneas Coffey, which is used to make this golden spirit. It offers mild vanilla-pear aromatics and is relatively light and silky on the palate. Look for a light vanilla sweetness at first, which gives way to a rounded dark chocolate note and baking spice finish. Recommended for highballs and other mixed drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from 100% wheat grown and distilled in California, then barrel-aged for a minimum of two years, this amber whiskey mingles vanilla, maple and orange peel in the aroma. It's oaky up front, fading to creamy vanilla and cocoa plus white pepper and ginger sparks. Add a cube of ice, or try it mixed in an old fashioned or Manhattan.
label: spirits_taster

description: This golden whisky has a bright, fresh scent bursting with fresh-cut apples and vanilla. It feels quite hot on the palate, hiding behind fiery cinnamon and alcohol heat. Tamed with plenty of water, it softens to show vanilla and fresh fruit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from organic wheat and aged in new oak barrels for at least 12 months, this craft whiskey has a velvety feel and lots of oak up front, fading to a cookie dough-like finish with vanilla, cocoa and allspice. It feels a little hot, but has good flavor. Mix into whiskey sours and other cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: A solid bouquet that doesn't scrimp on agave presence. The palate entry shows enough herbal/peppery agave thrust to impress; but at midpalate a metallic aspect takes charge, leaving the agave element in the dust. Concludes brassy and too bitterly astringent.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers rich, pastry scents with deeper fragrances of old oak, figs, dates and prunes. The palate entry is creamy, engagingly nutty, acidic and fresh; the midpalate offers long, expansive tastes of oak resin, paraffin, nougat and walnut paste. Concludes elegantly, sinewy and off-dry. This whisky has it all.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma features fig, prune, pastry dough, honey and maple scents. On palate, Louis XIII offers long and intensely woody flavors; additional layers of flavor, including figs, dates, prunes, dried apricot and vanilla, are featured at midpalate. Finishes elegantly, warm, smooth and more oaky than fruity succulent. Only minor rancio.
label: spirits_taster

description: An atypically textile-like and grassy rhum agricole bouquet. The palate entry is fruity sweet and not in the least hot, considering the 100-proof status; the midpalate features tastes of beans, vanilla, sugarcane and jellybeans. Ends up moderately sweet, graceful and invitingly warm. Masterfully distilled.
label: spirits_taster

description: The compelling brandy bouquet offers lean scents of resin, baked apple and vinyl. The palate entry is controlled sweet/ripe; the midpalate offers more generous flavors of baked apple, fruit pastry, pipe tobacco, new honey and oak. Ends crisp and properly acidic with baked flavors of fruit, nuts and nougat.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find attractive scents of hazelnut, wax paper, lime, peanut butter, citrus peel and unsalted butter. The palate entry showcases the peanut quality but adds a touch of charred oak; the taste at midpalate becomes more bacon fat-like and smoky, with nuances of palm oil, nut paste and cream. Very nicely done.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find aromas of peat, iodine and ash with subtle scents of hemp, road tar, burnt toast and seaweed. The palate entry is medium-weight, smoky sweet and oaky; at midpalate the strong taste of sautéed butter wonderfully suits the aroma. One of the best deals in Scotch whisky at present.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is intensely waxy, tea-like, fibery with scents of nutshell, toasted almond and hemp/rope aromas. The palate entry is nutty and mildly tobacco-like; the midpalate is keenly resiny and bittersweet with touches of early-budding rancio, oaky vanilla, cocoa bean and walnut paste. Finishes well and semisweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: An enticingly fresh bouquet with acidity enhancing the fruit component. The palate entry retains the acid backbone which allows the light wood and fruit elements to charm the taste buds; the midpalate stage features lively, immature flavors of ripe grape, slightly awry acid levels and touches of pineapple and mango.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet features plump, sweet aromas of buttercream and cake frosting. The palate entry is properly sweet and caney; the midpalate is delightfully sweet and almost candied. Finishes plump, sugary sweet and pleasant in the mouth and throat.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers scents of fruitcake and rummy sweetness/oakiness; the vegetal/grassy quality expected from this category is missing. The palate entry is sweet and bubble gum-like with nary a hint of grass or sugarcane; the midpalate stage is pleasing and mature, sweet and woody. Concludes sweet, sap-like and a touch maple-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sooty/ash-like fragrances are underpinned by cane and creosote base aromas. The palate entry is zesty, semisweet, herbal and tar-like; the midpalate taste offers deeply herbal/vegetal flavors of vegetation, textile and light smoke. Ends up off-dry and piquant.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pleasantly toasty and buttery in the first nosings; aeration stimulates lightly peated scents of butterscotch, light toffee and marzipan. The palate entry features delightful and gently sweet grain and caramel tastes; the midpalate sensation is round, slightly prickly, buttery and caramel sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial aroma is properly grainy and cracker-like; aeration brings on a gentle fruitiness; not a lot of depth. The palate entry is warm, dry and grainy; at midpalate a mildly fruity sake element emerges on the tongue. Concludes well as the sake aspect becomes more of a factor.
label: spirits_taster

description: Following aeration the aroma offers fragrances of oaky vanilla, baked pear and baked apple. The palate entry is lovely, elegant, semisweet and fruity; at midpalate the spirit foundation emerges and the taste turns brandy-like, clean, refreshing and mildly spicy. Finishes woody and moderately oily.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet features pleasantly off-dry and nutty cereal-like aromas. The palate entry is moderately sweet, biscuity, pastry-like and deeply grainy; at midpalate the taste profile displays a bit of heat that lies underneath the breakfast cereal surface flavor. Finish is dry, nutty and grainily wheat-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma features scents of cooking spices, tobacco leaf, spiced apple, traces of pear pulp, parchment, textile fibers and oak. The palate entry is delightfully sweet, fruity and lean; the acidity kicks in at midpalate, giving the brandy a fine, lithe mouthfeel and a crisp taste. Concludes drier than the entry.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find seductive aromas of soft cheese, ripe fruit, mature scents of vanilla and cinnamon. The palate entry highlights waxy flavors of palm oil, pork rind and bacon fat; at midpalate the taste profile turns maple-like and slightly spicy. Ends up honeyed and oaky.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial nosings find light, perfumed, juicy orchard fruit smells; the more peel-like aromas that appear following aeration lack the succulence of the early nosings. Palate entry is pleasingly fruity; the midpalate features the tart/astringent peel as much as the fruit meat. Too harsh and crude for my taste.
label: spirits_taster

description: The limp bouquet offers notes of oak, butterscotch and soft honey. The palate entry offers some pleasant woodiness and maple flavor; the midpalate overly showcases fatty/oily and chunky flavors. Finishes oily, buttery and without a whisper of acid. Lacks acidity and, therefore, freshness.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers toffee aromas with complementary smells of bakery spices, especially nutmeg, vanilla and cinnamon. The palate entry is delightful and focused on delicate sherry sweetness; the midpalate tastes include spice, baked bread, sherry, caramel, and nougat. Yet another sterling expression from this hallmark distillery. Classic.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma features assertive scents of lead pencil, iodine, sea salt and inner tube with salty Sherry notes, dates, black raisins, cigarette ash and smoked trout. On palate the taste profile is equal parts Sherry and seaweed; the midpalate showcases the Sherry influence and the result is deliciously raucous and hearty. A tongue-tingling experience.
label: spirits_taster

description: 70% malt; 30% grain. The bouquet is lean and svelte with scents of hemp, wheat kernel, crackers and dry breakfast cereal. The palate entry is fuller and sweeter than the bouquet indicated; the midpalate reminds me of baked bread with herbs and seeds, like rosemary and caraway. Finishes dry and keenly sappy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is pleasantly ripe and pastry-like. The palate entry is deliciously appley and more tart than sweet; the midpalate stage offers keen red-apple tartness and enough acidity to maintain the impression of authentic apple crispness. Lovely all the way.
label: spirits_taster

description: The highly perfumed aroma features good smells of lychee with additional layers of fragrances of parchment, palm oil, flowers and sealing wax. The palate entry is gently sweet and properly fruity; the midpalate displays a textured sweetness/ripeness that is delicious and light-to-medium weighted. Wraps up sweet, succulent, and genuinely tasty.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial sniffs pick up iodine and peppery scents; aeration elevates the pepperiness and adds dry notes of old parchment and gravel, sand and dry earth. The palate entry is dry, woody, and like unsalted butter; the midpalate offers tastes of saltwater taffy, egg cream, fino Sherry and almond butter. Ends on a prickly, peaty note.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial sniffs find an intense cigar smoke aroma; following air contact the scent becomes spicy, mildly smoky or peaty, green pepper-like and semisweet. The palate entry is oaky and pipe-tobacco sweet; the midpalate is lean to medium-weight, sappy and toffee-sweet, and delightfully peaty. Finishes gracefully, medium smoky and warming.
label: spirits_taster

description: The blueberry muffin perfume is alluring. The palate entry is delightfully fruity, berry-like and fresh; the midpalate stage reflects the careful merging of the fruit essence with the neutral grain spirit. A more than worthy addition to the already fine Stoli flavored portfolio.
label: spirits_taster

description: The excellent bouquet owns a crisply acidic green apple perfume which following aeration turns peel-like and very tart. The palate entry displays a mild sweetness; at midpalate the taste profile accurately mirrors fresh green apple flavor and is delightfully razor-edged. Finishes tart, piquant and lean.
label: spirits_taster

description: The supple bouquet has a strong coffee bean-like quality with additional scents of cocoa, road tar, roasted chestnut and wood smoke. The palate entry and midpalate are nicely mellow with plenty of rich espresso character. Finishes smoked and tar-like, with the coffee taking a back seat.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening aroma is atypical but following aeration the aroma becomes more of a customary Armagnac perfume as scents of sweet oak, prunes, cocoa, spice and raisins meld. The palate entry is assertive, sweet and raisiny; at midpalate a brief flash of spirit is followed by fat flavors of sautéed butter, almond paste, nougat and dark honey. Aftertaste is rich, long and sweet. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet features zesty aromas of green chili peppers and asparagus with touches of vanilla/oak, palm oil and almonds. The palate entry is sweetish and oaky; at midpalate a delicious buttery taste underpins flavors of oak, light spice and sautéed almond. Finish is elegant, long and satiny.
label: spirits_taster

description: The attractive, understated bouquet is nicely oily with a cottony scent. The palate entry is vibrant, grainy and off-dry to moderately sweet; the midpalate is keenly fresh and delightfully grainy/spirity. Finishes well as it cleanses the palate in well-defined tastes of grain and oil. A sophisticated spirit that puts a premium on elegance.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is zesty, acutely peppery and briny with scents of new oak, tobacco leaf and light honey. The palate entry is long, sweet, oaky and slightly honeyed; the midpalate stage boasts a sturdy agave sweetness. Finishes in a honeyed, almost Sherry-like manner that's highly charming.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers scents of roasted chestnut, sautéed almonds, and caramel. The palate entry is more toffee-like than nutty; at midpalate the flavors include cocoa, dark caramel, and honey. Finishes maple sugar sweet and delicious.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find generous notes of citrus zest, juniper berry, orris root, licorice, coriander and angelica. The palate entry is bittersweet, intensely grainy and speckled with licorice and orris root; at midpalate the flavor turns delightfully herbal. Finish is decidedly herbal/leafy/seed-like and, finally, bittersweet. An adult gin with an adventurous attitude.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet features scents of vanilla bean, dark honey, nougat, pipe tobacco and rancio. The palate entry is fat and creamy; at midpalate intensely sweet flavors of honey, dark toffee and cocoa take charge. Texture is heavy. Finishes on a honeyed note.
label: spirits_taster

description: Following aeration, swirling and a few added drops of mineral water a floral, dry grainy bouquet emerges. The palate entry is minerally and dry; at midpalate, with a few more added drops of water, the grain/malty elements mingle with oak, black pepper and grassy notes. Finishes lean, off-dry and intensely grainy/malty.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is deeply cherry-like, ripe, tart and fresh. The palate entry goes very sour at first but at midpalate the flavor becomes noticeably sweeter as the fruit pulp and juice elements move to the forefront. Finishes juicy, medium-weighted, and moderately sweet. A flavored vodka clinic.
label: spirits_taster

description: A fresh and seductive fragrance that includes scents of cucumber, agave pulp, fennel, pine, coriander and mint. The palate entry is smooth and correctly agave juice-sweet; at midpalate the flavors meld into a semisweet and lusciously prickly taste thrust. Finishes on a heated note as the spirit races ahead of the agave.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose is disappointingly limp. The palate entry finds deep flavors of corn syrup, breakfast cereal and oak; the midpalate is properly oily, buttery, corny and honey sweet. Finishes in a flurry of sap-like tastes and a round, honeyed texture. Nice but disappointing compared to earlier vintages in this series.
label: spirits_taster

description: A pleasant earthy/vegetal bouquet that displays the acidic nature of prickly pears. At palate entry the prickly pear flavor loses much of its fruitiness and leans heavily on the natural acids; the midpalate is astringent and tart. The aftertaste is short, refreshing and understated. Would make an interesting mixer with the right fruit element to bolster the acidity.
label: spirits_taster

description: The elegant bouquet is rich, gently sweet and generously malty. The palate entry is slightly salty and faintly peaty; at midpalate the grainy sweetness returns with traces of green vegetable, mint and black tea. Finishes with the tea flavor dominant. A good introductory island malt of finesse and substance.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers slightly bitter smells of toasty grain, parchment and cardboard with minimal depth and expansion. The palate entry is clean, grainy and off-dry; at midpalate the graininess counters the spirits influence. Finishes gracefully, if somewhat meekly. For this price I'd like to get a pair of designer cufflinks as well.
label: spirits_taster

description: An attractive, true to the source bouquet. The palate entry shows a pleasing sweeter, agave juice side to this tequila; at midpalate the black pepper/red pepper note drives the flavor forward into the delightfully prickly and full-weighted finish. A well-made blanco suitable for all types of Tequila-based drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find zesty smells of lemon and lime peel. The palate entry is suitably bitter/tart with a strong fruit pulp underpinning; at midpalate the taste turns sweeter as some of the bitter peel quality is softened. Finishes citrusy sweet and only moderately tart: I would have preferred enhanced sourness. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The four grains are corn, malted barley, rye and wheat. A mildly intriguing, if a touch flat aroma. The palate entry features flavors of honey wheat bread, sweet oak and light honey; the midpalate is round, elegant, mildly buttery/oily and gently honeyed. The aftertaste is understated and pleasingly easy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The strange bouquet features smells of ceramic tile, cement, wet sand and moldering vegetation with minor malty notes. The palate entry is mildly sweet and very grainy; at midpalate the flavors include bittersweet tastes of brown sugar, light honey and light toffee. The aftertaste is green and vegetal then grainy sweet and breakfast cereal-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial aroma is toasty and nutty; aeration allows scents of vanilla and cocoa bean to emerge. The palate entry is bittersweet and intensely beany; at midpalate the taste shows an inviting oiliness/butteriness. The finish is too sharp and resiny.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet features aromas of fresh-picked raspberries and blackberries. The palate entry is berry sweet/ripe and concentrated; by midpalate the fresh flavor intensity starts to fade. In the finish the flavor leans towards the berry preserves. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find scents of brine, peanut butter and lanolin with later sniffs discovering soft notes of vanilla, hemp and dried herbs. The palate entry is grassy and sweet; the midpalate stage is a tad restrained, but oily/buttery and deeply herbal. Finishes mildly sweet, and more timid than I like for an anejo.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is delightfully pungent with spicy scents of black peppercorn and caraway seed. The palate entry is semisweet with tastes of palm oil, beeswax and light toffee; the midpalate finds astringent and bittersweet flavors of coffee bean, tobacco leaf, pine and new oak. Finishes clean and assertive. An example of how compelling young Armagnacs can be.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose displays a solid, grainy, cracker-like aroma with notes of nuts, parchment and palm oil. The palate entry is smooth, a little toasty and very refreshing; midpalate highlights the deep grain taste along with touches of smoke and spice. Aftertaste is long and grainy/spirity with a dash of prickliness.
label: spirits_taster

description: A different style of vodka bouquet that includes faint scents of peach and cantaloupe, sand, tilled soil and green vegetation. The palate entry offers immediate bittersweet tastes of licorice, molasses and vanilla bean; the midpalate stage highlights the beaniness and a subtle trace of nutmeg. Finishes delicious, medium-weighted, a tad fiery and vibrant.
label: spirits_taster

description: An uninteresting bouquet consisting only of off-dry, slightly cardboard-like grainy/grassy notes. The palate entry, like the bouquet, is frustratingly meek and grassily off-dry; at midpalate there are faint tastes of barley malt, light caramel and wood. Finishes as timidly as it began.
label: spirits_taster

description: A blend of Bourbon from Kentucky and Canadian whiskies. The hybrid bouquet bears witness to both types of NA whiskey. The palate entry is exaggeratedly sweet and more like a whiskey liqueur than a blended whiskey; the midpalate is sappy sweet. Finishes on a mildly pleasing spicy note that doesn't offset the intense sweetness sufficiently.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes detect a dominant pickled aroma that's quite nice. The palate entry is very sweet and pleasantly oily; the midpalate features lesser flavors of black pepper, slate and mineral. Finishes sweet, plump and one-dimensional. This reposado doesn't quite pull the components together into a harmonious statement.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening aroma shows lots of oak, with minor scents of mint and dried sage after which the bouquet doesn't expand much. The palate entry is off-dry and oaky; the midpalate is astringent, a bit pinched, with intensely woody/oaky flavors that don't allow the grain to develop properly. Finishes lean and angular. A disappointing departure from form for The Glenlivet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The palate entry is sweet, slightly sugary and light; the midpalate is slightly better than the entry as the grape flavor settles down.Aftertaste is short, sweet and grapy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pale straw color and smoky, vegetal, brisk scent. It tastes the same as it smells:  smoky, vegetal, and herbal, with notes of oregano, anise, mint. Lightly smoky finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The smoky, vegetal scent of this gold-hued añejo is reminiscent of mescal, but has a lighter, softer texture. The honeyed flavor is quickly overwhelmed by a tingly, peppery finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged in barrels that once held Jack Daniels whiskey, this añejo has a sweet honeyed flavor and finishes nicely smoky with a touch of butterscotch. This Tequila would have rated higher if not for the plastic-y aroma.
label: spirits_taster

description: It looks silvery blue in the bottle, but it's crystal clear in the glass.  Citrusy, peppery fragrance, grassy, herbaceous flavor. Finishes dry and a little hot.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sweet scent, with just a puff of smoke. Sweet and earthy, with a jalapeno-like snap and a dry finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Smoky, fruity scent like apples and pears. What hits first is the alcohol bite, followed by vanilla flavor, lingering smoky notes, and another wave of alcohol bite. This Tequila needs to be tamed with ice.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sweet, almost marshmallow-like smell and a sweet flavor relieved by a clean, citrusy finish. finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Mild, slightly coconutty scent and a neutral flavor with slight sweet and grassy notes. Some alcohol zing.
label: spirits_taster

description: Honey scent and super-peppery flavor, with some heat in the back of the throat. This lively Tequila would be best mixed with ice and juices, since it's crying out for sweetness to mitigate the burn.
label: spirits_taster

description: Six months of aging impart a faint yellowish tinge, a citrusy scent, and a mild, smoky flavor that finishes with some mint and anise tones.
label: spirits_taster

description: Faint yellow tint and delicate honey and citrus-peel perfume. Thick, viscous mouthfeel. Tastes peppery, with a slightly petrol, minty finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This light gold Tequila has a lightly smoky aroma with a hint of butterscotch.  A vegetal, smoky, spicy flavor is chased by a nice caramel finish, which is unfortunately marred by a plastic-like aftertaste.
label: spirits_taster

description: Slightly sweet, vegetal aroma. Sharp, earthy flavor, with a slight touch of anise and a clean finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Beneath the sweet honeysuckle fragrance, this soft reposado mingles oaky and smoky flavors. It would do well in a cocktail with some sweetness to it, or a long drink that adds some fizz and dilution.
label: spirits_taster

description: Tawny color and lightly smoky aroma. At first, honeyed sweetness washes over the tongue, then a raw and lingering alcohol bite takes hold, even through the pleasantly smoky, herbal finish. This Tequila is better in the lively silver or the richer, mellowed Añejo expressions.
label: spirits_taster

description: This amber spirit smells smoky and vegetal, but with a lush caramel note in the back. It tastes just as the aroma suggests, with caramel and smoke mingled together. Where the reposado expression was super smooth, additional aging seems to bring out a little harshness in the añejo variation.
label: spirits_taster

description: This unaged Tequila has a warm, smoky/peppery flavor, and the pepper continues into the finish. It's not bad, but the barrel-aged version is vastly better.
label: spirits_taster

description: This certified organic, 100-proof Tequila has a vegetal, green-pepper aroma and jalapeno-like flavor:  sharp, grassy, spicy, peppery, with a final smoky, almost bacon-like twang. Would be interesting in a pitcher of Bloody Marys.
label: spirits_taster

description: A pale gold, light-bodied liquid with a lightly smoky aroma. This aged Tequila has a sweet honey flavor with a smoky finish and a sharp alcohol bite.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Tequila has a light straw color, a floral-vanilla scent and a smooth, tongue-coating texture. Although it tastes sweet at first, it finishes with smoky and sour notes.
label: spirits_taster

description: Even 11 months of aging in Kentucky whiskey barrels fails to tame the sting of this 100 proof spirit. Smoky, fruity scent and vibrant yellow hue. Certified organic.
label: spirits_taster

description: This light amber Tequila had a warm caramel scent with smoky, vegetal notes. Like the reposado expression, the añejo had a caramel flavor but a strong plastic-y finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: A pale gold, light-bodied spirit with a brisk feel and hearty alcohol sting. The scent landed somewhere between smoky and menthol, bringing to mind menthol cigarettes.  But the flavor was warm and honey-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: Petrol, herbal scent, and a lingering sweetness with a slight anise note. The highlight here was the bottle stopper, which is creatively engineered to be a shot glass.
label: spirits_taster

description: A soft and refined standout. Bright, citrusy aroma. This supersilky gin has a big licorice and juniper twang and a slight quinine flavor—in other words, it cries out for tonic water. The sweet, lingering finish evokes pink peppercorns, citrus peel and white wildflowers.
label: spirits_taster

description: Fresh, delicate fragrance of anise and coriander. This light-bodied, soft gin has a clean, brisk finish with anise and eucalyptus notes. A beautiful small-batch gin.
label: spirits_taster

description: Polished, versatile and well-balanced. Clean, mild aromas of juniper and citrus, and a sweeter flavor than most gins, with a bracing, astringent, citrus-peel finish. The gin's famed tea botanicals were not apparent in tasting; it had more of a pronounced grapefruit profile. The bottle is striking, with a red base and decorative glasswork.
label: spirits_taster

description: Unscrew that adorable bowler-hat bottle top, and a warm fragrance of orange peel, cinnamon-cassia, juniper and licorice wafts out. Well-balanced, clean, medium feel. Classic, strong juniper flavor, with a refreshing citrusy, piny finish, spicy and lively. Good value. Gin and tonic all the way.
label: spirits_taster

description: One of the most aromatic and least junipery gins, with aromas of cucumber, white pepper and lemon zest. On the tongue, look for a brief sweetness and floral taste, which rolls into invigorating, pleasingly bitter flavors of orange pith and pine.
label: spirits_taster

description: The vibrant juniper and licorice flavor and a pretty, slightly floral, rosewater finish is braced up with a peppery spine. Give this gin some time to open up for optimal aromatics—the reward is a citrusy zing. Good value.
label: spirits_taster

description: Golden straw color. Sea breeze/briny nose comes right at you in the opening sniffings; aeration releases pungent notes of dill, fennel and dry malt. Palate entry is marked with aggressive tastes of tobacco leaf, cigarette smoke, brine and wood resin; by midpalate, there's a slight settling down of the flavor profile as calmer tastes of cocoa, vanilla and maple make for sweet and pleasant sipping. Finish is raw, sweet and aggressive. The potential is there, but this malt simply isn't ready to be consumed yet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Gold appearance; egg white-colored head; unusual opening perfume is strangely broth-like and off-dry; aeration serves to stimulate further weird aromas like egg noodle and cotton—where are the hops and malt? Palate entry is light, palatable and mildly hoppy while the midpalate phase displays hints of steamed white rice, lightly toasted malt, pineapple and flowery hops. Finishes dry and properly malty. Some minor charm, but too uneven to be recommended.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening sniffs pick up lightly spiced, lean aromas from the citrus peel/botanical element; further aeration adds bittersweet notes of cassia bark and juniper berries. Palate entry emits slightly metallic tastes of slate, mica and pewter; at midpalate a botanical sweetness tries but fails to overcome the mineral/rock-like flavor. Ends a bit raw.
label: spirits_taster

description: Spicy aroma highlights the clove component. In the palate entry, cinnamon makes its first appearance, but by midpalate, the cinnamon/nutmeg tandem comes together. Aftertaste is dominated by the cinnamon.
label: spirits_taster

description: Vanilla bean fragrance in the opening passes is assertive and semisweet. Palate entry owns a vanilla bean core and by midpalate a mineral/chalky quality derails the vanilla element. Aftertaste is mellow.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial sniffs find bittersweet, intense, assertive and very nutty aromas; further aeration time accelerates the bittersweet concentration of oaky resin. Palate entry is seriously sap- and maple-like, then by midpalate the taste shifts from sap to the resiny, seed-like and bitter flavor of unseasoned oak, road tar and black tea leaves. Finish is firm but so resiny and tea-like that it's just flat-out bitter. Shows potential, but it's angular at this stage.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial nosings pick up a sweet aroma that's equal parts vanilla, cola nut, citrus and cinnamon. Palate entry is very vanilla cola-like and sugary; by midpalate, the citrus element kicks in adding a balance to the sugary sweetness.
label: spirits_taster

description: The peculiar aroma initially smells of new carpeting; with aeration, green apple emerges. Sour and astringent on the palate.
label: spirits_taster

description: First whiffs uncover scents of cotton candy, gum and dried tropical fruit; additional aromas include chocolate bar, nougat and oil. Flavor is intensely cocoa-like and bittersweet early on, then a heavy cloak of sweetness quashes the virtues. Concludes long, concentrated and too sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is ethereal, astringent, and spirity. Palate entry is properly flowery (heather with a trace of rose petal) and mildly fruity (green apple, pears); the midpalate is moderately sweet, malty and floral, but there's a fundamental hollowness to this edition. Finishes malty sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aroma is peppery, clean and dry; later aromas include saddle leather, herbal agave and wood resin. Palate entry emits simple tastes of dried herbs and black peppercorn; by midpalate, the flavor turns astringent and prickly on the tongue. Ends up desert dry, warm and resiny.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial nosings pick up notes of bacon and oak; aeration stimulates, distant scents of chalk, black pepper and dried red fruit. Palate entry is off-dry to semisweet and candied; at midpalate the flavor closes in on itself, shutting out all possibility for depth of taste. The finish is roasted, toasty and bittersweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Mild, light aromas of tropical fruit and parchment. Palate entry displays a nut-like opening taste, then at midpalate there's an expanding profile that includes oaky vanillin, young spirit and pear drop. Concludes austere and thin.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening aromatic salvo offers air-from-deflating-tire mustiness; time in the glass does little to bail this bouquet out of the stale soup. Palate entry shows a bit of zestiness as the taste goes peppery and bittersweet; the midpalate displays road tar, cigarette ash and distant brown sugar. Finishes flat and off-dry.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aroma is vaguely grainy, fresh and pleasing in the initial sniffs; further aeration brings out a mildly oily scent. Palate entry is simple, fundamentally sound and intensely dry and grainy; by midpalate, a shy, kernel-like, bittersweet taste enters the picture, then fades quickly. Ends meek and ethereal.
label: spirits_taster

description: An unpleasant fishy aroma. The pleasing palate entry taste bears no resemblance to the bouquet, going potato sweet and a touch honeyed; the midpalate stage echoes the entry flavor. Ends up semisweet, a bit fishy or briny, and very odd.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is appealingly fruity and develops with notes of green melon, banana, sultana, light spice, green grapes and pear. The opening taste is toffee and baked pear-like; then at midpalate the flavor loses the fruit component and accents oaky resin. Concludes flimsy and too intensely resiny/woody.
label: spirits_taster

description: An aroma reminiscent of chocolate covered cherry candies. The palate entry is clean, semisweet and candied; at midpalate the taste is manufactured and clinical, bearing little resemblance to fresh fruit or fruit essence. Concludes sweet. Certainly drinkable and mixable.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening aroma is a touch herbal, and properly grainy; aeration time adds simple scents of marshmallow and cedar. The palate entry is creamy at first, and then turns a little hard-edged in the acidity department; at midpalate there are muted tastes of roasted hazelnuts and cereal grains. Concludes flat, very lean and acidic, but drinkable.
label: spirits_taster

description: The eggnog-like first scents remind me of those sickly sweet, supplemental drinks that you're supposed to begin consuming the day you turn 60; later whiffs find aromas of ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, and black leaf tea. Palate entry is creamy and sweet, with a touch of cinnamon spice; at midpalate the ginger and clove kick in. Concludes pleasantly.
label: spirits_taster

description: Floating detritus makes this libation look unappealing. The initial nosings detect unpleasant traces of creosote, paint thinner, anise and green pepper. The palate entry highlights flavors of black pepper, stone and egg whites; at midpalate, the taste turns slightly sweet and toffee-like, becoming more acceptable.
label: spirits_taster

description: Gorgeous cherry wood/ruby hue; faint white foam. Bing cherry nose is sweet, almost soda pop-like. More sweet than sour in the nose. Tastes of ripe red cherries; no subtlety or complexity here. Aftertaste is limp. Drinkable, but ordinary.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening aroma comes off as being “manufactured”; five more minutes doesn't seem to stimulate much more than a desultory caramel flavor. Palate entry is mildly caramel-like; by midpalate, the caramel flavor component finally gets together with the cream and makes a decent, moderately sweet showing. Concludes sweet and candy-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: This nose is barely fruity in the first sniffings, then in later passes a cotton candy scent takes charge. Palate entry is sweet/sour and ripe; the midpalate stage sees a touch of the vodka come through, but not enough to bolster the flabby fruit flavor. Concludes sour.
label: spirits_taster

description: Fragrant, flowery, popcorn-like aroma; aeration reveals underlying scents of sweet grain, ripe red plums, spice and buttered sweet corn. The palate entry is hard, brittle and unwelcoming; at midpalate there's a slight reflection of the fetching grainy aroma, but that's washed away in a torrent of oaky resin. Ends up bitter and biting.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bronze color topped by a beige head. Opening aroma is fresh, malty and off-dry; time in the glass adds subtle notes of hops and breakfast cereal. Palate entry is dry, toasty and more hoppy than malty; by midpalate, the taste is astringent, hinting slightly of lead pencil or metal. Finishes intensely hoppy, lead-like and bitter. Drinkably average but after liking the bouquet so much I expected more satisfaction from the taste and finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Perfumed scent of fresh-picked raspberries is enticing. Palate entry is tart and fruity, then at midpalate the taste develops a ripe sweetness that turns too sugary and syrupy. Aftertaste is long and candied.
label: spirits_taster

description: Weird nose after the opening has a burnt match/sulphury quality. Palate entry flavor is simple and sugary. Aftertaste is sweet and moderately pleasant.
label: spirits_taster

description: The early aroma displays peppery spice and celery; aeration adds fiber-like scents of flax or nylon; an odd kind of synthetic bouquet. The spirit is aggressive in the palate entry; vigorous tastes of light caramel, unsalted butter and oak resin rule in unquestioned authority. Too volatile, ungainly and immature.
label: spirits_taster

description:
The opening nosing finds marshmallow-like scents; later sniffs pick up disintegrated aromas of tobacco, tar, light honey and spice. The palate entry is candy sweet; the midpalate improves with tastes of molasses, cake batter, dried fruits and winter holiday spices, especially 
cinnamon and nutmeg. Decent, best drunk in a cocktail.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first inhalations find succulent aromas of butter, cream, and oak resin; following aeration the bouquet displays alluring notes of baked apple and almond paste. The palate entry is engagingly toffee-like and oily; at midpalate the taste becomes more complex, offering layered notes of light caramel, candied pear, and maple. Concludes semisweet and silky. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: A balanced approach to the coconut flavoring; aeration allows delightful, low-key and unsweetened coconut perfume to appear. Palate entry is moderately sweet and coconut-like; by midpalate, the coconut flavor turns drier and crisper. Finish is long, and savory. Terrific in any piña colada.
label: spirits_taster

description: Zesty opening bouquet is fruity and raspberry-like. Palate entry is keenly tart and fruity in an unripe way; at midpalate, the taste turns very tart, almost sour, but stays the raspberry course. Aftertaste is medium-long, sour and angular.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening nose is off-dry and very banana-like; with time in the glass the banana perfume turns candy-like, but it's perfectly fine. Entry is dry to off-dry, somewhat banana-like and a touch bean-like; the midpalate shows more actual banana fruit. Finish is mildly sweet and long.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial aroma is fruity and winey and almost sour; more air contact brings out an alluring linseed oil/candle wax scent. The palate entry shows a solid, high-octane, spirity and almost fiery profile; at midpalate the alcohol heat reduces, allowing toasty tastes of hazelnuts and figs to emerge. Concludes cleanly, mildly hot and oily.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first whiffs pick up pork sausage, pork rind, green olive and peanuts; following aeration scents of baked pears, sesame oil and buttered popcorn appear with traces of dried herbs and fennel. At palate entry there's a moderately oily, semisweet taste of pear; at midpalate the pear presence expands. Ends buttery, silky if a bit fey. A very good malt for aficionados of lighter malt styles. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosing passes find a backbone aroma of malted milk; further aeration adds nuances of coconut, fudge, mead and toffee. The palate entry is warm and bittersweet; at midpalate flavors of light toffee, light honey and nougat are highlighted. Finishes as handsomely as it started.
label: spirits_taster

description: Delicate, lightly honeyed and not overlysweet scents with a buttery/creamy quality. Palate entry is gooey, concentrated, chewy and numbingly sweet; the midpalate phase heightens the impressions of the entry. Aftertaste is scoop-out-with-spoon thick and tonsil-screamingly sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial nose emits expressive notes of light toffee, nougat and grain-like sweetness; after aeration the bouquet turns fruity, especially apples, pears, cherries and peaches. Palate entry is cocoa-like and smooth; at midpalate the flavor profile turns caramel- and toffee-like. The finish is long, sweet, satiny and nutty. A well-made and uncomplicated quaff. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening sniffing picks up alluring, rich creamy/spicy notes. With aeration the spice element recedes, leaving the creamy/milky aroma. Palate entry is pleasantly sweet; at midpalate the taste goes bittersweet and chocolaty. Concludes well and on a balanced aftertaste of cream, cinnamon stick and milk chocolate. Good job here. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromas are fruity/citrusy and moderately tart. Palate entry is sweet/sour and intensely lemony. Finish is brief, concentrated and citrusy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from wheat and barley, the wheat component is apparent in the early-stage bouquet; further aeration allows a dry stony/mineral-like aroma to mingle with the biscuity underpinning scent. Palate entry is surprisingly semisweet and delicious; at midpalate the taste profile shows flashes of spirity heat that pull the rug out from under the terrific palate entry. Finishes oily and raw.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial whiffs detect a strong musty-mushroomy aroma which after aeration turns remarkably rubbery. Significantly more attractive in the mouth than in the nose, the palate entry is grapy, intense and semisweet; at midpalate the taste profile turns seed-like, bittersweet and very dried fruit-like. Concludes off-dry, bitter and musty.
label: spirits_taster

description: Maple scents lead the way over more subtle fragrances of gum, old oak and prune. Palate finds ripe red fruit, light honey and caramel. Finish is long.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening sniffs discover a tightly wound aroma featuring chalk, minerals, flowers and cowhide; aeration stimulates scents of gum, allspice, ginger, saddle leather and pencil eraser. Palate entry is dry and astringent; at midpalate a flash of smoke/peat makes things momentarily interesting, but then the mineral-like taste returns. Finishes spicy/gingery and moderately grainy.
label: spirits_taster
