description: Early-stage aroma is keenly briny/salty/herbal; more time allows dark honey and light toffee to emerge. Palate entry is pleasantly sweet and viscous; midpalate features tastes of roasted agave, tobacco leaf, black pepper and palm oil. Ends clean and buttery.
label: spirits_taster

description: A weary opening bouquet of black raisins and plums; further aeration only arouses meek, off-dry scents of tobacco, oak and fruit candy. Palate entry at least offers tastes of baked banana, pear drops and guava; midpalate the flavor turns sap- and maple-like. Finishes sappy sweet, moderately fruity and pleasant. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Exotic aroma is inviting, citrusy and mild. Palate entry is keenly tart, then by midpalate the taste profile accents the orange and mango fruit elements nicely. Finish is tart, crisp and long.
label: spirits_taster

description: The peppercorn-like opening aroma is firm and vegetal; further air brings traces of wood resin and licorice. Palate entry is luscious and chocolaty; at midpalate, the flavor stays the sweet, dark chocolate course, adding subtle notes of butter, cream and oil. Finishes long, oily and intriguing.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening sniffs encounter a candy-sweet, ripe red fruit bouquet that's ambrosial; the bouquet stays the fruity/estery course as a subtle, underpinning note of confectioner's sugar comes alive. Palate entry flashes spirity fire but underlying that is a delicious honey-like, almost buttercream taste; the midpalate shines for its sherry and cocoa-like sweetness. Aftertaste is sweet, malty and spirity.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosing provides a fruity/ripe experience that's elegant and restrained; aeration allows the bouquet to evolve into a splendidly fruit-salad fragrance. Palate entry is bittersweet and juicy; by midpalate, the flavor profile accents the grainy spirit as well as the passionfruit infusion. Finish is long and more beany than fruity.
label: spirits_taster

description: Not much happens in the initial minutes of nosing; more air contact helps in releasing supplementary aromas of black pepper and cardamom. Palate entry taste shows minor league cereal grain spice (rye) and a welcome flash of spirity warmth; at midpalate, this vodka displays some grip and character in the forms of oily texture and the piquant, spicy graininess. Aftertaste hangs its hat on the spicy, rye-grain flavor that dominates at the tail end.
label: spirits_taster

description: Mildly sweet vanilla bean perfume. Palate entry is sweet, while the midpalate displays a thick texture that supports the velvety vanilla frosting flavor. Finish is acceptably sweet and lip-smacking.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial whiffs detect gently spiced and herbal scents that include traces of peppermint and dried herbs. On the palate entry, a potent taste of mint grows in intensity on the tongue; at midpalate, there's really nothing new except for an expanding bittersweet element. Finishes very cleanly and intensely pepperminty.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aroma is fresh, mildly sweet and properly coconut-like. Taste is gently sweet, coconut-true and has a marshmallow-like quality that's attractive in its simplicity. Aftertaste stays the course set out at palate entry.
label: spirits_taster

description: Lovely, burnt umber/honey color—excellent purity. The opening nosings detect concentrated, nutty scents followed by dry, cardboard, parchment, and brown rice-like aromas; the palate entry is rich, honey-like and sweet. The midpalate gushes with piquant taste of nuts, nougat, dark caramel and dark honey; ends a bit too mossy/earthy/ mushroomy and sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Offers gently sweet, moderately nutty scents of banana bread, just-cracked walnuts, grass, hay and light brine. The litheness found in the nose doesn't prepare you for the alluring firmness and spirity punch of the palate entry; by midpalate, there's a lovely honey/toffee quality that's succulent. Ends politely and moderately sweet and honeyed.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is assertive, vegetal, and damn near prickly in the nasal cavity at first, then with aeration it turns malty, biscuity and leathery in the final stages. Palate entry is sweet, concentrated, honeyed and caramel-like; the richness found in the entry continues at midpalate as the taste profile goes creamy, fatty and pleasantly oily. Finishes semisweet, malty, oily and warm in the throat.
label: spirits_taster

description: The early stage aroma reeks of malt, porridge and heather; aeration brings out appealing scents of pears, peaches, brown sugar, honey and almond butter. Palate entry shows firm and slightly oily, light toffee, nougat tastes; by midpalate the flavor profile offers off-dry to medium-sweet tastes of oaky vanilla, maple, marzipan and oloroso Sherry. Concludes with a rush of toffee/maple.
label: spirits_taster

description: The piquant nose offers immediate and stunning notes of sea salt, peat reek and black pepper; aeration time encourages deeper aromas including malt and almond. Palate entry is malty sweet and nicely peppery, then at midpalate the peaty iodine character kicks in. Finishes well as it gives off fiery, peaty/tobacco-like flavors.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pronounced “so-rush” (like “so Russian,”) this wheat-based vodka has an aroma that whispers faintly of cool cucumber and mint. Meanwhile, the palate skews fruitier, with boisterous banana and raspberry warming to cinnamon sizzle on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This wheat-based vodka is made in Ireland by Connacht Whiskey Company. Look for a bit of almond and vanilla sweetness on the palate, finishing with a plume of intense black pepper heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from New York state grain, this vodka shows faint vanilla on the nose and palate, plus charcoal midpalate warming to black pepper and hot cinnamon on the fiery finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This corn-based vodka has a sweet scent and flavor reminiscent of raspberry and banana, finishing with earthy black pepper sting. The liquid is packaged in bottles shaped like letters, hence the name, which is cute but some shapes are awkward to hold and pour.
label: spirits_taster

description: For those who seek neutrality in vodka, this spirit offers little on the nose or slick, silky palate, finishing with muted cinnamon heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: While the aroma is nearly neutral, the flavor of this corn-based vodka has a distinctly savory, vegetal, almost funky quality up front, fading into sugary sweetness and then a ginger-laced finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a lightly fruity scent from this vodka distilled from sugar beets. Soft and subtly sweet on the palate, but otherwise neutral, the finish is quite fiery, with plenty of alcohol punch.
label: spirits_taster

description: A small-batch vodka made from corn, this spirit has a powerful, distinctly funky aroma. That umami characteristic shows up on the palate too, alongside a rubbery note, but finishes cleanly and smoothly.
label: spirits_taster

description: Reserve this 100-proof vodka for making infusions. The aroma is distinctly fruity, redolent of banana, lychee and pineapple. The bold tropical fruit is evident on the palate too, but the initial peppercorn sting quickly turns into a four-alarm alcohol blaze—ouch.
label: spirits_taster

description: Complex, robust, and hard to put down, this sipper offers big, buttery, toasty flavor. Look for crème brûlée and custard, caramel apple and brioche rounding into a gently spiced finish. Limited production.
label: spirits_taster

description: Balancing fruit, spice and oak, this 10-year-old whiskey offers enticing orchard and stone-fruit aromas warmed by a whiff of butterscotch. The palate opens with zingy baking spice and winds into a long exit with citrus peel and buttery brioche. A splash of water tames the spicy heat, but still leaves plenty of sprightly flavor.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bold, fruit aroma suggests fresh-cut apples and honeysuckle, while the silky palate offers deep, bold flavor. Look for dark honey and clove, edging into tea, oak and cocoa midpalate. Apple freshness brightens the dry finish. An ice cube is the only adornment needed for this well-structured, tasty sipper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged in former Bourbon, Sherry and Malaga casks, look for a deep orange-gold hue and inviting baked-pear aroma. The robust, spiced palate offers brown sugar, honey, golden raisins and vanilla-tinged baked pear.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with a range of 15- to 22-year-old whiskies, this big, flavorful bottling will remind some of bourbon. Look for a rich amber color and caramel scent, and a robust palate with tons of vanilla, peach and a warming cocoa and espresso-tinged finish. Add a splash of water to balance out the high proof. Note: Each label is marked with the number of the tree (sustainably grown and harvested) from which the barrel was made, making this an ideal gift for an environmentally minded whiskey lover.
label: spirits_taster

description: A quartet of casks (Bourbon, Sherry, Port, Madeira) provide a spice-cake-like sipper. The complex, drying palate opens with candied citrus peel and almond, warms up with hints of molasses, ginger and vanilla, and finishes with rounded toffee, cocoa and spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: A dark, moody, almost Scotch-like take on Irish whiskey. The concentrated aroma suggests caramel and vanilla. Meanwhile, the velvety palate starts at caramel but quickly deepens to dark chocolate, molasses and coconut, teased at the edges by campfire smoke and mint, finishing with anise and black pepper heat. Think of s'mores held a little too long at the fire and you get the idea.
label: spirits_taster

description: Break out the water and ice, because this Sherry-finished single malt is packing plenty of alcohol heat. That said, there's also plenty of flavor: vanilla and butterscotch, plum and dried apricot, plus baking spice and a whiff of smoke in the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Burnished gold in the glass, this robust sipper offers complex vanilla, caramel, almond, butterscotch and honey. A splash of water opens up fruitier notes: dried apricot, buttery baked pear and a rounded, clove-accented finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This new single malt,  debuting in March 2017, has a fresh, grassy scent, a  drying feel and plenty of bold flavor. Think rounded  almond, subtle vanilla sweetness and coconut  cream pie, finishing with a burst of citrus- and  ginger-peel  zing.
label: spirits_taster

description: Atten¬tion wine-lovers: Meet an Irish whiskey aged in former Bordeaux wine barrels—specifically, barrels from Château Léoville Barton, established by native Irishman Thomas Barton in 1725. The end result is a grassy, bright whiskey with a baked pear note mid¬palate and a subtly smoky finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is enticingly bright and fruity, like fresh pears, while the palate is silky and mellow. A fruity core is layered with vanilla, hints of salted butterscotch and buttery croissant, plus a light sprinkle of cinnamon and clove.
label: spirits_taster

description: This new blended Irish whiskey is intended to showcase flavors imparted by the barrel. (A cooper makes barrels; a croze is a tool used to cut grooves in the barrel.) Look for a bright, fresh scent layered with fresh pear and sweet vanilla, which is echoed on the palate. Adding water coaxes out more vanilla, crème brûlée and baking spice. A real sipper, this whiskey warms all the way down.
label: spirits_taster

description: This golden whiskey has a gentle honey aroma and complex, layered flavor. Look for waxy honey, white flowers, dusty plum and black pepper tingle, finishing long, with a brisk, drying feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: An easy, elegant sipper, look for a gentle vanilla-caramel-almond profile on the nose and palate as well as a silky feel. Mild baked pear and dried apricot midpalate wind into a cinnamon and clove finish. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made by Wicklow Hills Whiskey Company, cut with water from the family well, and aged in former Bourbon and oloroso Sherry barrels. The end result: a mild vanilla scent with hints of pineapple and lemon zest and a light, creamy palate. Look for vanilla, lemon cream and honey, finishing smoothly with ginger, cinnamon and cayenne heat. A splash of water teases out more vanilla, oak and a hint of cocoa sweetness.
label: spirits_taster

description: This special-edition whiskey matured for 14 years in former Bourbon cask, then spent additional time in oloroso Sherry casks. The end result is a vanilla-caramel scent and relatively dark flavors. Oak, caramel and toffee dominate, with baked pear in the middle and drying to vanilla, cocoa and clove on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This blended whiskey was matured in Sherry and Bourbon casks and finished in former rum casks—the latter an unusual touch for Irish whiskey. All this yields vanilla sweetness on the nose and palate, plus almond, creamy honey and an exceedingly long finish with plenty of ginger and sweet cinnamon sparks.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from a combination of whiskeys made with malted and unmalted barley, this is a gentle, versatile spirit to sip or mix. The honeyed scent leads into a light, sweet flavor profile that shows coconut and vanilla, plus a bracing sprinkle of nutmeg and cinnamon heat on the drying finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This robust newcomer is a collaboration between the master blender at Midleton Distillery and winemakers at Bodegas Lustau; the whiskey spends time in former oloroso Sherry barrels. Big, spicy flavors sweep over the palate in waves: vanilla, waxy honey, apple butter, dried apricot and dried fig, drying to chamomile tea and oak midpalate, and winding into a rich honey finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This single malt has a fresh, bright scent with stone fruit and vanilla. The drying, relatively hot palate skews a bit darker, deepening to cocoa, oak, almond and dried apricot, plus a smoky hint in the finish and plenty of cinnamon and clove finish. A splash of water helps tone down the heat and softens flavors to vanilla, peach and ginger sizzle.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clear in the glass, this corn-based whiskey offers a sweet, slightly fruity scent and lots of fruit on the palate, ranging from raspberries to ripe banana funk. It feels soft, though there's lots of alcohol bite on the long, spicy finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This 15-year-old Bourbon was distilled at the New Bernheim Distillery and found in the old Stitzel-Weller Warehouses (both in Louisville, KY), then bottled in Tullahoma, TN. The aroma and palate show bold vanilla and a subtle waft of mesquite smoke. It finishes long and drying, with clove, cinnamon and black pepper spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from 100% malted barley, a quarter of which is smoked with cherrywood, this single malt is aged in barrels that previously held Few's own Bourbon and rye. The end result has a honey hue and aromas of honey, cedar and oak. Soft on the palate, it delivers most of its flavor on the rounded, honeyed finish. A splash of water coaxes out additional vanilla sweetness and baking spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: This unaged corn whiskey is clear in the glass, with a nearly neutral, slightly fruity scent. On the palate, sweetness mingles with alcohol bite, leaving behind a lingering, pleasantly fruity note. Producer recommends serving as a “moonshine sour.”
label: spirits_taster

description: This fiery single-barrel Bourbon has a burnished copper hue and rich caramel aroma. That concentrated caramel-toffee note shows up on the palate too, finishing oaky with clove and cinnamon burn.
label: spirits_taster

description: Reminiscent of tea with honey, this bottling is a collaboration between a whiskey producer and a honey purveyor, both from upstate New York. The three year-old rye is infused with a “slight amount” of raw local honey, creating a light-bodied, drying whiskey, with notes of cedar and black tea, and slightly a sweet honey accent on the finish
label: spirits_taster

description: This new offering is bottled at 113 proof, making it fiery but flavorful. Expect a stab of alcohol even while inhaling the lovely crème brûlée-like aroma. The palate is extremely drying, showing mainly oak at first, but opening up to caramel, toffee and burnt orange peel. Adding much-needed water pales the taste to cinnamon Red Hots.
label: spirits_taster

description: This amber-hued rye shows notes of oak, chamomile tea, vanilla and cedar, concluding with a pleasingly juicy orange-peel note on the fiery cinnamon finish. 70% rye.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bold topaz in the glass, this single malt features a rich maple scent with a flicker of spice. The palate is drier, showing oak, vanilla and just a trace of maple, finishing spicy and fiery.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with Crooked Creek Corn, an heirloom variety, this clear whiskey has a sweet marshmallow scent and a relatively neutral palate, finishing with marshmallow, vanilla and a flicker of alcohol heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with a blend of straight Bourbons, this whiskey has a mild vanilla and resin scent. On the palate, flavors run to vanilla, cedar and citrus. Adding water brings out distinct cinnamon and peach notes, before fading into vanilla.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from a mix of 70% cane and 30% corn, this small-batch 'shine is clear in the glass, with a sweet banana-like scent. The palate reads as fruity with a touch of oakiness, finishing with a hot and puckery feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Bourbon-based liqueur is made with honey and infused with ghost pepper, which is reputed as one of the hottest chile peppers in the world. The golden liqueur has a mild caramel-honey scent. At first sip, it shows a slight fruitiness, like red apples and vanilla, and mild heat. But the slow burn builds with each sip, showing cinnamon, black pepper, cayenne and chile heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: A fleeting vegetal note, like fresh celery, underscores the vanilla and oak aroma and flavor, finishing distinctly spicy with lots of cayenne and black pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with a mashbill of 96% rye and 4% barley, this rye whiskey tastes relatively young, showing mostly oak on the nose and palate. But there's potential, with enticing caramel and orange peel lurking just below the fiery surface.
label: spirits_taster

description: This “moonshine-style” unaged corn whiskey is clear in the glass, with a very sweet, corn-like aroma. It's exceedingly hot on the palate. A touch of sweetness reads almost like cherries, but the sharp alcohol heat obliterates most of the flavor. Small batch
label: spirits_taster

description: This unaged 100% rye-based is intended to evoke early whiskeys distilled in Colonial Virginia. This has a malty, slightly sweet scent and a rawness that finishes with green apple and a subtle floral note.
label: spirits_taster

description: The owner of this Irish-style, American-made small batch whiskey is named Begley, not O'Begley, but this product nonetheless is intended as a nod to his Irish roots. Made primarily from barley, the spirit has a warm, grainy aroma and bold, malty palate, finishing long and lip-numbingly hot at 100 proof.
label: spirits_taster

description: Though this topaz rye smells bright and fresh, on the palate it's quite fiery at 95 proof. Adding water coaxes out some vanilla sweetness and flecks of cinnamon, but the whiskey doesn't stand up well to dilution. Named for the date FDR signed the 21st Amendment into law (December 5, 1933); Cedar Ridge is the first licensed distillery in Iowa since Prohibition.
label: spirits_taster

description: Intended as cherry-cola-flavored whiskey, this amber spirit has an herbal scent that suggests horehound and cherry-flavored cough drops, and an ersatz flavor redolent of cherry cough syrup. The producer suggests drinking as a shot.
label: spirits_taster

description: The magnum opus of rum maestro Francisco “Don Pancho” Fernandez, this velvet-soft, limited-edition rum is redolent of rich, warm caramel accented with espresso and cocoa. It fades gracefully into long notes of toffee and clove.
label: spirits_taster

description: Rich and concentrated, this is a blend of rums aged up to 12 years, then aged an additional two years in former PX Sherry casks. The end result is luxurious, thick in caramel, toffee and gingerbread flavors that finish long and elegant, with clove, allspice, dry cocoa, leather and orange peel accents. It sips beautifully.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Florida-made rum, with honey and spices added, shows a light touch yet is remarkably complex for a flavored rum. Velvety soft, with just a touch of sweetness, it offers notes of brown sugar, vanilla, coconut and cinnamon that waft across the palate. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: Single-vintage rums are few and far between. This one, distilled in 2000, is worth seeking out. Aged for 12 years before finishing in Sherry casks, this sipper offers rounded, lip-smacking notes of caramelized brown sugar and allspice, fading into a rich hazelnut and toffee finish. The proof feels comparatively high, but an ice cube or two should help restore balance.
label: spirits_taster

description: Despite being aged 18 years, this suprisingly easy sipper is full of rich toffee and crème brûlée aromas and flavors, finishing long, with touches of orange peel and spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: This light and silky rum offers vanilla and honey, brightened by tropical fruit and finishing with pops of baking spice. Made with a blend of rums aged 3–12 years, and aged via solera method in Sherry casks, it's packaged in a bottle resembling an oversized perfume flask
label: spirits_taster

description: Golden and light-bodied, this small-batch rum mixes honey and oaky vanilla notes with fresh apples, pears and pineapple. It offers pleasant sipping and a light, spicy finish. The slow-building alcohol heat suggests this is an ideal rum to mix in tropical drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: This chocolate-flavored dark rum is soft and delicious, with a slightly nutty flavor and a dusty cocoa finish. Mix with cold-brew espresso and coconut milk for a memorable coffee-spiked libation.
label: spirits_taster

description: Adorned with a shark tooth and an etched image of a shark, this small-batch rum attracts attention. In the glass, look for bold and warming notes of honey, vanilla and coconut, ideal for tropical libations. Made from a blend of four-, six- and eight-year-old rums.
label: spirits_taster

description: Since Pusser's utilizes traditional wood pot stills in addition to copper pot stills, that may account for the unusual flavor profile. Overall, the rum is light bodied, showing oak and resin-like flavors layered with vanilla, plus notes of cedar, chamomile tea, honey and a flash of dried apricot. Finishes dry and spicy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Toasty/roasted aromas of molasses, black coffee and road tar begin the nosing stage, then bittersweet scents of oatmeal stout ale, licorice, dark cocoa, pipe tobacco and brown sugar take over. Palate entry is long, more sweet than bittersweet and dark chocolate-like; at midpalate, tastes of bacon fat, oak resin and brown sugar turn creamy. Finishes smooth, creamy and dense.
label: spirits_taster

description: First nosings find a starchy, cotton fiber, desert dry aroma that's appealing; aeration heightens and reinforces the dry, starch- and seed-like bouquet. Squeaky clean and dry at palate entry; by midpalate, there's a faint bittersweet note that fades quickly, leaving the astringent, pod-like flavor. Ends up oily in texture and taste. A solid vodka that comes on strong when you want it most, in the taste and aftertaste.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening inhalations offer proper, if standard-issue, scents of grain and dry-roasted peanuts; more air contact introduces totally dry aromas of cardboard, synthetic fibers and palm oil. Palate entry flavors offer vivid, off-dry tastes of wheat and resin; by midpalate, the taste expands to include bittersweet cocoa and prickly (a plus) cereal spirit. Concludes offering moderately hot tastes on the tongue.
label: spirits_taster

description: The seductive perfume of ripe raspberries fills the office upon pouring; air contact stimulates ambrosial, berry-like, properly fruity aromas. What's attractive about this bouquet is that it holds onto the natural fruit acidity/astringency aspect. Palate entry is tart; by midpalate, the tartness begins to turn peel-like and seed-like. Ends tart and bitter. One of the best less-than-$15 berry flavored voddies out there, period.
label: spirits_taster

description: Starts out concentrated, coffee bean- and kernel-like in the aroma, which turns more cocoa/dark chocolate-like with aeration. Palate entry is creamy, thick and intensely black coffee-like; at midpalate, the sweetness accelerates and includes toasty flavors of roasted nuts and tar. Ends sweet, rich and properly coffee-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: Early-stage sniffings find delicate aromas of green vegetables, carnations and grain mash; further air contact brings up slightly sour notes of damp soil, glue and marshmallow. Exceedingly pleasant, grainy sweet and genial on the palate. Finishes cleanly.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening sniffing picks up alluring, rich creamy/spicy notes. With aeration the spice element recedes, leaving the creamy/milky aroma. Palate entry is pleasantly sweet; at midpalate the taste goes bittersweet and chocolaty. Concludes well and on a balanced aftertaste of cream, cinnamon stick and milk chocolate. Good job here.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first inhalations find a charming, sweet, nutty and fruity bouquet; further time stimulates the dairy element and accentuates the fruit component. Palate entry is intensely fruity and almost too sweet and syrupy; by midpalate the taste profile includes chunky cherry-like fruit, milk chocolate, a faint hint of spice and hardly any nuttiness. Finishes thick and sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial inhalations expose a moderately spicy, black peppercorn perfume; aeration brings about flax, cooked vegetables, and brown sugar. The platform flavor is intensely cocoa-like, then at midpalate, the taste leaps into deeper cocoa/bittersweet chocolate territory before turning lean and keenly bittersweet, oily and chocolaty in the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Nose displays an early oakiness, then well-developed aromas of nut paste, roasted almond, cola nut and meringue. Flavor is dusty, semisweet and caramel-like, with late notes of nougat and marzipan. Finishes sweet, raisiny and toffee-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromas include walnut butter, nougat, jasmine, papaya, grape skins and leather. Rich, textured, sweet, honey flavors emerge at palate entry, then stately tastes of nougat, toasted almond, sweet oak, vanilla bean and tobacco emerge. Ends long. and maple-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: Delicate, biscuity, sugar cookie batter aromas start the experience; another six minutes bring forward scents of ripe yellow fruit, gum, confectioner's sugar and a distant hint of honey. Palate entry features the corn component in its finest grainy sweet state; by midpalate, flavors include caramel corn, cocoa butter, oak resin and honey. Finishes sinewy smooth in the throat.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is pleasingly oily, mildly sweet and bean-like; air contact does little except to bolster the bean/kernel quality as the bouquet becomes intensely cereal-like. Palate entry is bittersweet and beany and the oily texture works for me; at midpalate, the intensity of the grain kernel flavor accelerates. Finishes sweetly and quietly.
label: spirits_taster

description: The beany vanilla bean aroma leaps from the sampling glass; aeration encourages the vanilla essence to turn plumper, more fatty and biscuity than bittersweet or extract-like. Palate entry is bittersweet and intensely beany while the midpalate stage is all about the buttery/oily side of processed vanilla essence. Concludes by going a bit soft in the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bouquet leaps from the glass in waves of perfectly ripe tangerine/blood orange, citrusy scents. Sweet-and-sour palate entry features the tangerine, but in a dried pulp, rind-like way; at midpalate, bitter traces of cardamom, bitter root, fennel, rosehip and mustard seed prevail. Finishes sweet and sour.
label: spirits_taster

description: The unabashedly briny opening bouquet is all peat, sea salt and salted focaccia; time in the glass serves to bring out a refined Sherry scent. In the mouth, it's lean, surprisingly sweet and acutely resiny. Ends pine-like, resiny, moderately salty, fruity (yellow fruit, like yellow plum or banana) and semisweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The grain takes a backseat in the early sniffing stages as bittersweet bean- and kernel-like scents dominate; later whiffs merely confirm the intense bean/cocoa quality. Palate entry mirrors the bouquet to a tee; at midpalate, the kernel-like intensity turns smooth and viscous on the tongue. Ends bittersweet and oily.
label: spirits_taster

description: The early whiffs find spicy/peppery notes that are semi-dry and alluring; later sniffings pick up deeper scents of toffee, citrus rind and hazelnuts. Palate entry starts semisweet then immediately turns bittersweet and resiny; midpalate the flavor profile focuses almost entirely on the oak, leaving the fruit way behind. An ethereal, sinewy Cognac with no fat on it.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first sniffings pick up lively scents of buckwheat and hemp; more time encourages spirity aromas of light toffee, nougat and oak to emerge. The palate entry is moderately sweet, lead pencil-like and a touch chalky; at midpalate the roasted/toasty grain mash flavor gives way to tastes of baked pear, pie crust and spice. Concludes very warm, toasted and tobacco-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sniffings detect dull notes of burnt paper and charcoal. The palate entry is sweet and toasty; at midpalate a moderate oiliness acts as a nice foundation for the toasty, sweet, almost smoky/sooty taste. Ends sweet and oily. A vodka with a “save the rainforest” theme and a bonfire-like personality.
label: spirits_taster

description: Whiffs detect notes of dry breakfast cereal, egg cream and a touch cocoa/chocolate-like. The palate entry is alluringly oily, bittersweet and vanilla bean-like; at midpalate toasty, roasted grain tastes impress the taste buds. Finishes with the sweet grain taste center-stage.
label: spirits_taster

description: Neon forest green appearance. Initially smells like Scope mouthwash or minty toothpaste, aeration allows a more nuanced leafy, minty core, totally dry and piquant to appear. The palate entry is rich, intensely minty and only moderately sweet; at midpalate the mint comes on strong, cleansing the tongue and leaving behind a fresh taste. Concludes concentrated and properly minty.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose after the pour is moderately expressive and nutty/sweet; aeration doesn't smooth out the icky-sticky sweet, only mildly almond-like aroma. Palate entry is moderately tasty and almondy but the syrupy texture and candied sweetness nearly obliterate the chance of any kind of classic amaretto flavor profile. Ends better in the throat than on the tongue.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening aroma offers dry graininess; later sniffings discover scents of chalk or limestone and wheat. The palate entry is elegant, smooth, and dry to off-dry; at midpalate there's a quick flash of spirity warmth, then a grainy dryness. Ends up off-dry, minerally, and admirably clean and lean.
label: spirits_taster

description:
The peculiar, but appealing bouquet includes unexpected aromas of lead pencil, baking bread, baked pear, and sautéed butter with hints of mango. The mango core flavor is detected quite clearly in the palate entry, and then it makes a slightly bigger fruity splash at midpalate. Concludes mildly sweet and fruity. A classy fruit 
flavored rum that gains momentum with time. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet contains delicate aromas of red fruit and cranberry . The palate entry reflects that delicacy; at midpalate the taste of cranberry is faint and fresh. Finishes elegant, clean, semisweet, ripe, and with a whisper of fruit. Best Buy
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial sniffings pick up delightfully fruity, jammy aromas. The palate entry is sweet, ripe, and intensely grapy with a bit of welcome heat on the tongue. Finishes grapy and ripe.
label: spirits_taster

description: First scent is wine-like and only mildly malty; additional minutes stir up aromas of freshly baked bread, saltine cracker, carnations, cherry, ripe pears and mead. Palate entry is off-dry, sinewy and lean, yet refreshing; at midpalate the flavor profile  capitalizes on the slender, winy/fruity structure by staying the course. Concludes off-dry, mildly marine-like, and just a touch resiny/woody.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening aroma is slightly prickly in the nasal cavity; aeration smoothes the aroma out as moderately salty-kippery scents dominate. Palate entry is integrated and sweet, at midpalate the presence of the peat takes shape in the form of smoky, woody, resiny tastes. Concludes with a flash of spirity fire on the tongue.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial whiffs uncover a firm, assertive, ripe apple perfume; following aeration the aroma becomes delicate, juicy and just moderately sweet. The palate entry is more sweet that tart and hence more like candied apple than fresh apple; at midpalate the taste turns layered, viscous and sweet and creamy. Finishes sweet, candied and full-bodied.
label: spirits_taster

description: A delicate, unusual mix of floral and spice marks this golden liqueur, supposedly based on “a forgotten Italian recipe.” The base is iris root, which on the palate yields an herbaceous scent and floral notes touched with saffron and cardamom. Seems like an ideal ingredient to play with for cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is reminiscent of rustic tarts. The pear fragrance features a robust malty note, and the flavor is warm, showing baked pear and cinnamon heat that seems to gather strength. The finish is exceedingly long and slightly perfumy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The rich, slightly sweet aroma is delectable and redolent of cherry pie filling. Made with tart cherries, this clear spirit has a faint, slightly bitter almond flavor and a pleasant cherry-flesh finish, plus a rousing bite of alcohol heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: While most pear brandies are made using Williams or Bartlett pears, this variation is made with Asian pears picked from Pennsylvanian orchards. The end result is fresh and clean, moderately drying, with a sweet fragrance that evokes pears as well as apples and grapes.
label: spirits_taster

description: The ruddy orange hue and citrusy aroma will remind some tipplers of Italy's Aperol. This tangerine and cane liqueur is quite sweet, with a candied-citrus flavor braced by pleasant, fleeting bitterness on the end. Top up with sparkling wine for a spritz-style sipper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with Moscato grapes, this spirit offers a sweet and perfumy aroma. On the palate, expect delicate, lingering notes of violet, rosewater and raspberry, finishing with white-pepper heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Although this is one of the nicer variations on slivovitz, the category isn't for everyone. Coppersea's version has a malty, fruity aroma and flavors that mix floral notes with a modest amount of fruit. Bigger, juicier fruit emerges on the finish alongside a dose of alcohol heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Allow this slivovitz, made from Italian blue plums, to open up in the glass for more flavor. The soft, warm scent captures a fresh-fruit essence. On the palate, flavors run to pleasantly floral, even perfumy, rather than outright fruity, but retain pleasing freshness.
label: spirits_taster

description: This liqueur has a faint golden tint and bold coconut aroma. On the palate, it's quite sweet, showing coconut backed by a surprising eucalyptus note.
label: spirits_taster

description: Described as “chocolate grappa,” this thick, opaque-brown liquid has an oily sheen and a chocolaty, boozy aroma. It's thick at first sip, featuring not-too-sweet cocoa notes, although the grappa influence shows up on the palate-cleansing finish. Packaged with two sleeves of ice cream cone-like wafers tucked inside the box.
label: spirits_taster

description: Let this cherry eau de vie sit in the glass to coax out more warm cherry aroma. Made with Oregon and Washington cherries, it's somewhat perfumy, with a mild flavor and silky feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Presenting a soft golden hue in the glass, this eau de vie wafts a rich, bold aroma that suggests peach nectar. The palate is lighter, mixing ripe peach flesh, white flowers and honey. Add a small dose to sparkling wine for a riff on the classic Bellini.
label: spirits_taster

description: This clear eau de vie mixes pear and malty notes in the aroma. On the palate, the pear flavor fades quickly, leaving behind a slight bitterness on the finish and alcohol heat around the edges of the tongue, plus a slight saline note.
label: spirits_taster

description: A variation on the Scandinavian holiday punch made with grain neutral spirit instead of wine, this cheery yellow liqueur is light on the palate, and packed with honey, clove, cardamom and cinnamon. Traditionalists will miss the warmth and weight that wine provides, but bartenders don't seem to care; they are using the liqueur to spice up wintry whiskey and rum cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with a whopping 40 pounds of Pacific Northwest berries per bottle, this clear eau de vie has a malty, funky aroma, with just a berry-ish tinge. On the palate, flavors are on the floral, waxy side, with faint berry notes woven throughout.
label: spirits_taster

description: A new entry for agave-lovers, this is made with 100% henequen, a type of wild agave that grows extensively in the Yucátan Peninsula. This “reposado” version is aged in white-oak barrels for a few months, creating a light gold color and honey-like note. The slightly smoky-agave-pear-vanilla scent is reminiscent of mezcal. On the tongue, it's quite spicy and jalapeño peppery, with just a touch of honey sweetness.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from wild raspberries from the Carpathian mountains, this eau de vie has a light, faint berry scent and flavor, marked by a slight bitterness similar to that found in some flavored vodkas. The finish exhales more waxy berry, plus a flicker of alcohol heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: In this 100% henequen liqueur, the expression is clear, with a slightly sweet, almost neutral aroma. On the palate, a fleeting, honey-like sweetness yields to peppery spice; the flavor otherwise is mild, almost neutral. Fun fact: Similar to sisal, henequen also yields fibers used to make rope or twine.
label: spirits_taster

description: Despite the warm, juicy, grapy aroma and fruity palate, a strong alcohol presence dominates throughout. Even the fade-out mingles alcohol sting on the tip of the tongue with pleasant, lingering grape flavors.
label: spirits_taster

description: A total of 33 pounds of cherries are used to produce one bottle of this clear Black Forest cherry brandy. The light, sweet aroma shows a faint cherry scent, but there's not much cherry on the palate. Instead, rather soapy, floral flavors come forward, though a flicker of fruit emerges on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled in 1972 and bottled in 2012, this 40-year-old blended Scotch is special. The nut-brown hue and rich aromas of sweet spice and brown sugar hint at what's to come. It delivers bold, complex flavor: rounded toffee, allspice, leather, tea and oak, with a mouthwatering saline note and a long but gentle finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This golden blended Scotch is remarkably complex, showing creamy vanilla, crème brûlée and almond before tapering to dry, warm notes of cedar, sandalwood and clove. Finishes long and feather-light, with just a trace of smokiness.
label: spirits_taster

description: Amber and bright in the glass, this 18-year-old blended whisky melds vanilla, cigar wrapper and chamomile tea notes with nutmeg and cinnamon spice, plus a delicate puff of sweet smoke. Feels light and silky, finishes long and gently.
label: spirits_taster

description: Scented with honey and dried apricots, this blended Japanese whisky is remarkably soft for a 21-year-old bottling, with just the evidence of oak tannins as a reminder of age. Complex flavors included mellow, rounded vanilla and caramel, peach and apricot, orange peel, plus a light cover of smoke fading to toffee and citrus on the long finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: A limited-edition bottling to commemorate the brand's 75th anniversary, this luscious, full-bodied whisky mixes creamy mouth-coating vanilla, baked apple, crème brûlée and butterscotch, finishing long, warm and spiced. Consider this mellow, balanced whisky for a dessert pairing or post-prandial sipper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged 18 years, this “private blend,” added to the line-up in 2013, is supple and smooth. It has a vibrant topaz tint and bold orange peel and honey notes underpinned by light smokiness. The smoky notes gently crest with each additional sip.
label: spirits_taster

description: Velvety and complex, this blended whisky mixes light smoke and butterscotch aromas. On the palate, look for bold toffee and oak, baked apple and cedar-clove spice wrapped in moderate peatiness, which also winds into the drying finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Possibly one of the best-balanced whiskies around—which is what blending is all about—this honey-hued Scotch measures out fruit, smoke, oak and spice. The fresh, enticing scent incorporates fresh apple, orange peel and milky caramel. On the palate, light smokiness up front gives way to more vanilla and fruit, winding into the long baking-spice finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Intended for mixing, so bring on the whisky sours and the Blood & Sands. Or drink this blended Scotch straight if you choose, to enjoy mouthwatering butterscotch and juicy orange, balanced by oaky tannins into the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Featured as a blend of Johnnie Walker's rarest whiskies, this Scotch billows with sweet cigar smoke from the very first sip. Underneath that, look for vanilla, oak and dry cocoa, finishing dry and spicy with cigar wrapper, allspice and clove, plus a mouthwatering saline note.
label: spirits_taster

description: This five-year-old Speyside single malt is certified organic by the Soil Association Certification—a distinction not often seen on Scotch labels. The spirit inside has an enticing apple and pear aroma. The palate is relatively hot, leading with oak and spice into a long vanilla finish. Adding water softens the profile to vanilla cream, plus hint of lemon and ginger on long, drying finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Islay single malt has a straw hue and saline, seaweed and peat aromas underpinned by light vanilla and coconut. The palate is distinctly smoky, and has a mouthwatering saline quality, with a pepper and jalapeño finish. Faint vanilla and pineapple notes play underneath. Keep a light hand on the water, this washes out easily.
label: spirits_taster

description: Fresh apple and pear aromas lead the nose on this Speyside single malt. The palate shows oak and rounds into mouthwatering hints of espresso, cocoa, cigar wrapper and clove. Water mellows the alcohol a bit, but the cocoa-coffee-spice trinity remains firmly in place.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a straw hue and unmistakably peaty, smoky scent. On the palate, fruity sweetness leads at first, quickly morphing into a billow of pungent peat smoke. Quite drying, and finishes fiery. Water tamps down the alcohol heat and brings more orchard fruit forward. Released in 2016 to honor Alfred Barnard, considered to be the first whiskey writer, as part of the 200th anniversary of Lagavulin.
label: spirits_taster

description: This easy-sipping Highlands single malt was finished in oloroso sherry casks, and has no age statement. A surprising cherry scent mixes with fresh-cut apple and a hint of sherry. Meanwhile, the silky palate shows mellow vanilla and cinnamon, freshened with a hint of apple. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Highlands single malt has a golden hue and mild, fresh pear and vanilla scent. The palate leads with oak and a faint resiny note, finishing with vanilla custard and cinnamon heat. Dilution brings more vanilla and less fire. Limited edition; 3,000 bottles in the U.S.
label: spirits_taster

description: This limited-edition single malt scotch is scented with white flowers, fresh pear and honey. The palate is relatively drying and herbaceous, starting with cedar, oak and cigar wrapper, winding into earthy hints of sarsaparilla, chamomile tea and lemon peel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a pleasantly peaty aroma; smoke intertwined with mellow vanilla. The palate shows cocoa and a salted caramel core, but it's mostly about the smoke. The palate closes with a clove and cayenne sizzle. Water coaxes some caramel sweetness forward.
label: spirits_taster

description: The mild aroma suggests sherry, golden raisins and vanilla, which are echoed on the palate alongside a ribbon of smoke that winds into the clove and cinnamon-spiced finish. Water gives the vanilla more power and brings out a nice butterscotch richness.
label: spirits_taster

description: The earthy scent of this whisky suggests oak and hints of vanilla and caramel. On the palate, look for drying, oaky flavors: Tea, cigar wrapper, espresso, plus clove and black pepper on the biting finish. Dilution coaxes out a mellow honeyed note and faint puff of smoke, but overall it's dry as a bone.
label: spirits_taster

description: Muted aromas offer pear and an earthy hint. Meanwhile, the palate leads with vanilla sweetness touched by peat smoke. The smokiness amps up with repeated sips, bringing dark chocolate and black pepper, plus clove heat on the finish. Water softens it all, integrates the smoke and chocolatiness, dials back the heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: This rum-cask-finished single malt is amber in the glass and has vanilla, oak and baked apple aromas, which are echoed on the palate alongside a cedar note and a clove and cinnamon-spiced finish. Water brings more vanilla forward, along with a hint of sarsaparilla.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a mild, earthy aroma that hints at cedar and vanilla. The palate is relatively oaky, with an assertive alcohol tingle up front. Cedar, vanilla, and a hint of butterscotch richness wind into a big, drying finish. Adding water tames the alc  ohol heat to a simmer and coaxes almond and stone fruit notes forward. Highland single malt.
label: spirits_taster

description: The relatively sweet aroma suggests honey, coconut, marzipan and a peachy hint. But the palate is oaky and drying, leaning toward cedar and chamomile, plus just a hint of honey into the finish. Water brings out whispers of almond and stone fruit. Speyside.
label: spirits_taster

description: This wild strawberry liqueur reads like a glassful of strawberry jam, with a deep garnet hue and concentrated fruit flavor that goes down sweet and warming. Splash this easy-drinking, dessert-like cordial into Champagne or sip as a sweet ending to a meal.
label: spirits_taster

description: A top pick for mixing into sparkling wine or cocktails, this wild blackberry liqueur has a deep plummy color and features a complex, moderately sweet mix of Concord grape, delicate violet and black cherry aromas and flavors, finishing with a pleasing vanilla and floral exhale. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Jahiot Crème de Framboise (France; Heavenly Spirits, Lakeville, MA). Overall, this raspberry liqueur is rich and viscous, redolent with dark, ripe black cherry and blackberry compote—there's even a fortified wine note reminiscent of Manischewitz. The finish is long and clings to the palate, yet offers just enough mouthwatering tartness to keep things interesting. Dessert-worthy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with over a quart of raspberries in each bottle, look for a deep plum hue and bold, sweet raspberry jam aroma and flavor. Add sparingly to cocktails where a bit of fruity sweetness is desired, or follow the producer's suggestion to pour over ice cream. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Plush and velvety, this blackcurrant liqueur is a classic choice for mixing into Kir Royales. Look for a blackberry compote aroma and a sweet, palate-coating mix of Concord grape, black cherry and prune, finishing long with a brush of vanilla. Made by Maison Ferrand.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with a mix of raspberry brandy and raspberry juice, this is not a classic sweet sipper. It has a fair amount of sour cherry-like acidity on the palate, and reads almost like a port or weighty red wine. It's deep and dark in the glass, featuring stewed berry and dried herb aromas, along with a fruit-forward palate that finishes on a mouth-puckering hint of lemon curd. Pair with dark chocolate.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clean, neutral and versatile to sip or mix, this brisk, bracing vodka has just a hint of almond sweetness and finishes crisp, with a faint white pepper tingle. Made from winter wheat and barley.
label: spirits_taster

description: Produced from corn and Cape Cod potatoes, this versatile vodka offers feather-light almond sweetness, carrying over into the gentle, creamy finish, plus a refreshing flicker of white pepper heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: This corn-based vodka is generally neutral on the nose and palate, with just a hint of charcoal and a shadow of clove-like heat into the smooth, mouthwatering finish. Try it, well chilled, as a pairing for savory foods.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with vanilla and a Cognac base, this liqueur has a muted plum hue and a rich, black cherry scent. The palate is lightly sweet and easy-sipping, with a warming, candied berry-cherry flavor. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: The enticing scent is reminiscent of cherry pie filling. Meanwhile, the palate is not overly sweet, showing concentrated cherry flavor on the midpalate and finishing relatively clean for a liqueur. Mix into whiskey for a Black Manhattan-style sipper or pair with dark chocolate. Made from Morello cherries.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distinctly sweet on the nose and palate, this wheat-based vodka offers nuanced hints of vanilla, citrus and mint, finishing clean with an echo of mild almond-like sweetness and white pepper heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Mushroom cocktails are trendy right now, but this might be the first commercial bottling of a liqueur made with Black Trumpet mushrooms, along with blueberries, lavender and lemon verbena. Altogether, it's a heady, intriguing mix, purple in the glass and scented like crushed berries and dried herbs. The complex palate suggests a mix of mashed blueberries and Concord grape jam, enlivened by a faint savory note midpalate, and finishing with lush, palate-coating fruit. Try it in a Kir.
label: spirits_taster

description: This raspberry liqueur has a deep plum-skin hue and berry compote aroma. The relatively sweet flavor suggests cherry pie filling and strawberry jam, finishing long and warming on a hint of vanilla. Ideal to pour over vanilla ice cream. Made by Maison Ferrand.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a neutral scent and mildly sweet palate showing faint hints of tropical fruit and vanilla, plus mild cinnamon heat on finish. Distilled from corn.
label: spirits_taster

description: This wild strawberry liqueur has a bright red hue. Look for a ripe berry scent, and a moderate amount of fruit on the palate. It's not overly sweet, and the grappa base supplies a medicinal tinge.
label: spirits_taster

description: This 12-year-old Barbados rum has a copper penny color and a bright banana cream pie scent. Peppy coffee and clove notes are smoothed with caramel and banana   flavors, plus enough alcohol for structure. Good dessert pairing.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is a Scotch-lover's rum, with an intriguingly smoky flavor reminiscent of a lightly peated whiskey fading into a lingering finish touched with vanilla and tropical fruit. Light body and light amber color.
label: spirits_taster

description: A deep and dark rum, with a nut-brown color and sweet toffee and hazelnut aroma. Strong alcohol presence on the palate, but that washes over with toffee and coconut and a hint of cinnamon. If rum and cola is your tipple of choice, this cola-like rum should make a fine match. Aged “upward to four years.”
label: spirits_taster

description: Although surprisingly light and soft for a 100-proof product, with lively vanilla and lemon peel flavors, the alcohol sure does sting going down. Mix this rum in tropical and tiki recipes, and remember that a little bit goes a long way.
label: spirits_taster

description: This 10-year-old rhum agricole has a warm and welcoming, sweet caramel scent. However, the flavor is more on the dry side, with tropical fruit, vanilla and cola. The otherwise silky feel is marred by the presence of a little too much alcohol.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Cognac-finished Panama rum has an earthy, herbaceous scent mixed with banana and vanilla tones. It reads on the sweet side, flashing a vegetal note and a complex finish inflected with caramel, orange peel and bitter chocolate.
label: spirits_taster

description: Among the most aromatic rums, with a rich, thick caramel perfume. On the palate, this honey-colored spirit, made from a blend of rums aged from 10 to 30 years, is full bodied and viscous. It has an oaky flavor mixed with tropical fruit and a powerful burnt-toffee finish. Rather heavy on the alcohol; it ought to be a sipping rum, but it's so boozy it burns the tongue.
label: spirits_taster

description: The color of apple juice, this rum has a warm, fruity scent and a light smokiness. Although boozy up front, that fades out to a pleasing tropical fruit and sweet vanilla finish. Glug the bottle into a punch to smooth out the rough edges.
label: spirits_taster

description: Resembling cachaça, this clear aged rum has a coconutty aroma and a sweet flavor with a marshmallow finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Blending rums aged between three and eight years yields an amber spirit with a mild scent and light body, with notes of vanilla and cassia bark on the finish. Works well mixed with ginger beer in a Dark & Stormy-style drink.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with rums aged two to five years. Look for a honey-colored spirit with a light, silky feel, balanced alcohol, and vanilla and resin notes on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: An almost cordial-like stunner, from the dense deep red color to the brandied cherry flavor. Though it's a trifle boozy, like an eau-de-vie, the syrupy, velvety spirit is surprisingly luscious. A dark cherry flavor clings to the palate. It wouldn't be out of place as an after-dinner digestif, swirled in a snifter with an ice cube or two. How many vodkas can say that?
label: spirits_taster

description: This sophisticated and sippable American brandy can hold its own against fine Cognacs, but at a much gentler price. It has a deep amber color and big, resonating tones of toffee, figs and allspice. A drop of water releases still more toffee. Made with a blend of Pinot Noir brandies, aged on average seven years. Previously sold as Shareholder's Reserve, now with a new label and new name.
label: spirits_taster

description: From Etude Wines comes this rich, highly aromatic wine lover's brandy. Made with a blend of brandies aged on average over 20 years in French oak casks, look for Sherry-like dried fruit and honey flavors, finishing with a lingering and lightly boozy caramel note. Sipping brandy.
label: spirits_taster

description: From a small family-run distillery, this blend of “older” California brandies has a vibrant golden-orange color and a sweet apples-and-honey note. On the palate, creamy citrus flavors finish big and rich, with caramel, ginger and cinnamon notes, and a soft texture. Pair with a fruit dessert, like apple pie with vanilla ice cream. Come to think of it, this brandy would be dynamite simply poured over ice cream, too.
label: spirits_taster

description: A small-batch vodka from master distiller Tim Vos, this pretty pink spirit with a mild cherry-almond scent is surprisingly big and sweet on the palate, with a touch of bitterness. Ice transforms this spirit, though, erasing the bitterness and coaxing out violet notes. Shake it with ice, strain it into a coupe glass with brandied cherries and call it a Vodka Aviation.
label: spirits_taster

description: The best of the raspberry crop: a clear spirit with a light, sugared scent and a fleeting juiciness that winds into a nicely mouthwatering, fruity finish. Silky texture. Good value, too
label: spirits_taster

description: Warm, sweet, candy-like scent. On the palate, this clear spirit shows a flare of alcohol up front, fading into sweetness and a lingering, pleasant raspberry finish. A good match for vodka tonics and vodka sodas.
label: spirits_taster

description: A vodka with finesse and elegance, from the light, sweet cherry scent to the restrained cherry-vanilla flavor to the smooth feel. Best with ice. Clean, striking bottle design.
label: spirits_taster

description: While it won't cure your craving for a chocolate fix, this vodka is smooth and pleasant sipping, and surprisingly addictive. The aroma translates more grape-like than berry. The clear spirit is mildly flavored, with a pleasant, subtle cocoa finish. Made in Cognac, France, this spirit is 80 calories compared to the 100 that most vodkas have.
label: spirits_taster

description: Intriguingly complex, with earthy, cedar-like aromas and muted herbal flavors of mint, eucalyptus and rosemary. Although the flavor doesn't read as fruity, it's very nice nevertheless, with a soft, velvety texture. No additives or flavoring agents.
label: spirits_taster

description: Since the round-ball bottle and its candied-violet-scented, lavender-pink contents so closely resemble perfume, presumably the ladies are the target audience. On its own, this vodka, an offshoot of Chambord liqueur, is viscous and tooth-achingly sweet. But mixed and chilled, the ladies will love this in martini'd and carbonated form.
label: spirits_taster

description: Craving cherry candy? Here it is, in liquid form. The clear spirit has a perky, assertive Charms lollipop scent. Although it reads as ersatz and a touch bitter at first, the flavor rounds out on the finish to be lollipop bright.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with raspberries from Germany, this clear vodka has a bright berry lollipop scent and a sweet flavor with an insistent pop of berry flavor up front. Best with lots of ice, which smooths out the flavor and coaxes a softer feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: A very grapey vodka, with a grape soda-like purple color and scent, and intensely juicy, grape-berry flavor lifted by a lightly effervescent feel on the tongue and a touch of violet on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a juicy grape lollipop scent and flavor, with a gentle effervescent feel. This spirit would blend seamlessly into a fruity martini-style drink.
label: spirits_taster

description: A clear Idaho potato-vodka spirit, with lots of vanilla in the aroma and flavor, plus a touch of cherry candy on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This vodka is all about the aromatics—the bright, bold, juicy strawberry fragrance practically bounces out of the glass. The flavor washes out, except for the pleasant burst of strawberry-vanilla on the finish. But this could make for a lovely strawberry-scented spritzer when there won't be any real berries found at the greenmarket.
label: spirits_taster

description: Dense cherry red color and juicy scent redolent with dark raspberries or cherries. An enormous sweet-tart cherry flavor washes over the tongue, then fades quickly. Consider using this spirit to add color and flavor to a martini-style drink.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from fermented molasses and locally sourced maple syrup, technically this isn't rum but is distinctly rum-like. It's light gold in the glass, with an herbaceous aroma reminiscent of Tequila, brushed with oak and vanilla. The palate is relatively oaky, winding into vanilla and cinnamon heat on the fiery finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Named for the tahona stone used to crush the agave piñas, this blanco has an astonishing purity to it. Pleasingly peppery on the nose and palate, backed by a hint of vanilla, roasted jalapeño emerges midpalate before finishing clean and crisp, with a lemon-zest note. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: This single-estate blanco has a bold, bracing scent that suggests bell pepper, fresh basil and lemon peel. The citrusy palate is accented by fresh herbs and trails off with a hint of vanilla sweetness. The gorgeous Day of the Dead-style bottle design makes this a gift-worthy pick.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is a raw, visceral, sexy Tequila. The savory, almost meaty nose and palate are reminiscent of pechuga mezcals (which are actually made with meat). All that umami is softened by a rounded, waxy honey note on the midpalate, finishing with an herbaceous lilt on the peppery exhale.
label: spirits_taster

description: Certified organic, this blanco has a zesty, savory nose and palate that suggest dried herbs, honey and a hint of tomato paste. The complex flavor finishes with light almond and agave sweetness, a hint of steely minerality, and a final burst of jalapeño heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Delicate and nuanced, the mild, fresh scent suggests tomato water and fresh basil. The palate is mellow, grassy and bright, laced with spearmint and basil and finishing with zesty lemon peel and ginger.
label: spirits_taster

description: The Tequila brand backed by Justin Timberlake has an herbaceous fragrance and distinctly sweet palate, with notes of honey, almond and a touch of coconut, finishing smooth and crisp. Thumbs-up for Margaritas and other cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Brisk, clean and herbaceous, this Tequila is almost reminiscent of gin. The aroma has a spicy edge, plus hints of mint and dill, while the minty palate finishes with vanilla-coconut sweetness and mild baking-spice tingle. Versatile for a wide range of cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a delicate mix of floral and tropical fruit aromas, which are echoed on the palate. Pineapple and coconut sweetness segues into a long coconut-vanilla finish accented with cinnamon, plus just a mild floral hint on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This certified organic Tequila has an herbaceous scent, suggesting mint and bell pepper. The soft palate shows agave up front, moving to a spicy midpalate with plenty of cayenne and black pepper heat, then finishing with hints of herbs and lemon peel, plus a kick of alcohol heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: The light, delicate scent balances floral, grassy and fresh fruit notes. Meanwhile, the palate brings lychee and pineapple forward, plus vanilla and a sprinkle of cayenne pepper on the finish. A lip-smacking head start to fruity cocktails. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Margarita-ready Tequila features mellow vanilla and dried herb aromas. It's perkier on the tongue, showing spearmint, fennel and jalapeño, plus a vanilla and coconut fade and just enough alcohol punch on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma entices with honey and subtle vegetal notes. Meanwhile, the palate has a lightly fruity flavor, suggesting raspberry, honey and vanilla, plus a sprinkle of cayenne on the crisp finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This golden agave-based spirit is not made in Mexico, so it's not technically Tequila, but it tastes similar. Look for a markedly sweet vanilla fragrance, plus lots of vanilla on the palate, plus honey, coconut and almond, which fades to a mild but long-lasting pineapple note on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The mild, savory scent hints at fresh oregano, tomato and bell pepper. Fleeting agave sweetness leads the palate, followed by a zesty, herbaceous, citrusy midpalate and lightly spicy finish. Overall, it's an ideal flavor profile for a Bloody Maria or any other savory cocktail. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: This limited edition blanco has a brisk, delicate aroma that hints at wet slate plus whispers of fresh herbs and honeysuckle. That's echoed on the light, astringent palate, which dries into lemon and grapefruit peel, plus a gentle floral exhale. Certified organic.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a bold, vegetal aroma marked by bell and jalapeño pepper. The palate is fairly spicy up front, with black pepper and jalapeño sparks against a vegetal core. The mineral-laced finish is clean and bracing.
label: spirits_taster

description: The honeyed agave aroma hints at what's to come. The palate starts sweet and mellow, almost reminiscent of corn-based white whiskey, but dries into a spicier finish, with touches of bell pepper, black and cayenne pepper. The flavor evolves with every sip, from sweet to spicy, and finishes long, with a slow burn.
label: spirits_taster

description: The zesty scent mixes roasted pepper and honey. Meanwhile, there's an entire herb garden in that plush, super-soft palate: dill, oregano, and rosemary wind into a peppery, perky finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The mild scent hints at agave and basil. Meanwhile, the palate shows vanilla sweetness up front, warming to a traditional agave and jalapeño midpalate, and finishing with black pepper sparks and echoes of vanilla and cinnamon. Seems like it would lend itself to barrel-aged expressions.
label: spirits_taster

description: This “unrested Tequila” (some blancos do spend short periods in oak barrels) has a bold, fresh tomato and herb scent. The silky, almost viscous palate starts with a minty punch, plus honey and jalapeño sizzle midpalate, and finishes herbaceous, grassy and light, with just a touch of black pepper heat as it drifts off the tongue.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a mix of honey and roasted jalapeño, plus black pepper sizzle and a chipotle-like hint of raisiny sweetness in the background. Each sip finishes with a mellow mix of pepper and vanilla.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with agave cooked in a stainless steel oven instead of clay “to create smooth profile,” this blanco offers dried oregano and tomato on the nose and palate, softened with honey and finishing with a citrusy, gingery burst. The unusual X-shaped bottle is attractive, but a little challenging to hold while pouring.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distinctly sweet scent, vanilla forward, marshmallow, cocoa. Same on palate, finishing with white pepper and ginger tingle, faint hint of grapefruit peel and jalapeño. It's a little too sugary-sweet, but the barrel-aged versions amp up warmer tones.
label: spirits_taster

description: For those who prefer their Tequila with a sweeter side, this blanco offers a vanilla-marshmallow scent, which is echoed on the silky palate alongside coconut and pineapple, finishing with hints of cinnamon and lemon peel. Recommended for tropical drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged 45 days, this Tequila has a faint straw tinge and an aroma that mixes zesty tomato and sweet honey-vanilla. Vanilla wins on the palate—bold and sweet, with hints of coconut and dill, drying to a nutmeg and cinnamon-accented finish. Versatile cocktail choice.
label: spirits_taster

description: A mild, barely-there whiff of vanilla and white flowers leads into a soft palate marked by coconut, vanilla, almond sweetness. The elongated finish shows vanilla and marshmallow, plus flickers of white pepper and cayenne heat. It seems insubstantial as a blanco but all those confectionary notes suggest that the barrel-aged expressions are worth seeking out.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a honey and bell pepper scent, plus a faint, soapy touch of lavender. The palate shows agave and vegetal bell pepper, plus a mildly floral finish laced with white pepper. The strikingly heavy bottle is cobalt blue glass, bulbous with a wide, flat teardrop bottom.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Tequila is clear like a blanco, but—surprise!—it's really an añejo Tequila, aged for 18 months then filtered to remove the color. The aroma is crisp, with mild honey and jalapeño. It's remarkably peppery on the palate, with jalapeño, cayenne and black pepper tingle, finishing clean, with a pleasantly buttery feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is nearly neutral, while the light, soft palate shows vanilla, coconut, and a bit of peppery heat on the finish. Overall it's inoffensive but unsubstantial, without much to grab a Tequila-lover's interest.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Sherry-finished Irish whiskey has a vanilla and honey fragrance, with hints of white flowers and fresh basil. The silky palate echoes the vanilla and honey, plus juicy pear and finishing with dark chocolate and clove. Add a splash of water to soften the potent alcohol heat and watch the flavor profile subtly shift: more pear appears, alongside hints of white flowers and white peach, finishing with white chocolate and nutmeg.
label: spirits_taster

description: “The official Irish whiskey of the legendary band,” this robust spirit is made at West Cork Distillers, one of two remaining 100% independently owned and operated distilleries in Ireland. The aromas suggest stone fruit and a whiff of smoke. The palate also shows smoke, plus dried  apricot richness and a mouthwatering saline finish. A mix of whiskies aged 5 to 10 years.
label: spirits_taster

description: This unusual bottling comprises 55% Irish whiskey and 45% American whiskey, both 10 years old. Look for a citrusy aroma with a hint of smoke. The palate shows lots of bright  tropical fruit, lemon curd and pear, with a whiff of smoke, and finishing with drying oak and ginger heat. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: The gentle honey scent edged with vanilla leads into the vanilla-forward palate, which also shows caramel, oak, and baking spice on the raucous, relatively hot finish. A splash of water tames the heat nicely, dialing it back to vanilla and honey, with hints of pear and a mellow fade.
label: spirits_taster

description: A blend of single-malt and grain whiskeys, this has a relatively light, approachable profile. The aroma is bright, fresh and grassy, with hints of white peach and smoke. The palate shows subtle sweetness, layering peach, lemon and grapefruit peel with almond, oak and coconut, plus a mouthwatering, spicy ginger-cinnamon finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This single malt has fresh, bright scents of pear, vanilla and almond. The palate shows darker fruit: plum and dried apricot, layered with almond and hints of smoke and clove. A splash of water mellows the potent alcohol heat, but dilutes the flavors to milder almond, coconut and just a whisper of stone fruit.
label: spirits_taster

description: A quartet of casks (Bourbon, Sherry, Port, Madeira) yield a gentle, mellow sipper, with vanilla on the nose and palate, plus cocoa and dark honey accents. Compared to the complex, bold 18-year-old expression, this is a much more restrained sip.
label: spirits_taster

description: This honey-hued blended whiskey offers vanilla, coconut and almond aromas and flavors plus touches of menthol and honeysuckle. The finish is quite spicy; cayenne and cinnamon prickle the tip of the tongue.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with Irish whiskey and honeycomb liqueur, mix or serve as a dessert pairing. The distinctly sweet aroma hints at pecan pie. The palate isn't overwhelmingly sweet and sips well, suggesting nuts, waxy honey, white chocolate, nutmeg and cinnamon.
label: spirits_taster

description: The fragrance of fresh-cut apples leads the nose. On the palate, look for green apple, pear and grass perked up with herbaceous and menthol notes, plus a hint of smoke, smoothed with fleeting honey and vanilla-mint sweetness. The drying finish combines spearmint, ginger and black pepper heat. Limited edition.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pale gold in the glass, look for honey and vanilla, plus a thin ribbon of juicy apple and a faint plastic-y note. Recommended for mixing.
label: spirits_taster

description: Ideal for mixing nuanced cocktails that don't taste like dessert, this bittersweet coffee-based amaro offers a mix of almond, chocolate and coffee, finishing with cardamom and bitter orange peel complexity. Made with coffee from Kansas City roaster Thou Mayest, and briefly barrel aged.
label: spirits_taster

description: This “coffee amaro” has a deep, dark hue and enticing, sweet scent that suggests hazelnuts and root beer. On palate, the liquid is thick and viscous, with a mild espresso flavor that eases into a pleasing roots-and-bark finish shot through with clove spice. Mix into cocktails any place amaro would go.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with Fair Trade coffee and sugar, this liqueur has a fresh-ground coffee scent and viscous, creamy feel. Hazelnut, milk chocolate and mocha coat the palate, finishing with hints of coffee, chocolate, orange peel and spice. Mix into coffee or pair with dessert.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a deep, ruddy brown hue and enticingly rich mocha scent. This is a dessert-like sip, sweet and viscous with tons of creamy fudge, vanilla and hazelnut up front. A welcome hit of alcohol on the finish cuts the sweetness and adds cinnamon-clove tingle to the exit. Producer recommends to pour over ice cream, affogato style.
label: spirits_taster

description: Golden-bright and richly fragrant, this hazelnut liqueur has a sweet, pleasingly nutty flavor, finishing long. The moderate weight coats the palate without becoming cloying. Pour over ice, or mix into coffee or cocktails. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Deep brown in the glass, this walnut liqueur offers a pleasing dark chocolate scent and fleeting sweetness on the palate, perked up by a lightly spicy, tingly exit that suggests ancho chile. Ideal to add spice and mild sweetness to whiskey or brandy drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: This liqueur actually tastes like almonds, not cloying almond extract. It pours thick and viscous, with a nutty but not overly sweet flavor, plus a honeyed note on the spiced exit. Sip or mix, or use for baking. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sip or mix this dessert-worthy liqueur. It looks and smells like coffee. On the palate, it's viscous and quite sweet, suggesting coffee with milk and sugar, finishing with rich hints of milk chocolate, Nutella and cinnamon.
label: spirits_taster

description: This inky, opaque walnut liqueur has a mild scent and drying, tannic palate that suggests unsweetened chocolate, blackberry and prune. It comes alive on the finish, showing orange peel, vanilla bean and baking spice. Sip as a refreshing digestif. Made with Ohio black walnuts in a vodka base.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from green walnuts and a base of fermented Pinot Noir, this deep brown liqueur has a bold, fruity scent. The robust, palate-coating flavor suggests raspberry jam, cassis and baking spice, plus a tinge of espresso and walnut-like bitterness on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This unusual garnet-hued spirit is based on a historic 19th-century French liqueur. Almond extract and cherry-berry-like fruitiness mix together in a flavor profile that will remind some of childhood cough syrup, but finishes far more pleasantly, with cinnamon spice and hibiscus. An essential ingredient for the Pink Squirrel, with crème de cacao and fresh cream.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sip or mix this deep brown liqueur. The scent is sweet and coffee-like, interwoven with hints of dark chocolate and blackberry. The palate surprises with a distinct, assertive anise twang. Finishes long, with anise, espresso and dark chocolate.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is a deeper, darker take on amaretto. Look for a bold marzipan scent and rich toffee, brown sugar and almond extract on the viscous palate. Hints of baking spice and burnt orange peel shore up the finish. Sip or mix; the producer suggests mixing with champagne. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Dark, inky brown, with a savory, herbaceous scent. The flavor surprises with a spicy burst up front, with leads to cola, amaro-like bitterness, and a rounded, mouthwatering finish accented with vanilla, clove and allspice. There's a pronounced alcohol kick; seems ideal as a warming post-prandial sipper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Looks and smells like a cup o' joe. The palate is medium-bodied and quite sweet, suggesting espresso with two sugars, but finishing gentle and creamy, trailing off with Nutella, milk chocolate and a flicker of ginger-like heat. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Inky dark brown in the glass, this liqueur suggests strong espresso in look, aroma and taste. Inspired by New Orleans-style coffee and made with French chicory root, vanilla and cane sugar, this liqueur has a robust, long-lasting coffee flavor with restrained sweetness, showing dark chocolate and a flicker of bitter edge on the exit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Burnished copper in the glass, this liqueur has a sweet almond extract aroma. On the palate, it's sweet and mouth-coating, showing almond extract mixed with vanilla and caramel, fading into a warming, ginger-y finish. Some will find it a bit sweet to sip straight up, but should be a versatile mixer for a wide range of cocktails. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Despite an only mildly nutty scent, the palate is rich and concentrated, with plenty of brown sugar accented by cinnamon and clove. Addictive sipper; pour into coffee or over ice cream. Best Buy.
