description: This small-batch gin was made using antique Cognac stills, then aged for one year. It's golden in the glass, with a mild, minty aroma. On the palate, it's notably silky, light and delicate. A smooth vanilla note leads into spearmint and lemon peel, before drying to cayenne and black pepper tingle on the finish. Only 100 cases made, so snap it up while you can.
label: spirits_taster

description: This history-minded bottling was made in collaboration with Brooklyn barmen Damon Boelte and Maxwell Britten. It's made from an 18th-century recipe, pot distilled using “exotic spices inspired by the British Spice Trade,” and finally, aged for 12 months in Bourbon and oloroso Sherry casks. All that adds up to a light gold hue, light sweetness (typical of the Old Tom style) and a pleasing, robust vanilla-mint profile with flecks of rosemary and lemon peel, finishing long and spicy. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sweet and slightly fruity on the nose, juniper-forward on the palate. This small-batch gin distilled from organic California wheat feels brisk and bracing, showing a twist of citrus and finishing with very light berry note.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a zesty, pungent aroma reminiscent of tomato water. The palate takes a different direction, skewing floral with a touch of lavender, with juniper and white pepper emerging on the silky finish. Consider jumping on Spain's gin-tonic trend to showcase this intriguing newcomer.
label: spirits_taster

description: As the name suggests, the London Dry Style gin has a floral cast, though it's delicate and not at all overpowering. The mild, slightly citrusy aroma leads to a light rosewater sweetness on the palate, spiced up with white and black pepper and lime peel into the brisk exit. Sleek square bottle.
label: spirits_taster

description: The scent evokes candied lemon peel, while the complex palate shows cucumber, anise and cardamom, plus a lingering rosewater note on the finish. Consider for aviations and other cocktails where a floral touch is desired.
label: spirits_taster

description: Packaged in an exotic-looking, elephant-emblazoned bottle with a red tassel around the neck, this gin explodes with spice box aromas the minute it's poured. Though relatively neutral on the palate at first, the lingering finish whispers with cumin, coriander, black pepper, ginger and clove. If you were thinking of infusing a spirit with spices for a cocktail, use this instead.
label: spirits_taster

description: Scented with juniper and an earthy hint of anise, on the palate anise dominates, though it's tempered by pops of black pepper and an elusive sweetness (hazelnuts are among the botanicals used).
label: spirits_taster

description: Ideal for those who love chili pepper heat, this pale-straw gin has a mild, candied lemon peel scent but hits the palate with a one-two peppery punch. Reminiscent of mezcal, smoky notes mingle with honey sweetness and pops of menthol and mint, finishing fiery with jalapeño and cayenne heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: An old-school London Dry style gin recently re-introduced to the States, look for a classic juniper-pine aroma and a grapefruit-like flavor finishing with spicy hints of coriander, rosemary and black pepper. Despite that perceived flash of grapefruit, no citrus is used in the ingredients, a nod by the original creators that “any proper gin drink always included the addition of a slice of lemon or lime, and to include it in the gin's recipe would be redundant.”
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from rye grain grown on the distillery's farm, this soft, unusually full-bodied gin has a sweet bananas-and-honey aroma and flavor sprinkled with hot cinnamon and grapefruit peel. Consider for cocktails where a sweeter/fruitier profile is desired.
label: spirits_taster

description: It's hard to miss the pale robin's egg blue of this London Dry-style gin “with certified color.” Though neutral in scent, it's complex on the palate, starting with a delicate floral note that morphs into lemon and grapefruit peel before fading into a clean, bracing, peppery finish. Adds surprising color to G&Ts; and other mixed drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: Rested for six months in former bourbon barrels, this complex aged gin shows bright rosemary, citrus and mint, finishing long with spicy cayenne and cinnamon. It's soft on the palate, but sharpens with alcohol heat on the tip of the tongue.
label: spirits_taster

description: This bracing, pungent gin shows bold mint, menthol and pine. On the palate, it's relatively earthy, with lots of licorice and pine, offering a juicy, slightly sweet finish that might be due to the cucumbers macerated in the gin.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from a rye grown on the distillery's farm, this gin mixes bracing notes of anise, Meyer lemon, fennel and pine. The flavor grows with repeated sips, but so does the fiery, even numbing alcohol heat, which is to be expected from an overproof spirit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Part of this craft producer's “avant garde collection,” this gin has rested for five months in former red wine barrels. It has a pale ruddy hue and mixes notes of juniper, soapy rosewater and red berry, finishing with perky anise.
label: spirits_taster

description: The baffling use of a cork closure (grab a corkscrew!) for a modern gin bottling is meant to highlight the Old World nature of this genever-like gin. Warming and pleasantly malty, this pot-stilled spirit offers notes of anise and juniper, backed by a substantial body, that finishes with a faint effervescent feel on the tongue.
label: spirits_taster

description: This unusual gin is infused with cedar wood. Though it smells like a traditional gin, with licorice, sage and a touch of juniper in the scent, it's bold and earthy on the palate, almost reminiscent of genever, and has a distinct woody finish showing a trace of smoke. Try in a cocktail that includes sweet vermouth, like a Martinez.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bright aromas of citrus and pine show on the nose and palate of this classic London Dry-style gin. It finishes brisk, rather hot and drying, with a prickle of cinnamon heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: What's unique about this London Dry-style gin is the “gunpowder” green tea used as a botanical, sourced from a local tea shop. There's not much tea presence in the gin; rather, it has a clean and citrusy presence, with a piney juniper bounce and a slightly hot, drying finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This complex gem offers toffee and peach aromas that are surrounded by a faint smoky wisp. Caramel-sweet and soft on the palate, this is no fading violet; it finishes with a spicy cinnamon and cayenne pepper prickle—memorable to the end.
label: spirits_taster

description: Named for the Grassa family, which settled in the Château du Tariquet in 1912, this is made from a blend of Ugni Blanc and Baco grapes. Here, a heady vanilla tone mixes with a fresh apple flavor, leading to a hint of rich butterscotch and a surprisingly delicate white-flower note on the finish. Pair with tarte Tatin.
label: spirits_taster

description: As one of the few Armagnacs bottled as cask strength, the “Millésime 1995,” as this is also known, has a sharp alcohol presence, but it's balanced by rich, sweet cola, hazelnut and stone-fruit tones, with clove, cinnamon and ginger notes surfacing on the superlong finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: From Château du Tariquet, this fruity-floral treat melds together apple, pear and hazelnut notes, ending with a long, soothing toffee-flavored finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bright, light and citrusy, this is made from 100% Ugni Blanc. The color is light amber, with bright golden highlights, and the flavor tends toward lemon cream, with notes of nutmeg and spicy cinnamon on the finish. Consider a savory pairing, such as blue cheese or nuts.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with 100% Baco, this vintage Armagnac has a nut-brown color and maple-sugar aroma. Rounded sarsaparilla and vanilla flavors finish with an almost effervescent sensation on the tongue, along with a tannic oaky pucker.
label: spirits_taster

description: Allow this bright amber brandy some air exposure, and the reward is a dried- fruit aroma and a vanilla flavor, with touches of cinnamon- and clove. It feels a bit drying on the palate.
label: spirits_taster

description: This burnished-gold-colored spirit is made from a blend of Baco, Folle Blanche, Ugni Blanc and Colombard. The scent is light, with a funky touch of resin. On the palate, vanilla and maple flavors mix with a hint of citrus peel and a faint smoky note on the finish. Brisk in feel, this is recommended for mixing into cocktails, such as a sidecar variation.
label: spirits_taster

description: A rare sexagenarian spirit, this is intense and a bit challenging to drink but likely would soften alongside a rich and creamy dessert. Look for a dark amber hue and aromas of fruit, caramel and sweet tea. Citric and tart at first, the flavors soon morph into dark toffee, espresso, burnt edges of crème brûlée, dried figs and black currants.
label: spirits_taster

description: Given some time to aerate for full aromatic effect, the end result is a maple- and vanilla-scented nose, with a butterscotch-banana flavor and abundant baking spice notes that are heaped on the long finish. Brisk in alcohol but balanced, this feels like a great foundation, but would benefit from more aging time.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sweet vanilla and orange flavors are jarred by a resiny note at the back of the palate, then rescued by a smooth, buttery finish. Hard wax cap.
label: spirits_taster

description: Versatile and a good choice for mixing, this has a maple color, with dried-fruit aromas and a hint of fresh sugar-cane funk. On the palate, a long, soft vanilla flavor fades into clove and cinnamon sparks. Soft but brisk in alcohol, this is aged for a minimum of 10 years. Hard wax cap.
label: spirits_taster

description: This offers a mix of fresh and dried-fruit aromas and a slightly resiny nose. Its juicy apple cider, vanilla and toasty baking-spice notes suggest this would be a fine choice for mixing- into a mulled brandy punch for winter parties. Hard wax cap.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clear, funky, grappa-esque and muscular, this is a bit much straight up, but could have cocktail applications similar to cachaça or pisco. Blanche Armagnac Caiprinhas, anyone? Made using 100% Folle Blanche, this comes in a clean, modern-looking bottle. The producer suggests serving it well chilled alongside smoked salmon or caviar.
label: spirits_taster

description: A 1986 vintage made from only Folle Blanche—is it possible that it was allowed to age too long? The effect is one of fleeing sweetness, overwhelmed by an oaky, tannic feel, even lingering into the vanilla-tinged finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This clear blanche has big, funky, fruity flavors, with a robust alcoholic twang and a long brute of a finish. Use for mixing into cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Armagnac is cask strength and feels it. Beneath the alcohol lurks rich scents of apple and honey, with a sweet, nutty palate that's nearly obscured by fierce alcohol heat. 100% Folle Blanche.
label: spirits_taster

description: Most caçhacas are crystal-clear, but this unique aged version has a pretty amber cast and enticing aromas that evoke butterscotch and hazelnut. The flavor runs to brown sugar, with a warm, nutty finish. Delicious, and new to the market as of summer 2012.
label: spirits_taster

description: Hailing from Jamaica, this smooth 12-year-old rum features a sticky dark-toffee aroma accented by almond and peach notes. On the palate, look for a nice rounded caramel flavor that flashes lots of clove and cinnamon tones on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Smooth and mellow, this tawny aged rum features light almond and crème brûlée flavors, and a long finish accented by notes of black tea and clove. It's good for sipping with a block of ice. Made from a blend of rums aged 2–7 years.
label: spirits_taster

description: From Spain's sunny Canary Islands, this honey-sweetened 7-year-old rum has a lovely sweet-spice scent akin to chai tea, a sweet vanilla-bean—almost dulce de leche—flavor and a honeyed finish that coats the tongue.
label: spirits_taster

description: This amber spiced rum, which debuted last October, is aged in charred oak barrels, yielding a smooth, oaky vanilla flavor with a bit of spice on the lingering finish. Use as a mixer for rum and cola or in tiki-inspired drinks. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: With its transparent pink-blush hue that was imparted from hibiscus flowers, this unusual flavored white rum resembles rosé wine in the glass. But the delicate flavors tend toward sugary coconut, touched with vanilla and a hint of juicy red fruit. Made from sugar cane in a Montana microdistillery. Use for tropical drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: A collaboration between rum producer Roberto Serralles and nightlife impresario Rande Gerber, this clear rum has a mild, sweet coconut flavor and a faint citrusy tang. Made with rum aged up to four years, it's presented in a rustic-looking bottle with a rope coiled around the neck. Mix it into fruity daiquiris and mai tais.
label: spirits_taster

description: Give this amber rum, which is made using rums aged between 8–10 years, a chance to open up in the glass. The reward is a warm, honey-like flavor touched with notes of dry tea and oak, with a toffee accent toward the back of the palate. The lingering, warm finish is reminiscent of brandy. Made with 100% molasses, sourced from one of the oldest sugar-cane fields in Central America.
label: spirits_taster

description: Supposedly, the mojito is the drink that bartenders hate to make—that muddling of the fresh mint and lime juice is tedious. Bacardi's ready-to-drink version goes down easy, like minty limeade. It's no substitute for the real thing, but it's not a bad way to enjoy a mojito at home without suffering the bartender's scowl. Fewer than 95 calories per serving.
label: spirits_taster

description: This new spiced blackstrap rum is dark and dangerous, with a cola-like flavor that explodes into spicy fireworks of cinnamon and clove. Rum aged in double-charred blackened barrels results in an oaky, slightly bitter edge. Some may prefer the lighter hand of the original Captain Morgan for rum and Cokes.
label: spirits_taster

description: As a mixer, this clear, flavored rum should appeal to the vodka-tonic crowd. Look for a sugared berry scent and a juicy, mouthwatering raspberry flavor.
label: spirits_taster

description: Proceeds from this light-gold spiced rum benefit   Soles4Souls, an international shoe charity providing footwear to those in need. Flavors run to vanilla and clove, a fine match for tropical-style cocktails. The playful label sports a floral Hawaiian-shirt motif.
label: spirits_taster

description: This pale-gold spiced rum has sweet vanilla and cola aromas, with mild flavors of honey, cassia bark and clove. Mix with cola or fruit juice.
label: spirits_taster

description: Silvery and clear. Dry, delicate and mildly creamy in the initial sniffings; time in the glass allows other scents to emerge, especially wet grass, new leather and a fresh-off-the-still flowery perfume. Palate entry is stone-dry and minerally; at midpalate the flavor turns grainy sweet and a touch smoky. Aftertaste shows a bit of charcoal smokiness. So savory, maybe other Mexican distillers should begin thinking “vodka.”
label: spirits_taster

description: Visually appealing pale flax color. Bouquet offers seductive aromas of almonds, crushed violets, truffles and dark caramel at all nosing stages. Palate entry taste is focused on the fruit, which is more tropical (pineapple) than grape-like; midpalate experience is extraordinarily complex as flavors of black pepper, old oak, spirit, lead pencil and red fruit disarm the taste buds. Finishes dense, multilayered and medium-long. A textbook Cognac. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Chardonnay and Malvasia grapes. Delicate, crisp bouquet offers nuances of pomace, orange peel and clove. Understated taste at palate entry is elegantly grapey; midpalate showcases tastes of tropical fruits, in particular, citrus and pineapple. The refined, warming aftertaste shows genuine finesse.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose at opening is peppery, lean and fruity; aeration stimulates scents of vanilla bean, piquant spirit and oak. In the mouth, restrained, stately tastes of dried fruit and raisins delight the taste buds at entry; midpalate shows tastes of baked apple, sweet red pepper and light caramel. Finish is elegant, sweet and long. One of the more refined XOs in the marketplace.
label: spirits_taster

description: Luminous, golden nectar-like hue. Smells of nut meat and nut butter with equal parts of dried herbs. Creamy tastes of hazelnut and butter are featured at midpalate. Finish showcases hazelnut. Classy, focused and delectable. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pristine appearance. Lovely, clean and intense aroma of tangerine is full and squeaky tart in the first whiffs; aeration serves to bring out zesty, spot-on scents of lemon juice and lemon peel. In the mouth, the crisp, razor-edged lemon taste dominates from entry into midpalate. Finishes tangy, pleasantly tart and irresistibly fresh. A superb, prototypical flavored vodka. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Extremely pale yellow. Wonderfully alive in the nose, as subtle, woodsy scents of juniper, thyme and laurel make an impression. It's clean, dry and refreshing at palate entry; midpalate shows traces of citrus, pine and berries. Aftertaste is harmonious and medium-long. The finest dry vermouth money can buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Cola hue. Sensuous nose features ginger, prunes, sap and bark aromas. In the mouth, it's supple, sweet, winey and almost Sherry-like at entry, then at midpalate citrus and grape flavors appear. Finishes luscious and semisweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pale lemon-juice hue. Initial nosings detect musty, ripe fruit pomace aromas; aeration releases succulent scents of banana, peach and pear. Palate entry is ripe and sweet; midpalate shows concentrated pear, yellow-plum and white-raisin tastes. Aftertaste is full, moderately sweet and very long. Superbly satisfying and graceful.
label: spirits_taster

description: Mahogany color. Rich, semisweet nose is so ideally melded that no one attribute leaps out except for traces of cinnamon and cedar; an exquisite, mature Cognac bouquet of the top rank. Sweet, ripe and grapey at palate entry; midpalate is warming and oaky, with a healthy dose of rancio similar to wood resin and maple. Aftertaste is extended and fruity. A class act.
label: spirits_taster

description: Nose is divine in the first whiff, as evolved scents of fennel, anise and peanut butter impress the olfactory sense; later sniffings find the deep anise perfume enchanting. Beautifully balanced on the palate, with tantalizing, dry and sweet flavors of licorice. In my book, this intense thoroughbred runs rings around the category leaders.
label: spirits_taster

description: Goldenrod-orange color. Unique, sweet-sour bouquet of mandarin orange and a hint of Cognac. Supple, satiny on tongue; tastes of orange zest and sinewy Cognac; the alcohol-acid- fruit harmony is seamless. A timeless liqueur.
label: spirits_taster

description: The youngest eau-de-vie in this legendary blend is 50 years old. 100% Grande Champagne. Amber color. Harmonious, hallmark bouquet of blue cheese-like rancio, truffles, roasted chestnuts and prunes; the aroma stays firm and concentrated through 10 minutes of nosing. Accessible, satiny smooth at palate entry, then at midpalate the flavor profile turns semisweet, profound and pruny. Finishes gracefully, almost like a ghost on the tongue. Lovely.
label: spirits_taster

description: Extremely bright amber color. Scents of baked pears and oak; aeration releases additional aromas of vanilla and cinnamon; it's a sophisticated bouquet. Palate entry is slightly sweet; midpalate features oaky vanilla, ripe grapes and tropical fruit. Aftertaste is clean, lean, even austere.
label: spirits_taster

description: Part of this brandy's story is its luminous orange-honey color. Aromawise, Lepanto is almost Cognac-like in its grapey, piquant, generous but focused bouquet; it presents a very disciplined nose. The off-dry flavor brims with mellow fruit at entry and midpalate, then fades neatly into a tobacco leaf, tea leaf, tar-like finish that's off-dry and tight.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pretty burnished-orange hue. Generous opening bouquet emits scents of nougat and cake frosting; aeration stimulates deep aromas of dark caramel, roasted almonds, oloroso Sherry and rancio. In the mouth it tastes of white raisins, cake batter, orange rind and oak resin. Finishes manageably sweet. A gorgeous treat from Spain.
label: spirits_taster

description: No wallflower, this one. The intensity of the bouquet starts right with the pour as waves of prunes and raisins rise from the glass; air contact stirs deeper aromas, most notably orange rind, peppermint and roasted nuts. This rich, heavyweight brandy features layers of flavor, including cocoa, toffee, caramel, cream Sherry and oaky vanilla. Finishes as large and robust as it started.
label: spirits_taster

description: Dark copper color. Aroma is full, concentrated and oaky-resiny at first, then with aeration it expands and deepens, showing walnut, plum, pear and cheese-like rancio; a seamless bouquet. Palate entry is dry; midpalate highlights oak, toasted nuts, dried fruit, bittersweet chocolate and rancio. Finish is luxurious on the tongue, sweet and oaky.
label: spirits_taster

description: A sublime marriage of over 100 eaux-de-vie, some more than a century old. Amber/gold appearance. Textbook tête de cuvée Cognac bouquet of pine needles, clover honey, rancio, sweet oak and spiced apple. Offers elegant flavors of fatty rancio, soft cheese, wood smoke and bacon fat from entry through midpalate. Finishes more woody and resiny than fruity-ripe. Still a favorite after all these years. Gorgeous.
label: spirits_taster

description: Crystal-clear appearance. Full-throttle, aldehydic nose of grape must, freshly mown hay and cut flowers provides a rollicking, all-you-can-smell banquet of intense, fresh spring-garden fragrances. In the mouth, the highly concentrated, raisiny flavor is sweet right from the pour through the entire midpalate. Aftertaste is fruity and long. One of America's premier grappas.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pretty topaz color. Opening bouquet is round, assertive and pear- and nectarine-like; further air exposure unearths harmonious scents of quince, old oak and butter. Taste is polite, if reserved, showing sweet flavors of raisins and wood. Finish is sweet, warming and elegant. Owns a quiet power.
label: spirits_taster

description: Light amber hue. Nose is very softly perfumed. In the mouth, this delicate liqueur is manageably sweet and round, offering hints of yellow fruit and honey. Ideal for people who don't care for icky-sticky liqueurs.
label: spirits_taster

description: Deep copper hue. First nosings detect intensely acidic notes of orange peel; later whiffs are treated to chunky aromas of marzipan, candied orange rind, dried apricot and almond oil. Palate entry is heavy, syrupy; midpalate is pleasantly fruity, orange-like and sweet. Finishes long and thick.
label: spirits_taster

description: Straw-yellow color. Bouquet is dry, fruity and soft, with a trace of peach pit bitterness. On palate, the peach flavor is delicate, yet ripe; by midpalate, the ripe peach taste dominates. Aftertaste is fruity, but carries enough acidity to maintain crispness. Serve slightly chilled at 50°-55°F. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Hennessy XO Cognac (France; Schieffelin & Somerset, New York, NY); 40% abv, $150. The eaux-de-vie range in age from 10 to 70 years. Deep amber/chestnut brown hue. Nose is opulent, elegant and emits mature aromas of cheese-like rancio, black tea leaves, raisins and oak. In the mouth, this XO displays melded tastes of astringent oaky tannins, ripe grapes and toffee. Aftertaste offers parting sweet tastes of dark caramel and honey.
label: spirits_taster

description: Limpid and clean. The odd, atypical aroma of damp fabric and wet earth dominate all nosings. Comes alive in the mouth as juicy tastes of berries, black raisins and pears enchant the taste buds. Lovely, raisiny finish. Peculiar bouquet doesn't overshadow exuberant, sterling flavors and finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Amber color. Aroma begins with green apple and pear; aeration adds notes of wax, sunflower seed and cherry. Palate entry is tart and dry; midpalate is warming, mildly caramelized and nutty. Finishes lean, off-dry, showing hints of honey and oak resin. Only available in California.
label: spirits_taster

description: Very dark tawny tone. Heady perfume speaks of overripe grapes, quinine and roots. Agile, tar-like in the mouth as flavors of quinine, citrus peel, roots and berries combine in a piquant twang that's neither clumsy nor cloying. Finishes tasting of ripe oranges and pink grapefruit. Very nice with a splash of fresh-squeezed O.J.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pale yellow color. Offers unusual aromas of pear drop, banana and kiwi in the first passes; aeration stimulates reluctant scents of sunflower seeds, faint orange zest and grain mash. Flavor phase is strikingly rich, oily in texture, vanilla-like and fruity-sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Cherry-red color. Assertive bouquet of freshly picked grapes, black cherries, black raspberries, apricots and pepper keeps the olfactory sense focused. In the mouth, it behaves like a fat, chewy red from the sun-drenched south of France; tastes ambrosial and clean. Finishes short, mildly fruity and ripe. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial sniffs after the pour reveal supple, buttery, and piney aromas; more time allows a pleasant fruitiness to appear along with traces of vanilla and cedar. Palate entry is honey sweet and silky; by midpalate the backbone flavors are clearly the sweet grain andvanilla bean. Concludes warmly in the throat. An extremely pleasant malt. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first inhalations pick up reluctant odors of paraffin, roasted grain and malted milk; further aeration fails to extract anything more from the aroma. No worries, though as the palate entry is succulent, fruity, and sweet; at midpalate the fruit disappears and is replaced by a semisweet dark toffee/maple/sap flavor. Ends maple-like and muscular.
label: spirits_taster

description: (Linlithgow distillery, now closed, is more commonly known as St. Magdalene.) The initial nosings find soft scents of sweet malt, almonds and olives; aeration adds aromas of saddle leather and pork sausage. At palate entry toasted, toffee-like flavors override the mammoth alcohol; at midpalate the abv jumps in but a pleasant weed/grass-like taste extinguishes the heat. Finish includes flavors of fudge, dried figs and sultanas.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening nosing pass shows deft touches of caramel, honey and molasses. Palate entry is dry to off-dry and mildly honeyed; the midpalate is stately, medium-bodied and tastes of tar, tobacco, old oak and molasses. Aftertaste is long, bittersweet, brandy-like and tastes of dark caramel.
label: spirits_taster

description: A blend of Raynal French Brandy, French vodka and citrus flavorings. Sniffings detect citrus peel, a trace of oily vodka and a grapy/brandy character. Palate entry is firmly structured and juicy sweet; at midpalate, the brandy/vodka tag-team makes more of an effort to counter the citrusy surface taste. Aftertaste is mildly fruity and off-dry.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial aroma is of black pepper and steamed broccoli. Following aeration, a bouquet of succulent scents of Brazil nuts, egg cream and light oak resin appear. An oily flavor of bacon is apparent at palate entry; at midpalate the pepper returns with added tastes of spinach, sage and butter. Finishes elegantly yet zestily as the pepper comes to the fore. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is intensely minty and a touch herbal/woodsy. Palate entry is thick, sweet and very minty; the cinnamon comes on strong at midpalate. Delightful finish is very sweet but not ooey-gooey, long and more spicy than minty.
label: spirits_taster

description: Its tea leaf/toasty aroma is so emblematic of bacco, with scents of honey wheat toast, rubber pencil eraser and butterscotch. Palate is scrumptious, sweet, concentrated and intensely caramel-like; with traces of asparagus and green leaf vegetable. Finish is bittersweet, eggy and creamy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Ripe and succulent aromas of light toffee, baked apple, poached pear and honey. Palate is off-dry to sweet, very ripe and apple-like. Delicious finish is long, sweet, slightly honeyed.
label: spirits_taster

description: Amber/harvest gold color. Bouquet is decidedly grassy and woodsy in the first couple of whiffs; aeration unleashes intriguing scents of pine cone, lanolin, milk chocolate and oak resin. Palate entry is oily, buttery, fatty and utterly luscious; at midpalate, the taste of oaky, creamy fat and rich, oily feel go off the charts. Aftertaste continues the cream-a-thon and comes off tasting like nougat or, better, white chocolate. One of the two best Dallas Dhus I've evaluated since 1989.
label: spirits_taster

description: Autumnal gold/wheat field/honey color. Opening whiff unearths honey wheat toasted bread, light caramel and gently sweet malt; air contact unleashes attractive earthy/woodsy scents of pine, grass, sweet oak and a distant trace of sea breeze. Palate entry emits lightly toasted tastes of wheat bread, honey, fino sherry and oaky vanillin; by midpalate, a hint of lightly salty sea breeze enters the taste profile and beyond that there's an astringent underpinning flavor of wood resin. Aftertaste is medium-long, moderately sweet and composed. Vividly youthful despite its age.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromas are of almond butter, linseed oil, figs and dates; aeration allows more luxurious scents of honey, molasses and nutmeg to emerge and meld. Palate entry is long, sweet, woody and caramel-like; midpalate the flavor profile turns chewy in texture and sap-like in taste; finishes fudge-like and intense.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial whiffs emit delicate evidence of carnations, honeysuckle and nectarines; further aeration encourages scents of yellow plums and banana to emerge; a superb bouquet. Palate entry shows an unexpected trace of fire; at midpalate, the spirity warmth fades, leaving succulent tastes of honey, egg cream and light toffee. Finishes deliciously warm and elegant.
label: spirits_taster

description: Early on, oak, wood resin and glue are major contributing aroma factors; later, the wood intensity becomes dominant and takes on a touch of rancio. Palate offers honeyed tastes of dark caramel and brown sugar; oily tastes of cocoa butter, cream Sherry, dark chocolate and molasses inhabit the midpalate. Aftertaste is long, sap sweet and chewy. This brandy's dalliance with rancio makes the trip worthwhile.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is brawny, salty and lightly smoky; six more minutes of aeration see the aroma pick up hearty notes of peanut butter, baked apple and sea salt plus a deft touch of cigar tobacco. Tastes robust, briny and sweet; by midpalate, flavors of sweet grain, popcorn, quince and nougat provide plenty of textural and taste depth. Aftertaste is buttery and semisweet. Leagues away from the Jura 16 in style.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening whiffs provide ample evidence of the presence of both lemon and lime riding in tandem; the aroma fades noticeably in the extra minutes of aeration. Palate entry is seamless and attractive; the midpalate is especially savory as the lemon/lime duo comes off as crisp and tart. Aftertaste accents the tartness of the citrus without being astringent or harsh.
label: spirits_taster

description: A syrupy textured mixer comprised of liquid sucrose, lime juice, almond and clove essences and water—not to be consumed neat. Clove and lime juice on the nose. Thick and sweet on the palate, but the lime juice acts as the perfect balance for the high-octane liquid sucrose. Scores of applications in cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Vivacious, nimble aromas line up in rows of vanilla, spice and orange rind; aeration accentuates the mild citrus-zest element. At palate entry, it's velvety in texture and herbal, almost woody in flavor; traces of rancio are displayed at midpalate. Finish is long, satiny and bittersweet. Another Delamain jewel for the sophisticated imbiber.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aroma is reluctant at first, but then after a couple of minutes it breaks out, emitting dry, chewy scents of bacon fat, lanolin and palm oil. A cocoa-like taste greets the taste buds; by midpalate, the tastes include almond butter, walnuts and buttery rancio. Finishes well, with creamy tastes of candied nuts, nut butter and caramel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Spicy/peppery bouquet leaps from the glass; the second stage offers vivacious, biscuity scents of cookie batter, butterscotch and walnut. Palate entry is semisweet, warming and honeyed; at midpalate, the taste expands to include mint, light toffee, marshmallow and oloroso Sherry. Finishes in an assertive manner, offering tastes of honey, grapes and tropical fruit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Prickly, medicinal, but aromatic notes of brine, green olive and vinegar soften with aeration into a mildly sweet, moderately smoky/briny perfume that's salty, focused yet plentiful. Palate entry is beguiling and understated; the midpalate is compact, moderately smoky and tobacco-like. The lush texture supports lots of viscosity and natural oils. Aftertaste is long, lush, more sweet than smoky.
label: spirits_taster

description: First inhalations detect an easy, polite aroma that highlights sweet grain, bread crust and a trace of vanilla; aroma expands with exposure to air, affording the grain element to deepen. Palate entry is firm, sinewy and grainy sweet; the midpalate opens to include dark caramel, honey, vanilla bean and tobacco leaf. Aftertaste is warming, moderately sweet, caramel-like and almost biscuity.
label: spirits_taster

description: Scents include brown sugar, molasses, vanilla bean, ripe tropical fruit, marzipan, refined sugar and honey. Taste features intriguing, bittersweet tastes of black pepper, molasses, dark chocolate and palm oil. Finish is long, bittersweet and woody.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial aroma includes scents of treacle, spice and flower garden; further aeration brings out aromas of black pepper, cola nut, dried red fruit, and molasses. The palate entry is long and toffee-like; at midpalate honeyed, apple butter-like, and creamy flavors add zesty spice to the aftertaste.
label: spirits_taster

description: A solid, grainy vodka bouquet that includes scents of dry breakfast cereal, parchment along with dry odors of shale, minerals, cardboard and beans; The palate entry introduces a sweeter reflection of the grain-fiber-paper character; the midpalate adds bittersweet flavors of cocoa, coffee bean, sugar and sap. Concludes with a note of spirity warmth. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: First nosings find aromas of flowery, slightly sour spirit, later sniffings discover scents of banana, buttered popcorn and freshly sawn wood. Palate entry has a richly textured taste of creamy butter, canola oil, seaweed; midpalate features sweet butter, honey and light toffee tastes. Concludes on a grainy/malty/honey note. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet features a woody/piney aromatic surface with dry scents of grain and resin beneath. The palate entry has a flash of corny sweetness upfront, then a whisper of butterscotch; the midpalate is full-bodied, sweet, oily, clean, and maple-like. Concludes with sumptuous tastes of dark honey and marzipan.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers scents of thyme, tarmac and pepper. The palate entry is luscious and bittersweet; the midpalate stage is chock full of nougat, honey and dark chocolate tastes. Concludes sweet, medium-bodied, Sherried and honeyed. A true pleasure.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes detect notes of orchard fruit and beeswax with subtle traces of red apple, pears and pipe tobacco. The palate entry is loaded with rich, nut-like/nougaty tastes; at midpalate a rush of sweetened tobacco quickly gives way to flavors of dark caramel, honey and oaky vanilla. Finishes with a flurry of caramel, marzipan and nougat notes.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pleasing vanilla bean bouquet. At palate entry the sweet vanilla bean flavor maintains its focus; at midpalate the taste turns crisp and properly acidic as the flavor profile goes from moderately sweet to bittersweet and beany. Finishes in a satiny texture and a rich, vanilla bean taste. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening sniffings pick up delicate, mineral-like scents of lead pencil, wet slate and black pepper; aeration releases an almost fruity aroma. Palate entry is round and textured; at midpalate, there are bittersweet tastes of cocoa, stone and charcoal. Finish features the ash-like charcoal.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aroma displays a round, gently sweet ripeness of red cherries. Palate entry is ripe, concentrated and accurately fruity; by midpalate, the taste profile is sweeter than the bouquet. Aftertaste is jammy.
label: spirits_taster

description: This curious bouquet starts out seductively fruity, but time in the glass adds zesty, off-dry notes. Palate is mineral-like and dry, with the sweet taste of honey. Aftertaste is minerally, lean and mildly honeyed.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial nosing pass detects toasty scents of ripe tropical fruit and toasted honey wheat bread; exotic fragrances of dried fruit overcome the burnt, toasty fragrance following aeration. Palate entry is engagingly sweet and sap-like; at midpalate there's a pleasing coming together
label: spirits_taster

description: First whiffs are treated to fruity/spicy scents of yellow fruit and green peppercorn; over time, the aroma bears down on the wood resin, leather and vanilla bean components. Palate entry is off-dry; at midpalate, the overriding flavor turns out to be lean and woody, oaky and leathery. Aftertaste shows a touch of oil.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sickly sweet pineapple scent dominates. The orangy/tropical fruit flavor doesn't disappoint in terms of offering sweet and fruity taste. Drinkable and tasty.
label: spirits_taster

description: Whiffs detect mature, oily/buttery scents of almond butter and oleo margarine followed by delicate traces of oak resin, pepper, palm oil and oloroso Sherry. Palate is succulent and honeyed, turning oily in texture and honey/Sherry-like. Aftertaste is long and toffee-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: From the opening whiff, this bouquet offers scents of corn-on-the-cob, spice and light caramel—a genuinely lovely, if restrained Bourbon bouquet. Palate entry flares with fiery spirit on the tip of the tongue, then settles down at midpalate as the taste profile turns lean, resiny, even a tad candied at the end. Finishes austere, medium-sweet and short.
label: spirits_taster

description: An elegant vanilla-like oakiness nicely complements the fruit, spirit, and natural acids found in the aroma. The palate entry is gently sweet and ripe; at midpalate the taste profile turns mildly oaky and honeyed. The aftertaste is full, smooth, satiny, and pleasingly tart. Weird, but good.
label: spirits_taster

description: The strange but pleasant bouquet finds grapy/viney aromas with aromas of glue, gum, solvent and marshmallow. The palate entry is intensely viny, leafy, vegetal and off-dry; at midpalate the flavor is remarkably sappy, semisweet and slightly honeyed. Finishes clean, ripe, grapy and satisfyingly rustic.
label: spirits_taster

description: The delightful aroma is ripe, juicy, grapy, and reminiscent of orange blossoms. The raw palate entry is viny and leafy; the midpalate offers simple tastes of orange rind and grapes that redeem the astringent entry. The aftertaste is plump, juicy and semisweet. Simple, but good.
label: spirits_taster

description: Eight malts from Caol Ila, Laphroaig, Bunnahabhain, Highland Park, Ledaig and Bowmore. The salty perfume in the initial whiffs is moderately smoky; further aeration adds ashes, tobacco leaf, and kippers. Palate entry offers tastes of mild iodine, pipe smoke and sweet oak; at midpalate the flavor profile features ample amounts of peatiness and smoke. Finishes salty, smoky and elegantly sweet and pruny.
label: spirits_taster

description: Nosings are all about parsley, sage and thyme; later whiffs pick up more vegetal/rooty scents like fennel, ginger, and rhubarb. Palate entry highlights the leafy tastes of freshly cut herbs and ginger plus a pleasantly sugary base flavor. Finishes warm, tangy and herbal.
label: spirits_taster

description: The fruity bouquet foists plump aromas of sweetened coconut and bubble gum sugar onto the olfactory sense. Taste is all coconut with nary a trace of rum at first, then the midpalate turns rich, creamy, properly sweet. It ends as it began, with coconut flavor ruling the roost.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma displays nut-like, nougaty scents mixed with resiny traces of grain husk and oak. Palate entry is sweet and biscuity, with traces of cocoa and vanilla bean; at midpalate, the taste features round, oaky, even buttery flavors of sherry, milk chocolate and honey. Finishes well in a medium-rich, creamy fashion.
label: spirits_taster

description: The start-up aroma is green, lean and astringent; aeration softens the astringency by bringing in more of the oak, which imparts aromas of resin, grain, new leather and vanillin. The taste profile is heathery and slightly peaty/smoky.
label: spirits_taster

description: The zesty, ripe berry aroma jumps from the glass in the first nosing passes. The palate entry is soft, piquant, acidic and tart; at midpalate the cranberry once again rushes to the forefront. Finishes nicely tart, yet ripe and engaging.
label: spirits_taster

description: The appearance is of pink lemonade. The opening inhalations find appealing, tart grapefruit pulp, waxy Crayola crayon notes. Palate entry is nicely tart, nearly sour, and appropriately acidic; at midpalate the fruit takes a backseat to the spirit, making for pleasing quaffing. Finishes fruity and light. Nice job.
label: spirits_taster

description: Cobalt blue appearance. The initial nosing passes locate very little in the way of oranges; following aeration scents of tart, acidic oranges peek out. Palate entry is sweet and mildly orangy; at midpalate the sugary sweetness almost overtakes the piquant orange flavor. Aftertaste is long, sweet and moderately orangy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The crisp, undeniable perfume of curaçao oranges leaps from the glass; aeration doesn't particularly affect this liqueur one way or the other. Palate entry is tart, sour and pleasantly orangy; at midpalate there's a major thrust towards orange zest and dried rind. Ends sharp, delectably tart and concentrated.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is late-developing and emits savory, if reined-in, smells of red fruit, grain and milk chocolate. The palate entry is smooth and toffee-like; at midpalate the taste is of semisweet to bittersweet flavors of caramel corn, chocolate-covered raisins and honey. Finishes warm and fruity. A very different blended Scotch.
label: spirits_taster

description: The lively brine and pepper opening aroma is zesty and a little smoked; later sniffings detect kippers, green olives, steamed asparagus, light caramel and a trace of honey. The palate entry is delicately sweet and honeyed; at midpalate the oak influence shows in the forms of vanilla and maple. Concludes classy, smooth and gently sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: A delicate, ripe grape and blueberry-like aroma. The palate entry is fine, vinous, and off-dry; at midpalate the taste of ripe grapes dominates. Ends up light, off-dry to bitter, and appropriately fruity.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is melony and banana-like. The palate entry is smooth, satiny, and properly fruity; at midpalate the taste goes sweeter and considerably more melon-like with a flash of spirity heat. Finishes spirity, fruity, and refreshing.
label: spirits_taster

description: First aromatic impression is of a florist shop, so fresh, vivid and floral is the redesigned bouquet; later sniffings detect delicate, more herbal-botanical notes of lemon peel, juniper berries, coriander and orris root. Palate entry displays a fine, off-dry, bean-like quality; at midpalate the flavor profile features the lavender and the off-dry grain. Finishes smooth, airtight and flowery.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial whiffs offer zesty scents of orange peel, coriander and fresh herbs; later inhalations detect subtle aromas, including cucumber, cilantro, parsley, orris and thyme. Palate entry is woolly-textured, off-dry and intensely herbal; at midpalate, the flavor turns sweet, cucumber-like, licorice, and salad greens-like. Finishes well, with an oily texture and an orange peel prominence.
label: spirits_taster

description: Nosing passes pick up earthy/woodsy scents of damp soil, vegetation, rubber pencil eraser, uncooked broccoli, mushrooms, and lead pencil. Palate entry is semisweet, intensely herbal, and very pleasurable; at midpalate the surface sweetness doesn't get in the way of the earthy/musky and spirity foundation flavors. Finishes sweet, very vegetal and herbal.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening inhalations offer nicely fresh, grape pomace mustiness; following another seven minutes of aeration, the bouquet becomes intensely grapy and ripe, but with enough of an acidic  foundation to remain fresh and clean. Palate entry is concentrated, grapy and medium-sweet; at midpalate the flavor turns decidedly sweet and ripe. Concludes with a burst of spirity warmth.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening aroma is light, grassy, green-tomato-like, and herbal; then the bouquet becomes assertive with scents of tar, cellophane, pine, dry malt and pork rind. At palate entry, the texture goes creamy and the taste turns peppery; at midpalate a sweetish flavor of mead dominates. Ends treacle-like and honeyed. Add mineral water to cut the fiery alcohol.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening nosing passes detect subtle traces of malted milk and honey; aeration unleashes deeper scents of vanilla extract, seared bourbon oak, maple and ash. The palate entry is semisweet, light toffee-like and spirity warm; at midpalate there's a burst of spirit, then that subsides, leaving behind toast, honey and wheat-bread flavors. Finishes malty and sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged five years, this “Western whiskey” has a mellow vanilla and oak aroma. The drying palate echoes the vanilla and oak, plus a violet note on the finish followed by spicy cinnamon, cayenne and black pepper heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged a minimum of two years, look for a honey hue and sweet aroma that suggests baked apple and coconut. The palate is light, lean and drying, with a slightly beer-like presence, including a bitter edge that suggests hops and a suggestion of effervescence on the spiced finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged six months, this honey-hued whisky (yes, that's how they spell it; not “whiskey” as most American producers do) has a vanilla and oak scent and sprightly palate showing vanilla and a mild floral note. It finishes long and drying, with plenty of nutmeg, cinnamon and white pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with New York state-grown rye and aged for more than two years, look for a deep amber hue and brisk, oaky scent. This small-batch rye is woody up front, finishing on drying walnut and baking spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: The zingy scent layers vanilla with with herbaceous, grassy notes. The palate suggests honey woven with fresh herbs and pineapple, creating an almost mezcal-like flavor profile, finishing with cedar, ginger and cinnamon.
label: spirits_taster

description: This whiskey is made with 80% Hazlet rye and other grains grown by the distiller on the family farm, and finished in sherry and cognac casks. Look for a relatively dark flavor profile, with oak, baked pear and vanilla -fishing long with molasses, dried cherry, allspice and clove. Mix into Manhattans or rye Old Fashioneds.
label: spirits_taster

description: What sets this rye apart from others is that it's finished in a former applejack barrel (the distillery also makes applejack). The aroma features honey, vanilla and oak. There's a flash of sweetness on the palate, which segues into oak, resin and a spiced finish with plenty of clove heat and alcohol sting.
label: spirits_taster

description: One of the very few whiskies made with green malt (not kilned malt) grown in the Hudson Valley and distilled using heritage techniques, then aged seven months. All this yields a bright, lean whiskey with a lively fruitiness, evoking banana and fresh pear overlaid with honey and vanilla, finishing with an earthy, herbaceous tang.
label: spirits_taster

description: This small-batch rye is aged one year, yielding oak and vanilla aromas and a drying flavor profile with walnut and oak, fading to vanilla and faint hints of banana and spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: It almost doesn't seem fair to stack up this “extra añejo” rum against barely-aged counterparts. This is the Cadillac of white rums, one of the few suitable to keep as a standalone sipper. Look for silky smoothness and pure, concentrated sugarcane flavor that mellows into accents of brown sugar, -caramel and baking spice on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged 10 years, this luscious sipper has an amber hue and mellow vanilla scent. Velvety on the palate, look for concentrated notes of vanilla, maple and caramel, which linger into the spicy finish that's accented by black pepper, cayenne and clove.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with rums from Jamaica, Barbados and Trinidad, and blended in France by Cognac Ferrand, this pleasing white rum offers a mild aroma like a grassy breeze and a smooth, slightly viscous texture. A lightly sweet coconut flavor morphs into vanilla, candied lemon peel and cinnamon sparks on the warming finish. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: This bold, unusual rum calls for tropical drinks at first sniff. The enticing aroma mixes juicy orange, cocoa, marshmallow and an earthy note reminiscent of mezcal. Look for mild sweetness and a fair amount of alcohol bite. It's made using sugar and molasses from Louisiana, one of the few U.S. states that grows sugarcane.
label: spirits_taster

description: Milky white and scented with coconut, this liqueur is sweet and creamy on the palate, with plenty of coconut flavor. It's not as thick as some other cream liqueurs, which makes it relatively easy drinking. Ideal for mixing into piña colada-style drinks in place of coconut cream.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aptly named, this rum is tiki-drink ready, for sure. It leads with a pungent banana aroma and distinct tropical fruit flavors—banana, mango, touches of lychee and coconut—with ginger and nutmeg sparks on the finish. It's not infused with fruit, but all those flavors may have you wondering.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a bold, fruity and floral profile. A delicate lychee note comes forward and mingles with mouthwatering pineapple and rosewater flavors. The drying, lip-smacking finish also brings a gentle waft of marshmallow sweetness.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged seven years, this honey-hued rum has an enticing vanilla-maple scent and velvety feel. Vanilla, maple and oak glide smoothly into the baking spice-flavored finish. -Versatile for sipping or mixing, this is a solid choice for any home bar; try it in a rum old fashioned.
label: spirits_taster

description: Smooth and mildly sweet, this rum has a pronounced vanilla note, tapering off to a gentle marshmallow fade followed by a hint of white pepper heat. It's made using a “double aging process”—rums aged for at least one year are blended and then returned to white oak barrels for an additional three months.
label: spirits_taster

description: Though it's made in the U.S.—not Martinique—this small-batch rum is reminiscent of a super-light rhum agricole, from the slightly funky ripe banana scent to mellow grassiness on the palate, which finishes with a fiery -cayenne flicker.
label: spirits_taster

description: This rum has a pale straw tinge and very mild scents of marshmallow and coconut. Silky and soft on the palate, look for hints of pineapple and coconut braced by ginger and white pepper sparks. Recommended for tropical drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: This spiced rum has a nut-brown appearance and bold coffee aroma, with hints of chocolate and toffee underneath. At first, it's campfire-smoky on the palate, showing coffee and vanilla on the midpalate, then fading to a smoky finish laced with clove, black pepper and nutmeg. Made with Colombian coffee beans, vanilla, fenugreek and a “smoked American hardwood tincture.”
label: spirits_taster

description: Relatively neutral overall, this rum shows subtle marshmallow and charcoal character, finishing crisp and dry, alongside hits of ginger and black pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: This cocktail-friendly white rum is neutral overall, with a faint citrusy aroma and a relatively dry, crisp profile that finishes with plenty of white pepper heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Ideal for mojitos and other cocktails, look for tropical fruit pungency and a grassy finish, all warmed by a sprinkle of baking spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: The perfumed aroma mixes tropical fruit and floral notes. The palate is fresh and complex, offering lychee, violet and white floral tones that lead into accents of banana, vanilla and ginger on the clean, crisp finish. Cocktail friendly.
label: spirits_taster

description: Packaged in a hefty, heavy bottle shaped like a cannon ball—a bit awkward to hold and pour—the liquid is amber-orange and has pleasing caramel and orange peel scents. It sips relatively sweet and viscous, with a warming, spicy finish of cinnamon and allspice. Overall, it's almost liqueur-like and goes down easy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for wafts of sugarcane and tropical fruit on the nose. The palate is light, with gentle sweetness, rounded tropical-fruit flavors and a mild floral lilt, finishing with a white pepper accent.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from Florida sugar—one of the few U.S. states to grow sugarcane—look for a pale straw hue and an earthy, grassy scent. A mild but distinctly coconut flavor leads from start to the spiced, drying, relatively hot finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged less than six months in former malt-whiskey barrels, this golden rum has a luscious vanilla scent followed by honey and oak notes on the palate. The finish is dry, with attractive hints of baking spice. Mix this into rum highballs with ginger ale or soda water.
label: spirits_taster

description: This honey-hued rum mixes vanilla, oak and floral notes in the bouquet. Relatively light on the palate, look for an oaky flavor, lightened by vanilla and a fleeting floral touch on the hot finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening the aromatic phase is a pleasingly languid grapy/vinous scent, followed by more focused scents of lead pencil, ripe grapes and grape skins. Palate entry is a tad hot, but dry and like dried tropical fruit; at midpalate there's the lead pencil aspect once again as well as tastes of prunes and dates. Concludes warm, metallic and just a bit grapy.
label: spirits_taster

description: A clean but dull aroma. The palate entry is pleasantly grainy, uncomplicated, and candy sweet; at midpalate there's a firm thrust of dark caramel fudge but that's it. Ends up moderately tasty, very sweet and candied.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial whiffs detect delicately sweet aromatic notes; exposure to air unleashes more substantial aromas of corn husk, pine and oak. The palate entry is concentrated, corn syrup-like, and nearly fruity; at midpalate the flavor turns astringent and slightly biting. Finishes rambunctiously, fruity and spirity. A tad too raw for me to recommend.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aggressive aroma of strawberry jam scent. The bittersweet, juicy palate entry isn't subtle but is neither syrupy nor cloying; at midpalate the flavor turns astringent and stunningly steely-metallic. Finishes on a disappointing metal note that eclipses the robust fruit component.
label: spirits_taster

description: Rather meek aromas of dark caramel, old oak and sweet grain fall short of the mark. Palate entry shows some assertiveness; at midpalate this whisky awakens, offering opulent, textured, semi-dry tastes of oak, cereal grain, oatmeal. Aftertaste is more grainy than woody.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening bouquet is aggressive, malty and deeply grainy; after another seven minutes I note dried aromas of Christmas spice, dates, white raisins, and shoe polish. Palate entry is spirity and fresh; the midpalate flavor is zesty, woody/resiny, dry and astringent, then fades. Finishes with unbridled tastes of resin, grain husk, and raw heady spirit.
label: spirits_taster

description: The fruity bouquet wastes no time exposing the melon and mango components; later nosings reveal a trace of spirit. Palate entry is more tart and acidic than sweet or ripe; the midpalate phase is less fruity and more spirity. Ends neither sweet nor sour, just a bit fruity.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial aroma of vinyl and prickly spirit. The palate entry finds semisweet tastes of dried pineapple and mince pie; at midpalate there's a sense of a typical Highland Park maltiness/creaminess, but the rest of the phase has very little depth. Finishes mildly sweet but flabby.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial sniffings highlight scents of pine cones, cedar, green tomatoes and green vegetables; aeration introduces a spirity aroma of moss and dirt. Palate entry is more focused than the aroma; at midpalate the texture turns creamy and rich while the sweet, cake-like flavor is overshadowed by the alcohol. Ends sweet, piney and resiny.
label: spirits_taster

description: Flavors are mildly sweet/sour and delicate;. with light caramel, baked apple, tea leaves and fruit acid. Aftertaste is brief, so understated as to be hard to define.
label: spirits_taster

description: Burnt copper/tawny color, crowned by a frothy, tan head. I have to hunt for the nose after the pour as it comes off muted and distant; several more minutes in the glass allows it to awaken a little as it gives off stifled scents of malt, hops, nuts and dried fruit. Initial taste is nutty and stone dry; the midpalate is lean, dry and keenly astringent. Aftertaste is confined, one dimensional, bitter and common. Drinkable, but unexceptional in light of so many other solid British ales.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bouquet hints at vanilla bean, tobacco leaf and mild honey. Taste is simple, candy-sweet and marshmallow, with no depth or scope. Aftertaste is predictably sweet and common.
label: spirits_taster

description: Following aeration, the bouquet offers toasty notes of tobacco leaf, baked apple, baked pear and sweet oak. Taste is sweet and intensely honeyed at first, then turns too concentrated and sweet in the finish. Almost a liqueur, which is not a compliment.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aroma makes a good showing following aeration as succulent, scents of almonds, toasty oak, lanolin, light toffee and paraffin entice the olfactory sense. Flavor is overly sweet and honey-like; the sweetness clobbers the taste buds into submission.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromas take time to rev up; following seven minutes of air contact, the dormant bouquet begins to emit muted scents that include breakfast cereal, light toffee and grapes. Palate entry is moderately oily, sharp, astringent and cereal-like; by midpalate, there's more integrated, bittersweet flavors of old wood and oak resin, but also boiled cabbage, tired peat and deep-roasted malt. Concludes bitterly and hot in an astringent, resiny fashion.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening nose is pleasingly, sharply spicy, then the aroma becomes metallic and raw egg-like. Palate entry is meek, bland and more milky than creamy; by midpalate, the taste profile presents a more harmonious, creamy, lightly spiced and milk chocolate face
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromatic notes of rubber pencil eraser, marshmallow and tropical fruit greet the olfactory sense after the pour; a directionless, featureless aroma. Palate entry does a minor salvage job on behalf of the aroma as toasty, creamy flavors please the taste buds. Ends up warm, smoky and creamy.
label: spirits_taster

description: First inhalations discover plump, slightly spiced aromas; after aeration mild scents of resin, marshmallow and soft cheese emerge. Palate entry is sweet, fruity and lean; at midpalate the taste profile turns a tad hot and acidic, losing its fresh, fruity early characteristics. Has some good points early on that disappear in the aftertaste.
label: spirits_taster

description: An inexpressive aroma. The palate entry is firm, dry and cereally, if somewhat nondescript; at midpalate the flavor profile turns to old leather and roast meat —very uncharacteristic for Rosebank. The finish shows a bit of flash and pepper, then fades.
label: spirits_taster

description: Lovely harvest gold/topaz color. The first whiffs encounter sweet, maple-like aromas; later inhalations detect dark caramel, honey and vanilla extract. The palate entry is sweet, corny and honey-like; at midpalate the sweetness accelerates into a cotton candy, nougat, candy bar effect that's surprisingly palatable. Finishes caramel sweet but simple. Too sweet but good for whisky cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma gives off buttery/fat scents of roast pork and cream. The palate entry is assertive, moderately chewy and nutty; the midpalate stage owns a keen astringency that undercuts much of the pleasing fat nuttiness found in the entry. Concludes uninteresting, totally dry and only mildly nutty.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosings detect electrical-type smoke; more air contact turns the smoke into sulphur/burnt matchstick and seed/bean/pod, with no hint of grapes/fruit. The palate entry is firm, lean, and just a shade grapy; at midpalate the taste turns woodsy with resiny/pod-like flavors. Ends seedy/pulpy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bouquet includes subtle notes of road tar, white pepper and just-harvested green agave with nuances of palm oil and sage. The palate entry is off-dry, spicy, and vegetal; at midpalate the taste profile turns surprisingly astringent and lean, ending up on flax-like note.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening aroma doesn't have the stoutness of Jim Beam Bourbons and therefore seems timid; air contact unleashes mild notes of melon, nuts, and woody resin. Palate entry is mildly spiced and grainy sweet, but simple; at midpalate the flavor profile displays more thrust and grainy presence. Finishes sweet, drinkable and easy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is subdued, peppery and eggy. Tastes totally different from how it smells; the palate entry is intensely spirity, even heady in its alcohol rush; in the midpalate stage heightened tastes of prickly pear, white pepper, and refined sugar make entrances. Finishes meekly and only mildly sweet. Too uneven for its own good.
label: spirits_taster

description: The pickle and olive brine opening aroma is sour, cat pee-like, and bracing, then becomes vinegar-like and ultrasour. The palate entry is sweet and sour, baked, and intensely green olive-like; at midpalate a pinched sweetness enters the flavor profile, mirroring the base material. Finishes sweet and sour, pineapple-like and long.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first sniffings find toasty notes of charcoal and minerals more than botanicals; later inhalations following aeration stir glimpses of fabric, hemp and butter. The palate entry is firm, moderately sweet and nearly plump; at midpalate the taste profile turns a bit drier, if a touch fruity. Ends up uncomplicated and grainy sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Palate entry shows a moderately plump, sweet, grainy taste with little depth; the midpalate is acceptable, but neither silky nor oily. Finish is its best phase, offering ripe juniper berries, coriander and spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first sniffs find soft, leathery notes of light toffee and oaky vanilla; after aeration the bouquet diminishes into a lightly smoked/burnt grain aroma. The palate entry is nicely baked and oven toasty; by midpalate there are traces of cocoa, nut paste and oatmeal. Ends fatigued and spent.
label: spirits_taster

description: The melon scent in the opening bouquet is firm, fresh and pleasantly melon-like. Palate entry is soft, melony, alluring and ripe; at midpalate the taste turns metallic/industrial, losing the melon focus. Ends tinny to the taste.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose displays robust notes of caramel, molasses and oaky vanilla, with subtle traces of nutmeg, rubber and cinnamon. The palate entry is toasty, brown sugar-sweet and slightly honeyed; at midpalate the flavor turns more candied, marzipan-like and even treacle-like. Finishes silky smooth, concentrated and sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers scents of linseed oil and vegetal, leathery, sap-like aromas. The first burst of sugarcane sweetness emerges at palate entry; the midpalate is caney sweet and medium-bodied, with enough notes of oil and spice to make it easily recommendable. Finishes grassy, semisweet and spirity.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find delicate notes of earthy, rooty ginger. The palate entry is marked by a strong ginger-root flavor; the midpalate is sprightly, nearly prickly and warming, and correctly spicy and gingery, even earthy or soil-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: A mixto base of agave and neutral spirits. The pleasing citrusy fragrance is rife with lime rind and tangerine juice with a base of agave. The palate entry bursts with authentic lime peel tartness; the midpalate is zesty, peel-like with an agave thrust.
label: spirits_taster

description: The texture is like a thick milkshake, color is chocolate milk-like. The aroma offers milk, yogurt, mild orchard fruit, and herb notes. The palate entry is thick as runny yogurt and tastes of milk and pears; at midpalate the Poire Williams taste is showcased and becomes luscious and moderately sweet. Finishes viscous, pleasantly fruity, and creamy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosing passes pick up fruity, cheesy scents of pineapple and cottage cheese; aeration stimulates an all-dairy bouquet with hints of cinnamon and rubber pencil-eraser odors. The palate entry is pleasantly creamy and spiced; at midpalate the cinnamon taste overwhelms the cream and spirit. The finish is long, creamy and vibrant.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers integrated scents of roasted chestnut, dried tobacco leaf, maple, orange zest, brown sugar, cinnamon and egg cream. The palate entry is curiously medicinal; the midpalate improves as the taste includes bittersweet flavors of old oak, wood resin, molasses and tree sap. Concludes intensely sap- and maple-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet consists of layers of dark chocolate, bitterness, cake frosting and malted grain. The palate entry is a touch hot, concentrated and properly beany; the midpalate offers pleasant, semisweet dark-chocolaty.
label: spirits_taster

description: The palate entry is smooth, intensely vanilla- and cocoa-bean-like, sugar caney and bittersweet; the midpalate is moderately oily and buttery.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is buttery and vanilla-like, with slight traces of cinnamon, rubber pencil-eraser and nut paste. The palate entry offers pleasant, lean bittersweet flavors of nougat and caramel; the midpalate sees the addition of spicy oak, cocoa and fruit stone. Ends up spry but bittersweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The agave foundation is buried under aromas of oak extract, vanilla and dark caramel. The palate entry is concentrated and sweet, with no natural agave herbaceousness; the midpalate mirrors the manufactured sweetness of the entry. Finishes warm, woody and smoky-sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet degrades with air contact although the first sniffs detected light scents of pine sap and clove. The palate entry is green, acidic, waxy, and moderately vegetal and briny; the midpalate offers some customary elements of pepper, green vegetable, and minerals, but no fennel, no dill, no herbs. Finishes with a big rush of pine or cedar.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma features a faint orange-pulp aroma. The palate entry offers only timid bitter-sweetness and astringency; at midpalate the orange flavoring dominates any sense of agave. Decent, drinkable, but entirely average.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes discover seductive aromas of hazelnut, butterscotch, spice cake, pipe tobacco and honey. The palate entry offers succulent flavors of toasted bread, blueberries and light toffee; the midpalate features delightful tastes of brown sugar, cocoa, butterscotch, lychee, oak, vanilla, rancio, nougat and black plum. Concludes with elegance and grace. One of my favorite cognacs.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers intriguing flax/wax and grainy/bakery odors. The palate entry is oaky sweet, minerally and roasted; the midpalate offers sap-like, semisweet tastes of honey, cane syrup, cocoa and tobacco leaf. Finishes with vitality as the sweet notes turn honeyed. A blockbuster that defines straight rye whisky.
label: spirits_taster

description: The sensational bouquet is jam-packed with ripe and baked fruit and toasted oak scents of chocolate and cocoa. Palate entry is intensely honeyed and properly woody; at midpalate the harmonious flavors include fruit pastry, oaky vanilla, marshmallow, pine nuts and marzipan. Finishes firm, long, full bodied and caramel sweet. A fantastic brandy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is toasty and jammy; following aeration the aroma turns spirity, mildly prickly and grapy/pear-like. The palate entry is biscuity/bakery-like and rich; the midpalate showcases the balance between the candy bar sweetness, the sweet oak, the alcohol, and the dried fruit ripeness. Finishes a tad raw.
label: spirits_taster

description: The peculiar bouquet emits concentrated baked tar odors with vague nut- and carnival candy-like aromas. The palate entry offers big, oily textured flavors of oak resin, sap and maple; the midpalate is chocolaty in its bittersweetness. Finishes on a semisweet maple note. A strange, idiosyncratic creature that's oddly compelling, even luscious.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet features multilayered scents of baked pear/apple pastry, walnut, roasted chestnut and maple. The palate entry is firm, semisweet, oaky, and spicy; the midpalate is well-balanced, sweet, oaky and compellingly baked, with finishing touches of rancio, hard cheese and caramel. Finishes elegantly and lushly, with final parting tastes of pepper and brown sugar.
label: spirits_taster

description: The dominant aromatic feature is caramel. The palate entry features the cream/dairy element as much as caramel and nuts; the midpalate highlights the cream, the caramel flavoring, the spirit and the gentle spice. Concludes smooth, satiny and properly creamy with greater emphasis on the spice than the caramel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Intensely woody aromas and succulent marshmallow, bakery and lanolin scents spring forth. The fat palate entry oozes butter cream, dark caramel, and brown sugar tastes; the midpalate focuses more on the grain aspect as the flavor becomes toasty, fruity and honeyed. Ends honey sweet, decadent and maple-like. An unbelievable bargain.
label: spirits_taster

description: The vibrant aromas offers spicy/bakery odors of banana bread, baking spices, fruit stone, old oak, worn leather and dates. The palate entry finds flavors of nut paste and butter sautéed almonds; the midpalate is buttery, bacon fat-like and meaty. The finish shows budding rancio, soft cheese and maple.
label: spirits_taster

description: A leafy spearmint perfume leaps from the glass in the nosing stages. The palate entry is refreshingly minty, creamy and mildly chocolaty; the midpalate features the mint/chocolate flavoring without eclipsing the cream and the spice. Finishes gracefully, silkily and smooth.
label: spirits_taster

description: Fruity scents of baked banana, spiced apple and dry, kernel- and cereal-like grain element; palate entry is semisweet, oaky, concentrated, grainy and smooth; the midpalate mirrors the entry with emphasis on the oak. Finishes elegantly, with a bittersweet dash of vanilla bean.
label: spirits_taster

description: The animated bouquet features pine, figs, white raisins and fresh oak. The palate entry features tastes of resin, black pepper and butter; the dry midpalate stage is full bodied, oily, spirity in a minor way, and mildly honeyed. Concludes toasty/roasted, tobacco-like and semisweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes detect engagingly tart aromas of passionfruit with traces of tangerine. The palate entry is frisky, tart, light and wonderfully fruity; the midpalate phase is juicier than the entry and seems fuller in the mouth. Refreshing and very pleasant because it retains the natural fruity tartness.
label: spirits_taster

description: The hollow bouquet emits only fey scents of vines and green vegetation. The palate entry is very sweet, nearly syrupy; the midpalate is the best phase as rounded flavors of dark toffee, nougat, and maple work nicely together. Finishes sweet, sap-like, and acceptably woody.
label: spirits_taster

description: A one dimensional bouquet features reluctant scents of grapes and dates. The palate entry is aggressively sweet and oaky; the midpalate is a little more balanced as the oak becomes more of a participant. Ends up seriously sweet, sticky, and far too sugary.
label: spirits_taster

description: Extra-aged Green Chartreuse. Aromas are keenly botanical and vegetal/woodsy. The palate shows peppermint, citrus peel, and sage along with the herbs and botanicals. Concludes with finesse and power.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromas feature plums, red berries, raisins, cherry preserves and poppy seed. The palate entry is sleek and woody sweet; the midpalate finds flavors of pipe tobacco, marzipan, dark caramel, fudge and chocolate orange. Finishes stately yet vivacious. Find and buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The backstory to this vodka is that it's made from grain, and it's finished with spring water from a glacier in the shadows of Mount Ranier. Rain City has a distinct earthiness, but it's also lightly sweet, and has a spicy ginger note on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Play off of this vodka's naturally fruity-sweet aroma by mixing it into fruity flavored cocktails. On the palate, it shows crisp and citrusy notes at first, then fades into a long, sweet finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This potato vodka is distilled and blended with water from an arctic glacier. It's neutral and mild, with a fleeting touch of bitterness on the finish. Enjoyable mixed into fruity cocktails, and a good value for the price.
label: spirits_taster

description: Powerful and voluptuous, this topaz-hued beauty features warm vanilla, cinnamon and concentrated fruit. Full bodied and weighty on the tongue, the long, spicy finish may remind some of mulled apple cider—except this is the real deal. Made with a blend of Calvados aged from 8–40 years.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first rollout in Jim Beam's premium Signature Craft series, this Bourbon is finished with Spanish brandy and aged in Bourbon barrels. It's delicious; dried fruit, vanilla and praline notes are chased by a long finish that winds into ginger and cinnamon. It grows richer and fruiter the longer it's allowed to open in the glass.
label: spirits_taster

description: There's no mistaking that this is a warm and welcoming product distilled from apples—a pleasing, authentic apple aroma wafts out of the glass, along with a light floral note. Caramel and gingerbread spice coat the palate on the rounded finish, suggesting tarte tatin. Mellow and sippable, this would be outstanding in fall-accented cocktails. Even the rounded bottle shape suggests an apple.
label: spirits_taster

description: This unique newcomer—a French single-malt whisky finished in used Cognac barrels—tastes like a soft, golden Speyside Scotch with a little something extra. Honey, apricot and crème brûlée kick into a spicy ginger and black pepper finish and a gentle puff of smoke.
label: spirits_taster

description: Spicy and refreshing, this bright golden-orange brandy shows thick caramel and dried fruit upfront, but ends on a lighter note, with tea, leather, ginger and a faint grassiness on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This blended Scotch, “matured in deep-charred old oak casks” features intensely smoky aromas and flavors, although honey sweetness and mellow almond peek through. Golden in hue, with a silky feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from as many as 120 different apple varieties, this burnished amber Calvados has a richness reminiscent of fine Cognac or Armagnac. The complex layers unfold to deliver vanilla, honey, almond, baked apple and dried apricot. The V.S.O.P. blends 4- and 10-year-old Calvados.
label: spirits_taster

description: Though this new offering meets the technical criteria for rye (a mash bill of at least 51% rye), the sweet, caramelly flavors suggest a high-rye Bourbon—which makes sense considering that Knob Creek is best known for its Bourbon. Expect bold almond, oak, brown butter and pecan pie flavors. The drying baking-spice finish is more characteristic of rye, and has less bite than might be expected of a 100-proof spirit.
label: spirits_taster
