description: This unaged whiskey has a malty, slightly raw   aroma. Although it's predictably hot at first, it fades into a pleasantly fruity finish. Most moonshines go the other way, with flavor fading into heat. This is a nice change. Recommended for cocktail use, especially for bloody marys.
label: spirits_taster

description: Goes down surprisingly easy for anything labeled “moonshine,” though flavoring is added and the label describes this product as a “moonshine cocktail.” Regardless, this golden corn-based liquid has rustic aromas of malt, apple and hay. A juicy, sweet-tart apple flavor hits the taste buds first, followed by a light wash of vanilla.
label: spirits_taster

description: Crisp and light bodied, this bright gold apple brandy could be mistaken for an oaked white wine (with a little extra alcohol, of course). Waves of juicy apple, honey and vanilla lead to a spark of ginger on the graceful finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: For each bottle, over 60 pounds of Hudson Valley apples are pressed, fermented and distilled, then aged in white oak for two years. The end result is fresh and pretty, pale gold and fragrant with honey and pear. Vanilla coats the palate at first, with a surprisingly viscous feel. Given time, more delicate pear and chamomile notes appear. Perfect for mixing jack rose cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: The backstory behind this bottling is that Master Distiller Fred Noe uses a “barrel sweating” technique to coax out Bourbon that has soaked into barrels during aging; that extract then is combined with newer whiskey. The end result is a lean and austere Bourbon, with brisk espresso, black tea and fig flavors highlighted by black pepper and clove. Seems made for mixing.
label: spirits_taster

description: This light-gold brandy has a distinct grassy, vegetal presence that's reminiscent of añejo Tequila, running to pineapple and pear, honey, agave nectar and white pepper. Intriguingly buttery finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Although “intense” may be an exaggeration, this syrupy-sweet liqueur delivers assertive green-apple flavor. It's fun, and a vast improvement over certain other ersatz offerings for flavoring apple cocktails. Mix with vodka or gin.
label: spirits_taster

description: This debut offering from Hudson Valley's Coppersea, which employs “heritage method” distilling techniques, is surprisingly smooth and complex for an unaged whiskey. Distinct notes of banana and fiery cassia bark mesh with candied citrus peel. Recommended for cocktails in place of white rum or silver Tequila.
label: spirits_taster

description: This golden Calvados offers a fresh, light mix of pear, grass, vanilla and honey, along with subtle hints of white flowers, ginger and black pepper. The alcohol feels a bit harsh and drying.
label: spirits_taster

description: It's not a liqueur, although some may expect it to be, with its amber color and rich maple aroma. Instead, there's only a touch of sweetness, leaning toward toasty oak and caramel on the palate, with most of the maple on the nose and lingering finish. An irreverent whisky to mix into maple whisky sours and other cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: This flavored whiskey is infused with honey flavors, then “filtered through oak cask wood.” It looks and smells just like honey, but on the palate also shows sarsaparilla and a pleasant Scotch-like smokiness, which cuts the intense sweetness. Use to sweeten whiskey-based cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: “Bottled-in-bond” spirits date back to 1897, meant to ensure the purity of American-made whiskey. As a bottled-in-bond apple brandy, this deliberately 100-proof spirit is meant for mixing, and retains apple, espresso, bitter chocolate and clove flavors. It's aged a minimum of four years in new, charred American oak barrels.
label: spirits_taster

description: This absolutely delicious aged rum evokes rich, creamy butterscotch and salted caramel candies. Savor the extremely long finish of this sipping rum, packaged in a striking squared bottle.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for concentrated toffee aromas and flavors, along with dry notes of coffee, chocolate, leather and black tea in this supple and elegant rhum. The finish is softly spiced and lingers nicely.
label: spirits_taster

description: This bright amber beauty mingles sweetness and spice on the nose and palate. Look for caramel, vanilla and allspice, with just a hint of bright banana and salty tang on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Rich and succulent caramel and orange lead into dry flavors of chocolate, espresso and clove. This supersoft aged rum is flavorful and well balanced, and excellent for sipping.
label: spirits_taster

description: Named for a wooden schooner famed for smuggling rum during Prohibition, this amber rum has a relatively light feel for a spirit aged a full 12 years. Flavors and aromas run to hazelnut, cookie dough, brown sugar and vanilla, pepped up with dark chocolate and espresso. Presented in a rotund “onion” bottle modeled after an 18th-century design.
label: spirits_taster

description: This notable new offering in the U.S. might be easily mistaken for fine Bourbon. Give it some time in the glass to open up and cast off some alcohol in the aroma, then enjoy complex flavors of toffee, orange peel and dark chocolate. This has a luxe, velvety softness, despite the distinct 90-proof alcohol presence. Mouthwatering.
label: spirits_taster

description: Tres vieux, indeed! Made with a rare blend of vintage rums reaching as far back as 1952, this amber XO boasts sweet, heady honeysuckle, candied orange peel and luscious vanilla, accented with clove, black tea, walnut and bitter chocolate notes. Add a little water to tame the puckery tannins. Presented in an expensive-looking teardrop-shaped bottle with a hefty rose-gold stopper.
label: spirits_taster

description: For those seeking a true coffee experience in liqueur, here it is. From Portland, Oregon, one of the capitals of coffee, Stone Barn Brandyworks has infused their Pinot Noir brandy with Yemeni and El Salvadoran coffees, along with vanilla, cinnamon and sugar. The end result is a fresh-brewed coffee aroma and flavor with a bitter edge, light feel and dark brown color. For a liqueur, a bit more sweetness would have been welcome.
label: spirits_taster

description: New to the U.S. market, Mariposa (Spanish for butterfly) is made with agave nectar, Tequila and vodka. It has a pale straw color and a honeyed agave scent with a light, perfumed rose note. On the palate, it reads as very sweet, like drinking thinned agave nectar with a splash of Tequila and vanilla on the finish. With good mixing potential, such as with lime and Tequila (or other spirits), Mariposa has the potential for creating fascinating new margarita hybrids.
label: spirits_taster

description: Dainty carnation pink, and smells like a grapefruit-flavored energy drink. The flavor is juicy and tart on the entry, but finishes rather sweet, reminiscent of grapefruit-spiked lemonade. Made with French vodka mixed with blood orange, mango and passion fruit. Although this appears to be made to mix, the modest alcohol level suggests this is intended as a ready-to-drink product. Distinctive tall frosted bottle.
label: spirits_taster

description: Yes, this pale neon-green liqueur is distilled from Bolivian coca leaves. But sorry, thrill seekers, the “negative narcotic compounds” are removed before the distillate is blended with 36 other herbs. The end result is a faint anise and grassy scent, and light flavors of anise, ginger, kiwi fruit and lychee, with a soft lemongrass and white-pepper spiciness. Consider subbing for green Chartreuse in cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: New to the U.S. market, Cedilla is made by infusing cachaça with açai berries grown in the Amazon region. Intense, plummy color with a sweet grape-soda aroma and flavor balanced out by a tartness on the finish and a faint cinnamon note. It goes down easy straight up, but would also be good mixed with sparkling wine or gin—or possibly cachaça.
label: spirits_taster

description: This limoncello has a light yellow, cloudy appearance, and a brisk lemon-lime flavor with a clean finish and a hint of lemon zest.
label: spirits_taster

description: Those with a sweet tooth will enjoy this bright golden liqueur as a sweetener for fall cocktails and hot drinks. Although the aroma delivers a finely tuned apple and caramel scent, caramel dominates the flavor, lingering and coating the palate. That said, the sweetness is well balanced.
label: spirits_taster

description: Cloudy carnation pink, with a juicy, grapefruit-like aroma and citrus flavor. Made with vodka, blood orange, mango and passion fruit. Although this appears to be made to mix, the modest alcohol level suggests this is intended as a ready-to-drink product. This has a distinctive curvy frosted bottle.
label: spirits_taster

description: This pale straw-colored liqueur features a sweet, light coconut fragrance and bright, lingering coconut flavor. Thick feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: This orange liqueur from Italy has a fleeting citrus scent but a big, sweet flavor, with a pronounced orange-peel note and a pulse of alcohol on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bright pale-pink colored, with a strong grapefruit scent. The flavor is sweet, slightly ersatz, with touches of grapefruit and peach. Made with French vodka, peach and passion fruit, and produced by Cognac maker Louis Royer.
label: spirits_taster

description: New to U.S. markets in spring/summer 2012, this light-gold liqueur is made with a blend of Irish and American whiskies mixed with natural apple flavor. Look for a bright green-apple scent, fresh, juicy and tart, which is echoed on the palate, reading almost like tart apple juice at first. The liqueur finishes with an alcoholic twang, where a touch of sweetness would have been welcome to temper the bite. Drink well chilled.
label: spirits_taster

description: A curiously old-fashioned spirit, within an old-fashioned wine bottle with a tall, skinny neck topped with a swing-line cap. The yellow-tinged liqueur is botanical and citrusy up front, with grappa-like heat fading into a creamy honey note.
label: spirits_taster

description: This intensely herbal, emerald-green liqueur is made with a blend of 32 botanicals, but a strong whiff of anise dominates the aroma and flavor. Although small doses may add a fresh herbal complexity to cocktails, caution is advised for straight-up sipping: this green giant weighs in at a whopping 110 proof.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bring on the white Russians! This deep brown, coffee-scented liqueur leans very sweet, and practically begs to be mixed with cream.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with “a harmonious blend of Scottish and Burgundy raspberries,” this liqueur sports a deep, vivid dark-cherry hue and a mouth-filling cherry-berry preserves flavor. However, the spirit finishes with a subdued, earthy note, and has a lighter feel than expected.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with agave Tequila and lime juice, this bright buttercup-yellow liqueur has a sweet-tart flavor and a lingering lime note. Overall it is light and crisp, though it would benefit from a bolder burst of flavor. It appears to be meant to drink as is, but it would make a refreshing apéritif in a tall glass with soda and a fresh wedge of lime.
label: spirits_taster

description: This sunny gold spirit is honey-sweet, with a finish reminiscent of Indian spices. Consider serving as an exotic touch alongside a honeyed dessert like baklava.
label: spirits_taster

description: One of the earthier black currant liqueurs, melding dark, plush berry with an oddly vegetal, spicy note with hints of oregano and bell pepper. Opaque plum color.
label: spirits_taster

description: A deep burgundy hue, with a fruity and floral scent. On the palate, the gin is tart, with a faint rose note and a dry, tannic feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Creamy yellow appearance and mild lemon scent. In many ways, it's reminiscent of lemon curd: thick and creamy, with a sweet flavor. Light lemony finish, with an herbal note. Made in Tuscany.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a light gold color and a ripe apple scent with a hint of resin. On the palate, this liqueur is sweet, with a honeyed apple essence. Light bodied.
label: spirits_taster

description: The oldest liqueur in France, dating to 1683, this liqueur features almonds and apricots macerated in Cognac. Nearly clear and clocking in at 80 proof, the spirit reads almost as almond extract, with its marshmallow fragrance and sweet, lightly almond and floral flavor with a rush of heat on the finish. Consider using to add subtle flavor to cakes and confections.
label: spirits_taster

description: This sweet amber liqueur has an aroma and flavor reminiscent of a light root beer, although it also has an offputting plastic-like undertone. Flavor fades quickly.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with French vodka, Cognac and passion fruit, the most fun part of this spirit is the artificial color: its lurid lime-green color sure attracts attention! Look for a mild kiwi and lime scent and a sweet, artificial flavor similar to an energy drink.
label: spirits_taster

description: Light gold in color with a juicy, true apple flavor. This apple schnapps would have scored higher were it not for the sticky, plastic-like aroma.
label: spirits_taster

description: This 10-year-old straight rye whiskey would make a top-notch Sazerac. Despite its rich, luxe aroma, this is light and smooth on the palate. Look for notes of sweet, creamy caramel and dried fruit enlivened by a signature rye bite and a sweet, surprisingly delicate finish with just a sprinkling of ginger and cinnamon. The sepia photo on the label features “gambler, buffalo hunter, Army scout, gunfighter and newspaperman” William “Bat” Masterson.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from Racer IPA, this is one of the most interesting and riotous options in the moonshine category. The aromatics are sweet and funky, with a sour hoppy note. Although it's hot—as would be expected at nearly 100 proof—bright flavors still emerge, tempered by a touch of sweetness and ginger-cinnamon fireworks. A surprising effervescence makes the flavors pop.
label: spirits_taster

description: With a zesty aroma hinting at spicy dried oregano, this tends toward the savory side, and would be a fine addition to a Bloody Mary. Tropical-fruit sweetness appears on the palate. With repeated sipping, spicy notes emerge on the finish, and the heat builds up—as expected at 100 proof. Overall, this is bold, mouthwatering and taut, and it really sings on the palate.
label: spirits_taster

description: This maple-syrup-flavored whisky is sure to please anyone with a sweet tooth. The base is a small-batch blend of 3- 5- and 7-year-old Canadian rye whiskies, lending backbone to the big maple and vanilla flavors, with a touch of peach and clove on the finish. Good for sipping over ice or mixing, as in Tap 357's suggested cocktail, The Montreal––a riff on the Manhattan.
label: spirits_taster

description: This 13-year-old straight wheat whiskey is a limited-edition release to raise funds for ALS research, in honor of Heaven Hill Master Distiller Emeritus Parker Beam. It's full of luxe caramel charm, with vanilla, crème brûlée and a touch of orange peel. It's bottled at cask strength; be prepared to add plenty of water to enjoy, otherwise it's quite fiery.
label: spirits_taster

description: Despite the hokey golf logo on the bottle, this four-year-old Kentucky Bourbon was a pleasant surprise. Inspired by Mulligan's Grill, a golf-themed bar and grill in Ellisville, MO, this is a light, balanced sipper that features bold caramel with hints of orange and grapefruit peel, almost like a head start on citrusy cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Straw-hued in the glass, this unusual oat whiskey offers bright, grassy aromatics with hints of fresh apple and vanilla. On the palate, the fruitiness comes forward, translating as tropical fruit and lemon cream pie, plus a sprinkle of nutmeg on the smooth, brisk landing.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clear in the glass with a warm, comfortingly polenta-like aroma, this white corn-based whiskey bills itself as “mellow as moonlight.” It's fleetingly sweet on the palate and surprisingly delicate at first sip. Additional sips build warmer, richer notes of vanilla, marshmallow and coconut, with faint corn sweetness on the crisp finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This small-batch, seven-year-old whiskey is bottled at cask strength (122 proof). A light, pleasant vanilla cast hints at richer butterscotch, with plenty of citrus peel and cinnamon sparks up front before it fades back into vanilla again. It's quite fiery, so mix with plenty of ginger ale for tasty highballs.
label: spirits_taster

description: As per the company, this 22-year-old Bourbon was distilled in Frankfort, KY at what was then the George T. Stagg Distillery and found in the old Stitzel-Weller Warehouses in Louisville, KY. The whiskey was then bottled in Tullahoma, TN. The whiskey needs some time in the glass to open up, showing caramel, oak and a touch of campfire smoke, before drying to espresso, tea and leather on the finish. Drying feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: This small-batch Bourbon has a bright vanilla and peach nectar fragrance. At first, it's juicy and fruity on the palate, but it finishes taut and dry, with tingly spice, vanilla and oak. Versatile and not overpowering, it seems well suited for cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: This limited release 100% corn whiskey has a light, bright honey color and vanilla-oak aroma. The palate surprises with butterscotchy corn sweetness, lemon peel, baking spice and a saline tang, finishing with more butterscotch on the elongated finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for bold vanilla aroma, a drying feel and loads of vanilla, brown sugar and even touches of butterscotch on the exceedingly long finish. It's surprisingly smooth for a 101-proof product, although the alcohol indeed makes its presence known. It stands up well to dilution, which blunts the alcohol edge and coaxes out more vanilla.
label: spirits_taster

description: The only Pennsylvania-style rye actually made in Pennsylvania is finished for three months in former sweet-vermouth casks from Quady Winery. The base rye has a bananas and honey character; this builds on it nicely with layers of raisin, figs, dates and caramel, finishing attractively spiced. Small batch.
label: spirits_taster

description: This five-year-old cask-strength Kentucky Bourbon is bottled at 122 proof, but feels smooth and light nevertheless. The scent mingles vanilla and cedar while the drying palate shows richer hazelnut, cocoa and cigar wrapper, finishing extremely long with clove and cinnamon sparks
label: spirits_taster

description: This is Bourbon infused with cinnamon liqueur, taking aim at the popular Fireball brand. A golden liquid, this smells like cinnamon Red Hot candies and most of the flavor arrives on the mild cinnamon-style finish. It's not overly sweet nor overly spicy.
label: spirits_taster

description: This blend of straight rye whiskeys has a light amber hue and a scent redolent of brown sugar and baked apple, plus a fleeting sarsaparilla note. Most of the allspice and oak flavor comes through on the long finish. At 92 proof, this rye feels relatively hot; mix into Sazeracs and other cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: This small batch honey-hued Bourbon has a light vanilla scent and soft feel on the palate. It starts with a gentle vanilla flavor and finishes bold and spicy. Supposedly, actor and whiskey lover John Wayne left behind a reserve of bottles dating back to 1963, and this Bourbon was blended to taste just like those bottles. It's a good whiskey and a good story.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged for eight years—twice as long as regular Jim Beam—this Bourbon offers rich caramel aroma and flavor. Though it's a little fiery from the first sip, moderating the heat with water brings out a saline lick that makes for a salted caramel impression, fading to vanilla on the long finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This small-batch Bourbon is made with whiskeys aged 11 years and older. Made with brown rice in addition to corn, this deep amber whiskey has an aroma that mixes vanilla, dried fruit and a touch of red fruit. On the palate, it's full-bodied and oily, showing oak, dried orange peel, red fruit and vanilla. Though it's drying and feels relatively hot, adding water softens the heat and brings out more vanilla and caramel. Limited edition.
label: spirits_taster

description: This six-year-old bottling has a mild aroma that hints at caramel. On the palate, look for touches of toffee, espresso, brown sugar, clove and a meandering, grain-y sweet finish that some might compare to oatmeal cookies. Velvety feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Yes, it's a Dallas-themed bottling; an image of Southfork Ranch is printed on the square bottle and the Kentucky-made four-year-old Bourbon is bottled in Texas. Look for easy-sipping soft vanilla and caramel finishing with oaky flavor and baking spice sparks. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: A dead ringer for Southern-style sweet tea, this has just a hint of alcohol to it. This dark amber whiskey has a steeped-tea scent and flavor and goes down ridiculously easily.
label: spirits_taster

description: The peated version of Westland's single malt is modestly smoky on the nose, but boldly smoky on the palate, overshadowing the pleasant notes of vanilla and caramel underneath. The peat flavor accelerates into the finish, growing peppery and relatively hot.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with triticale, a wheat-rye hybrid, as well as corn, this limited-edition Bourbon is relatively dry in feel and flavor despite the bold, sweet vanilla aroma. On the palate, it's oaky with touches of vanilla, clove and burnt orange peel, finishing long and dry with notes of espresso and cigar tobacco.
label: spirits_taster

description: Light, drying and spicy, this cask-strength Bourbon offers vanilla and cedar notes. Adding water coaxes out vanilla, honey and a pleasing touch of almond.
label: spirits_taster

description: This single-barrel whiskey is made from 100% rye and  aged for less than two years. In the glass, it has  an orange-amber hue and aroma that melds oak,  malt and vanilla. On the palate, vanilla leads, with  oakiness winding into a baking-spice finish. A good  match for Manhattans.
label: spirits_taster

description: Ten years of barrel time has created a concentrated caramel scent and palate spiked with sarsaparilla and allspice, finishing spicy and quite hot, with a fleeting orange peel note. Balances with a bit of branchwater, but needs a light touch.
label: spirits_taster

description: Despite a mild aroma, this whiskey offers bold caramel, vanilla and maple on the palate, with soft, creamy mouthfeel. Water opens up the aroma a little, disclosing a bit more vanilla. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: This blend of straight whiskeys offers rich, sweet aromas bursting with caramel and brown sugar. A concentrated, drying palate shows bold toffee, clove and espresso, finishing quite fiery. Adding water softens the heat and coaxes out a buttery feel, but it also pales the flavor from toffee to vanilla.
label: spirits_taster

description: Surprisingly smooth and nuanced, this moonshine-style white whiskey is made with New York state corn. It's “lightly oak aged” rather than unaged, which may account for a distinct almond note and subtle fruitiness.
label: spirits_taster

description: Although this honey-hued flavored whiskey is blended with apple juice and cinnamon, the aroma and flavor veer toward distinctly peachy-sweet and juicy rather than apple-like. There's faint bitterness on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made and bottled by Koval (in Chicago) for Belle Isle Craft Spirits in Richmond, VA, this organic corn-based 'shine has a nearly neutral, slightly fruity aroma. On the palate, it's also relatively neutral, with a slight bitter-almond note and raspberry-like fruitiness on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The ninth release in the Master's Collection series showcases a Bourbon finished in Pinot Noir barrels from the Sonoma Cutrer winery. The burnished amber liquid has a slightly rosy tinge. On the palate it's surprisingly earthy, showing oak, coconut and vanilla, plus a touch of dark fruit on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This amber spirit is sweet, silky and sippable. It emits a warm vanilla scent and honeyed flavor with hazelnut notes and a ginger zing. Aged three years.
label: spirits_taster

description: Light amber color, sweet and fruity scent, like apples. The flavor is sweet, with a deeply honeyed finish, and a splash of water brings out a nascent smokiness and spiciness. The alcohol is a little astringent at first. Aged 12 years in American Bourbon and Spanish Sherry casks.
label: spirits_taster

description: Dark amber color and brooding, smoky scent. Although intense peat is characteristic of Islay Scotches and Ardbeg in particular, here the smoke goes too far. It starts with lovely vanilla, brine and light smoke, but the peat party simply goes on far too long. Adding water softens the feel of this cask-strength Scotch, but does nothing to dampen the smoke.
label: spirits_taster

description: At first, this spirit seems mild, with its gentle amber color and mild, fruity scent. But whoah—this cask-strength Scotch is bold and intense. Smoky flavor thunders across the palate, drowning out a mild vanilla sweetness. Meanwhile, the alcohol is the lightning: It burns, even diluted it stings fiercely.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is a light and drinkable spirit with a fresh, tropical fruit aroma, buttery feel and a nicely lingering mix of caramel and spice notes.
label: spirits_taster

description: This dark gold spirit is distilled by Macallan, but bottled by Douglas Laing & Co., an independent bottler and blender, and made with Scotch from a single cask. Save this one for peat lovers; it has a mild fruitiness and a quick-building, long-lingering smoky character.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Sherry-aged Highland single malt has a maple syrup color, a caramel aroma and a thick, velvety feel. Expect citrus-tart and butterscotch flavors, with a smoky finish. Add water to mitigate the alcohol burn.
label: spirits_taster

description: It's a refreshing change of pace to see an Islay Scotch that's not teeming with peatiness. Instead, this honey-colored spirit offers a well-balanced mix of smoke and caramel, with a malty, cookie-dough sweetness in the background, finishing with allspice and caramel. Most of the smoke is on the nose, and the distiller's tasting notes advise:  “to fully enjoy the aroma, savour it outside in the fresh air.”
label: spirits_taster

description: A honey-colored spirit finished in Sherry casks, with a beautiful sweet aroma of dried fruit and vanilla. On the palate, the flavor is sweet as well, showing peach nectar, caramel, spicy clove and ginger. It's better lightened with water, as the peachiness becomes less intense. Yes, the retail price for this extremely limited offering Scotch (fewer than 500 bottles produced) really is skyward of $1,000.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sherry-cask maturation shows in the rich, buttery caramel scent and big caramel and nut flavor. This spirit has so much flavor and promise, but it's marred by excess alcohol. Even well diluted, it still stings going down.
label: spirits_taster

description: A lightly vegetal and plastic scent knocked down the score on this brandy, but the flavor is intact, with a pronounced sweetness and cinnamon and rounded dried fruit finish. Light amber color.
label: spirits_taster

description: At heart, this is a lovely and delicate Scotch, from its fresh, lightly floral scent to the lingering crème brûlée and hazelnut finish. But its delicacy is buried under a mountain of alcohol. Even with copious amounts of water, it's remarkably hot.
label: spirits_taster

description: “Superstition” is billed as the sweet and delicate one in the Jura line, but it's surprisingly aggressive with the smoke. It starts out mild, with a warm peaty and vegetal scent, a smooth feel and, at first, just a wash of smokiness followed by a mellow caramel finish. But then the smoke reverberates with a vengeance, and it's just altogether too much.
label: spirits_taster

description: Maple syrup color, soft feel, vegetal scent, caramel finish. Would have scored higher if not for an off-putting and pervasive resin-like flavor.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made to celebrate 100 years of rum making, this is a spirit to savor. It's made from a blend of rums aged from eight up to 30 years in American whiskey barrels. The unusually deep caramel hue advertises the powerful flavors: crème brûlée, lingering and kaleidoscopic notes of coffee bean, caramel, cola, muted gingerbread spices and just a mere hint of sweetness.
label: spirits_taster

description: From this dark amber liquid wafts a luxurious aroma of toffee, marzipan, candied fruit and sarsparilla. On the sweeter side of the spectrum, this aged rum is gorgeous and mouth-filling, with caramel and a sprinkling of ginger and cinnamon fireworks on the elongated finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sweet and sippable, this nut-brown spirit has complex, rich flavors and a soft feel. The aroma is dark and somewhat boozy, with notes of dried fruit and burnt toffee. On the palate, look for creamy vanilla, cinnamon, clove and mocha flavors, with a lovely rounded finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: As might be expected from a rum affiliated with a Cognac maker, this honey-colored spirit is finished in old Cognac barrels. The end result is luxe but light, yielding caramel and orange peel aromas, as well as loads of sweet honey and creamy caramel on the palate, accented with a bright touch of lemon. Especially enjoyable mixed with ginger beer, Dark & Stormy-style.
label: spirits_taster

description: Give this velvety, golden amber rum a few minutes to open up, and it shows warm vanilla and almond aromas. Most of the flavor is on the finish: gentle vanilla bean, banana and coconut tones. Makes for a nice sipping rum.
label: spirits_taster

description: A limited-edition rum, newly launched in August 2011, and finished in previously used Sherry casks. That Sherry finish contributes so much: the bright copper-penny color, the lush aromas of burnt orange and raisin and the smooth, full-bodied texture. Enjoy the elongated flavors of toffee flavor dusted with Mexican-spiced chocolate while you can.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with a blend of rums aged seven years, this silky spirit has an amber color and warm toffee aroma. On the palate, this rum is relatively dry, with clove and cinnamon spice and a lingering vanilla note. Good alcohol balance, just enough for structure.
label: spirits_taster

description: This dry rum has a soft amber color and an enticingly warm caramel fragrance. On the tongue, it has a soft feel, with crème brûlée and banana flavors, braced up with lightly tannic black-tea notes and a baking spice finish. While a versatile choice for all manner of cocktails, the spice profile seems a natural for enlivening warm winter toddies.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bottle resembles an oversized perfume flask, showcasing a golden blend of rums aged from three to 12 years, and aged in American white oak and Sherry barrels. This is a relatively light rum, with apple and almond aromas, a soft feel and rounded flavors of almond, vanilla and brown sugar.
label: spirits_taster

description: This nut-brown rum is scented with sweet vanilla and baking spices, though it shows a hit of booziness on the nose. Soft feel, bitter chocolate, toffee and tropical fruit notes, with a long caramel finish. A fine choice for sipping, but with its pastry-like profile, consider soaking some into a rum cake.
label: spirits_taster

description: This bright mahogany spirit has a playful, slightly boozy scent, mixing cherry and pineapple with caramel. Meanwhile, the flavor has lots of oak, leather, cigar and dark chocolate, with a lingering finish that plays on and on. Clement recommends this in a rum “Old Fashioned”—with those fruity notes in the aroma, you already have a head start.
label: spirits_taster

description: Finished in Cognac casks, this honey-colored spirit has a lovely caramel-vanilla scent that is echoed on the palate, where it is brightened by a spicy ginger and clove pop on the finish. Creamy mouthfeel.
label: spirits_taster

description: This spirit is made from rums between five and 18 years, aged in a sequence of American whiskey, Sherry and Port barrels. This aging trifecta results in a nut-brown color and lingering and complex toffee, cocoa and raisin notes. Needs some time to open up for best effect.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged for a minimum of eight years, this full-bodied amber rum has a fruity scent with a hint of vanilla and sweet caramel flavor with a baking spice finish. Smooth feel. A good choice for mixing into cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Give this Cognac-finished and honey-hued rum a couple of minutes to open up. The reward is a thick vanilla aroma and flavor, with graceful almond, ginger and nutmeg notes on the finish. Velvety feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: The texture of this golden rum is remarkable—velvety and feather-soft. Maturation in ex-Bourbon barrels creates sweet, rich caramel and root beer scents. The flavor is surprisingly subtle at first, but gives way to a long, rolling finish with honey and bitter chocolate notes. Striking, gift-worthy bottle.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find slightly stale, industrial scents of fermented lime. The palate entry shows some improvement with a sour lime flavor; the midpalate stage displays some authentic tastes of sour/bitter lime juice. Finishes very tart and juicy. Could be employed with some success in a gimlet cocktail.
label: spirits_taster

description: A one-dimensional bouquet of oak and wood. The palate entry is clumsy and too woody and resiny; the midpalate improves with the addition of a light toffee taste. Finishes oaky sweet, resiny and drinkable, if hollow.
label: spirits_taster

description: The uninteresting bouquet features distant notes of corn muffin and husk. The palate entry is sweet and uncomplicated; the midpalate stage features warming spirit, sweet corn, breakfast cereal and paraffin. Ends sweet, simple and waxy. The lack of depth works against this Bourbon.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find an oaky/nut paste aroma with fruity notes of berries, dried fruit, plums, pears and soft cheese. The palate entry is composed, succulent and honeyed; by midpalate the flavors deepen to include caramel, rancio and orange rind. Finishes beautifully with depth, finesse and maturity.
label: spirits_taster

description: The fragrance is alive with scents of pepper, oak, caramel corn, new leather, plums, light toffee and pipe tobacco. The palate entry is astoundingly rich, deeply honey-like, and gently warming; the midpalate features tastes of marshmallow, caramel corn, sautéed almonds, nougat, figs and dates. Finishes composed and flavorfully sweet. Add mineral water. Delicious!
label: spirits_taster

description: The understated bouquet features earthy scents of wet forest and pine with supplemental aromas of light caramel, honey, and milk coffee. The delicious palate entry is richly sweet; by midpalate the honey character turns more like cream sherry and dates. The finish is toffee sweet and fudge-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet features scents of vanilla bean, dark honey, nougat, pipe tobacco, and rancio. The palate entry is fat and creamy; at midpalate intensely sweet flavors of honey, dark toffee, and cocoa take charge. Texture is heavy. Finishes on a honeyed note.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet slowly emerges, offering delicately sweet scents of buttered popcorn, light toffee, maple and lanolin. The corn base taste of the palate entry is balanced by a sap-like flavor; at midpalate sweet, oaky, maple-like and grainy tastes meld into a seamless taste profile. Finish is elegant, semisweet, intensely oaky, resiny and pineapple-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: The full-bodied bouquet features doughy scents that are dry, resiny and clean. The palate entry is fresh, surprisingly fruity and wonderfully creamy; the midpalate taste is rich in a fruity, ripe manner and oaky. Concludes sap- and maple-like, oaky and bittersweet. One of the best straight rye whiskeys available.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find a delicate strawberry fragrance. The delightfully tart palate entry offers fresh, ripe strawberry; the midpalate displays the skill of the distiller, in that the flavoring is an accentuation more than a dominant force. Finishes elegant, savory, ripe and clean.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes detect subtle earthy notes of flowers, spring garden and spring forest. The palate entry is oily, nicely viscous, and grainy; the midpalate stage shows more weight in the texture and an unabashed sweetness attributable to the grain mash. The aftertaste is sweet, if a bit metallic, in the late phase.
label: spirits_taster

description: The complex bouquet features scents of holiday spice, vanilla bean, marzipan, candied almond, honey, old sweet oak, and dark toffee. The palate entry is fruity and spirity warm; the midpalate includes tastes of honey, orange peel, baked pear, cinnamon, vanilla, cocoa, and rancio. Finishes as elegantly and assertively as it began.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers appealing fragrances of oak, medium-sweet cane, escarole, pine cone and new leather. The palate entry is long and medium-sweet; at midpalate finely layered tastes of cocoa butter, palm oil, oaky vanilla, light honey and almond paste enthrall the taste buds. Concludes silky smooth, mildly sweet and honey-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose is of sea air, green olives, and brine; after adding mineral water the bouquet turns creamy and marshmallowy. The palate entry is sweet and moderately oaky; the midpalate possesses an oily, velvety and salted butter flavor. The aftertaste is long, semisweet and briny.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma displays a spicy, rind-like bearing with hints of orange candy, fresh herbs, and the oily presence of grain whisky. The palate entry is nicely acidic and bone dry; at midpalate the taste profile turns mildly sweeter, sap-like, and more whisky-like. The finish is off-dry, citrusy, sappy, yet creamy. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sports a clean, off-dry, nicely grainy opening scent; following aeration, the bouquet turns pleasantly expressive as the sweet spiciness of the grain kicks in. The palate entry is very sweet and medium-bodied; the midpalate flavor is intensely grainy sweet. The aftertaste is slightly honeyed and Graham cracker-like. Use as a mixing, not a sipping, vodka.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet includes delicate fragrances of spice, sesame seed, light oak, pineapple, light toffee and brown sugar. The palate entry is elegant and moderately sweet; at midpalate there are flavors of ripe pear, white grapes, cake frosting, oloroso Sherry, orange peel and dark honey. Ends up sweet, satiny and long in the throat.
label: spirits_taster

description: A lovely bouquet that features a wonderful balance of base spirit and vanilla flavoring. The palate entry is mildly vanilla-like and quite beany; at midpalate there are subtle tastes of cocoa, milk chocolate, and cream that work beautifully with the vanilla core flavor. Finishes well as the vanilla turns slightly sweet. Luscious.
label: spirits_taster

description: Wonderful fresh and tart bouquet of just-sliced ripe lemons. The palate entry is tart, rind-like, and refreshing; the midpalate offers zesty, tangy flavors of bitter lemon and lemon drop candy. Concludes tart, lean, and lovely. One of the better lemon liqueurs out there.
label: spirits_taster

description: The early aroma is forest-like and herbal, a touch of mineral water unleashes scents of raisins, marzipan, smoldering bonfire, and soft cheese. The palate entry displays the sweet, winy emblem of long maturation in Sherry cask; at midpalate the taste turns more intensely cocoa-like and bittersweet. Finishes creamy, cocoa butter-like and Sherry sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening aroma is atypical but following aeration the aroma becomes more of a customary Armagnac perfume: sweet oak, prunes, cocoa, spice and raisins. The palate entry is assertive, sweet and raisiny; at midpalate a brief flash of spirit is followed by fat flavors of sautéed butter, almond paste, nougat, and dark honey. Aftertaste is rich, long, and sweet. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nut-paste, oaky scents take on a citrusy tone as the smell turns fruitier the more it aerates; lovely and compelling. The palate entry is supple, fruity sweet, and ripe; the midpalate stage highlights melded flavors of light caramel, marzipan, and nougat. Ends up oaky- sweet, lightly spiced and satiny.
label: spirits_taster

description: The potent aroma features leathery and intensely woody scents with atypical notes of brown sugar and molasses. The palate entry is startlingly sweet, oaky and balanced; after water is added the midpalate leaps with bittersweet flavors of cocoa bean, vanilla extract and corn husk. Concludes fiery, candy sweet and intensely oaky. An over-the-top experience that should be tried.
label: spirits_taster

description: The smoky, bean-like aroma is vivid, beautifully bitter and bark-like. The palate entry is root- and bark-like, herbal, and moderately oily; at midpalate the flavor profile turns towards refreshing bitterness and a minerally quality. Ends dry yet oily and smooth. A dandy value.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma has an anise/licorice foundation with unexpected odors of vanilla, bark and spice. The palate entry reflects all the keenly appealing zestiness of the bouquet; the midpalate offers creamy texture, tangy anise and black licorice flavors, and a lovely mouthfeel that's warm and plump. Ends up elegant yet vigorous. Very nice.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes detect soft, earthy scents that are a touch smoky; with further aeration the aroma takes on a grassy odor. The palate entry is first sharp and then keenly bittersweet and vanilla bean-like; at the midpalate the flavors become caney and a touch honeyed. Ends on a dry, grassy or green note.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers scents of cream, wild flowers, and honey. The palate entry features the cream, both in flavor and texture; by midpalate the taste includes flavors of cocoa, milk chocolate, and buttercream. The aftertaste is sweet, long, and creamy. Good for whisky cocktails. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma includes scents of roses, honeysuckle and mature spirit with notes of oak, pepper and dried red fruits. The palate entry is light, medium-sweet, fruity and woody; the midpalate offers dried red fruit and oaky vanilla; there's a lack of depth in the entry and midpalate. Concludes sweet, warm and silky.
label: spirits_taster

description:
Only available at Casa Bacardi Visitor Center, PR 

The aroma is tobacco-like and honeyed. The palate entry is intensely sweet and sugary; at midpalate the taste is similar to cream cheese frosting and also possesses a cola nut quality. Finishes polished, unreservedly sweet and sugary. Elegant and easily recommendable, but I hoped for greater depth and layering.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial bouquet is faint and mildly fruity but following aeration the aroma goes a little too flat. The palate entry is tart and rind-like; the juicy tartness and acidity grow further at midpalate. Ends up tart but not sour; zesty without being oily, and very clean on the tongue.
label: spirits_taster

description: An invitingly herbal and woodsy initial aroma of sage, nutmeg and cassia bark; more minutes find the juniper behind the assertive spice and herb flavorings. The palate entry is round, semisweet and moderately oily; at midpalate the taste is of rosemary and coriander and pepper. Finishes elegantly, firmly and squeaky clean. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Teasing scents of grapes, baked apple, oak; gum, paraffin, palm oil and unsweetened coconut. Luscious and grapy but pointed at palate entry; by midpalate, the creamy taste and sinewy feel of almond butter overrides the oak and fruit. Aftertaste is long, creamy, nutty, spirity and only slightly oaky.
label: spirits_taster

description: White wine yellow/gold. Bouquet immediately asserts itself, emitting peaty, smoky, briny aromas that are off-dry to sweet; exposure to air expands the bouquet to include nutmeg, almond butter and grass. Palate entry is succulent, sweet, Sherried and scrumptious; by midpalate, the texture turns oily and the taste profile takes on a tobacco leaf, tobacco smoke, sea brine posture that's surprisingly sweet. Aftertaste is long, peaty, sweet and loaded with herbal elegance. Another winner from this wonderful distillery.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pale gold appearance is ringed with an egg white-colored foam; small, tight bubbles. Nose is much riper and fuller than the Dry version, giving off strong evidence of ripe, red apples. First taste is of ripe, peeled apple meat while the midpalate flavor profile exhibits a welcome touch of astringency to counter the moderate sweetness. Aftertaste is long, apple-like and off-dry.
label: spirits_taster

description: Old copper penny/burnished/cherry wood hue; long-lasting sand-colored foam. First whiffs discover earthy scents of mushrooms and dampened barley; aeration brings out the maltiness as the musty earthiness recedes. Opening flavors are properly bitter and keenly malty; at midpalate, there's a brief surge of hops before the malty bitterness and astringency takes command once again. Finish is long, almost fruity and delightfully smooth. A winning traditional-style Bitter from eastern England.
label: spirits_taster

description: First sniffs pick up scents of cream and oaky vanilla; after aeration the oak influence continues to the point of near-exclusion. Palate entry is creamy and nutty; at midpalate, the intense nuttiness and creaminess make it almost like a Tequila liqueur. Finishes thick, concentrated, and sweet. An atypical reposado but hard not to admire. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The intense berry freshness on the nose is stimulating; aeration heightens the blackberry concentration to the point of jamminess. The ripe taste at palate entry is tart and inviting; the midpalate is lush, ripe and only marginally sweet. Finish is fruity, ripe, sweet/sour and long.
label: spirits_taster

description: All sorts of scents are on the initial nosings, including almond butter, honey and mint. Palate entry is mildly sweet and sugary, but the taste profile takes off at midpalate with firm, lean but well-developed flavors of oak, brown sugar and cocoa. Aftertaste is long, semisweet and extremely honeyed.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial nosing passes reveal a zesty and mildly spicy aroma that's focused on the cereal grain; the bouquet registers on the leaner, drier side of neutral grain spirits and as such is in direct opposition to other creamier, sweeter Dutch vodkas. Palate entry is moderately sweet, almost smoky; at midpalate, a flash of black licorice tempts the taste buds, then recedes, allowing the sweet, nearly smoky/pipe tobacco leaf taste to dominate.
label: spirits_taster

description: The ripe peach character makes itself known immediately; that this spirit is something special. Palate entry is ripe but not in the least candied or overly sweet, just juicy; by midpalate, the flavor profile includes peach skin and peach nectar. Aftertaste is balanced, acidic and ripe.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first aromatic impressions are delightfully fruity and floral, with just the merest trace of off-dry malt; the flower-fest continues in the nose with the additions of honeysuckle and light new oak. Palate entry is sweet, pleasantly thick and robust; at midpalate, the zesty spirit takes charge and guides the woody/floral/grainy supplementary flavors into the sweet, slightly honeyed aftertaste. A treat from an overlooked, under-appreciated distillery.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose opens with biscuity, caramel-like scents; aeration releases deeper aromas including oak, pineapple, pears and nut. Palate entry is crisp, candied and spirity; at midpalate, flavors of coffee bean, spice and cocoa butter complement the dried fruit and oak. Finishes firm, sweet and oaky. Lovely.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bouquet opens with aromas of hazelnut, asphalt, fennel, steamed asparagus and damp hay; additional air contact adds metallic/botanical fragrances that suggest lead pipe, rust, popcorn, dill, brine and charred oak. In the mouth, loads of rich, maple-like flavors delight the tastebuds. Finishes softer than I expected.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bouquet is acidic and sharp at first; with aeration it smoothes out, displaying plump, candied scents of light toffee, caramel and nougat. Palate entry is full-bodied and semisweet; at midpalate, the flavors blossom into pipe smoke, sweetened coconut and breakfast cereal. Finish is long and luxurious.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bouquet begins with tart scents of tropical fruit and green apple; aeration stimulates an odd perfume, almost medicinal but pleasantly fruity. By midpalate, the flavor settles down and offers lean, bittersweet and mesmerizing tastes of old oak, vanilla, coffee bean, tree sap, butterscotch, honey and even a fleeting moment of rancio. Aftertaste is deliciously sweet and maple-like.
label: spirits_taster

description:
Bottled at 21 years of age. First sniffs detect an immediate rush of heather, green pepper and sweet grain; further aeration allows the aroma to show delicate hints of unsweetened coconut, banana cream, light toffee and smoke. Palate entry is resiny/woody; at midpalate there's a gentle sting of mature spirit on the tongue and echoes of honey and vanilla. Finish is long, sweet, malty and honeyed. A Northern Highlands malt whisky at the height of its powers.
.
label: spirits_taster

description: Mixture of whiskies from the Tamdhu, Highland Park, Glenrothes and Bunnahabhain malt distilleries. Tangy aromas of pork rind, bacon fat, cream and almond paste make for luscious early-on sniffing. Palate entry is chewy, rich, honey sweet and just a tad spicy in a peppery manner; at midpalate, the flavor profile shows off an oily/buttery side that greatly complements the baked, honeyed sweetness. The aftertaste is long, oaky sweet and even vanilla-like. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The orange aroma grows substantially in the glass, expanding and mingling perfectly with the Cognac. Palate entry is zesty, piquant, peppery and spicy; the midpalate makes the tongue glow with spirity warmth as the flavor profile takes the orange zest/peel to the edge of bitterness. Ends bittersweet, zesty and luscious.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sensuous bouquet offers buttery scents of old oak, dark toffee, cola, tobacco smoke, charcoal and bacon fat. Taste is bittersweet like brown sugar and dark honey, toasty, smoky and warm. Aftertaste is long, oaky, intense and silky.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aeration serves to cut loose an intense nut-like perfume that's off-dry and oily. Flavor displays a wonderful harmony between the acidity,  ripe fruit, nut-like oil flavor, honey and dark cocoa. Concludes succulent, sap-like and honeyed.
label: spirits_taster

description: Displays sophisticated aromas of lanolin, cream, light oaky resin, pine nuts, light caramel (like English toffee) and the early stages of rancio. Palate entry is creamy, medium-rich and sweet; at midpalate, the flavor profile expands to include sautéed almonds, bacon fat and sweet oak. Ends in a lush, sweet style.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first sniffs detect restrained, lightly roasted kernel/bean-like scents; bouquet opens up as aromas of saddle leather, tobacco leaf and walnut come to the fore. Palate entry is semisweet, candied and creamy; by midpalate, the taste includes pepper, welcome spirity heat, oak resin and caramel corn. Ends showing the delicate side of Bourbon.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma offers succulent dried fruit and nut surface notes plus deeper scents of oak, black raisins, cinnamon, prunes, vanilla bean and honey. Palate entry is stately and semisweet; by midpalate, lip-smacking flavors of nougat, almond butter, molasses and Sherry abound. Finishes as elegantly and fully as it started.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is subtle and alluring, with distant notes of buttered popcorn and escarole broth; aeration stimulates aromas of peanut butter, rye toast and damp cobblestone. Silky palate entry is slightly sweet, concentrated and grainy; at midpalate, the flavor turns drier, lightly spiced and almost fruity (as in dried fruit). Aftertaste is long and spicy. Well crafted and quality driven.
label: spirits_taster

description: Early sniffings find friendly scents of uncooked white potato and light spice; further time leads to pleasingly off-dry aromas of yam, butter and multi-grain cereal. Entry flavor is off-dry to semisweet, succulent and moderately oily; at midpalate, the oiliness comes to the forefront, then a peppery quality takes charge, leading to the medium-long aftertaste.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening nosing passes detect soft scents of spicy rye; aeration adds notes of black pepper, marmalade and plum preserves. The oily palate entry makes the tongue tingle pleasantly; at midpalate this whiskey's youth is accentuated by racy tastes of alcohol, spicy grain and light caramel. Finishes as sprightly and carefree as it starts. A straight rye with attitude.
label: spirits_taster

description: The early aroma is reined in, showing just a whisper of lemon peel zestiness; exposure to air stimulates more of the lime juice component as the lemon retreats. Palate entry features the lime essence as the flavor goes citrusy, acidic, razor-sharp and refreshing; at midpalate, the off-dry flavor remains focused on the lime juice/pulp. Concludes long and astringent. Excellent.
label: spirits_taster

description: Vigorous aromas of damp earth, wet barley, wet concrete and tobacco leaf-like peat wow the olfactory sense, then deeper scents of black pepper, barley malt, steamed asparagus and steamed white rice further enhance the bouquet. Tastes of light caramel, toffee, nougat and oak. Finishes sweet in a honeyed manner.
label: spirits_taster

description: Early nosing passes detect nuances of old flowers, parchment and black raisins; aeration encourages spice, old oak and fabric. Palate entry is gloriously rich, fruity, resiny and clean; at midpalate, there are multilayered tastes of maple, palm oil, sap, light toffee, marzipan. Ends concentrated, oily, viscous, sweet and oaky.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening whiffs pick up luscious aromas of nutmeg, cinnamon and white raisins; further aeration introduces traces of hard cheese, oak/vanillin, dried fruit, black pepper and almond paste. At palate entry the early-on taste includes nuts and butter cream; the viscous texture and nut butter/oaky/maple-like flavor is highlighted at midpalate. Finishes regally without any alcohol heat and plenty of lip-smacking sautéed almond. In a word, scrumptious.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose finds supersweet deep caramel candy and almond extract, but don't be fooled. On the tongue, it's punch-in-the-nose dry and biting. Best served on ice, which takes down the burn and lets the pronounced woody flavors come through:  lots of oak, strong tea and cigar tobacco.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pleasantly sweet nose. Medium body and sticky-toffee flavor. This would be great mixed into cocktails, because the flavor is smooth but bold at the same time; it would blend without being completely lost. Finishes mellow, smooth, with just enough alcohol bite. Easy to like. Think Manhattans and Old-Fashioneds.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromas are sweet and fruitcake-like, with faint cigar smoke. Restrained, subtle flavors of orange peel, cinnamon and leather ride a medium-to-heavy body. The finish is extremely smooth, with a touch of anise.
label: spirits_taster

description: Fragrant with cinnamon, floral clover honey, and sweet dried fruit notes. Flavorful:  lots of oak, a generous dose of toffee, toasty nutmeg and allspice, finishing with a big bite. Reminiscent of dark gingerbread. Medium body, pleasant, a touch astringent.
label: spirits_taster

description: Hudson has a great story—indie distiller based in upstate NY, but the product underwhelmed. Faintly fragrant, like weak tea with high notes of ginger and honey. Perfumy taste, finishes a little bitter, a little spicy. Light, flaccid body.
label: spirits_taster

description: Intriguing and challenging bouquet of aromas of roasted nuts, old leather, black pepper, old oak and dried fruit. Palate entry is aggressive in spirit, but sweet and pruny; midpalate is drier and features tastes of leather and grain. Aftertaste teems with oak resin, hard cheese (meaning, rancio), candied nuts, candied fruit and dark honey. Add mineral water.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening bouquet offers sedate fragrances of dried flowers and malted barley; aeration stimulates marginally bigger aromas of dried yellow fruit (baked banana), toasty oak barrel and still-vigorous spirit. Palate entry is succulent, honeyed and luscious; midpalate tastes of dates, figs, S'mores, cocoa butter, nougat and dark fudge. Finishes oily, buttery, honey-sweet and focused.
label: spirits_taster

description: Wonderful bouquet features aromas of sawdust, dry cheese, lanolin, wax paper, peatreek, chalk, kippers, unused band-aid, medicine chest and dried tobacco leaf. Palate entry offers flavors of tobacco smoke, smoked fish, honey and grain; midpalate adds tangy flavors of spiced rum, vanilla cake frosting, cocoa butter, milk chocolate and sweet oak. Concludes with vivid tastes of grain, cheese, dried fruit and brown sugar.
label: spirits_taster

description: The low-key bouquet offers intense breakfast cereal smells with meek scents of spice and dried flowers. Palate entry is assertive, spirity, malty-sweet and slightly candied; the midpalate tastes include harmonious flavors of honey wheat toast, light fudge, caramel, marshmallow, candied almond, candied orange peel and oaky vanilla. Concludes elegant yet attractively potent.
label: spirits_taster

description: Lovely, expansive bouquet includes scents of malted barley, baking spice, hearty spirit, toasted marshmallow, honeysuckle, fresh honey and dried citrus peel. Palate entry is firmly structured, moderately grainy sweet and features integrated flavors of honey wheat toast, dried apricot and wood resin; midpalate is slightly sweet, keenly resiny, grainy, toffee-like and tight. Finishes lean, crisp and dry.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is austere and leathery with curious aromas of beeswax, vegetable oil and oaky resin. Palate entry is focused on the resin; midpalate is splendidly multilayered and offers elements of black pepper, dried orange blossom, honeysuckle, dried fruit, sage, fennel and confections. Aftertaste is deep and unabashedly sweet and honeyed.
label: spirits_taster

description: First whiffs pick up garden fresh aromas of rose petals, jasmine and grain; further aeration stimulates elements of spice, newly tanned leather, citrus and grapes. Palate entry is wonderfully floral, fruity and winey; midpalate features spicy notes that complement the assertive grainy alcohol. Finishes medium-long, astringent, crisp, winey and satisfying.
label: spirits_taster

description: Nosing passes pick up very dry cereal and grain notes with background scents of newly tanned leather and paraffin. Palate entry is strong, structured, malty sweet, oaky and baking spicy; midpalate includes lovely flavors of light peat smoke, sweet grain, honey, Sherry, figs and yellow cherries. Ends up stately, elegant, firm and grainy sweet. An underrated and overlooked gem.
label: spirits_taster

description: Lovely smells of butterscotch, maple and baked pineapple first off; aeration and swirling stimulate fruity scents, in particular, banana, applesauce and baked pear. Entry offers delicately sweet tastes of ripe yellow fruit, oaky vanilla, cinnamon and nutmeg; at midpalate the fruit elements go into overdrive. Finish is long and biscuity. Sweet, uncomplicated taste enjoyment.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening sniffs find focused, lean woody/oaky/resiny notes; aeration rounds out the bouquet making it nicely corny sweet and peppery. Entry explodes with vivid tastes of oak, vanilla, brown sugar, and light toffee; midpalate features semi-rich flavors of dried fruits, pastry shop almond paste, and oak-influenced vanilla. Ends up sweet, woody, and a touch yeasty.
label: spirits_taster

description: Smells of yellow fruit, wax paper, paraffin and resin but, no graininess. Tastes of sweet corn, buttered popcorn, and corn syrup flavors come on strong; midpalate brings the oak factor and acidity into play and perfectly balances the corny sweetness. Finishes with tastes of loose leaf tobacco and honey.
label: spirits_taster

description: Not much aroma initially; following aeration time succulent notes of sweet grain, sweet oak, marzipan and nuts appear. Entry is firm, focused and moderately sweet and grainy; midpalate is intensely honeyed, featuring plump tastes of marshmallow, dark caramel, fudge, cake frosting and wood. Finishes sweet and full-bodied. Very good and straightforward.
label: spirits_taster

description: Fragrances of butterscotch, brown butter, toffee, dried pears and apple, as well as salt and old oak notes. Palate entry is toffee and butterscotch laden; midpalate is concentrated, toasty, buttermilk-like and full-weighted. Ends up heavily in the marzipan/light caramel/toffee “sweet zone” which, while not for everyone, works for me.
label: spirits_taster

description: Nosing passes find delicious aromas of roasted chestnuts, nectarines, apricots, banana, traces of jasmine, unbaked bread dough and yeast, and light honey. Palate entry is assertive and caramel sweet; midpalate is more integrated as layers of sweet grain and toffee intermingle with dried fruits (prunes), oaky spice and marzipan. Concludes sweet, oaky and a touch Sherried.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial inhalations detect lots of vibrant, salty, maritime aromas, including seaweed, coastal brine and smoke; aeration introduces deft traces of oak, Sherry, honey and dried fruits. Palate entry is acidic, clean, vigorous and properly oily; midpalate highlights include bittersweet flavors of toffee, cocoa bean, light honey and oak resin. Ends up long, spirity, clean and salty.
label: spirits_taster

description: The understated but appealing bouquet offers smells of rain-in-the-air, wet stone, wet pavement and minerals. Palate entry is far more expressive—juicy, crisp, astringent and nicely reminiscent of grape must; midpalate evolves further as the tastes expand to include orchard fruit as well as a ripe grapiness. Ends up rich, oily, velvety and minerally.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening whiffs encounter lively, herbal aromas of vinyl and fennel turning sweeter following aeration; it's a stinky bouquet but, bizarrely, I like it. Entry is sweet with tastes of honey, brown sugar, rutabaga, turnip and spices; midpalate showcases various spices that include cinnamon, vanilla and, most exotically, calamus. Strange, but I like it.
label: spirits_taster

description: Lackluster bouquet smells keenly vegetal and a little waxy without enough grapiness for balance. Palate entry is clean, acidic, astringent and grapy; midpalate features ripe grape roundness and charm that was lacking in the aroma. Ends moderately sweet, satiny and ripe. Crisp taste and satiny aftertaste made up for the underwhelming bouquet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is featureless offering at most a timid and ghostly graininess. Entry is clean, grainy sweet and mildly intriguing; midpalate offers little flavor impact.
label: spirits_taster

description: Delightful aromas of dill, asparagus, baked bread and black peppercorn; following aeration subtle notes of vanilla, just-sawn oak, loose leaf tobacco and fennel are added. Entry is poised, sap-like and delicately honeyed; midpalate is regal, satiny textured, rich in grapy yet vegetal and spicy flavor. Concludes long, layered and succulent.
label: spirits_taster

description: A beguiling rum bouquet offering pleasing biscuity smells and a natural juiciness. Palate entry finds succulent flavors of marshmallow, cotton candy and light caramel; midpalate is alive with chocolate-covered raisins, treacle, marzipan and candied almonds. Concludes smooth, rich, integrated and more bittersweet than all-out sweet. Luscious, world-class.
label: spirits_taster

description: No aromas other than traces of wet stone. Palate entry is surprisingly (after the undemonstrative bouquet) sweet, mellow and buttery in texture; midpalate continues the mild breakfast cereal sweetness in style and elegance; firm, oily texture is a real bonus on my scoring chart. Concludes delicately sweet, buttery and with loads of layered character.
label: spirits_taster

description: A blend of reposado, añejo and extra añejo Tequilas. Opening aroma is very ripe, oily and peppery; further aeration stimulates keenly acidic agave notes which allow an inherent saltiness to come through. Entry is off-dry and minerally (lead, slate); midpalate goes sweeter, more biscuity and vanilla-like than the drier entry. Finishes clean, smooth, creamy and savory.
label: spirits_taster

description: A very different rum bouquet offering ambrosial freshness. Palate entry is crisp, bittersweet and brief in staying power; midpalate tastes include baked pear, brown sugar, molasses and cake frosting. What this rum lacks in heft and texture it more than makes up for in keen freshness, a light touch and juiciness. Bravo.
label: spirits_taster

description: The assertive bouquet offers distinct scents of dried beans, grain kernels, buckwheat and brown rice. Palate entry is bittersweet, keenly black peppery, clean and oily in texture; midpalate stage adds pleasing, desert dry notes of slate and chalk. Finishes bittersweet, starchy, and acutely minerally. May be too much for drinkers who prefer their vodkas lithe and featureless.
label: spirits_taster

description: A particularly fruit-forward Cognac, look for candied--orange peel, ripe grapes and stone fruit on the first sips, which soon mellow to stewed-fruit flavors on the caramel--coated finish. Savory, mouthwatering rancio notes make for addictive sipping. Made with brandies aged 20–50 years.
label: spirits_taster

description: Peyrat is one of the few producers to focus on certified organic Cognac—this one is certified by France's Ecocert, with USDA certification still in the works. Organic or not, this is a beauty, rich in Sherry and birch beer-like notes, dappled with cinnamon and allspice. The dry finish suggests accents of spiced cocoa and leather.
label: spirits_taster

description: Rich and luxurious, this 12-year-old “Tres Vielle” Cognac offers deep toffee and hazelnut flavors, before tapering off to a cocoa and espresso-inflected finish. It's a well-structured brandy that puts you in mind of a leather club chair—you just want to close your eyes and sink into it.
label: spirits_taster

description: Like gingerbread in a glass, this topaz-hued and highly aromatic brandy offers bold baking spice, orange peel and floral notes, and an elegant, spicy finish, with flavors of ginger and clove.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bold and butterscotchy, this easy-drinking Cognac also has dried fruit and nutty tones, plus a saline touch that's reminiscent of salted caramel. There's a spicy flourish on the relatively dry finish. Delamain notes that it is one of the only Cognac houses to exclude VS and VSOP expressions from its portfolio, “its range starts where others end, with an X.O.”
label: spirits_taster

description: This copper--penny colored Cognac is best when allowed time to open, since it evolves in the glass. The nose offers notes of dried cherries, toffee and oak. The palate is light at first, with vanilla and warm caramel deepening to an unusually fruity finish full of rounded apricot and orange flavors. It's mouthwatering and delicious, perfect for pairing with fruit tarts and pies.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is particularly rich and complex, with notes of cocoa and apricot. On the palate, thick caramel and cocoa flavors lead, finishing with a perky baking-spice accent and hints of almond and apricot. If you can bear to squander a few ounces of a Cognac made from old vine grapes, consider making a Japanese cocktail—orgeat would complement the natural nuttiness.
label: spirits_taster

description: At the more precious end of Ferrand's offerings, it takes 90 bottles of wine and 70 years to make just one bottle of Ancestrale. It's undeniably delicious, with dark fruit notes that suggest brandied cherries, Port, ripe plums and cassis, finishing with a wash of dusty cocoa. The concentrated, rounded flavor may remind some of Bourbon.
label: spirits_taster

description: Although this dark amber Cognac has a mild aroma, it's full flavored on the tongue, boasting a toffee flavor with fruity edge and lots of spice. Overall, this is rich and warming, with a lingering finish to savor fireside.
label: spirits_taster

description: This XO needs time to open up and slough off a resiny note on the nose. Currently, the palate expresses an array of lip-smacking flavors: oak, toffee, coffee and a faint Sherry note. The finish is extremely long, with flavors of orange peel, stewed fruit and lots of cinnamon. Presented in an unusual teardrop-shaped bottle.
label: spirits_taster

description: With its nut-brown hue and brisk, warmly spiced aroma, this Cognac exudes dark toffee, cola, espresso and leather on the palate. Even into the finish, spice, toffee and dried fruit notes intertwine. Sip from a snifter to accompany a favorite dessert.
label: spirits_taster

description: This “selection of the angels” offers warm, enticing richness balanced by a freshness that keeps you coming back for more. Vanilla, hazelnut and fudge-like notes are enlivened by fleeting, disarming hints of fresh apples, pears and fall spices.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with Cognacs aged 15–35 years, this big, bold brandy has a thick toffee aroma that hints at espresso, followed by a rounded, plummy flavor and a spicy, mouthwatering finish. This would be a lovely accompaniment to a spice cake or chocolate cake, or served alongside coffee.
label: spirits_taster

description: Light, crisp and mixable if so desired, this brandy is scented with aromas of golden raisin and honey. On the palate, a flash of vanilla sweetness gives way to notes of oak, tea, allspice, leather and cocoa.
label: spirits_taster

description: Presented in a giftworthy teardrop-shaped bottle, the spirit tends toward the sweet side, bathing the tongue in caramel and vanilla, yet braced up with cinnamon, allspice and black pepper on the pleasantly dry finish. The bouquet features ripe grape and peach aromas, laced with vanilla.
label: spirits_taster

description: Graceful and dessert-like, this Cognac gives off toffee and fig aromas. It treads lightly on the palate, with creamy caramel, dried fruit and touches of allspice and dried orange peel on the palate, suggesting that it might be food-friendly enough to serve as an apéritif or alongside fruit desserts.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromas point to honey, vanilla, Sherry and nectarines. It warms as it goes down, with plenty of spice and dried fruit, and evolves on the palate from light (honey) to dark (dried orange peel, caramel, clove) in an intriguing way. Sip and ponder, perhaps with a few squares of dark chocolate.
label: spirits_taster

description: Big, bold and beautiful, this dark amber VSOP is perfumed with toffee, cola and hazelnut. On the palate, it's velvety and sweet, giving up lots of vanilla, toffee and allspice, and landing on a mouthwatering saline note.
label: spirits_taster

description: A mild vanilla aroma leads on the nose, but becomes more forceful and concentrated on the palate, backed by flavors of sweet caramel, toffee, baked apple and espresso.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is particularly complex, showing Sherried fruit, sweet vanilla, grapes and white flowers. On the palate, it's rounded with lots of fruit and a light touch of vanilla that unfolds to bolder caramel with repeated sips. The finish is floral.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bright aroma of honey and peaches doesn't quite prepare you for how big the flavors are the palate. With the first sip, rounded butterscotch and caramel flavors explode, matched by decadent fruity and syrupy undertones, like peaches in syrup, perked up by a spicy finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is a brandy with a dark side, featuring intense, sticky-sweet notes of cola, allspice, clove and toffee, with some alcohol warmth on the finish. The concentrated nature of this Cognac would make it a match for equally intense chocolaty desserts.
label: spirits_taster

description: Although the first sip is all creamy caramel, it develops a bit of an edge with repeated sips, introducing espresso, tea and cigar box notes, and providing delicacy and finesse.
label: spirits_taster

description: This sippable, dark gold Cognac offers aromas of butterscotch, dried apricot and golden raisins. The flavors grow even bolder and rounder on the exit, warmed by a cinnamon spark.
label: spirits_taster

description: Golden and slightly cloudy in appearance, this unusual Cognac has a pleasantly floral and honeyed aroma, with a touch of fresh pear. It's bolder on the palate, with lots of fruit, nut—particularly almond—and honey flavors, as well as crisp acidity. The finish fades into a light nuttiness, with a flick of ginger. Lighten it further with sparkling wine, or pair it with cheeses.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is made with a blend of brandies aged for a minimum of 20 years, but it's surprisingly light and fresh, perfumed with chamomile tea, cedar and honey. On the palate, these notes mingle with pear, lemon peel and ginger, finishing surprisingly crisp, with a snap of alcohol.
label: spirits_taster

description: Big, sweet and boozy, this VSOP offers rich caramel aromas and flavors alongside lots of spice and a mouthwatering saline tang on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged in oak barrels for a minimum of 24 months (a relatively short spell for the Cognac universe), this honey-hued spirit still boasts bold aromas of vanilla and pear. The flavor profile is sweet, with lots of vanilla, buttered toast and a surprisingly long finish, touched with baking spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: This VS starts out gentle and sweet, showing vanilla, hazelnut and stone fruit flavors, but it dries to a spicy finish, with notes of nutmeg, cinnamon and black pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Like candy in a glass, this bold brandy overflows with butterscotch and caramel notes and finishes with ginger, cinnamon and candied-lemon peel accents. A delectable pairing with crème brûlée or other creamy desserts, or poured over ice cream.
label: spirits_taster

description:
Aggressive bouquet is intensely viny, almost stemmy and pomace-like in the first nosings; aeration 
doesn't tame it. Significantly more settled in the mouth, as voluptuous, concentrated flavors of grapes and tangerine take command of the palate. Aftertaste is long and intensely grapey.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose is very and unevolved in first minutes; only minimal stimulation brought about by aeration in the forms of faint pear and wood scents. Far better in the mouth, as focused tastes of ripe grapes, old oak resin and candied nuts greet the taste buds; midpalate shows a bit of fire along with fruit, wood and spirit. Finishes sweet, balanced and fruity.
label: spirits_taster

description: Harvest-gold color. Delicate aroma is lightly oaked and pleasantly spicy through all four nosings. Palate entry offers vanilla and candy-like flavors; midpalate goes deeper with tastes of marzipan and toffee. Finishes semisweet, oaky and mildly fruity. Not the peak achievement of this great Cognac house, but still very savory.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pale straw color. Nose is vibrant and brimming with off-dry, slightly candied and metallic scents of pine tar and damp vegetation. On the palate, it's clean and keenly off-dry. Aftertaste smacks of roots and tree bark. Round, carefree and beguiling.
label: spirits_taster

description: Gold amber hue. Pleasantly zesty, piquant, floral and maize-like in the first sniffings, goes fruity in later whiffs. My palate is shocked by the graceful bearing and generous flavors of this blend. Finishes in waves of caramel, charcoal and English toffee. One of the better inexpensive Scotch blends around. Buy by the magnum. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Straw yellow, white wine appearance. Perfumey, but gentle, bouquet offers hints of quinine, minerals, wine and citrus. Tart and acidic at palate entry; midpalate is clean, fresh, dry, winey, mildly citrusy and spicy. Aftertaste is brief, refreshing and squeaky clean. Elegant and sophisticated. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clear as spring water. The saucy, piquant bouquet reminiscent of jalapeño peppers and Tabasco sauce; later sniffings pick up an almost Tequila-like herbaceousness. Sassy, mildly prickly and intensely peppery on the tongue. Aftertaste is notable for its sudden burst of spicy heat that then warmly fades in the throat. Bloody Mary, anyone?
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosings detect distant echoes of grape and must; aeration allows off-dry aromas of juicy fresh berries and grape stems to join the rustic pomace perfume. In the mouth, it's subtle, potent and creamy at entry; midpalate is concentrated and viscous. Aftertaste is sweet and long.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bronze color. A bit of pleasantly prickly spirit opens up the nose, then that blows off, leaving behind mild but substantial scents of beeswax, butter, marzipan and raisins.
