description: With its bold, sweet coconut aroma and flavor, this vodka should appeal to piña colada lovers seeking a lighter alternative. The big, long-lasting coconut flavor veers more toward candy-like than authentic tropical fruit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Glowing bright amber-orange in the glass, this cinnamon-scented vodka offers woody, cinnamon stick and stewed apple flavors, finishing quite spicy. Consider this a starting point for autumn punches and spiced sangrias.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bold, fruity aroma brings to mind lemon curd mixed with piña colada. On the palate, look for an assertive lemon lollipop flavor with a coconutty, slightly bitter exit. Directed at dieters who don't want to give up tropical drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: The juicy peach fragrance and flavor is clean and not too sweet, giving a true impression of the stone fruit's essence. Consider mixing with iced tea or add to cocktails for a summery touch.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is fruity, warm and grapy. It's sweet and easy to sip, although it tastes like neither blueberry nor pomegranate; it's more of a generally sweet and comforting fruit-punch flavor.
label: spirits_taster

description: Scented with sweet peach notes, use this vodka to add aromatics to cocktails. It has a modest amount of peach flavor, a good silky texture and balanced alcohol feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bottle is tinted the lurid red of the famous hot sauce, so it's a surprise when the vodka pours out crystal clear. The eye--watering garlic-chili aroma is reminiscent of sriracha. Although this novelty vodka doesn't have the addictive spicy-sweetness that makes the hot sauce such a must-have, it still adds sizzle to a bloody Mary or other savory drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: No fake peach flavoring here: you'll see the fruit segments bobbing in the bottle, and detect it in the pleasantly sweet, true-peach scent. Perhaps because the vodka is made from a corn base, the bright tawny liquid is reminiscent of peach-flavored Bourbon: it has a boozy presence, and a long finish that hints at vanilla and bruised peaches.
label: spirits_taster

description: When this collaboration with cinnamon bun maker Cinnabon rolled out in December 2013, jaws dropped—some with delight, some with dismay. So how is it? In a word, sweet, from the caramel aroma to the vanilla-maple flavor backed with cinnamon sizzle. Overall, it makes for pleasant sipping—and it's surely an excellent conversation piece.
label: spirits_taster

description: A good entry-level pepper vodka for those afraid of heat, this is on the mild side. It's almost neutral at first, and takes a couple of sips before a black pepper note emerges, which builds gradually. Mixed with other ingredients—particularly sweet mixers—you might not even notice it's there.
label: spirits_taster

description: Like alcoholic fruit punch, this confected vodka tastes fruity, but not like any specific fruit. Rather, it's sweet and wholly candy-like, with sugar-dusted pineapple and raspberry-like aromas and flavors.
label: spirits_taster

description: This potato-based vodka has a juicy green-apple aroma. At first sip, the punchy but ersatz green apple note takes center stage, with just a hint of baking spice on the finish. It's soft in feel and accessible.
label: spirits_taster

description: The cherry lollipop scent is the attraction here. On the palate, look for strong sweetness and ersatz cherry candy flavor, plus a welcome touch of vanilla on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This deliberately candy-like vodka opens with mild sweetness, followed by a tart, acidic green apple twang, which gives way to a mouthwatering sensation of salted caramel that comes through on the finish. Each flavor is very distinct rather than melding together.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aimed at the calorie-conscious tippler, this vodka has a pleasant cherry aroma and less alcohol than most other flavored vodkas. It's clear in the glass, and most of the ersatz, slightly bitter cherry flavor is on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This corn-based vodka is infused with Japanese chili pods, which are visible floating in the bottle. And that's the problem: left infusing in alcohol, chili peppers will continue to give up heat. Although there's an attractive savoriness at first, just three sips in and the result is almost unbearable capsaicin heat. Recommended for serious daredevil chili-heads only.
label: spirits_taster

description: This elegant blanco features gentle floral notes, agave sweetness and a refreshing touch of minerality, finishing crisp and peppery. Shows surprising finesse for an unaged Tequila.
label: spirits_taster

description: Zesty and spicy, this highlands Tequila shows dried herbs, jalapeño, lemon peel and black pepper, all wrapped up in a clean finish. The alcohol levels feel surprisingly restrained for a blanco. Consider pairing alongside rich or fried foods.
label: spirits_taster

description: A refined, classic take on blanco, this Tequila has a soft feel and rounded agave sweetness. The peppery heat—more cayenne and cinnamon than vegetal jalapeño—is muted at first, but builds with repeated sips.
label: spirits_taster

description: Co-owned by actor George Clooney and nightlife impresario Rande Gerber, this blanco is smooth and light. The aromas are restrained, but on the palate look for mild agave sweetness backed by lemon zest, ginger and white pepper sparks, plus a candied lemon-peel note on the gentle exit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Inside the handsome, hefty bottle are spice-rack aromas. But the flavors are light and complex, interlacing honey with lime zest, mineral and faint white flowers that float off at the end. A top pick for pitchers of high-end margaritas.
label: spirits_taster

description: Categorized as a “half-bitter,” this ruddy brown spirit is complex and pleasing, mixing brandied cherry, candied orange peel, caramel, mild horehound and allspice, with just a hint of amaro bitterness on the exit. All together, the flavors suggest Christmas cake studded with candied fruit. Mix or sip.
label: spirits_taster

description: This lime-green, anise-scented liqueur is sweet at first sip, then herbaceous in the middle, showing fennel, pine, tarragon and mild floral notes. The finish is spicy and warming, with anise, white pepper and ginger heat. It's a bit too viscous and fiery for straight-up sipping, but it's beautifully complex and a key ingredient for the classic Last Word and other cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Deep purple-brown in the glass, the aroma mixes jammy cherry and raspberry with eucalyptus. The palate walks the line between lightly sweet and lightly bitter, mingling herbaceous root beer notes with faint but refreshing mint and a mildly bitter edge. Recommended as a digestif or for cocktail mixing (i.e. Negroni-style drinks).
label: spirits_taster

description: This ruddy amaro has a deep fruity nose, like strawberry jam mixed with light herbal notes. The flavor is pleasant, showing root and bark notes, a light mintiness, and smoothed over with sweet orange peel, cocoa and vanilla. Feels light and finishes with a slight lilt of mint. Sip or mix, only mildly bitter.
label: spirits_taster

description: Categorized as a “half-bitter,” this pleasant sipper smells like root beer, plus a bracing, breezy eucalyptus note. It's sweet and gingerbread-like on the palate at first, with notes of ginger, anise, allspice and a hint of molasses. Pleasant sipping, it's herbal but not at all bitter.
label: spirits_taster

description: Reminiscent of birch beer, this amaro has a brown hue and a relatively sweet, mellow molasses-like flavor, with a hefty twang of anise midpalate followed by pine and licorice on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: With a concentrated spearmint aroma, this liqueur has a chocolaty core and plenty of cooling mint, like a mint-chocolate cookie with a moderately bitter edge. Use to sass up a classic Grasshopper or other drinks that call for crème de cacao.
label: spirits_taster

description: Amber and cloudy, this spirit looks and smells almost like brewed herbal tea. Starting with honeyed sweetness up front, a mild walnut bitterness dries the palate and keeps it from becoming cloying. The finish mixes honey, orange peel and cinnamon-clove spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: This special edition amaro is barrel-aged for 12 months. It's brown in the glass and has an intense herbal aroma of mint and a touch of chocolate. Bitter espresso, dark chocolate and walnut lead, chased by mild vanilla sweetness and a hint of clove.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for rich, mildly sweet cocoa, sarsaparilla and espresso notes, with spearmint building into a cooling finish reminiscent of mint-chocolate Girl Scout cookies. Not too bitter, this is a pleasant sipper.
label: spirits_taster

description: This rum-based hibiscus liqueur has a deep black-cherry hue and deep, juicy, fruity scent mixed with dried herb notes. It's warming and jammy on the palate, with loads of dark fruit. The floral finish overlaps with a lingering fruit compote note that practically begs for mixing into Kir-style cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Ruddy brown in the glass, this pleasing sipper layers vanilla, chocolate, caramel and cola, finishing herbaceous and mildly bittersweet. Recommended for dessert pairings.
label: spirits_taster

description: Take a cue from the deep, dark-brown hue and viscous texture: This is a palate-coating liqueur with deep, dark flavors of espresso, bitter chocolate, dark gingerbread, toffee and dried fig, cut with a mild bitter-orange note and cardamom spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: This rosy Italian-inspired liqueur will remind some of a USA-made version of Aperol. The juicy, bittersweet grapefruit profile, with a dried-herb undercurrent is ideal for spritzes and other aperitif cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: This relatively gentle amaro supposedly tastes like artichokes. Instead, the palate finds mellow dark chocolate, walnut and allspice, finishing bittersweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bartender John Ueding contributed to this citrusy sipper. It has a bright-orange appearance and mellow, a mild aroma that hints at sarsaparilla. Sweetened with agave nectar, it's viscous and relatively sweet up front, but dries to show cinnamon bark, bitter orange peel and plenty of clove and black pepper on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Created with direction by Atlanta bartender Miles Macquarrie, this bright amber amaro seems custom-made for tiki drinks. It's relatively syrupy, with a bright, fruity aroma and a relatively sweet profile that delivers plenty of vanilla, lime, sarsaparilla and an allspice finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: With its vibrant garnet hue and raspberry jam scent, this spirit has an initial juicy, bright fruitiness, with a fleeting sweetness midpalate and a barely perceptible bitter orange finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is an intense digestif, decidedly on the bitter side of the spectrum but not tongue-curlingly so. With an espresso hue and solid menthol aroma, expect concentrated  flavors featuring bitter chocolate, coffee and anise, with a very minty finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Inspired by an 18th century vermouth formula, this amaro coats the palate with dark flavors that evoke dried figs, dates and oloroso sherry. There's a moderately intense bitterness and drying oakiness on the midpalate, rounding out to a boozy espresso and chocolate finish. The producer recommends mixing with Champagne.
label: spirits_taster

description: This liqueur is made in Italy's Trentino region, where chamomile flowers grow in the mountains. Honey is the dominant note on the nose and palate, mingled with nutmeg, cardamom and vanilla, plus spearmint on the finish. Made with a grappa base.
label: spirits_taster

description: Amber and cloudy in the glass, this amaro has a ripe, fruity aroma, suggesting fresh peach, maple and baking spice. It's peachy up front on the palate, but finishes quite spicy, with a cayenne and habanero heat that grows increasingly fiery with every mouthwatering sip.
label: spirits_taster

description: Created with direction by NYC bartenders Demario Wallace and Joaquin Simo, this amaro has an apple-ginger profile that seems just right for autumn-inspired drinks. It has a maple hue and cloudy appearance and a eucalyptus-forward aroma, with a fruity undertone that evokes fresh red apples. It's relatively viscous, quite sweet and fruity at first, though that's soon cut with bitterness on the midpalate and an intensely gingery zing on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: New to the market and developed specifically for cocktails, this higher-octane version of classic Cynar offers bold allspice and star anise up front, dark chocolate and vanilla on the midpalate, and finishes spiced and lightly bitter, with a flicker of alcohol heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Enjoyable as a digestif, this deep brown amaro is fairly sweet and reminiscent of root beer at first taste. The midpalate shows perky allspice and vanilla while the finish brings a smooth chocolate note that is almost imperceptibly bitter. The producer recommends serving with ice cream or other sweets.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a deep poppy-red hue and grapefruit aroma in this liqueur. It's hard not to compare the lightly bitter flavor profile to the popular Campari, though this easy drinker is a little softer, lighter and sweeter, and has a light floral fade. The label is particularly fun, featuring a handsome Italian waiter offering an aperitivo on a tray.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made in Berlin's oldest distillery, this thick, golden liqueur is scented like honey, hay and dried herbs. The flavor is concentrated and sweet, showing honey and vanilla, plus flicks of butterscotch and baking spice on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This nut-brown liqueur, known best as a college shooter, has a sophisticated side, too. Look for a root-like nose that hints at sarsaparilla and a spiced, warming palate that suggests cinnamon, gingerbread, molasses and clove.
label: spirits_taster

description: A classic liqueur best known as a key ingredient in the Harvey Wallbanger, this bright yellow liqueur has an anise scent and is viscous. On the palate, look for a concentrated anise flavor backed by sweet vanilla, finishing with a flicker of ginger and pepper heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Italian-inspired amaro is barrel-aged for 30-45 days. Deep brown in the glass, with an intense caraway and anise aroma, the spirit has an earthy funkiness. The palate shows some molasses sweetness and lots of caraway, finishing with an allspice spark.
label: spirits_taster

description: Billed as “New England style rum,” distilled entirely from molasses, this rum features a powerful pungency that evokes overripe fruit on the nose and palate. It morphs from funky banana to a more delicate yet lingering lychee-kissed finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clear and scented like coconut, this flavored rum has sweet flavors of coconut and vanilla. A note of resin comes through on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Patrón's first-ever extra añejo is aged at least three years, and is named for the stone wheel (piedra) that crushes agave to make Tequila. It has an amber hue and a rich aroma that mixes caramel, dried fruit and peppery notes. The palate is silky and rounded, with lots of caramel and oak up front, tapering off gently with anise, ginger and cinnamon.
label: spirits_taster

description: This unusual crystal-clear añejo, launched in June 2015, seems to be aiming for the premium vodka nightclub crowd. The bottling mixes añejo with extra añejo, plus a hint of agave nectar. Tequila purists likely won't approve, but the subtle coconut-pineapple-vanilla flavor profile—more drying and astringent than rum or vodka—seems ideal for mixing tropical cocktails and is addictive to sip.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged for three and a half years in former Scotch barrels, this extra añejo, introduced in November 2015, has an amber hue and mixes honey and pepper in the aromatics, plus a rich maple threat. It's velvety, well-structured and mouthwatering, showing an assertive cooked agave and honey note that dries to raucous baking spice and jalapeño, plus a raisin and chipotle note on the finish. Ideal as a digestif.
label: spirits_taster

description: A special edition for the company's five-year anniversary, this Tequila was aged a full five years in Napa Valley wine barrels that previously held Merlot and Cabernet. The end result is a tawny, rose-gold hue and lovely, complex fragrance that melds floral, fruity and honeyed agave, spiced up with peppery hints. At 100 proof, it's understandably fiery, but mellows with some dilution to a juicy-sweet profile that shows orange, red fruit and honey, finishing long, spiced and warm.
label: spirits_taster

description: This golden Tequila balances honey and lighter jalapeño and bell pepper notes for a classic profile, finishing with vanilla, ripe banana and echoes of cinnamon and clove. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: Hitting all the right notes, this 18-month-aged añejo melds tropical fruit and fresh-cut apple with silky vanilla and agave nectar, finishing on a brisk peppery-cinnamon note.
label: spirits_taster

description: Though it seems shy in the glass, with its light-gold hue and mild vanilla fragrance, on the palate this añejo is quite bold, with caramel and vanilla drying to leather, baker's chocolate, cinnamon and a hint of dried fig. Addictive and easy sipping.
label: spirits_taster

description: This lush Tequila has a caramel and maple profile, shored up with plenty of baking spice and jalapeño. It finishes long with enticing touches of espresso, leather, baking spice and burnt orange peel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Remarkably light for an añejo, look for a bracingly peppery aroma and pale straw hue. It's feather-soft on the palate, with notes of pineapple and jalapeño pepper that fade into the pleasant finish of vanilla and spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: It would be easy to mistake this añejo for a Cognac: the rich, complex aroma suggests stone fruit and caramel, like an aged brandy. It's soft and rounded on the tongue, with peach and apricot, almond and hazelnut, and vanilla. Only the spicy finish—baking spice, cayenne, black pepper—gives it away as Tequila.
label: spirits_taster

description: Soft rose gold in the glass, this añejo has a distinctly sweet, rich fragrance, like vanilla syrup. That rounded sweetness is echoed on the palate, with vanilla, almond and toffee, drying to allspice, clove, leather and espresso. Overall, it drinks a bit like an overproof bourbon. Aged up to 16 months in American oak barrels then blended with a touch of extra añejo.
label: spirits_taster

description: Lunazul's first special-edition Tequila is a reposado that is blended with extra añejo Tequila and finished in barrels that previously held Heaven Hill wheated bourbon. It has a light gold hue and zesty oregano, bell pepper and honey scents, all echoed on the palate. This balanced Tequila sips well, showing vanilla and subtle mint up front before fading into herbaceous oregano, jalapeño, white pepper and cinnamon, and faint cookie dough and vanilla. New starting October 2015.
label: spirits_taster

description: This certified organic Tequila has a bold pineapple fragrance, with a hint of vanilla. More vanilla shows on the palate, plus caramel, toffee and a warm, toasty flavor reminiscent of roasted coffee beans, finishing with an explosion of clove and black pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: This small batch Tequila aged over 25 months in barrels that previously held Garrison Brothers straight whiskey. The end result is a rounded palate of caramel and toffee, perked up with baking spice and jalapeño sparks, plus a welcome floral delicacy on the exhale. Bottled at a rollicking 100 proof, some dilution is needed for sipping; the bold, intriguing flavors hold up when water is added.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bright gold in the glass, look for a fresh and breezy aroma that mixes grassy notes with gentle vanilla. It's light and soft on the palate, showing honey, pepper and banana before finishing on baking spice and spearmint notes.
label: spirits_taster

description: Brisk and light, this añejo has a pale straw hue and a scent tinged with vanilla and fresh apple. On the palate, look for vanilla, cooling mint, and a brisk flurry of black pepper and a mouthwatering saline touch on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged for 18 months, this easy sipper has a pale gold hue and mild honey aroma. It's mellow and light on the palate, mixing honey and vanilla with a slightly drying flurry of nutmeg, ginger and cinnamon.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged 18 months in American oak barrels to deliberately create whiskey-like flavors, this maple-hued añejo has a concentrated, distinctly sweet aroma that hints at vanilla and tropical fruit. On the palate, this Tequila is soft and slightly viscous, with a cookie dough-like sweetness plus traces of allspice, cocoa and clove. The finish is lightened by tropical-fruit tones.
label: spirits_taster

description: The golden hue and subtly sweet tropical-fruit scent suggests a gentle sip. But this añejo explodes on the palate with vanilla, jalapeño, tropical fruit, cinnamon and clove. There's plenty of bold flavor, but it's also spicy and fiery from the first sip—it's 100 proof, and don't you forget it.
label: spirits_taster

description: This golden Tequila has an herbaceous aroma that suggests fresh basil and a hint of pineapple. The palate shows lots of vanilla—peppered with drying, spicy-hot dashes of cayenne, cinnamon and black pepper—and smoothed by a hint of tropical fruit on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This clear Tequila has a sweet honey-vanilla scent and clean, dry palate. Most of the flavor is on the finish, showing oak, vanilla and tingly cayenne pepper. Packaged in an expensive-looking cut glass bottle and billed as “the world's first platinum extra añejo,” this Tequila is aged in American whiskey and French Bordeaux barrels for 8 to 10 years.
label: spirits_taster

description: Fifteen months in former Jack Daniels whiskey barrels creates an añejo with a rich caramel aroma underscored by a green pepper note. On the palate, the vegetal notes come forward, showing green pepper and fresh jalapeño followed by a wash of vanilla and caramel. Each sip finishes with clove and allspice accents, plus a surprising tinge of cocoa and espresso.
label: spirits_taster

description: Burnished gold in the glass, this silky Tequila has a mild honey and pear aroma. The palate mixes agave and jalapeño, finishing spicy-hot with mouthwatering black pepper, cayenne and jalapeño.
label: spirits_taster

description: This limited edition añejo has a light gold hue and a pleasingly fresh, fruity aroma of apples and pears. The palate goes in a different direction, with vegetal jalapeño pepper and prickles of cardamom and cinnamon, finishing with light touches of banana and vanilla.
label: spirits_taster

description: Matured in ex-bourbon barrels for 18 months, this añejo has a soft gold hue and fruity aroma that suggests apples and pears, plus vanilla and a faint white flower note. On the palate, vanilla and fruit sweetness lead, but that's promptly overpowered by a sting of alcohol, fading to cinnamon and clove sizzle on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with añejo Tequila, agave nectar and spices, this viscous liqueur has a bold, sweet, nutty aroma reminiscent of amaretto or pecan liqueur. That nutty sweetness comes through on the palate, but accompanied by a surprising and fiery cayenne pepper singe on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This spirit is añejo Tequila infused with fiery Serrano peppers and cinnamon. The golden liquid has a sweet aroma, though it's clear that chile pepper notes lurk beneath the surface. It's fiery at first sip, with plenty of heat and a faint fruitiness behind that. Unfortunately, there's more fire than flavor, and all but the most diehard chileheads will find the heat a bit much to tolerate. Mix with pineapple juice or other sweet mixers to temper the heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Created with direction from Chicago bartender Mike Ryan, this is almost like a bottled cocktail. It's burnished copper and cloudy in the glass, with a dynamite citrus-vanilla nose reminiscent of a well-made daiquiri. It feels light on the palate, with a rich cocoa edge, subtle orange-peel bitterness and finishing with ginger, cinnamon and white pepper sparks.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet shows a strong, assertive aroma of wheat cracker, wheat bread, ointment, and fusel oil. The palate entry is rough, spirity and raw on the tongue; the bitter tasting midpalate is the best feature of this otherwise underwhelming vodka. Finishes up raw, harsh and prickly in the throat.
label: spirits_taster

description: The dazzling bouquet includes scents of malted barley, oatmeal, prunes, dark toffee, dark honey and double cream. Palate entry is warm, semisweet, caramel-like and woody; at midpalate charcoal, oloroso Sherry, dark honey, marzipan, candied walnut and even a touch of rancio are added. Aftertaste is warm with long-lasting oily/buttery/creamy flavors. A wonderful whisky. Limited availability at selected retailers.
label: spirits_taster

description:
The nosing passes find smoky, pipe tobacco-like peat reek but the peatiness found here differs from Islay peatiness with sweeter, earthier, more smoky/ashy scents. The palate 
entry taste is sweet and tobacco leaf -like; the midpalate continues smoky with added subtle notes of honey and caramel. Finishes prickly, warm and alluringly sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers mature yet still vivid scents of oak, dried fruit and cream. The palate entry is round, succulent, rich, and even tobacco-like; at midpalate almond paste, caramel and honey are added to the flavor. The finish is elegant, pleasingly rich and sweet, and intensely nutty.
label: spirits_taster

description: The toasted bouquet features nuts, burnt toast, cashews and cream. The palate entry is divinely creamy and only moderately sweet; the midpalate stage highlights the sweet buttery cream and café au lait. Finishes satiny smooth, creamy and luscious. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The vibrant, bittersweet bouquet is citrusy, herbal, floral and earthy. The palate entry is bittersweet, intensely herbal and earthy but refreshingly orange citrusy; the tasty midpalate is marked by heightened sweetness and a more mineral-like core flavor. Finish is savory and bittersweet. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is appealing, ripe, fruity and berry-like. The palate entry is pomegranate-like, extremely sour, acidic and tart; the midpalate is less aggressive and riper. Finishes tart, amazingly clean and ripe. A wonderful cocktail ingredient.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosing passes find fruity aromas with a dash of sweet oak; aeration dries out the fruitiness while oaky astringency and bean-like vanilla characteristics prevail. The palate entry is parchment-like, nutty and mildly toasty; at midpalate the flavor profile is Sherry- and honey-like. Finishes semisweet, medium sappy/piney and compellingly warm. Available via auction only.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find lightly toasted malt notes along with wood, sawdust, distant mint, and light caramel—not the most expressive Highland Park bouquet. The palate entry highlights the maltiness; at midpalate the taste becomes sweeter and honey like complementing the grain/malt base. Finishes assertively with the spirit underlining the honeyed sweetness.
label: spirits_taster

description: A composed Islay bouquet with scents of grain mash, new leather, seaweed, sea air and peat. The palate entry is first astringent, smoky and briny and then semisweet and malty; the midpalate stage is moderately oily, oaky sweet, and tobacco- and cocoa-like. Finishes gracefully, focusing on the natural smokiness of Islay malts. Well done. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: An elegant bouquet featuring scents of new leather, dried fruit, pine needle, oak, nuts and lanolin. The palate entry is enticingly sweet; the midpalate is honeyed, creamy and smooth. Concludes gracefully with reined-in notes of sautéed butter, roasted walnuts, nougat, honey and dark caramel.
label: spirits_taster

description: The anemic bouquet offers only distant scents of malt and wood. The palate entry counters the bouquet by offering delicious, sweet tastes of candy, cream, marzipan and butter; at midpalate the oak impact becomes more apparent with honeyed, sherried, vanilla and cocoa butter flavors. Concludes smooth and cocoa-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is floral, herbal and root-like with elegant scents of flowers, and spices. The palate entry is herbal and almost sour; at the midpalate there are melded flavors of mint, sage, fennel, quinine, thyme and honey. Concludes more sweet than sour and delicately herbal/rooty. Lovely and elegant.
label: spirits_taster

description: The fetching bouquet is anything but bitter with floral and fruity notes with scents of black pepper, parchment and kale. The palate entry is sweet and cherry cola-like; at midpalate the berry/red fruit character comes to the fore. Finishes satiny smooth, ropey in texture and almost like chocolate orange. Very nice. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: A modest aroma of tropical fruit and white grapes. The palate entry features tangy, fresh flavors of pineapple and grapefruit; by midpalate sweet tastes of honey and chocolate cake frosting have joined the tropical fruit components. Finishes gently sweet and smooth.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find scents of palm oil, old leather, dried herbs and minerals. The palate entry tastes of meringue, light toffee, egg cream, and vanilla bean; by midpalate the flavors include marzipan, nougat, and candied nuts. Ends up sweet and satiny, but not profound.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find plenty of coffee bean bitterness dominating the anise/licorice scents. The palate entry is well balanced between the sambucca and the coffee flavoring; at midpalate the taste continues to feature a the deep, rich black coffee flavor. Ends medium-long, bittersweet to sweet and cocoa-like; very pleasing. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma features juicy orange scents mingled with zesty peel bitterness. The palate entry is fruity and sweet with a background astringency countering the sweetness; the midpalate stage is correctly bittersweet and juicy. Finishes with a nice shot of orange zest.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is slightly skimpy with ethereal notes of spirit, grapes and light oak. The palate entry highlights the delicacy of the sweet, caramel-like taste; enticing flavors of cocoa, toffee and molasses are added at the midpalate. Finishes with a welcome burst of sweet, silky flavor. It's fey and immature but very palatable and better than average for a VS.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet after aeration offers nicely melded scents of green leaves, distant herbs and mild spices. The palate entry is concentrated, herbal, leafy, vinous and only mildly spiced; the midpalate is round, gently sweet and subtle. Finishes stately with finesse and controlled power. A good runner-up to Chartreuse.
label: spirits_taster

description:
The aroma is nutty and kernel-like with a bit of a metallic-like odor. The palate entry is nicely sweet and pea pod-like; at midpalate the pod- and seed-like flavor shows a flash of bitterness that's quickly covered 
by the sweetness. Finishes well in a silky way. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find scents of aniseed and licorice with additional aromas of lead pencil and linseed oil. The palate entry is correctly licorice-like and syrupy; at midpalate the sweetness accelerates and accentuates the aniseed and waxy texture. Finishes long, mildly bittersweet and even a touch quinine-like. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes pick up tangy scents of dill, anise and sage. The palate entry is sweetly herbal and root-like; the midpalate stage is intensely herbal with dashes of fennel and quinine. Ends up concentrated, medicinal and wildly herbal.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose offers subtle notes of coconut, tobacco and baked pear. The palate entry is citrusy and moderately sweet; the midpalate stage features fruit and spices tastes with a pleasant oaky core. Finishes caramel-like, sweet, mildly oaky and silky.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose features scents of caramel, nougat and quince. The palate entry adds an inviting malty sweetness; the hard candy sweetness is heightened at midpalate as the malt flavor increases. Concludes light, amiable and savory.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find scents of sweet, ripe grapes, butter; oaky vanilla, dates, raisins and worn saddle leather. The palate entry is sweet and very ripe and milk chocolate-like; at the midpalate tasty notes of apple butter, cream and cocoa are added. Concludes concentrated, sweet and moderately oaky.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet only offers traces of lemon drop, cotton and some meek scents of malt and oak. The pleasing palate entry is grainy/breakfast cereal sweet; midpalate highlights the sweetness of the malt which is balanced by some astringency. Ends up simple, very tasty and pleasant.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosing passes find scents of nuts, old leather and milk chocolate; after aeration the leather scent dominates. The palate entry is long, sweet, toffee-like and medium fat; the midpalate's taste features caramel, nougat, and sautéed almonds with oaky vanilla at the core. Finishes well with a creamy texture.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose is tired, dusty, limply sweet and raisiny. The palate is more characterful and offers ripe flavors of dates, figs, raisins and prunes. The aftertaste is long, intensely fruity and ripe, if a bit flabby. For fanciers of older, sweeter brandies who don't mind a little corpulence.
label: spirits_taster

description:
The bouquet is compellingly straightforward and delicately sweet with grapey/pineapple-like notes. The palate entry is pineapple-like, gently ripe and sweet; the midpalate highlights the fruitiness and downplays any acidity 
or woodiness. A young, vigorous, fruity Cognac best used as a mixer.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is oily, fat and pleasantly anise-like. The palate entry is a tad harsh and more minerally than botanical; the midpalate is pleasant, if indistinct from many other good but not great sambucas. Concludes well as the anise flavor finally steps up to the plate in the throat.
label: spirits_taster

description: A peculiar but not unpleasant aroma that is herbal, minerally and strangely like peanut shells. The palate entry is sweet, fig-like, and even a little nutty; at midpalate the flavor focuses on the oak/resin qualities that meld well with the fruit/nut element. The finish is dry, buttery and a touch hot.
label: spirits_taster

description: An amazing bouquet that oozes with scents of pears, banana bread, figs and toasty malt. The palate entry is rich, salty and dense; the midpalate features succulent flavors of dates, grapes, sautéed bananas, sweet malt, sea breeze, sweet oak and honey. Ends up sweet, compelling, and idiosyncratic. Worth every cent and more.
label: spirits_taster

description: A sophisticated rum perfume that shows clear influences of the Syrah. The palate entry is satiny, medium-sweet and pear-like; the midpalate displays flavors of baked pear, pineapple and grapes that meld to honey sweet tastes of cane spirit. Concludes medium-sweet, very smooth and cake-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: There is no stopping this aroma which includes scents of grapes, oranges, cotton, tar, wood shavings, fruitcake, chocolate covered cherries and candied almond. The palate entry is fruity and ripe; the midpalate highlights honey, Sherry, baked apple and ruby Port. Finishes warm, sweet, ripe and jammy. Add mineral water before tasting. A landmark achievement for this still-young distillery. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The early-on maritime aroma is followed after aeration by delectable smells of melon, red berries and red grapes. The heady, fiery entry is toasty warm; at midpalate the fruit comes alive again and continues through to the ripe, berry-like aftertaste. The addition of spring water brings out sweet notes of wood and malted barley. Delicious.
label: spirits_taster

description: The vividly spirity aroma includes a fruit presence that turns slightly sweeter, more complex and peppery as the bouquet deepens following aeration. The palate entry is peppery, spicy, nougaty and bittersweet; the midpalate offers multiple layers of flavor, including baked pear, white raisins, maple and molasses. Ends elegantly with subtle elements of raisins.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial bouquet is spicy, lean, and cream soda-like but doesn't expand with aeration. The delicate palate entry features a cocoa-like bittersweet taste; the midpalate is oaky and vanilla-like with a molasses sweetness. The finish includes flavors of dates, fudge, vanilla bean and cocoa.
label: spirits_taster

description:
Everything about the intriguing bouquet says “old”, though not necessarily “tired” as the aroma includes whiffs of butterscotch, sautéed butter, nougat, cigar ash, mushroomy rancio and leathery, dusty scents. The palate entry oozes sweet notes of dark chocolate, coffee bean and honey; the midpalate finds tastes of nougat and candy bar. 
Finishes intensely sweet and rich.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes detect a lackluster aroma of weary spirit, old newspaper and astringent oak. The palate entry is assertively spirity, mildly sweet and a tad grainy; the midpalate is more expressive as richly sweet tastes of marzipan and toffee emerge. Finishes well, stately, and surprisingly well-endowed. Add a splash of mineral water.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is soft, perfumed and orangey. The palate entry is oily, peel-like, orangey  and mildly bittersweet; the midpalate stage is lovely, elegant, gently bittersweet, and very like orange candy. Concludes softly, tart, and bittersweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is pleasantly minty and vegetal. The palate entry is clean and focused; the midpalate displays a delicate touch of agave sugar sweetness with supplemental tastes of steamed asparagus and anise. Concludes dry, vegetal and earthy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma only offers reluctant scents of sandy earth and salt. The palate entry is limp and sap-like; the midpalate remains timid and lacking in depth of taste. Ends meekly. A vodka-like sotol without much sense of agave.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet has a deep grain foundational aroma with an overlying fruity scent. The palate entry is stunningly rich, caramel sweet, and even nutty; the delicious midpalate displays a fat/oily, toasted grain and sweet oak profile. Finishes as full and toasty as it begins. A very good blended Scotch value. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The uninviting aroma includes scents of sautéed onion, cigarette smoke, smelly cheeses and vinyl. The palate improves with flavors of tobacco leaf, sea salt and oak; the midpalate offers tastes of beeswax, lip salve, popcorn, palm oil and ruby Port. Finish is oily with tastes of wax, tobacco, Port and seaweed. A curiously fascinating oddball.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find crisp scents of wet straw and earth and mild vegetal sweetness in this rather meek bouquet. The palate entry is focused, moderately oily and semisweet; the delightful midpalate is long, oily and mineral-like.
label: spirits_taster

description:
The nose offers wave after wave of botanical and floral perfumes, with the end bouquet focused on cucumber and spring garden floral scents. The palate entry is moderately oily, semisweet and gently herbal; the midpalate stays spirity, vegetal and earthy. The 
aftertaste features juniper with a dry and minerally undertaste.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma highlights lemon peel, angelica, coriander, orris root and juniper. The herbal palate entry is bean-like and bitter; the awkward midpalate features citrus peel oil and a distracting harshness. Finishes with flashes of juniper, citrus and coriander, as well as a bit of heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: The strange aroma smells of new carpeting instead of anything like lemons and limes. The mildly pleasing palate entry is curiously candy-like yet void of real citrus flavor; the midpalate is more directed to citrus peel astringency. The finish displays minor lemon peel zestiness.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from sugar cane. The nosing passes encounter notes of juniper and lemon peel wrapped in a semisweet core flavor. The palate entry is sweet, moderately junipery and thick; at midpalate the botanicals get overshadowed by the sweetness of the sugar cane base. Concludes caney and clumsy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers controlled aromas that are fiber- and hemp-like with additional scents of ink, cardboard, guava, and nylon. The palate entry is disconcertingly aggressive and sugary sweet; the midpalate stage is more settled but still assertively and cloyingly sweet. Ends up rowdy, intensely spirity, and caney sweet. Good in a caipirinha.
label: spirits_taster

description: The wonderful bouquet includes scents of seaweed, smoke, peat, iodine, kippers and pipe tobacco. The palate entry is briny and intense; the midpalate is oily with traces of anise, butterscotch and linseed oil. Finishes vibrantly with tastes of salted butter, oil and brine. Highly idiosyncratic: for lovers of robust, seaside malts. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose includes aromas of dates, marzipan with underpinning aromas of old oak, nutmeg and hard cheese. The palate entry is balanced, semisweet and slightly toasty; the midpalate stage features succulent tastes of Brazil nut, mincemeat, figs, bacon fat and prunes. Finishes with finesse and heartiness. A mature brandy at its wonderful peak.
label: spirits_taster

description: A lovely bouquet that is perfumed, gently woody and breakfast cereal-like. The palate entry offers melded tastes of toffee, buttered popcorn and marzipan; at midpalate flavors include butterscotch, brown sugar and dark honey. The aftertaste displays the oak influence and is long, off-dry to semisweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose is biscuity, caramel-like, cream Sherry-like with a touch of cheese-like rancio. The palate entry tastes like bittersweet dark chocolate, cocoa butter, chocolate-covered raisins and dark honey; the midpalate is fruity and less bittersweet than the entry, making for a succulent aftertaste. A genuine classic.
label: spirits_taster

description: Honeyed, caramel-like, oily bouquet. At palate entry, tastes of dates, roasted almond, walnut paste and baked pear delight; the midpalate highlights the cheese-like and bacony rancio. The aftertaste blankets the tongue in sumptuous coats of oil, rancio and maple sugar.
label: spirits_taster

description: An intensely grainy bouquet. The palate entry is corny sweet and nearly honey-like; at midpalate the core flavor of sweet corn mash remains while tastes of buttered popcorn, brown sugar, and nougat expand. Finishes with a spurt of fire and lots of long, corny/grainy tastes. Should be part of every serious whiskey-lover's collection.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet emits irresistible scents of tar, tobacco leaf and sea salt. At the palate entry a wave of road tar washes across the tip of the tongue, followed by a smoky taste of ash; the midpalate highlights a sweeter side of agave juice that rides atop the tar/smoke/tobacco. Finishes semisweet and a bit industrial-tasting.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma includes peculiar, but appealing aromas of saddle leather, old vinyl, cream, mustard seed, grass and paint. The palate entry is sweet, almondy and near-oily; the midpalate taste goes all out on the oiliness, but with a pleasantly sharp pepperiness. Finishes on a dry, parchment-like note.
label: spirits_taster

description: A full-blown spirits bouquet that emits lacy, garden-like perfumes of citrus rind, ripe grapes, cotton fabric and carnations. The palate entry is tight, integrated, semisweet and pleasingly ripe; by midpalate there's a rush of acidity that cleanses the palate, leading to a firmly structured finish that's bittersweet to semisweet, fruity and muscular.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is how blanco Tequila should smell with unadorned, raw, but fetching peppery/dill-like aromas, scents of lanolin, palm oil, sand, minerals and slate. The palate entry is semidry, intensely sap-like and honeyed; at midpalate the taste profile displays a satiny texture and a robust, herbal, mildly salty flavor.
label: spirits_taster

description: An aromatic yellow fruit perfume leaps from the glass; aeration adds subtle hints of citrus zest and tobacco leaf. The medium-bodied, creamy palate entry is succulent and woody sweet; at midpalate the flavor turns buttery rich, intensely oaky and moderately maple-like. Ends in a gently sweet, grainy, and appealingly fruity manner.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosing passes detect notes of charred meat, vanilla bean and pipe tobacco; aeration time stimulates more grainy/floral scents. The palate entry is sweet, oaky and slightly spicy; the midpalate finds delightful flavors of malt, sweet oak, honey, nutmeg and toffee. Concludes warm, but not searing. Sweet and succulent.
label: spirits_taster

description: Wonderful scents of fresh cilantro; after aeration the cilantro rush diminishes, leaving behind a seductive bouquet of muddled cilantro. The entry offers reined-in tastes of cilantro; at midpalate the cilantro lessens and becomes deeply leafy and herbal.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find deep and potent scents of rosemary. The palate entry is keenly rosemary-like; the midpalate highlights the sap-like intensity of rosemary and ends up being semisweet in the finish. Concentrated and aggressive.
label: spirits_taster

description: The understated bouquet keeps unfolding with time in the glass with evolving dill and caramel scents. The palate entry is mild, moderately vanilla-like and semisweet; the midpalate is long, biscuity sweet and only slightly dill-like. Pickle brine surfaces in the set finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find sweet scents of honeywheat toast, breakfast cereal, peat moss/vegetation, baked pear and baked pineapple. The palate entry features elegant tastes of key lime, meringue and toffee; the midpalate phase offers deeper flavors that include marshmallow, dark caramel, cocoa, cinnamon, marzipan, and maple. Finishes sweet, concentrated and smooth.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosing passes find intensely grassy-vegetal notes; following aeration delicate notes of Christmas spices and treacle are added. The palate entry is semisweet, properly grassy and just a bit spicy; by midpalate the oak emerges and eclipses the spice and cane, giving the taste profile a vanilla-like succulence. Concludes elegantly and sweetly.
label: spirits_taster

description: A slightly inexpressive bouquet that offers delicate dried, yellow fruit aromas; aeration releases minor scents of brine and dill that complement the fruit. The palate entry is silky and as sweet as honey; at midpalate flavors of white pepper, beeswax, light caramel and nougat are added. The finish highlights the nougat and caramel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromas of cracked grain kernels, breakfast cereal, earthy aromas of straw, flax/fiber and rope. The palate entry offers sweet grain tastes; the midpalate features medium to heavy-bodied texture and sweet grain/Graham cracker flavors. Aftertaste is plump, semisweet and very tasty.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial aroma is slightly seared/charred and almost synthetic; aeration allows nuances of fish, seaweed, salt and brine to emerge. The palate entry improves on the aroma with semisweet and salty flavors of kippers and saltwater taffy; at midpalate the taste turns more salty than sweet or grainy. Concludes tart and slightly medicinal.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet benefits significantly from aeration as it offers highly pleasant fragrances of flowers, light honey and sweet grain. The palate entry is elegant, vigorous, grainy and moderately sweet; at midpalate the taste becomes more spirity and aggressive but vivacious and grainy sweet. Ends up intensely grainy and fruity.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosing passes pick up pleasing peppery notes and strong herbal/botanical scents; aeration brings mild fragrances of green olive, brine, granite and sea salt. The palate entry is ripe, smooth and sweet; the midpalate features flavors of milk chocolate, butter cream and light caramel. Finishes sweet, oaky and medium-textured.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial aromas of dill, brine and bitter green vegetables but the bouquet becomes muted with aeration. The palate entry is a tad sharp and acidic, but that smoothes out at midpalate as tastes of honey, saltwater taffy and pickles take charge. Ends spirited and pungent.
label: spirits_taster

description: Faint scents of grape seed and red fruit, followed by a clean, vegetal taste that's dry and medium-weighted; at midpalate a good structural oiliness dominates as the fruit diminishes. Concludes firm, dry and a tad bittersweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet starts off heavily smoky/peaty but oddly, following aeration, it turns more tanned skin- and rubber-like. The palate entry is concentrated, chalk-like, smoky and intensely peaty; at midpalate things settle down a bit, offering more moderate flavors of tobacco ash, wood smoke, charcoal and sweet grain. Compellingly rambunctious for normally staid Bowmore.
label: spirits_taster

description: The lovely, integrated bouquet gives equal time to the alcohol, the wood and the molasses in semisweet to bittersweet waves. The palate entry is so influenced by the oak that it's off-dry, bittersweet and beany; by midpalate the tastes include touches of marzipan, dark caramel, vanilla extract and nougat.  Finishes well and cocoa-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is highly herbal, giving off piquant scents of prickly pear, desert flower and cocoa bean. The palate entry features sweet oak and salted butter tastes; the midpalate stage highlights the fatty quality as much in the texture as in the taste. Finishes mildly chili pepper-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: An underwhelming bouquet that features aromas of sawdust, sawn wood, pine sap, wheat cracker, burning rope and bonfire. The palate entry is inviting, warm, gently sweet, grainy and a touch oaky; by midpalate the lean-to-medium-weight taste profile focuses exclusively on the sweet grain and wood resin flavors. Finishes angular, lean and compact.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is initially nougat-like sweet; following aeration the candy bar sweetness deepens and turns men's club woody. At palate entry the tongue is coated with sugary notes; the rum regains it's composure at midpalate by becoming leaner and bittersweet. Concludes honeyed, bittersweet and very pleasant. The midpalate phase rescued this rum.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find smells of concrete, sand, minerals, slate, granite and grass. The palate entry is pleasantly grassy and keenly vegetal; the midpalate is oily, full-bodied and very, very minerally. Ends up zesty, intensely grassy (as it should be) and long in the throat. A very smooth cachaça.
label: spirits_taster

description: The garden-like scent of fennel is medium-strong. The palate entry is genuine, moderately herbal and deep and pleasingly bittersweet; the midpalate is deeper than the entry and is, therefore, far more gripping. Finishes spicy, tangy, earthy and herbal.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initially the nose is musty; following aeration the nosing passes find a pleasant, if atypical, moderately biscuity scent. The palate entry is intensely vegetal, medium-bodied and sweet; the midpalate is zesty, peppery and asparagus like. Concludes ripe, gently sweet and just a tad oaky.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aeration brings out a ripe, red fruitiness and a bread dough quality in the bouquet. The palate entry offers tastes of baked pineapple, toasted oats and roast pork; the midpalate is pleasingly buttery and nut-paste-like. Finishes semisweet, a little insecure structurally, but firm, prickly, caramel-like and oaky.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find intensely spirity, tropical fruit-like scents with additional fragrances of English toffee, sautéed almonds, quince, melon and fruitcake. The palate entry is sweet, piny and spirity; the midpalate is spirity, intensely oaky and sweet. An intriguing marriage of malt whisky matured in brandy cask. Good concept.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes detect scents of canned pineapple and guava with soft traces of baking spices. The palate entry is sweet and very fruity; by midpalate the flavors include ripe tastes of pineapple, guava, banana and citrus with delicate hints of clove, ginger and cinnamon. A tasty alternative to the more heavily spiced flavored rums available.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first whiffs detect medium-strong elements of tar, tobacco and hemp fiber; further air contact stimulates scents of minerals, matchstick and metal. The palate entry is sweet and a bit tobacco- and white potato-like; the pleasant midpalate is sweet in a creamy, buttery manner. Ends up clean, nicely acidic and synthetic fiber-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is somewhat flannel-like until aeration allows grassy, vegetal aromas to overtake. The palate entry offers timid tastes of dry breakfast cereal and grain crackers; at midpalate more succulent tastes of honey, caramel and almond butter emerge. Ends up slightly minty. Easy to drink, but lacks charm.
label: spirits_taster

description: An uninteresting bouquet. The palate entry is concentrated, spirity, very oaky and lacking in grain or fruit; the spirit settles down at midpalate and a sweet, nougat-like taste emerges and dominates. Concludes a tad too warm and resiny. Drinkable, with some good traits, but a misfire.
label: spirits_taster

description: The reluctant aroma features some mildly attractive scents of tree bark, pine, cedar and nutmeg; where's the agave? The palate entry is flat but displays some vanilla; the anemic midpalate offers some minor tastes of black pepper, granite and allspice. Finishes a bit harsh with a little agave brininess.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sky blue/green color shows perfect clarity. The initial sniffings detect ripe, mildly sweet fruit notes of gooseberries, pineapple and nectarine; the bouquet fades with time in the glass. Palate entry is sour yet appealing and deeply fruity; at midpalate the fruit presence is quite acidic and crisp, which allows the vodka foundation to be appreciated. Finishes well.
label: spirits_taster

description: Looks like a very old sauternes. The first sniffs suggest butterscotch flavoring; after aeration the aroma becomes fried banana, honey, graham cracker and banana candy-like. Palate entry is fruity tart, almost sour, then at midpalate the flavor shifts to ripe banana dipped in honey and I'm a believer. Closes on a bittersweet, graham cracker and mildly toasty note.
label: spirits_taster

description: The Blue seems to possess greater definition in the opening inhalations than the Orange. Palate entry is nicely citrusy and sour; at midpalate the orange taste is more pulpy and fruity than the Orange which was zesty. Finishes well in cascades of orange pulp and orange rind flavors.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pale straw yellow color. The opening whiffs discover strong notes of bran flakes, malted milk and tree sap; more time brings out solvent-like aromas of pine needles and gum. Palate entry is toffee- and caramel-like, almost creamy and buttery; at midpalate the flavor profile features intensely spirity tastes of almond paste and apple butter. Concludes oily and fiery.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial sniffings detect dull, limp scents of wet cardboard and parchment; with only meek, ripe and sweet grain and timid yellow fruit aromas added after aeration. The palate entry is moderately spicy and nicely grainy, but then at midpalate the taste becomes seed-like and mildly grainy. Drinkable but average.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose finds dry, toasty, and intense grain aromas but these flatten out, leaving an insubstantial and muted grain odor. The palate entry shows early signs of licorice-like bitter-sweetness, then at midpalate this changes to the same dullness found in the latter stages of the nosing. Concludes average and faded.
label: spirits_taster

description: Vegetal aroma with distant notes of black pepper and reed/tall grass. The palate entry is semisweet and bean/legume-like; at midpalate a spirity harshness takes hold. Ends bittersweet and a bit raw. For people who like their mixto tequila. on the rough-and-ready side.
label: spirits_taster

description: Orange hue. The nose after the pour shows no typical aromatic traces of grape brandy; several more minutes in the glass help by releasing friendlier, more appropriate off-dry aromas that include oak and ripe grapes. Texture at palate entry is surprisingly thin for what's supposed to be an X.O.; midpalate displays more flavor, mostly in the forms of mild oaky vanilla, candied nuts and brown sugar. Aftertaste is lean, dry and a touch hot.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial sniffings detect reluctant scents of apple and pear; aeration adds little more in the way of aromatics. Palate entry is very mild, banal and grainy sweet; by midpalate there are more comely flavors of almond paste, light oak, and clover honey. Ends up amiable, inoffensive, drinkable and entirely average and mundane.
label: spirits_taster

description: Blood-red, blackberry-jam hue rather than a serious opaque black. The nose is mildly grainy and fabric-like before disappearing altogether. The palate entry is pleasantly grainy and husk-like in its off-dry demeanor; at midpalate the taste turns more customary in its base graininess and spiritiness. Concludes mildly and off-dry.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bouquet with delicate notes of chalk and spice with resiny and old parchment backnotes. Palate entry is off-dry, mildly woody and a touch honey-like; at midpalate this slow-developing Armagnac finally comes together as moderately deep flavors including light toffee, honey, and old oak make a last-ditch effort. Concludes flat and dull.
label: spirits_taster

description: Crisp, fresh scents of ripe apple and apple peel. In the mouth, the peel-like flavor seems slightly burnt as in over-baked apple pie or apple strudel, and continues into the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled in Germany, but bottled in Great Britain. Opening bouquet is fruity and gum-like. Pleasantly fruity and off-dry at palate entry; the midpalate highlights a cottony candy quality. Aftertaste is medium-long, sweet and Juicy Fruit-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: Moderately pleasing scents of ripe banana, pear, tea leaves and distant oak resin. Entry is off-dry, lean and oaky; by midpalate, the taste is sweeter. Oak dominates the aftertaste as do flavors of cardboard and light toffee.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet introduces the pineapple/coconut components gently. The taste profile is very sweet and sappy while the midpalate turns completely candied and unctuous. Bubble gum all the way through the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bouquet highlights the tart lime flavoring quite well. Palate entry shows a sweeter side; the midpalate is lacking in any substantive tequila presence. No finish to speak of.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is pretty much nowhere to be found. Soda pop-like in the mouth with manufactured raspberry/berry flavors from front to back. There's a metallic note in the aftertaste.
label: spirits_taster

description: First sniffings detect herbal/peppery scents, though the road tar/asphalt quality makes me think more of mezcal. Further time bolsters the keenly herbal agave pulpiness and introduces dill and fennel to the aromatic mix. Palate entry is sweet; by midpalate, the smokiness becomes bitter then it turns sweet and black licorice-like. Finish mixes licorice sweetness with smoky bitterness.
label: spirits_taster

description: Toasty aromas are of dark caramel, molasses and hard candy. The entry taste is cloyingly sweet and sap-like. It concludes syrupy and sweet, with a trace of cola nut. Basic Dark Rum 101. A mixer rum that's ideal when you're concocting piña coladas by the batch for the gang.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening whiffs detect a reluctant, bitter scent of apple peel. Flavor is pleasantly ripe; by midpalate, the ripe apple taste (kind of like apple strudel) becomes more acceptable. Finish is very sweet and too sugary.
label: spirits_taster

description: Early on, there's a strongly vegetal, earthy aroma that's reminiscent of beeswax; further time gives rise to mildly pleasant scents of rubber eraser, tobacco leaf, light peat, cork and worn saddle leather. Palate entry shows a firmness and integration lacking in the bouquet; by midpalate, the taste profile displays a moderately toasty, malty, semisweet, if downward spiralling direction. Ends up malty sweet, simple and basically superficial
label: spirits_taster

description: Aroma is reminiscent of the stale, rubbery air that's expelled from a deflating bicycle or automobile tire. Palate entry taste is ashy and off-dry; by midpalate, tastes of soy sauce and cocoa make it drinkable. Ends up highlighting the cocoa over the old-tire air.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening aroma is grainy and corn-like, with background touches of paraffin and walnut butter; aeration stimulates green peppercorn, cotton candy and dried fruit scents that are a tad flat. Palate entry is crisp, prickly; by midpalate, the flavor highlights the toasty barrel char as tastes of maple, vanilla bean and dark caramel dominate this stage. Ends fiery, grainy, but lean.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma is ethereal, astringent, and spirity; not the best Glenlivet bouquet I've come across in the last 15 years. Flavor is properly flowery, moderately sweet and malty, but there's a fundamental hollowness to this edition.
label: spirits_taster

description: There's lots of caramel, off-dry, honey wheat toast, salty/seabreeze character in the opening whiffs. Palate entry is noticeably oily and sinewy while at midpalate the flavor turns moderately peaty, dry and smoked. Ends up clean, off-dry, mildly pleasing but unmemorable.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosings detect scents of rose, gorse and heather; aeration allows aromas of candle wax, linseed oil and green olives to emerge. Palate entry is sharp, off-dry and moderately malty; at midpalate the spirit stings the tongue and flavors of milk chocolate, malt and butter cream candies surface. Finishes oily and off-dry.
label: spirits_taster

description: Flawless pale yellow color. The initial aroma is faint, weedy, grass-like and apple-like; it remains an uninteresting bouquet following aeration. The palate entry highlights grain and gum; at midpalate the core seems hollow as mildly stirring tastes of malt, chocolate covered strawberry and apples swim on the surface. Ends off-dry and timid.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose offers delicate traces of fresh orange pulp and peel. The palate entry is very acidic and orange zest-like; at midpalate the taste profile continues the astringent, orange peel lean. Finishes very bitter and zesty. Lacks balance between the grain spirit and the fruit.
label: spirits_taster

description: The palate entry displays some pod-like trace of anise, but is basically meek and thin; at midpalate there's a better flavor thrust of licorice/ anise and herbs. Ends up a bit timid and lean.
label: spirits_taster

description: An ethereal fruity bouquet with earthy stirrings of green pepper, uncooked asparagus, light maple, decaying fall leaves, and confectioner's sugar. The palate entry is sweet, mildly grainy, and peppery; at midpalate the flavor profile features lemongrass and grain. Concludes sweet, with barely perceptible toffee end notes. Disappointing in the final half of the evaluation.
label: spirits_taster

description: Part of singer Kenny Chesney's rum line, this unusual rum-based cream liqueur has an enticing coconut and spice aroma, with a stronger hit of cardamom emerging on the palate. The mild coconut-milk effect would lend itself to tropical drinks.
label: spirits_taster

description: This whiskey-based liqueur has a bold, pleasant mix of coffee, cocoa and cream, plus a slight whiskey hit on the finish. It's not too thick, not too strong, and goes down easy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made using single-malt Irish whiskey, this full-bodied, creamy liqueur has an enticing coffee-and-milk aroma and flavor, with a modest but welcome whiskey note on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with Sorrento lemons and Holland cream, this bright-yellow cream liqueur is light and fresh, from its lemon-peel scent to the lemon-curd flavor and balanced sweetness. It has less alcohol than Gioia's regular limoncello, and both seem like refreshing ways to end a meal.
label: spirits_taster

description: Though it lacks the bracing bitterness that makes Averna so refreshing, this new cream liqueur still has faint herbal scent reminiscent of the amaro. The resemblance ends there: it's slightly sweet and resembles milky coffee in appearance and flavor, with a hint of nutmeg spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: Vibrant light brown hue, like fresh coffee with just a splash of cream, this liqueur offers a bold mocha aroma and flavor, plus an herbal note on the finish. Luxe and tasty, and presented in gift-worthy Art Nouveau-style packaging.
label: spirits_taster

description: Creamy yellow and viscous, this proffers a mild lemon scent. Most of the lemon-peel flavor emerges on the finish, plus a hint of cardamom.
label: spirits_taster

description: An apple cream liquor is definitely different. Made using apple brandy and produced by Boyen Valley Winery, a fourth-generation farm that produces wines and ice wines, it features apple faintly in the aroma and more boldly on the palate. The acidity of the apple seems to fight a bit with the cream element, but overall it's a refreshing take.
label: spirits_taster

description: Created by a cardiologist, the name refers to the units of energy used to shock a patient's heart back into rhythm. The subtle cinnamon aroma and flavor will evoke thoughts of eggnog. Use for holiday cocktails or for perking up coffee.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pristine milky white, this unique liqueur has a tangy aroma reminiscent of the Dutch yogurt from which it is made–and some will find it challenging to get past the scent. The flavor is slightly sweet, and only fleetingly tart. Since mixing cream liqueurs with citrus can risk curdling, this might add a useful tart note to creamy cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma recalls candied sweet cinnamon and lemon cream; on the palate, there's a fleeting mintiness and a vanilla-cinnamon fade. The black and white cow-spotted bottle with a bell around the neck sure gets attention.
label: spirits_taster

description: Think peaches and cream: this French vodka-based liqueur has a light peach aroma and flavor, mixed with a thin coconut-cream texture. Best served over ice.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bluish-brown color looks dirty, but the fudge-like aroma reassures. On the palate, it's almost like fresh-baked brownies: fudgy and sweet, with faint hints of cocoa and espresso.
label: spirits_taster

description: Milky, thick, and lightly spiced with ginger, it might inspire you to crave ginger-cream cookies as a pairing.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with Solera Gran Reserva Brandy from Jerez, this light-brown cream liqueur is sweet and buttery, with mild notes of hazelnut and vanilla, plus a flick of whiskey.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is made with fresh lemon peels (instead of lemon extract) and milk, and the producer assures that it's not unusual for the product to separate, which is what happened with the reviewed bottle. Even after vigorous shaking, this cream liqueur still appears yellow and lumpy in the glass, and it's hard to get past that. That said, the bold lemon-oil aroma and lemon sorbet flavor are appetizing.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from a blend of very rare 13- to 16-year-old whiskies, this bottling pays tribute to Master Distiller Jimmy Russell's 60 years at the Wild Turkey Distillery. This light, silky Bourbon shows lots of vanilla-maple and brown sugar flavors accented by a hint of peach, and tapers off delicately, with clove, cinnamon, ginger and burnt orange peel notes on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bold and well structured, this Bourbon features warming vanilla and caramel accented by orange peel, stone fruit and a dry baking-spice finish. Sip it with a chunk of ice, or mix up a round of juleps. The trademark round, faceted bottle with the horse-topped cork is perfect for Derby Day.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is from a series of old and rare limited-edition whiskies released by Diageo from their Stitzel-Weller warehouses. It's silky and surprisingly gentle for a 20-year-old whiskey, with notes of creamy caramel, brown sugar and touches of tropical fruit and allspice. It finishes remarkably long, with gentle vanilla sweetness.
label: spirits_taster

description: This uncut, barrel-strength Bourbon is bold and flavorful. The caramel aroma is rich and luxe. On the palate, it's quite tannic and drying, but the flavor shines through, showing toffee, caramel and dried cherry, with a spicy finish of clove, dried fig and date. The alcohol feels remarkably balanced despite the high proof. It needs no adornment: just add a chunk of ice and enjoy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Number 19 in a series, this robust Bourbon offers big, butterscotch-like notes alongside touches of fresh apple, baking spice and a fiery cinnamon finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This limited-edition bottling is released once a year, on Sept. 2, the birthdate of Old Forester founder George Garvin Brown. This one, aged 12 years, was bottled in 2013. It's bold, aromatic and sweet on the palate, with notes of toffee, oak and red fruit. It finishes long and spicy. Though it feels a bit hot, it settles down with a modest amount of water into a warming, flavorful sip.
label: spirits_taster

description: This tawny Bourbon has a rich, spiced scent reminiscent of fruitcake. On the palate, look for caramel studded with dried cherry, orange peel and clove, finishing quite dry. A great profile for classic cocktails, and not too precious to mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: Lean, dry and spicy, this seven-year-old small-batch Bourbon may be reminiscent of of rye whiskey. It has a mild maple scent and complex layers of vanilla, cigar wrapper, tea and orange peel, with a spicy finish. The alcohol feels moderate, even mellow, for over 100 proof.
label: spirits_taster

description: One of a series of old and rare limited-edition whiskies released by Diageo from their Stitzel-Weller warehouses. Aged 26 years, this is a mighty, intense Bourbon. It's dark amber in the glass and richly aromatic, with caramel and orange peel aromas. On the palate, it's substantial and oaky, showing strong alcohol and a surprising smokiness, which builds with repeated sips.
label: spirits_taster

description: Surprisingly evolved for a three-year-old whiskey, this one has a four-grain mash bill (corn, wheat, barley and rye). It's on the sweeter side, with notes of caramel and hazelnut interspersed with orange peel and spice. It's mouthwatering, and would be particularly good in an old-fashioned or other cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a gorgeous copper hue with orange highlights, a butterscotch-like aroma and soft feel. This Bourbon offers lots of fruit on the palate—orange, apricot, tropical fruit—that finish long, with caramel and a bracing burnt-orange peel note.
label: spirits_taster

description: After the usual aging time, this Bourbon is then moved to a heavily-toasted, lightly-charred barrel to extract additional oak flavor. The end result is deep amber in the glass, with bright spice cake and baked apple fragrance. On the palate, it's lightly sweet at first, showing creamy caramel, but finishes dry, with touches of espresso, oak and Baker's chocolate. Overall, a bold, flavorful sipper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Heaven Hill is offering a one-time-only limited allocation of the 21-year-old Bourbon, otherwise available only at the distillery gift shop. It's fairly oaky and drying, but it also layers vanilla and caramel with Sherried fruit, finishing extraordinarily long, with sparks of allspice and black pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Delicious but fiery, this nine-year-old small-batch Bourbon offers deep toffee aromatics and bold flavor. On the palate, look for relatively dry flavors: leather, cedar, dried orange peel. A splash of water softens the profile to bring out more vanilla, honey, even a touch of chocolate.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is charmingly understated with subtle scents of yellow fruit pulp, toffee, milk chocolate and vanilla bean. Palate entry is balanced, nicely acidic, creamy, cane sweet and warm; midpalate accentuates dark chocolate. Finish is confident and elegant. State-of-the-art, properly oak-aged rum.
label: spirits_taster

description: The rather inexpressive bouquet offers moderately evolved scents of dry grain and sour mash. The palate entry shows more personality as the taste goes oily and semidry; at midpalate a touch of lanolin firms up the flavor profile as the grain becomes more intense. Finishes dry and vegetal.
label: spirits_taster

description: The opening aroma is pruny, ripe, grapy and floral; following aeration the bouquet turns leathery and baking spicy. The palate entry displays succulent tastes of melon, dried fruit, nuts and pear; the midpalate point is focused, ripe, slightly woody and spicy. Finishes clean smooth and elegant.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is basic but pleasing, with sweet molasses scents and some delightful cocoa and tobacco notes. The palate entry is surprisingly bittersweet and nearly dry; the flavor turns tobacco-like, almost smoky, yet appealingly sweet at midpalate. Finishes with simple, no-frills charm.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find mature smells of men's club leather chairs, old books, molasses, honey, milk chocolate and nougat. The palate entry is a touch smoky and very sweet; the honey and molasses tastes come to the fore at the midpalate. Finish is warm, comfortable and mature.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find scents of charcoal, chalk and gum. The palate entry is full-bodied, acidic, sharp and moderately oily; at midpalate the grapy spirit stings the tongue. Finishes ramped up on the piquant spirit, but that's all right. An attractive, no-frills, unflavored vodka.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is understated and elegant with delicate scents of wheat and oatmeal with earthy, mossy notes. The palate entry is engagingly sweet and biscuity; the midpalate is firmly viscous and grainy sweet. Ends gracefully, with a touch of grain kernel tang.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is a compelling mix of fragrances of vanilla, nutmeg, sweet oak, saddle leather and palm oil. The palate entry is sweet, but not cloying, chocolaty and fruity; at midpalate the sweetness explodes on the palate, drowning out all other taste aspects. Finishes sweet and silky.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is raw, heavily spirity and fruity. The palate entry is basic and refined sugar sweet; the midpalate is therefore still painfully fundamental, unabashedly sugary and simplistically raw. Drinkable but a one-note song.
label: spirits_taster

description: The huge bouquet initially offers citrusy aromas that evolve to include harmonious notes of pineapple, grapefruit, allspice, pine sap and beeswax. The palate entry highlights the orange/lemon peel and the angelica components while the midpalate features more of the juniper and earthy cassia. Concludes zestily and savory.
label: spirits_taster

description: The quintessential London Dry bouquet features notes of cedary juniper with subtle notes of citrus and minerals. The palate entry is creamy, smooth, substantial and bracing; tastes of lemon/orange peel add a perfect touch of astringency to the velvety texture at midpalate. Finishes round and full. A distilling masterpiece and the gin category's benchmark.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find smells of chocolate -covered red cherries, old saddle leather, sweet-tart hints of grapefruit, kiwi and dried apricot. The palate entry is lush, fruity and intensely honeyed; the midpalate is creamy and concentrated on caramel, toffee and maple tastes. Ends silky, semisweet and nutty. A stunning B-A worth twice the price.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet features earthy, dry notes with hints of lemon grass, orange peel and cedary juniper. This Dutch-style gin takes flight at palate entry as the citrus presence comes on strong; at midpalate the root and seed elements come to the fore in a lovely oily texture. Finishes long, medium-weighted and off-dry.
label: spirits_taster

description: This luscious bouquet offers notes of roasted pork loin, bacon fat, sawdust, with a touch of smokiness. The palate entry is cocoa sweet, intensely oaky, vanilla-like and honeyed; at midpalate the smoke from the nose reappears in tandem with a delicious chocolate covered apricot taste. Fabulously plump.
label: spirits_taster
