description: The nosing passes find earthy grape must, sour apple and yeast-like aromas that nicely complement the assertive spirit. The zesty but balanced palate entry is lusciously toffee-like; at midpalate incredibly tasty notes of orange peel and grapefruit take charge. Finishes concentrated, fruity and citrusy. Delicious.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find fresh, authentic notes of pomegranate. At palate entry the flavoring is well balanced if a little understated; the midpalate shows more presence with nicely astringent fruitiness. Finishes medium-long and moderately sweet and ripe.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet smells of genuine pomegranate, is slightly berry-like and acutely brambly; aeration maintains the strength of the ripe, but not overly ripe, pomegranate. The palate entry is crisp, refreshing and true to the fruit; the midpalate offers succulent tastes of pomegranate beads plus a distant citrus note.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial aroma is very nutty; aeration settles the aroma down to engaging scents of beeswax and dried fruits. The palate entry features walnut butter; the midpalate has tastes of dark chocolate and rancio. In the finish there's an unexpected and unwelcome background taste of coin that undercuts the rancio.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes detect smells of cardboard, parchment and dried fruit. The palate entry is intensely nutty, nougaty and fruity; at midpalate the flavors are integrated, harmonious and wonderfully fruity. Ends semisweet, correctly acidic and elegant.
label: spirits_taster

description:
A veritable aromatic feast of maritime notes: seaweed, iodine, pine needle, matchstick and olive brine. The palate entry is full of mint, Sherry, pork rind, bacon fat, chimney soot and rancio tastes; by midpalate flavors of cocoa, coffee, pipe tobacco, chocolate-covered orange, marzipan and vanilla extract proliferate. Luscious and 
stupendously good.
label: spirits_taster

description: This boasts loads of different aromas in the bouquet including scents of treacle, spice, late summer flower garden, black pepper, cola nut, dried red fruit and molasses. The palate entry is long and toffee-like; the midpalate features honeyed, apple butter-like tastes, and creamy flavors that add zesty spice in the aftertaste.
label: spirits_taster

description: The wonderful bouquet features an unmistakable potato aroma with additional fragrances of pork rind, bacon fat, fried potato skins and soil. The palate entry is concentrated, honeyed and rich; the midpalate highlights the oiliness of the potato and the batch distilling process. Finishes fat, assertive and a touch hot. Very nice indeed.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet offers off-dry, delicate aromas of yellow fruit and wet earth with deft touches of vanilla. The palate entry is almost liqueur-like with its fruitiness and coffee bean-like character; the midpalate features bittersweet tastes of cocoa and coffee bean. Finish is bittersweet and beany.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find a floral mélange with additional spicey notes being added following aeration. The palate entry is medium sweet, intensely floral and tangy; at midpalate the taste profile turns sweeter as a light-fingered hint of honey enters the picture. Concludes classy, understated, and luscious.
label: spirits_taster

description: The zesty, inviting bouquet features an aromatic fruit thrust with layers of spiced apple, baked pear, oak and pastry components. The palate entry is oily, acceptably resiny and loaded with maple, caramel and marzipan flavors; the bittersweet midpalate adds honey, vanilla extract and beeswax, but is slightly flatter than the entry. Finishes chewy and elegant.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find enormous aromas of fudge, palm oil and burnt toast with additional bittersweet notes of wood resin, figs, dates and pecan/praline. The palate entry has pepper, leather and sweetened coconut; midpalate is intensely nutty and nougaty and a touch maple-like. Ends full-bodied and concentrated, with a compelling flash of rancio.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet features strong scents of wax paper and lanolin; I expect more oak and spice in a brandy of this age. The palate entry is gentle, satiny, and fruity sweet; the midpalate features chocolate-covered cherry, banana nut bread, candied almond and cocoa. Finishes deliciously sweet, medium-weighted, elegant and graceful.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet emits earthy/mineral-like and fruity scents of slate/stone, wax and orange zest. The palate entry is very citrusy and tart; at midpalate the flavor profile turns astringent and bitter with major grain and citrus fruit influence. Concludes zesty, acidic, fresh and clean. A floral/citrusy style that's completely different from London Dry's.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromas of new shoe leather, iodine, smoked trout, flowers, intense grain, soft cheese, peat-reek and dried seaweed. The palate entry is pleasantly smoky and grainy sweet; the midpalate flavors range from olive brine, seaweed, iodine, and wood smoke to baked pear, toffee and marshmallow. Concludes warm and toasty.
label: spirits_taster

description: This “fine island Cognac” is reminiscent of creamy salted caramels. It has lots of rich caramel on the nose and palate, plus a light, mouthwatering saline note. It's soft and easy drinking, though it finishes quite spicy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The light aromas and flavors of this VSOP run to vanilla, banana, tea and nutmeg, winding into a long, warm finish. Consider pairing this with fruit desserts, but it also hits all the right notes to fill out a sidecar or other cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: This organic Cognac has a deep, honeyed aroma, with hints of white flowers and peaches. On the palate, those characteristics read a little lighter, interspersed with ginger and a fleeting alcohol presence that reads as racy and refreshing. Certified organic by Ecocert; USDA certification in the works.
label: spirits_taster

description: Velvety and sweet, this VS nicely mixes fruit and salted butterscotch tones. The long vanilla-washed finish, which also shows orange peel, toasted brioche and apricot tones, drifts ever-so-softly away.
label: spirits_taster

description: This pours a bright amber color, with restrained but beautiful aromas of white flowers, orange, peach and honey. On the palate, it's full-bodied, with bitter orange peel and stone fruit flavors, with lingering vanilla and oak. The alcohol feels relatively balanced, but it creeps up on you. This needs dilution, so use it in punches as intended and you'll be fine.
label: spirits_taster

description: With a mild aroma and markedly velvety feel, this Cognac mixes caramel and oak notes, and finishes with a long stretch of vanilla sprinkled with cinnamon and clove.
label: spirits_taster

description: You'll find a bold dried fruit aroma alongside caramel, oak and nuts. A bit astringent and oaky on the palate, the finish has some hazelnut, dried apricot and espresso notes. Feels soft on the tongue despite the brusque astringency and oakiness.
label: spirits_taster

description: Although the aroma is a bit resiny, underneath that, the nose offers scents of orange peel, pear and white flower. On the palate, look for warm notes of caramel and cedar punched up by orange peel and zingy cinnamon into the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The mild aroma doesn't offer much, but on the palate, flavors run to caramel tinged with violet, mellowing on the finish to dried apricot, golden raisin and honey accents. This is mouthwatering and sippable.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for notes of honey, vanilla, fresh flowers and dried apricots, plus a zing of alcohol around the edges. The bold flavors would be an asset to making Cognac cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: This VSOP is front-loaded with fruit: banana, apricot, golden raisins washed with honey. The flavors grow bolder, sweeter and deeper with repeated sips, without losing any finesse.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is surprisingly light and fresh for a 40-year-old Cognac. Look for upfront notes of vanilla and creamy caramel, with touches of honey, banana and apricot, followed by a ginger-spiked finish. Its super-soft texture hints at its age.
label: spirits_taster

description: Part of an intriguing trio meant to highlight fruit, spice and floral flavor profiles, “Age des Fleurs” delivers fresh and gentle aromatics reminiscent of peach and honeysuckle, underpinned with vanilla. Despite a slightly tannic, drying feel, it's easy to enjoy the flavors of tangy stone fruits drizzled with honey.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with Cognac and “Moscato wine liqueur,” this blend is super sweet, tasting not unlike peachy grape juice punched up with a dose of honeyed Cognac. It goes down real easy. Consider adding a splash of club soda or sparkling wine for a bubbly brunch cocktail.
label: spirits_taster

description: Part of an intriguing trio meant to highlight fruit, spice and floral flavor profiles, “Age du Fruit” hints at bitter citrus peel, white flowers and pear, but the dominant flavor is honey. It has a refreshing light and spicy quality.
label: spirits_taster

description: From the makers of Grand Marnier, this new product is described as “Cognac with orange essence, infused with calamansi, citrus and spice flavors.” The enticing, very sweet fragrance reads like a liqueur, offering up marzipan, oranges and peaches. On the palate, it starts as oaky, dry and slightly tannic, but becomes quite sweet and warming on the finish, with an ersatz orange note.
label: spirits_taster

description: Intended for cocktail use, this VSOP has a deliberately brisk profile and powerful flavors: toffee, hazelnut, cocoa, oak and a dry, rather tannic finish that pulls up abruptly. Although this makes for rather rough sipping, when mixed with sweeteners and juices, that brusque profile becomes an asset for balancing out those ingredients.
label: spirits_taster

description: This “high strength” and full-bodied VSOP is intended as a mixer, and you'd do well to heed that intent. Although it has plenty of flavor—orange peel and caramel, with a suggestion of anise on the finish—you're not going to taste it for long if you insist on sipping straight up: the overwhelming alcohol is just too aggressive. Add it to cocktails, but sparingly: this brandy has bite.
label: spirits_taster

description: Part of an intriguing trio meant to highlight fruit, spice and floral flavor profiles, “Age des Epices” certainly provides a lovely, spicy aroma similar to fresh gingerbread. On the palate, it reads as a touch medicinal at first, but soon evolves into a nicely spiced sip. Though it seems a bit pricey to offer up for a spiced brandy toddy, it would surely stack the deck to make a fine cocktail.
label: spirits_taster

description: This amber Cognac starts out with a pleasing caramel character, but succumbs to an oaky, astringent note on the midpalate. It rebounds to a long finish laced with allspice and ginger.
label: spirits_taster

description: Rosy in the glass, this mix of Cognac and red wine evokes sangria on the palate. It's sweet like grape juice and light. It's even better with tonic water and lime as a refreshing sipper.
label: spirits_taster

description: This collaboration between Chef Daniel Boulud and Master Distiller Richard Paterson is predictably delicious. The bespoke spirit is made from Dalmore whiskies finished in casks that previously held Moscatel, Madeira and Port wine. It's scented with orange peel and caramel, has luxuriously rich toffee and dark-chocolate flavors and finishes with berry notes. This dessert-like Scotch went on sale at retail stores in October and is also available at Boulud's restaurants.
label: spirits_taster

description: This single-cask Scotch was distilled at Tobermory in 1994 and aged for 18 years. Pale straw in color, it offers complex flavors, yet never loses its refreshing lightness and delicacy. Light peatiness gives way to delicate tropical-fruit notes, which in turn give way to a long, buttery vanilla finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Luxe and easy-sipping. Look for enticing notes of butterscotch, baked pear, cinnamon and clove on the nose and palate, swathed in just the right amount of smokiness.
label: spirits_taster

description: This Scotch is named for the proof (105) of a bottle that Chairman John Grant's father, George S. Grant, bottled in 1968 as a Christmas gift for family and friends. Nut-colored, it has a markedly bold toffee aroma and lots of flavor and drama. Hazelnut, espresso and cocoa flavors linger, with hints of allspice and drying oak tannins. Though it needs more than a splash of water to arrive at a nuanced sippability, don't hold that against this almost Bourbon-like beauty.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for rich, rounded flavors with lots of honey, vanilla and baking spice notes. The palate is creamy, with a mouth-filling texture and smoky finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This single-cask Scotch was made at the Glenrothes Distillery in 1992, then aged for 20 years. It's surprisingly light for a 20-year-old whisky, with a bright gold hue, delicate creamed-honey scent and flavors of lemon-cream pie, butterscotch and ginger.
label: spirits_taster

description: Valinch means “whisky thief,” and refers to the overproof nature of this limited-edition product. Matured in first-fill Bourbon casks, this smoky Scotch is brisk and bright, with notes of peat, menthol, custard, vanilla and ripe banana—the distiller refers to it as an “alcoholic cream soda.” Even if you don't detect the smoke in the aroma, which tends towards fresh apple and vanilla, it's in full bloom on the palate.
label: spirits_taster

description: This 10-year-old cask-strength Scotch is velvety, balanced and for peat-lovers only. Though golden in the glass, on the tongue it's big and dark, showing notes of toffee and vanilla, then smoke, smoke and more smoke until it drifts gently away.
label: spirits_taster

description: With its light straw color and mild aromatics, this Scotch surprises with light smokiness on the palate, along with malty, faintly sweet cookie-dough notes interspersed with pear and caramel.
label: spirits_taster

description: This gin has a bright, citrusy scent. The drying palate shows cedar and a hint of spice, finishing brisk and fleetingly sweet with mint and rosemary. The alcohol heat is tongue-numbingly intense, so give it plenty of dilution.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a mild, almost neutral scent in this small-batch gin, with just a hint of lemon peel. The soft palate hints at pine, lavender, and lemon, finishing long and gentle.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from white grapes, this gin is meant to evoke “woodsy state parks.” The aroma shows candied lemon peel and grapefruit. That citrusy note comes through on the palate, too, where it is underpinned by earthy cedar and spice and a brisk finish redolent of pine and mint.
label: spirits_taster

description: Part of a series of wine barrel-finished gins, this bottling definitely shows the Sauvignon Blanc influence in the tropical fruit-accented nose and palate. The finish is drying, with ginger and black pepper heat. It feels relatively hot, but could add interesting complexity and fleeting fruit to Martinis. Rested in a former Sauvignon Blanc barrel for 149 days.
label: spirits_taster

description: Part of a trio of “culinary-inspired” gins, this has a striking bright yellow hue and mildly spicy saffron aroma. Almost curry-like spice hits your palate first: saffron, cumin, cardamom, black pepper. The rough edges are smoothed by candied lemon peel sweetness, though it finishes a bit spicy-hot.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from apples and grain, this gin has a mild anise and minty juniper scent. The palate starts with hearty cedar, lightens with lemon peel and lavender notes, and finishes with a cooling breeze of juniper. The alcohol heat can be a bit intense.
label: spirits_taster

description: The producer says this gin is “distilled in an underground cave.” It has a muted, mossy rosemary note, finishing with cedar, citrus and pine. Alcohol heat is present, but doesn't completely overwhelm.
label: spirits_taster

description: Overall, this is an earthy, woody gin. Star anise, cedar and cardamom lead the nose and palate, finishing with a warm cinnamon spark. Hops is one of the key botanicals, contributing to that earthy/woody perception.
label: spirits_taster

description: Part of a series of wine barrel-finished gins, this gin has a ruddy ting and a slightly fruity aroma. The palate is fruity as well, hinting at tart plum, raspberry and maple, while the drying finish shows lemon peel and cinnamon sparks. Finished in former Cabernet Sauvignon barrels for 213 days.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from a corn base, this overproof gin offers sweetness up front, then mint, anise, black pepper and cayenne pepper heat, plus the anticipated wallop of alcohol heat. The mild aroma hints at anise.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from a base of local corn, this mild gin offers a hint of sweetness marked by anise and savory licorice, plus hints of clove and cardamom in the warming finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Distilled from organic grain, this golden gin has a vanilla scent and palate, laced with baking spice and finishing with black pepper and clove sizzle. Grippy oak overwhelms the drying finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made in the lightly sweetened Old Tom style, this gin has funky anise-forward aroma and surprising vegetal palate. It opens with the expected licorice, then veers toward cucumber and bell pepper freshness, finishing with spice and another layer of anise. The end result is a bit discordant.
label: spirits_taster

description: This pungent gin is almost reminiscent of absinthe, redolent with fennel, juniper and sage. The bold, viscous palate echoes the fennel and layers on lemon peel and a good dose of pine, fading into rounded licorice on the finish. Made from a base of estate-grown rye, barley and corn.
label: spirits_taster

description: This overproof gin has a slightly savory aroma that hints at caraway and anise. These botanicals are echoed on the palate, with anise pungency leading the way and rosemary-like sweetness bringing home the mentholated finish. Overproof, so expect a wave of lip-numbing alcohol heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged for 6 months in new charred American oak barrels, look for a bright copper penny color and mild allspice-laced scent. The palate is front-loaded with spicy cinnamon and cayenne, finishing with sarsaparilla, vanilla, dusty cocoa, puckery oak and a whole lot of fiery alcohol punch. Adding dilution tames the oak and heat, and brings out vanilla, dried apricot and baking spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: The 2017 limited-edition release of this Bourbon-rye blend, all a minimum of 10 years old, perfectly balances sweetness and spice. Rich caramel and brown sugar lead on the nose and palate, finishing with clove, nutmeg and cinnamon sizzle, plus a hint of orange peel.
label: spirits_taster

description: A locavore single malt to savor. Look for a golden hue and smoky aroma framed by fresh pear. Peat smoke is pronounced on the astringent, drying palate. Adding water coaxes gentle pear and vanilla forward, though the pleasingly smoky flavor remains, winding into a mouthwatering clove-accented finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This layered sipper is full of surprises. Fragrant with fresh apple and honeysuckle, the drying palate suggests dusty cocoa, leather and vanilla midpalate, freshened by  a hint of apple-blossom freshness at the core. A final smoky exhale is reminiscent of lightly peated Scotch.
label: spirits_taster

description: Rich and butterscotch-like without overt sweetness, this ethereally light, silky whiskey hints at stone fruit, cedar and spice. Use a light hand on the water—that appealing richness washes out when overdiluted. Made from malted Bavarian hard wheat and aged four years.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made with 100% sorghum, this deep amber whiskey shows as peppery up front, then rounds to deep molasses, brown sugar and oak, finishing with an intriguing burnt orange peel finish. A complex addition for whiskey-forward cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged 11 years and made with a mix of whiskeys from Tennessee and Indiana, this complex sipper offers honey, vanilla and a hint of red fruit, finishing long and drying with lemon peel and ginger zing. Bottled at cask strength, so feel free to soften with as much water as you prefer; the flavor will hold up nicely.
label: spirits_taster

description: This “heritage series” whiskey is made mostly from corn, with just 1% barley, and is aged for eight years. Yet the producer says it's made in “classic Maryland style,” which usually refers to a lighter style of rye whiskey (there's no rye in this whiskey). In short, this is a confusing whiskey to decode, but a tasty one to sip, integrating oak backbone with pecan, brown sugar, almond and hints of Sherry and cinnamon. The whiskey is sourced in Indiana but bottled in Pennsylvania.
label: spirits_taster

description: An unusual whiskey made from Arkansas-grown sorghum grain (not sorghum syrup) and malted barley, aged 17 months in new charred oak barrels. The end result is reminiscent of bourbon, with a deep amber hue and big, concentrated caramel, toffee, orange peel and spice. Water takes down the fire and flavor a notch, but still plenty of vanilla and crème brûlée to enjoy. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: Fans of smoky Scotch will enjoy this peated American single malt whiskey, the third annual release from the producer. It's golden in the glass, with a pineapple aroma underpinned by a whisper of peat. On the palate, peat takes center stage from the first sip, bold but not overwhelming, while tropical fruit moves to a supporting role, alongside vanilla, honey and a delicate ginger finish. Ideal for a Penicillin cocktail.
label: spirits_taster

description: Concentrated cocoa and cereal notes introduce this “Missouri whiskey” to nose and palate. It sips a bit drier than the rich scent suggests, layering on leather, oak and  a faint campfire note, and finishing with clove and cinnamon sizzle and final dusting of cocoa. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: A blend of whiskey styles (Bourbon, rye and Tennessee whiskey) yields a golden spirit with a gentle peach nectar and almond profile, underpinned by oaky vanilla and a cinnamon-clove finish. Feels light, sips well. This is a collaboration between Diageo and Hollywood director Brett Ratner.
label: spirits_taster

description: An enticing, chocolaty and clearly high-octane sipper, this whiskey entices with rich vanilla and dulce de leche aromas. The palate starts with fleeting sweetness—chocolate, vanilla, toffee—but quickly veers toward superdry, resounding with dark chocolate and mouth-puckering leather. It stands up well to substantial dilution—it needs plenty. Aged nine years, six months. American straight whiskey, sherry cask finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Vanilla, almond and coconut scents lead to dry, oak-driven palate accented with leather, espresso and cigar wrapper, finishing with bracing nutmeg and cardamom. Adding water coaxes out a pleasing fresh pear note. This four-year-old whiskey is made from 95% wheat and 5% barley.
label: spirits_taster

description: This 100% wheat whiskey is amber-orange in the glass, with a rich vanilla scent. The palate echoes that vanilla, along with butterscotch, cedar, and baking spice. Adding water dilutes the buttery quality, but brings forward crème brûlée notes.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial aroma is firmly structured and a tad baked; following additional air contact the aroma opens up adding charming scents of burnt match, cigar ash, linseed oil and peanuts. The palate entry is smooth and off-dry; by midpalate, flavors expand to include paraffin, creamery butter and vegetable oil. Finishes elegantly and creamy smooth.
label: spirits_taster

description: Subtle notes of chalk and paper with additional whispers of cream, powdered milk, and refined sugar. Palate entry is bittersweet and tightly structured; by midpalate, the bittersweet aspect develops into a honey-like presence. Concludes pleasingly sweet and silky.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosings find notes of quinine, burnt match and furniture polish; additional time brings out deeper scents of onion, brine, olives and damp earth. The palate entry is sooty, sweet and close to creamy; at midpalate the taste profile turns zesty and peppery, oaky sweet, charcoal-like and savory. Finishes bittersweet and caramel-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: A lovely opening bouquet of tropical fruit; following further aeration, the bouquet becomes deeper as the oak enters the equation along with honey and beeswax. The palate entry is sweet with overtones of marzipan and light caramel; at midpalate the taste profile highlights the oaky vanilla and honey elements. Concludes gracefully, integrated and semisweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: A fat, fruity and malty initial aroma; after aeration the bouquet adds alluring nuances of apple crisp, sautéed butter, honey and Sherry. The palate entry is clean, grainy sweet, and slightly oaky; at midpalate the flavor deepens and adds notes of marzipan, nougat, candied apple and bacon fat. Concludes gracefully and balanced.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial aroma emits seductive scents of pork sausage, bacon fat, and candied walnut; aeration adds dried figs and dates, marzipan, nougat, dark coffee, and honey. The palate entry is unabashedly sweet and maple-like; at midpalate the taste profile rings of candied nuts, caramel, maple, sap, mature oak, and brown sugar. Finishes concentrated, sweet, pruny, and huge. Might be too much for those brandy lovers whose preferences lean towards delicacy and nuance. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening aroma is fresh, concentrated, and extremely lemony/acidic before settling into a moderately juicy scent highlighted by lemon zest. The palate entry is clean and tart; at midpalate the crisp tartness accents the fruit beautifully. Finishes acidic and clean, juicy and luscious. One of the better limoncellos out there. A perfect summertime treat served on ice. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bouquet of crisp aromas of cedro lemon. The palate entry is sweet/sour, citrusy, properly lemony and acidic; at midpalate there's a rush of lemony/zesty freshness that's irresistible and pure. Concludes fresh, lemony/citrusy, and suddenly tart.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first aromatic blast is seductively anise-like, then it mellows, turning softer, more herbal, and plumper. At palate entry the intensely bitter taste of anise both enlivens and cleanses the palate; at midpalate the pleasant sting of alcohol and the zest of rooty/woodsy botanicals make for memorable imbibing. Finishes elegant and smooth.
label: spirits_taster

description: Smells of dried figs, sultanas, lime marmalade, sea breeze, green olive, lemon grass, malted milk and unsweetened coconut. The taste profile asserts itself in the forms of light caramel, paraffin and almond paste; at midpalate the spirit becomes more evident as the off-dry, malty, moderately salty flavor warms the tongue and throat. Concludes gracefully and elegantly, with a mild rush of heat and smoke.
label: spirits_taster

description: An extra aged Trebbiano brandy. Opening scents are of tobacco leaf, walnut butter and oak; later sniffings find new aromas of ginger, cinnamon, and pipe tobacco. Palate entry is oily, buttery and semisweet; at midpalate the taste stays the course of oil/butter, adding delicious notes of vanilla and an early-budding rancio/blue cheese quality. Finishes classy, spirity warm, woody and elegant.
label: spirits_taster

description: A seductive brininess and waves of oily peat-reek greet the olfactory sense. The palate entry finds a surprisingly buttery-creamy leaning along with the peat-reek; at midpalate the flavor becomes concentrated, oily, malty sweet, and only moderately peaty. Ends on a sweet malty note. Builds from stage to stage, each phase being better than the last. Best Buy.
label: spirits_taster

description: Opening nosings offer concentrated oak, paraffin/melted candle and baked apple; bouquet expands incrementally as raisiny/pruny/dried red fruit and cocoa override the wood and wax aromas. Palate entry is long, properly oily and full-bodied; the flavor profile turns raisiny, chocolaty and coffee-like, with just a hint of seared pork sausage. Finishes long, fat, buttery and fruity.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosings pick up beguiling scents of carnation, rose petal, spring garden, mint and cinnamon spiciness; further aeration adds nuances of white pepper, fir-tree needles, and a faint dollop of honey. The taste at palate entry is creamy and moderately spicy; at midpalate the flavor turns biscuity, doughy and Sherry-cask sweet. Concludes gracefully.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial sniffings find delightful waves of sweet berry candy; further air contact allows the aroma to turn more plummy and jam-like. The entry flavor is sweet and intensely ripe; at midpalate the taste becomes preserves-like and a touch bitter, making the flavoring seem more authentic. Ends up fruity and properly bittersweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial whiffs find an authentic aroma of just-picked mango freshness; aeration time brings out even deeper levels of amazingly genuine fruitiness and tart mango perfume. The entry is ripe and sweet, then by midpalate the flavor turns tart, acidic, yet completely true to the source. Finishes sweet, lean, and savory.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial scent reminds me of walnuts and nougat; aeration and swirling encourage plumper, more candied/honeyed/minty aromas to emerge. Taste at entry is sensuous, sweet and like brown sugar; at midpalate there's a seductive smokiness that takes on a pipe-tobacco quality. Concludes moderately sweet, yet razor sharp and nicely acidic.
label: spirits_taster

description: Early inhalations unearth traditional Armagnac scents, including freshly sawn wood and smoldering fire; the aroma later emits punchy odors of butter, sautéed mushrooms, clove and cigar tobacco. First taste profile shows off toasty/biscuity flavors of sugar cookie batter, maple and brown sugar; at midpalate honey, cocoa bean and nougat get added to the menu. Concludes with spirity warmth on the tongue.
label: spirits_taster

description: Silver/flax tint is very pale. Opening nose is piquant and intensely herbal; aeration adds hints of dill, brine, agave and green pepper. Palate entry is lovely and sweet; midpalate is honeyed, warm and lean in texture. Aftertaste shows signs of smoke, pepper, peas and a finishing sweetness. More austere than many reposados, but its focus is undiverted and admirable. A margarita Tequila, no doubt.
label: spirits_taster

description: Quadruple-distilled rye grain mash. Bouquet is mildly spicy. Turi is light-to-medium in body, not oily at all and bittersweet in a grainy, flowery, fresh-off-the-still manner. Finish is long, lean, floral and sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: Only 6,000 bottles available worldwide. Matured in 60% Bourbon, 20% fino Sherry, 20% oloroso Sherry barrels. Pure amber/gold color. Substantial aromas of toffee and honey at opening; aeration releases deeper scents of saddle leather, barely detectable sea salt, pine needle and malt. Lovely, succulent and maple-sweet at palate entry; the midpalate is where this malt explodes in sweet, honeyed (though not necessarily Sherried) flavors that also show hints of peat and dried fruit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Brilliant topaz/deep bronze hue. Opening whiffs discover a multilayered nose of toasted nuts, baked pear and dried red apple; more time in the glass stimulates seductive, oily scents of paraffin, old oak and well-worn saddle leather. Palate entry offers sublime, mature, fully melded tastes of oloroso sherry, honey and dark caramel; midpalate is noteworthy for its fullness, moderate heat and glycerine, toffee and sherry tastes. Aftertaste is long, bittersweet, woody and oily. A huge Glen Grant that begs for spring water.
label: spirits_taster

description: Offers an intensely bean-like aroma that's assertive and properly bitter; with further time the fragrance turns plumper and sweeter. Palate entry is clean, acidic and bittersweet; by midpalate, the flavor profile displays focused, well-knit tastes of vanilla bean and cocoa bean. Aftertaste is long, semisweet and intensely vanilla-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: Intriguing scents of old leather, cheese, oatmeal, and pork roast are found in the first nosings; further sniffings pick up treacle and damp forest. The palate entry is stunningly dark caramel-like and lip-smacking sweet; by midpalate tastes of buttercream cake frosting, vanilla, maple syrup, and heather honey have appeared. Concludes in a stately, semisweet manner.
label: spirits_taster

description: Palate entry is slightly maple-like and more bittersweet than flat-out sweet; the midpalate shows rich molasses and sugar maple tastes. Aftertaste is long, slightly lead pencil-like, bittersweet and elegant.
label: spirits_taster

description: Interesting aromas of cream, dill-like agave, coconut and cocoa. Palate entry is off-dry, mildly creamy and just a touch earthy/herbal; the midpalate is all milk chocolate. Aftertaste is medium-long, semisweet and creamy.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first whiffs reveal plump, toffee-caramel notes underpinned by an asparagus-like agave aroma; aeration unearths nuances of fennel, white pepper, sage and rosemary—a complex and engaging bouquet. Palate entry is vegetal, green and off-dry; at midpalate the flavor profile turns sweet and sour, fruity and oaky. Concludes on a bittersweet note that somehow closes the circle on the journey.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosings detect dark fudge, vanilla extract and dried herbs; following aeration layered aromas of oak/pine, old saddle leather and crème caramel candy are added—a gorgeous bouquet. Palate entry is long, deep and bittersweet; at midpalate the flavor turns toasty/smoky, sap-like and chewy. Finishes on a maple-like note that's semisweet and lip-smackingly delicious.
label: spirits_taster

description: Dazzling henna/old copper color. The first sniffings reveal traces of gum, pencil eraser and dried apricot; following aeration the bouquet becomes earthy, chalky and minerally. Palate entry finds delightful deep vanilla and cocoa flavors; at midpalate the flavor turns creamy, buttery and oily as the oak resin and rich fruit vie for dominance. Concludes semisweet, biscuity and maple-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma begins woody and marshmallow-like; after air contact toasty notes of burnt apple crisp, lanolin, candle wax and coffee bean appear. The palate entry is sweet like dried fruit or black raisins; at midpalate the taste profile turns deeply oily/resiny, with seductive hints of rancio and soft blue cheese. Ends sweet, viscous, raisiny and honey-like. A stately beauty.
label: spirits_taster

description: Consider this blended Bourbon for dessert pairings or a fruit-spiked Old Fashioned. Look for caramel and dried-cherry aromas and a flavor akin to dark chocolate-covered cherries. The long, mouthwatering finish is dark and decadent, evoking chocolate, espresso, Port, leather, nutmeg and clove.
label: spirits_taster

description: This luxurious Bourbon shows layered and dense flavors that run to the darker and drier side: cocoa, espresso, clove and allspice, all wrapped in beautiful caramel and butterscotch aromatics. At 100 proof, the alcohol deservedly feels intense, so best to temper this with a bit of branchwater or ice.
label: spirits_taster

description: Since Louisville is horse country as well as Bourbon country, the galloping horse etched on the bottle feels spot on. Silky and rich, this dark amber Bourbon offers espresso, dried apricot and cigar tobacco, with a baking spice finish. Brisk alcohol.
label: spirits_taster

description: This small-batch Bourbon uses wheat in place of rye to create a soft, rounded character. The mild crème brulee aroma leads into sasparilla and creamy caramel flavors. At 92 proof, it's a wonder that the alcohol feels so moderate, but it makes its presence known in the cinnamon-firework finish. Attractive bottle design with clever keyhole label.
label: spirits_taster

description: Resurrected after 23 years, this smooth, buttery American whiskey is worth the wait. It has mellow vanilla and oak flavors, with a faint cherry essence on the long finish that seems to urge, “stir up a few Manhattans already.”
label: spirits_taster

description: This Bourbon boasts concentrated caramel aroma. Flavors run to caramel and honey, touched with charred oak and allspice notes. It's plush and rounded in feel. The soft-wax cap is frustratingly hard to open, but luckily, it's worth the struggle.
label: spirits_taster

description: Finished in the barrel with specially seared oak staves, this Bourbon is a new classic. In the glass, it sports a bright maple color, and lively, spicy aromas and flavors of oaky vanilla and tropical fruit touched with clove, ginger and allspice.
label: spirits_taster

description: Full of bold vanilla, dried fruit and sweet caramel, this Bourbon pops with spicy cinnamon, ginger and clove on the finish. Just a splash of water opens up more gorgeous vanilla and oak. Has a pleasing viscosity and modest alcohol presence.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pour this single-barrel Bourbon some time in advance to allow it to open up and reveal crème caramel aromatics while you eye the rich topaz color in the glass. Sweet and smooth, this whiskey finishes with dry espresso, dark chocolate and black-tea notes. Mix into classic cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: A good workhorse for all manner of cocktails, this bright amber Bourbon has a butterscotch aroma and oaky, relatively dry flavors that elongate into a rich caramel finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This blended Bourbon starts smooth and sweet, with sasparilla and maple sugar, then explodes with bold cassia, cinnamon and cayenne razzle-dazzle.
label: spirits_taster

description: Gentle and soft, this blend of straight Bourbons would be lovely in a Manhattan smoothed out with sweet vermouth. Look for sweet, creamy caramel aromas and flavors that waft into cocoa and espresso on the finish. A portion of profits goes to benefit the American Prairie Reserve in northeastern Montana.
label: spirits_taster

description: From Master Distiller Jimmy Russell and his son Eddie Russell, this tawny and full-bodied whiskey evolves on the palate. At first, it features orange peel, vanilla and caramel, then dry leather and cocoa notes midpalate, and finishes long and lean with clove and allspice accents. Dilute to taste, sip slowly and consider all the complex flavors.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged in American oak casks, then finished in “white-wine seasoned French oak barrels,” this honey-hued whiskey has rich, powerful aromas of apricots and butterscotch. On the palate,  surprising floral accents transition into honey and rounded stone-fruit notes, with a bit of a tannic pucker on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged for “a six year stretch,” in jailhouse parlance, this silky amber Bourbon features vanilla touched with bright Meyer lemon, espresso and allspice.
label: spirits_taster

description: Rich and creamy, this small-batch Bourbon offers butterscotch laced with bitter chocolate and orange peel, edged with a clove and cinnamon finish. Muscular alcohol feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Perfect for classic cocktails, this golden-amber rye invites with lots of vanilla on the nose and palate, plus mouthwatering notes of pear, cinnamon and black pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: A lighter-style Bourbon with finesse and elegance, this amber spirit has a pretty vanilla and orange blossom scent, and gentle vanilla sweetness on the palate rounded out with a baking spice finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: An unexpectedly wonderful pairing with a sweet chocolate or a sticky caramel dessert, Campfire blends straight rye whiskey, straight Bourbon and blended Scotch. Altogether, it's big and smoky, with lots of iodine, but doesn't completely overwhelm, settling into a pleasing mix of toffee and peat. Gift a bottle to a Scotch lover to introduce the joys of American whiskeys.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bright and buttery, this rye has a warm, malty scent and mellow flavors of cookie dough and juicy lemon, interspersed with just the right amount of rye bite.
label: spirits_taster

description: A word of warning: don't drink this straight. Don't even try. At 110 proof, it can be downright painful. But with proper dilution, this Bourbon is still rich and deep flavored. Maturation time in dark “alligator char” barrels yields hazelnut, oak and toffee seasoned with nutmeg and clove.
label: spirits_taster

description: From chocolate maker Cacao Prieto comes an innovative Bourbon made with water from the Widow Jane mine in Rosendale, NY—an unusual limestone-rich source similar to those found in Kentucky. Aged for seven years in American oak, the spirit needs a little time to open up and coax forth vanilla and cola-like notes on the palate. Distinctly sweet on the palate, most of the flavor is on the finish, with a flourish of sasparilla, vanilla, cola and allspice.
label: spirits_taster

description: A little aeration time coaxes out a mellow vanilla scent. As with its Bourbon counterpart, this rye is aged in American oak casks, then finished in “white-wine seasoned French oak barrels.” The result is a soft feel and honeyed fruit notes spiced with cinnamon and nutmeg.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged a minimum of two years, this lighter whiskey is especially enjoyable when mixed. It has an amber hue with golden highlights, and gently sweet flavors of vanilla and honey, dried apricot, raisin, baked apple and nutmeg.
label: spirits_taster

description: Going back to colonial days, Pennsylvania had a long tradition of distilling sweeter, more robust Monongahela rye—also called Pennsylvania rye. Dad's Hat is giving that style a resurgence. The bright and fruity scent mixes vanilla and tropical fruit. The flavor also has a funky edge, like overripe bananas and honey, finishing with sparks of spicy ginger. Silky texture.
label: spirits_taster

description: Mingling selected barrels of 11-year-old, rye-based and 11-year-old wheated Bourbons yields a soft spirit with crème brulee and toffee aromatics. The palate boasts warm caramel, cookie dough and dried fruit flavors, and a dry oaky note on the finish. It's interesting and no doubt technically accomplished, but at a whopping 132 proof, most will find this quite challenging to drink. Limited release of 7,500 bottles.
label: spirits_taster

description: Gentle and mild, this Bourbon plays well with others. With a restrained vanilla flavor touched with ginger and cinnamon, this spirit is especially nice in mixed drinks with a bit of sweetness.
label: spirits_taster

description: This two-year-old amber rye has a fresh apple scent, and a slightly fruity cast on the palate too. Most of the flavor is on the finish, showing clove, bitter chocolate and cinnamon. Strong alcohol presence.
label: spirits_taster

description: Just over 200 bottles of this super-limited edition were released in 2012—most of them are already gone from the shelves. Although many whiskey lovers have lauded this Bourbon as a new favorite, the titanic 114 proof makes it hot and difficult to savor the butterscotch-like flavors, even with major doses of water added.
label: spirits_taster

description: As a six-year-old Bourbon whiskey blended with honey liqueur, this has potential as a digestif or sweetener for Bourbon-based drinks. It has a lightly floral cast, melding honey, vanilla and white flowers with a sprinkle of cinnamon. Use a light touch, though—it still has kick.
label: spirits_taster

description: For those who like rum with a bit of sweetness to it, this honey-hued sipper offers vanilla bean and brown sugar on the nose and palate, drying to a hot cinnamon finish smoothed by decadent hints of cocoa, espresso and hazelnut.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bold, offers smacks of banana taffy and circus peanuts. That taffy-like note is echoed on the palate, which finishes long and sweet, with waves of -coconut, banana, almond and marshmallow, -winding into a lip-smacking, spiced finish. Sip or mix into tropical cocktails. Launching in the U.S. in late 2018.
label: spirits_taster

description: Palate-coating vanilla and coconut set the stage for layers of orange peel, coffee, and spice. This rum lands lightly, with a smooth hint of dark chocolate. Ideal as a dessert pairing. Launching in the U.S. in late 2018.
label: spirits_taster

description: Honey and orange peel aromas lead the nose. The drying palate shows vanilla, leather and chamomile tea, finishing with a burst of spice and orange peel, plus a hint of banana on the final exhale. Aged a minimum of six years, in virgin oak and ex-Bourbon barrels.
label: spirits_taster

description: This unusual rum is matured for nine years in oak barrels, plus another eight months in former Château La Tour Blanche Sauternes casks. The effect is harmonious and subtle. A thick layer of vanilla coats the palate, accented by lighter hints of oak, orange peel, baking spice and golden raisin, finishing with a fiery cayenne sizzle.
label: spirits_taster

description: Burnished gold in the glass, this rhum offers a vanilla-forward aroma and light, smooth palate, with concentrated creamy honey and a long baking spice finish accented by a whiff of Scotch-like smoke and lemon peel. Barrel-aged for a minimum of four years.
label: spirits_taster

description: This complex, intriguing rum is made 100% from South Carolina sugarcane, then barrel rested for 10 months. The end result is a golden-yellow hue and pungent aroma of banana bread. A long swath of palate-coating waxy honey leads the way, finishing long on touches of agave nectar, banana, nutmeg and cardamom.
label: spirits_taster

description: This tawny orange rhum offers a mild, slightly oaky aroma.   The palate opens with distinct sweetness, blossoming into brown butter and banana, then drying to clove and cinnamon  sparks to close out the sip. Aged six years.
label: spirits_taster

description: This amber liquid has a luxuriously rich, concentrated brown sugar scent. Meanwhile, the palate shows dark layers of toffee, espresso and vanilla, finishing with a flicker of orange peel and clove. According to the producer, this rhum undergoes a “very long aging process in Bourbon oak casks.” Unsurprisingly, it drinks like a long-aged Bourbon.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sip or mix this honey-hued rum. The palate opens with vanilla sweetness, then dries to dusty cocoa and clove and finishes with honey, cedar, ripe banana and black pepper.
label: spirits_taster

description: Deep vanilla, toffee and espresso aromas lead the nose. The drying palate evokes chocolate-covered oranges, melding dark chocolate with a rounded finish that has pops of vanilla, orange and spice.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clear in the glass, this offers gentle wafts of coconut and marshmallow on nose and a plush palate that finishes with the faintest hint of lime. Ready for daiquiris and other rum cocktails. Distilled in Guatemala, then aged and bottled in Portland, Oregon; barrel aged for six to 12 months.
label: spirits_taster

description: Clear in the glass, look for a grassy, slightly funky scent and a silky palate that echoes that grassy, almost floral note. The finish is gentle but long, exiting with ginger and cinnamon sparks and a mouthwatering hint of banana.
label: spirits_taster

description: A mellow caramel aroma entices on the nose. The palate sets up with oak, vanilla bean and maple sweetness, drying to lemon peel acidity and a flicker of ginger heat on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Concentrated brown sugar dominates the nose and palate on this tawny rhum, edged by echoes of maple sugar, vanilla and clove. Aged a minimum of six years.
label: spirits_taster

description: This rhum, aged for three to four years in ex-Bourbon barrels, was engineered to drink like American whiskey. The end result is a bright topaz hue and mild vanilla bean aroma, with a pleasing flavor profile that frames espresso, campfire smoke and caramel. The slightly drying exit shows clove, black pepper and a hint of orange peel.
label: spirits_taster

description: The oak-vanilla-spice trinity of this 10-year-old rum will be familiar to lovers of American whiskey. Rich brown sugar and vanilla aromas lead the way, followed by oak and vanilla on the palate enlivened by a juicy hint of lemon peel and an echo of bananas Foster. Clove and cinnamon tingle round out the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This limited-edition blends rum aged for 12 years in Bourbon barrels with rum aged 10 years in virgin oak. The end result is a burnished gold liquid redolent of maple and brown sugar on the nose and palate. Sweet vanilla and hazelnut wraps around a warming core, finishing with a cinnamon tingle. Micro batch of 3,000 bottles.
label: spirits_taster

description: The honey hue and sweet vanilla-spice aromas lead on this agricole rhum. The palate opens with vanilla and honey, carrying to an earthy, rubbery midpalate and spicy finish, laced with black pepper, clove and cayenne. Aged three years.
label: spirits_taster

description: Named for the highest mountain (Monte Pasubio) in Pasubio Group of the Piccole Dolomiti, this is made with a combination of Pilsner and Vienna malts as well as five different hop varieties, making for quite an herbaceous and even slightly resinous experience. It's bright and earthy, with upfront scents of both fresh and pressed hop flowers, sweet grass, citrus blossoms and supremes. The mouthfeel is clean and refreshing, with a light body and medium-plus carbonation that carries through to the crisp, lightly astringent close. Slow Brewing Certified. MHW, Ltd.
label: spirits_taster

description: As expected from a 100-proof spirit, alcohol heat overwhelms from the first sip to the peppery finish. Get beyond that, and the reward is a bright, honeyed scent and bold palate that shows lychee and rosewater, with bouncy bubblegum and rubber.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is a blend of rums aged from 5–8 years, finished for a few weeks in barrels that previously held Italian sweet vermouth. The spirit has a mild scent and light, honeyed palate accented by savory cedar, sarsaparilla and curry. The vermouth finish shows up on the close, which is laced with sweet spices and a hint of red fruit.
label: spirits_taster

description: This rhum received six years of typical oak barrel aging, followed by another 12 months maturing in barrels that held single malt whisky from Scotland's Highland region. The end result resembles a rum-Bourbon hybrid, though not so much Scotch. The mild aroma mingles sweet vanilla and brown sugar, while the palate shows coffee, vanilla, cocoa and a hint of orange peel. The finish is very drying and spiced with clove and black pepper. As with a good Bourbon, consider adding a splash of water to temper the persistent alcohol heat.
label: spirits_taster

description: An agricole rhum from Oaxaca, the region better known for mezcal, this is an exciting proposition. The liquid is clear in the glass, with a pungent, funky scent and bold notes of banana and cinnamon on the palate, finishing fiery, though with a pleasing, fleeting grassy exhale. Labeled as aguardiente de caña—cane firewater—this unaged bottling is a bit punishing as is, but the prospect of a mellower barrel-aged version down the line is enticing.
label: spirits_taster

description: This golden Tequila puts the agave front and center, without burying it under wood. Pleasantly savory honey, pineapple and jalapeño aromas lead the nose and palate. A wash of vanilla smooths the exit, accented by gingery spice. Sip or mix. Aged six to nine months in a mix of American and French oak.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is very pale in the glass, but with a zesty, savory aroma that suggests fresh oregano and basil. The palate melds that herbaceousness with hints of almond and lemon cream, plus cinnamon and white pepper on the elongated finish. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: The zesty jalapeño aroma and sweet tomato undercurrent suggests what is to come. The savory palate delivers fresh mint, basil, jalapeño and green pepper, finishing with a hint of black pepper smoothed by vanilla-mint sweetness. Sip or mix.
label: spirits_taster

description: The light but zesty aroma evokes tomato water, bell pepper freshness and agave nectar. Meanwhile, the palate leads with honey and jalapeño, finishing with hints of vanilla and sweet cinnamon. Aged in Tennessee and Kentucky whiskey barrels for a minimum of six months.
label: spirits_taster

description: This is a reposado Tequila blended with extra añejo. The aroma mixes tropical fruit and jalapeño. The silky, delicate palate opens with vanilla and almond elegance, almost reminiscent of a blended Scotch infused with jalapeño peppers, finishing with peppery edge. Recommended as a sipping Tequila.
label: spirits_taster

description: Look for a pale rose-gold hue and a mild, herbaceous aroma that hints at basil and slate. The palate is light and silky, echoing that slate-like minerality alongside hints of cedar, coconut and honey, finishing with a flurry of white pepper and brush of raspberry. Aged four months.
label: spirits_taster

description: This spirit has a complex, rewarding array of flavors. The aroma is very smoky and spicy, evoking barbecue. But on the tongue, this vibrant-gold reposado layers vanilla and orange-peel flavors with a warm hint of toffee, and the smoke only comes through on the finish. Comes packaged in a striking, gift-worthy square-shouldered bottle with impressive heft. Aged nine months.
label: spirits_taster

description: This reposado reads almost like a mezcal, showing lots of zingy jalapeno pepper and smoke, chased with just a touch of vanilla-tinged agave sweetness. Attractive bottle design with embossed bull logo on front and gold-leaf design on back. Aged for eight months.
label: spirits_taster

description: The aroma on this single-estate Tequila is reminiscent of a very lightly peated whiskey, mingling smoke and pepper with a light caramel note. The flavors tend toward custard and agave sweetness, spiked with pepper and mint. Earthy, smoky and peppery notes accelerate on the long finish. Light, silky feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: This limited-edition reposado comes in an exquisite bottle with a spiky glass piña (agave) blown inside. The restrained and mellow spirit has a mild honey aroma and flavor, with flashes of cinnamon and jalapeño pepper on the finish. Soft feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: Tiki-philes will exclaim over the whimsical bottle with a green tiki figurine inside and capped with a green wax seal. The light gold spirit itself, aged six to eight months, features zesty citrus, piquant pepper, and a long, elegant vanilla finish. It's a natural for tiki classics like El Diablo (combined with crème de cassis and ginger beer).
label: spirits_taster

description: A beautiful story accompanies this Tequila: the name translates as “Tribute To My Father.” This pale gold, addictively sippable reposado does justice to the memory of Hector Barrero Sr., melding notes of wildflowers, honey, custard and pears. Despite a bit of alcohol sting, this spirit is soft and light.
label: spirits_taster

description: This bright, light-gold spirit has a luxuriously fresh, fruity scent, like caramel drizzled over apple slices. The flavors are complex and mellow, morphing from grassy and herbal to lemon, hazelnut and cocoa on the finish. This single-estate highlands Tequila has a bit of alcoholic heat, but that wouldn't matter lightened in a margarita or other citrusy cocktail.
label: spirits_taster

description: In this lowlands Tequila, fruity and peppery flavors weave harmoniously into the elongated finish. This spirit would be particularly welcome in a paloma or other citrus-forward cocktails. Rested in oak for eight months.
label: spirits_taster

description: After a hint of agave sweetness, this spirit is fairly smoky on the palate, chased by a fruity note. Overall, this light-gold Tequila has a soft feel, although there's a bit of alcohol bite, too.
label: spirits_taster

description: This pale straw-colored spirit has a soft, fruity aroma with a hint of green bell pepper. On the palate, look for jalapeño pepper and oaky, tannic notes and a gentle vanilla finish. Velvety feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: This light-gold reposado has a funky, overripe aroma and flavors that lean toward green pepper, sweetened with a drizzle of agave and nice sprinkle of baking spices on the finish. Any cocktail dosed with lime would really perk up this spirit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aged for just three months, this reposado reads almost like a perky blanco. It features lots of jalapeño pepper, smoothed out with light honeyed notes and it finishes with a touch of oak tannin astringency. Would make a good margarita. Aged for three months.
label: spirits_taster

description: At 42% abv, this spirit is distilled hotter than Peligroso's standard 80 proof line. Although there's been something of a mania for higher-proof spirits recently, the extra alcohol doesn't do this reposado any favors, bringing forward notes of smoke, oregano and resin. Consider opting for Peligroso's fruity standard-issue reposado instead.
label: spirits_taster

description: Although this lowlands Tequila rested in oak for six months, the spirit shows practically no color or aroma from its time in barrels. The flavor has notes of resin, with a light floral or herbal finish, and a flash of alcoholic heat on the tongue.
label: spirits_taster

description: This highlands Tequila has a funky vegetal scent and herbaceous flavors that combine oregano, resin and faint agave sweetness. It does come in a distinctive, bright-blue pyramid-shaped bottle.
label: spirits_taster

description: With its clean, neutral profile, this graceful gin works well with just about anything, from Aviation cocktails (natch) to bone-dry Martinis. On the palate, look for bewitching hints of caraway, juniper, grapefruit and a dry, faintly spicy finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: For those who prefer a sweet cast to their gins, this one is a winner. The grapefruit-like, almost candy-like scent leads into pleasantly sweet and citrusy flavors, which finish with a faint floral note. Blends particularly well into lightly fruity and citrusy cocktails and gin-based punches.
label: spirits_taster

description: A relative newcomer to the gin landscape, this is the proper gin to use for a Tom Collins cocktail. It intentionally leans sweet, but it's balanced with the right amount of alcohol bite, a lightly piny scent, and faint herbal and citrus peel notes. If using this 19th-centurystyle sweetened gin for other cocktails, be sure to hold off on adding sugar.
label: spirits_taster

description: Discovering this artisan gin distilled in West Virginia was a pleasant surprise. Though it's perfumy and pretty, it has restraint. The enticing aroma is decidedly botanical, with notes of fresh basil, white flowers and orange blossom. Though the flavors read as floral, they're balanced with cool lightness and a honey-sweet finish. Consider this one for fruity and floral spring cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: A soft, classic gin, ideal for Negronis and a wide range of other drinks. Overall, the flavor is neutral, but it has a touch of sweetness and complex underpinnings of pine, citrus and black pepper. Because it's so versatile, this workhorse is recommended for anyone starting to build a bar.
label: spirits_taster

description: Bartenders will want to experiment with this lovely, lightly floral gin for spring cocktails. It has a light touch, from the citrus scent to the sweet flavor that finishes with a bouquet of rose petals, violets and honeysuckle. One of a trio of new gins from this small-batch distiller.
label: spirits_taster

description: This gin-based liqueur made with local damson plums is unique and different. The vibrantly cherry-red spirit has a warm, fruity scent, like a cross between sweet vermouth and cherry juice. The flavor is more tart than sweet, with a lingering earthiness on the back of the tongue. Though a little too tart for straight-up sipping, it's a dynamite addition to the arsenal for adding flavor and color to gin-based cocktails, such as fizzes and punches.
label: spirits_taster

description: This gin has a fierce following, in part because of its quirky brand personality (see the Monty Python-esque website) and aggressive marketing among bartenders. But it lives up to the hype. Some might expect a more concentrated rosewater-cucumber profile, but it's relatively subtle, with just a hint of cucumber mingling with juniper in the aroma, and white pepper, citrus and floral notes on the lingering finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: One of a new trio of gins from this small-batch distiller, the Dry-Rye version has a bold, warm caraway scent and assertive notes of juniper and black pepper, finishing with peppy, lingering citrus flavor. Would make for a complex G&T.;
label: spirits_taster

description: Light, warm Dutch licorice comes through on the nose and palate, lightened by cardamom and a sweet lemon zest note. Spicy and intriguing. Made in Nashville, Tennessee.
label: spirits_taster

description: This American-made gin veers close to London Dry territory, with its juniper and citrus-peel profile and powerful finish. However, it has some unusual botanicals: black pepper, basil, peppermint and kaffir lime, and would do well cooled in a tall glass of tonic. Made with Colorado and California juniper berries.
label: spirits_taster

description: A Scottish gin, you say? From the Balmenach whisky distillery in Scotland's Speyside region comes this crisp gin, with a light juniper and citrus scent and a surprisingly warm finish with a prickle of anise and alcohol. The distiller notes list a host of intriguing-sounding botanicals, including rowan berry, heather and Coul Blush apple, which unfortunately are undetectable. However, the clean, quinine-like feel suggests this would be a fine match for G&T; lovers.
label: spirits_taster

description: If you're seeking a floral-tinged gin for spring cocktails, this small-batch French number should hit the spot thanks to its very sweet perfume, with lots of lime and white flowers. On the palate, look for a nice balance of citrus and light, fresh floral notes, developing into an elongated floral finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Your favorite vermouth or bitters will shine with this quiet gin as its backdrop. Neutral aroma, with a barely-there whiff of lemongrass, and a nicely round, citrusy flavor with a spicy coriander note and a clean finish. Despite the relatively high proof, this gin has a silky feel.
label: spirits_taster

description: There's no mistaking this old-style Genever for its cousin gin–but you might be forgiven for mistaking it for moonshine. The powerful, pungent aroma, malty but fresh, smells like it rolled right off the still. Dry, warm and fairly boozy finish, with a hint of anise.
label: spirits_taster

description: Sniffs discover zesty aromas of green, red and jalapeño pepper as well as notes of parchment, coin, lead pencil and paraffin. Entry is oily, smooth, off-dry and peppery; midpalate features tastes of oak, vanilla, cream, cooking oil and butter. Concludes clean, bittersweet and oily.
label: spirits_taster

description: Stately aroma reminds me of butter- cream candies; further air contact reveals deeper scents of melon, white raisins, dried yellow plums and fudge. Entry is honey-sweet, ripe and fruity (dried yellow fruits, banana, pineapple, pear); midpalate is long, satiny, honeyed, eggy, fruity and balanced. Concludes on notes of Sherry, apricot, white raisins and light toffee.
label: spirits_taster

description: Pungent, peppery, waxy and fiber-like aromas precede deeper aromas of oak resin, beeswax, white raisins and white pepper. Entry is oaky with toffee flavors; the midpalate is salty, smoky, mildly peaty and dry. Aftertaste is crisp, mildly sweet, oaky and austere.
label: spirits_taster

description: Emits delicate, mildly spicy and grapy fragrances at first; additional time fails to open up any more aromatics. Entry is peppery, spicy, astringent and tangy; midpalate is moderately sweet, grapy, ripe and honeyed towards the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Smells of cookie or biscuit batter, with aeration stimulating scents of honeycomb, light toffee and mild oak. Entry tastes of buttercream, light caramel and honey; midpalate offers whipped egg white, creamy flavor and oak-influenced vanilla tastes. Finishes a bit short.
label: spirits_taster

description: Smells of dried berries in the initial sniffs; the aroma turns toasty, with hints of orange marmalade, after another several minutes. Entry has foundation taste of ripe white grapes and oak; midpalate features long, silky, honey-sweet tastes, as well as an astringency that maintains this Cognac's freshness.
label: spirits_taster

description: Smells of white grapes, fresh spirit off the still and sand. Entry is semisweet,  then baked and spicy (black pepper); midpalate is chewy in texture, mildly sweet and grassy, and even honeyed. Finishes well and stable, with delectably sweet tastes that gently coat the throat.
label: spirits_taster

description: Baked pear and peach and bakery scents charm the olfactory sense right away. Entry is honey-sweet, fruity, toasty and caramel-like; midpalate highlights the ripe fruit, which seems more tropical in nature than grapy or berry flavored.
label: spirits_taster

description: The complex bouquet offers layers of scents of very toasty, baked apple, pie crust, spicy and resiny, rancio notes, walnut meat, butterscotch and hard cheese. Entry tastes like caramel-covered apple, baked apple with cinnamon, and honey; the sweetness increases at midpalate as the flavor becomes succulent, creamy and buttery. Hint of rancio in the finish. Wonderful.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes find zesty scents of jalapeños with deeper aromas of dill pickle, relish, textile, oaky vanillin, salt and brine. Entry is sweet, salty, peppery, and oily; midpalate features creamy, oily and tangy flavors that coat the tongue. Ends earthy, sweet, satiny, concentrated  and oily. A classic extra añejo.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromas of dill, pickle brine, flowers, green pepper, black pepper, flax and tobacco leaf. Entry is earthy and moderately sweet; the midpalate features melded tastes of honey, brown sugar and vegetables. Finish is oily, concentrated, peppery and integrated.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet is rubbery and wet suit-like. Entry is pleasantly oily with pungent tastes of cigarette smoke and burning rubber; the midpalate is surprisingly sweet and relatively well behaved as lively and peppery tastes challenge the taste buds. Finishes in a flurry of smoke, tobacco juice, road tar and burning rubber flavors. Mezcal fans will love it.
label: spirits_taster

description: Delightful bouquet of butterscotch, hazelnut, old cigarette ashes, spices, fennel and honey. Entry is intensely herbal and semisweet; the midpalate is medicinal, a touch smoky, herbal and honeyed. Finishes with a notable honey taste and an end taste reminiscent of Drambuie. I like this flavored whiskey.
label: spirits_taster

description: The initial nosing finds pleasantly zesty and pungent smells of grain spirit; following aeration the aroma settles down and features mildly fiery notes of toasted grain, chalk and textile. Entry is warming and intensely grainy; the midpalate stage is surprisingly sweet. Concludes on an aggressive, but not off-putting note of sweet grain spirit.
label: spirits_taster

description: Aromas of baked apple and wood with subtle scents of nutmeg, apple peel, flowers and earth. Entry is austere at first then explodes in assertive waves of apple pastry, mineral, stone and oaky vanilla; a delicious layer of honey/light toffee is added at midpalate. Finish is elegant, dry to off-dry, and wonderfully toffee-like.
label: spirits_taster

description: The delightful bouquet has a pleasing crisp graininess early on which becomes even more enjoyable following aeration as scents of peanut and white pepper emerge. Entry is lean, clean and sweet; at midpalate the grain element is sweet but not cloying. Finishes elegantly, smoothly and silkily. An excellent unflavored vodka.
label: spirits_taster

description: The interesting bouquet offers pleasantly grassy, waxy and vegetal notes with the aroma becoming more expressive and focused on a grain component following aeration. Palate entry is tobacco-like, a touch smoky and biscuity sweet; the flavor turns intensely grainy and taste almost of sweet corn at midpalate. Finishes composed, grainy, doughy and slightly honeyed.
label: spirits_taster

description: Lackluster bouquet of oak, paraffin, spirit and baked apple smells. Entry is lean, minerally, slightly metallic and disappointing; midpalate finally opens up with tasty flavors of baking spices, tart red apple, under-ripe pear, black coffee, and dark caramel. Concludes well and suddenly toasty and oily. Good recovery from disappointing start.
label: spirits_taster

description: Early scents of sautéed butter, apple strudel and melon followed by plumper aromas of oaky vanillin, sap and resin. Entry is austere, nougaty and almond-like; the midpalate features ripe, pleasingly sweet and sour apple and pear tastes with caramel and nougat. Finishes gracefully and more tart than sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet aromas include barley malt, asparagus, hollandaise, dry breakfast cereal, white peppercorns and salt. Entry is soft, citrusy-orangy, moderately baked and toasty; an almond nougat taste enters at midpalate and nicely offsets the dry maltiness and vegetal flavors. Shows solid presence and a hint of heather in the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The bouquet smells of herbal agave and plastic/vinyl underpinned by a bittersweet agave note. Entry is very sweet and nicely warm, with vegetal tastes of raw asparagus and Brussels sprouts; the vegetal, spicy, herbal qualities are wiped out at midpalate by the flavor becoming even sweeter. Finishes keenly sweet.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosing passes find aromas of green, red and jalapeno peppers; aeration brings out woody notes and subtle scents of parchment, coin and paraffin. Entry is pleasingly oily, off-dry and mildly peppery; the midpalate features tastes of oak, vanilla, butter and cooking oil. Concludes bittersweet, oily, with a trace of black pepper but dominated by the wood.
label: spirits_taster

description: The first nosing passes discover scents of walnuts, grass and dark toffee; aromas of black tea and tobacco come to the forefront. Entry is delightfully grainy, malty and vanilla bean-bittersweet; the midpalate is silky, creamy, Sherry-sweet, pruny, black raisin-like and delicious. Ends on a medium-sweet dark chocolate note. A terrific 12 Year Old.
label: spirits_taster

description: The ripe and beguiling cherry scent bouquet is strikingly kirsch-like. At entry, the taste is delicate with ripe cherry flavors, elegant and integrated; the delicious taste continues into the midpalate phase as the creamy texture coats the tongue in rich and genuine black cherry flavor. Finishes a touch metallic, but is still a smashing flavored rum.
label: spirits_taster

description:
The bouquet offers smells of tropical fruits and baking spice. Entry is minerally, pleasantly 
ripe, viscous in texture; the midpalate point is earthy, floral, stony and off dry. Finishes gracefully, minerally and drier than the midpalate.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nose offers firm, concentrated scents of cereal grain, palm oil, parchment and nuts. Palate entry is full, semidry and intensely grainy; in the midpalate stage, the taste profile turns more oily and waxy, all the time maintaining a high degree of grain kernel. Concludes dry, clean and elegant.
label: spirits_taster

description: The nosing passes pick up delicate notes of quartz crystals, minerals, earth and cotton. The palate entry is surprisingly sweet and assertive; the midpalate is grainy, sweet and minerally enough to offset the sweetness. Concludes grainy, semisweet and clean.
label: spirits_taster

description: The muted bouquet is slow in offering woody, leathery aromas with light touches of cocoa, cola and egg cream. Entry tastes include cocoa butter, honey, treacle, marzipan and nougat; by midpalate the taste profile leans towards fudge and cake frosting. Finishes intensely sweet and chocolaty.
label: spirits_taster

description: Deep aromas of oak resin, beeswax, white raisins and white pepper emerge following aeration. Entry is intensely oaky and toffee-like, with subtle touches of salt and butterscotch; the midpalate is salty, smoky, mildly peaty and grainy dry. The aftertaste is cleansing, crisp, mildly sweet and oaky and a touch austere.
label: spirits_taster

description: Initial sniffings detect tart, yeasty aromas of barley malt and bread dough. Palate entry is off-dry and a touch bittersweet in caramel; at midpalate, the taste profile tends to the toasted cereal and toasted bread side of the scale. Finishes gracefully, dry, tart, crisp and clean.
label: spirits_taster

description: The ripe, fruity style of this mezcal lends itself to making margarita variations and other cocktails. Look for tropical fruit flavors like lychee and banana, and a mild note of jalapeño on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: As with the (previously reviewed) resposado and joven expressions, Ilegal's añejo is also mellow and elegant, although having spent 13 months in American and French oak, it's richer. The barrel aging contributes lovely aromas of honey and vanilla, which are echoed on the palate, along with a surprising flowery note, a suggestion of smoke and a spiced finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: From the lovely rounded bottle shape to the gentle flavors to the spirit's soft feel, everything about this mezcal is elegant and polished. While most joven mezcals have no color, this one has a barely-there golden tinge. Look for a warm, fruity, honeyed aroma and a restrained mix of vanilla and light smoke flavors that fade to a minty finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: The remarkable nose is jammed with pineapple and earthy roasted notes, plus a faint touch of vanilla. This mouthwatering mezcal mixes sweet and salty sensations on the palate, along with just the right amount of smoke. It would be an intriguing addition to cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: This single-variety mezcal, made solely from Espadín agave, has a sweet aroma, mingling a note of tropical fruit with a touch of roasted tomato. It shows fruity acidity on the palate, with moderate smokiness and black pepper flavor that accelerate into the clean finish. The alcohol feels brisk but surprisingly balanced for a product clocking in at 96 proof.
label: spirits_taster

description: The pechuga style of mezcal—which include raw chicken breast as part of the distillation process—has been relatively hard to find in the U.S. This well-structured newcomer is a welcome addition, offering bright, almost berry-like aromas, and warm, moderately smoky and faintly savory flavors.
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from the Dobadaan agave variety, this joven mezcal has pleasing minty, grassy aromatics and sweet flavors that finish with menthol smokiness. It's bracing and drying in feel thanks to overproof alcohol levels. Pair this with cured meat or smoked fish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Almost evoking a forest fire, this intense, intriguing mezcal melds fruit and smoke aromas with a rounded, pine-like flavor and a touch of honeyed agave nectar. Serve it with a lick of salt or a salty, savory appetizer for best effect.
label: spirits_taster

description: Inside the squared bottle, this silky mezcal is warm and lightly fruity, with insistent smokiness and perky mint and rosemary accents on the finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: This pale-straw-colored joven mezcal is tinged with fresh apple, pear, vanilla and smoke notes, with refreshing astringency on the palate. The packaging is intriguing: The label shows dancing devils and skeletons and there's a drinking vessel attached to the bottle neck. The brand recommends drinking this over ice, with grapefruit-flavored soda and lime sprinkled with gusano (worm salt).
label: spirits_taster

description: Made from Madrecuixe, a low-yielding wild agave found at high elevations of southern Oaxaca, this mezcal explodes with herbal and minerally flavors that are set against a softly smoky backdrop and bracing alcohol. Because the wild agave is so difficult to obtain, this mezcal is available only in limited quantities.
label: spirits_taster

description: Perhaps the most gin-like of all the mezcals, this joven, which is made from blue agave, is bright and perky, with pine, juniper and menthol notes, plus a clean finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: Recommended for those who love big, smoky flavors in mezcal, this single-village spirit starts with mellow oregano and herb notes, which are quickly engulfed by waves of iodine and smoke. This is a great way to add a smoke note to cocktails.
label: spirits_taster

description: This blend of Espadín, Largo, Barril and Tripón agaves yields a mezcal with round, robust flavors of bell pepper and stewed tomato, with sprinklings of oregano, rosemary, black pepper and cayenne pepper on the piquant finish.
label: spirits_taster

description: From country singer Toby Keith, the reposado expression of the Wild Shot line has a soft golden color, with a bold, smoky, roasted aroma. It's not as smoky on the palate as the scent would suggest; instead, flavors run to citrus and vanilla, with a fairly hot, drying finish. Although most quality mezcal producers eschew worms, this brand deliberately flaunts its worm at the bottom of the bottle.
label: spirits_taster
